-- | Traverse the prefix of an object key.
--   
--   The prefix is classified as the entirety of the object key minus the
--   name. A leading prefix in the presence of a name, and no other
--   delimiters is interpreted as a blank prefix.
--   
--   <pre>
--   &gt;&gt;&gt; "/home/jsmith/base.wiki" ^? keyPrefix '/'
--   Just "/home/jsmith"
--   </pre>
--   
--   <pre>
--   &gt;&gt;&gt; "/home/jsmith/" ^? keyPrefix '/'
--   Just "/home/jsmith"
--   </pre>
--   
--   <pre>
--   &gt;&gt;&gt; "/home" ^? keyPrefix '/'
--   Nothing
--   </pre>
--   
--   <pre>
--   &gt;&gt;&gt; "/" ^? keyPrefix '/'
--   Nothing
--   </pre>
keyPrefix :: Delimiter -> Traversal' ObjectKey Text

-- | Traverse the name of an object key.
keyName :: Delimiter -> Traversal' ObjectKey Text

-- | Traverse the path components of an object key using the specified
--   delimiter.
keyComponents :: Delimiter -> IndexedTraversal' Int ObjectKey Text

--   using this region-specific website endpoint.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>Amazon Simple Storage Service Website Endpoints</a>.
getWebsiteEndpoint :: Region -> Text

-- | Specifies the days since the initiation of an incomplete multipart
--   upload that Amazon S3 will wait before permanently removing all parts
--   of the upload. For more information, see <a>Aborting Incomplete
--   Multipart Uploads Using a Bucket Lifecycle Policy</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAbortIncompleteMultipartUpload</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   multipart upload.

data AnalyticsS3BucketDestination
AnalyticsS3BucketDestination' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AnalyticsS3ExportFileFormat -> BucketName -> AnalyticsS3BucketDestination

-- | The account ID that owns the destination S3 bucket. If no account ID
--   is provided, the owner is not validated before exporting data.
--   
--   Although this value is optional, we strongly recommend that you set it
--   to help prevent problems if the destination bucket ownership changes.

--   results.

--   exported.

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Bucket

-- | In terms of implementation, a Bucket is a resource. An Amazon S3
--   bucket name is globally unique, and the namespace is shared by all
--   Amazon Web Services accounts.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucket</a> smart constructor.
data Bucket
Bucket' :: ISO8601 -> BucketName -> Bucket

-- | Date the bucket was created. This date can change when making changes
--   to your bucket, such as editing its bucket policy.
[$sel:creationDate:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> ISO8601

-- | The name of the bucket.
[$sel:name:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> BucketName

-- | Create a value of <a>Bucket</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_creationDate</a> - Date
--   the bucket was created. This date can change when making changes to
--   your bucket, such as editing its bucket policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_name</a> - The name of the bucket.
newBucket :: UTCTime -> BucketName -> Bucket

-- | Date the bucket was created. This date can change when making changes
--   to your bucket, such as editing its bucket policy.
bucket_creationDate :: Lens' Bucket UTCTime

-- | The name of the bucket.
bucket_name :: Lens' Bucket BucketName

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccelerateConfiguration

-- | Configures the transfer acceleration state for an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon S3 Transfer Acceleration</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccelerateConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data AccelerateConfiguration
AccelerateConfiguration' :: Maybe BucketAccelerateStatus -> AccelerateConfiguration

-- | Specifies the transfer acceleration status of the bucket.
[$sel:status:AccelerateConfiguration'] :: AccelerateConfiguration -> Maybe BucketAccelerateStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>AccelerateConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AccelerateConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>accelerateConfiguration_status</a> - Specifies the transfer
--   acceleration status of the bucket.
newAccelerateConfiguration :: AccelerateConfiguration

-- | Specifies the transfer acceleration status of the bucket.
accelerateConfiguration_status :: Lens' AccelerateConfiguration (Maybe BucketAccelerateStatus)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccelerateConfiguration.AccelerateConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccelerateConfiguration.AccelerateConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccelerateConfiguration.AccelerateConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccelerateConfiguration.AccelerateConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccelerateConfiguration.AccelerateConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccelerateConfiguration.AccelerateConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccelerateConfiguration.AccelerateConfiguration

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSRule

-- | Specifies a cross-origin access rule for an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCORSRule</a> smart constructor.
data CORSRule
CORSRule' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> [Text] -> [Text] -> CORSRule

-- | The time in seconds that your browser is to cache the preflight
--   response for the specified resource.
[$sel:maxAgeSeconds:CORSRule'] :: CORSRule -> Maybe Int

-- | Headers that are specified in the
--   <tt>Access-Control-Request-Headers</tt> header. These headers are
--   allowed in a preflight OPTIONS request. In response to any preflight
--   OPTIONS request, Amazon S3 returns any requested headers that are
--   allowed.
[$sel:allowedHeaders:CORSRule'] :: CORSRule -> Maybe [Text]

-- | One or more headers in the response that you want customers to be able
--   to access from their applications (for example, from a JavaScript
--   <tt>XMLHttpRequest</tt> object).
[$sel:exposeHeaders:CORSRule'] :: CORSRule -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Unique identifier for the rule. The value cannot be longer than 255
--   characters.
[$sel:id:CORSRule'] :: CORSRule -> Maybe Text

-- | An HTTP method that you allow the origin to execute. Valid values are
--   <tt>GET</tt>, <tt>PUT</tt>, <tt>HEAD</tt>, <tt>POST</tt>, and
--   <tt>DELETE</tt>.
[$sel:allowedMethods:CORSRule'] :: CORSRule -> [Text]

-- | One or more origins you want customers to be able to access the bucket
--   from.
[$sel:allowedOrigins:CORSRule'] :: CORSRule -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>CORSRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxAgeSeconds:CORSRule'</a>, <a>cORSRule_maxAgeSeconds</a> -
--   The time in seconds that your browser is to cache the preflight
--   response for the specified resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedHeaders:CORSRule'</a>, <a>cORSRule_allowedHeaders</a> -
--   Headers that are specified in the
--   <tt>Access-Control-Request-Headers</tt> header. These headers are
--   allowed in a preflight OPTIONS request. In response to any preflight
--   OPTIONS request, Amazon S3 returns any requested headers that are
--   allowed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exposeHeaders:CORSRule'</a>, <a>cORSRule_exposeHeaders</a> -
--   One or more headers in the response that you want customers to be able
--   to access from their applications (for example, from a JavaScript
--   <tt>XMLHttpRequest</tt> object).
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:CORSRule'</a>, <a>cORSRule_id</a> - Unique identifier for
--   the rule. The value cannot be longer than 255 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedMethods:CORSRule'</a>, <a>cORSRule_allowedMethods</a> -
--   An HTTP method that you allow the origin to execute. Valid values are
--   <tt>GET</tt>, <tt>PUT</tt>, <tt>HEAD</tt>, <tt>POST</tt>, and
--   <tt>DELETE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedOrigins:CORSRule'</a>, <a>cORSRule_allowedOrigins</a> -
--   One or more origins you want customers to be able to access the bucket
--   from.
newCORSRule :: CORSRule

-- | The time in seconds that your browser is to cache the preflight
--   response for the specified resource.
cORSRule_maxAgeSeconds :: Lens' CORSRule (Maybe Int)

-- | Headers that are specified in the
--   <tt>Access-Control-Request-Headers</tt> header. These headers are
--   allowed in a preflight OPTIONS request. In response to any preflight
--   OPTIONS request, Amazon S3 returns any requested headers that are
--   allowed.
cORSRule_allowedHeaders :: Lens' CORSRule (Maybe [Text])

-- | One or more headers in the response that you want customers to be able
--   to access from their applications (for example, from a JavaScript
--   <tt>XMLHttpRequest</tt> object).
cORSRule_exposeHeaders :: Lens' CORSRule (Maybe [Text])

-- | Unique identifier for the rule. The value cannot be longer than 255
--   characters.
cORSRule_id :: Lens' CORSRule (Maybe Text)

-- | An HTTP method that you allow the origin to execute. Valid values are
--   <tt>GET</tt>, <tt>PUT</tt>, <tt>HEAD</tt>, <tt>POST</tt>, and
--   <tt>DELETE</tt>.
cORSRule_allowedMethods :: Lens' CORSRule [Text]

-- | One or more origins you want customers to be able to access the bucket
--   from.
cORSRule_allowedOrigins :: Lens' CORSRule [Text]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSRule.CORSRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSRule.CORSRule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSRule.CORSRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSRule.CORSRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSRule.CORSRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSRule.CORSRule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSRule.CORSRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSRule.CORSRule


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSConfiguration

-- | Describes the cross-origin access configuration for objects in an
--   Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Enabling Cross-Origin
--   Resource Sharing</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCORSConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data CORSConfiguration
CORSConfiguration' :: [CORSRule] -> CORSConfiguration

-- | A set of origins and methods (cross-origin access that you want to
--   allow). You can add up to 100 rules to the configuration.
[$sel:cORSRules:CORSConfiguration'] :: CORSConfiguration -> [CORSRule]

-- | Create a value of <a>CORSConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cORSRules:CORSConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cORSConfiguration_cORSRules</a> - A set of origins and methods
--   (cross-origin access that you want to allow). You can add up to 100
--   rules to the configuration.
newCORSConfiguration :: CORSConfiguration

-- | A set of origins and methods (cross-origin access that you want to
--   allow). You can add up to 100 rules to the configuration.
cORSConfiguration_cORSRules :: Lens' CORSConfiguration [CORSRule]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSConfiguration.CORSConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSConfiguration.CORSConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSConfiguration.CORSConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSConfiguration.CORSConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSConfiguration.CORSConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSConfiguration.CORSConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.CORSConfiguration.CORSConfiguration


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.CommonPrefix

-- | Container for all (if there are any) keys between Prefix and the next
--   occurrence of the string specified by a delimiter. CommonPrefixes
--   lists keys that act like subdirectories in the directory specified by
--   Prefix. For example, if the prefix is notes/ and the delimiter is a
--   slash (/) as in notes/summer/july, the common prefix is notes/summer/.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCommonPrefix</a> smart constructor.
data CommonPrefix
CommonPrefix' :: Maybe Text -> CommonPrefix

-- | Container for the specified common prefix.
[$sel:prefix:CommonPrefix'] :: CommonPrefix -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CommonPrefix</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:CommonPrefix'</a>, <a>commonPrefix_prefix</a> -
--   Container for the specified common prefix.
newCommonPrefix :: CommonPrefix

-- | Container for the specified common prefix.
commonPrefix_prefix :: Lens' CommonPrefix (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.CommonPrefix.CommonPrefix
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.CommonPrefix.CommonPrefix
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.CommonPrefix.CommonPrefix
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.CommonPrefix.CommonPrefix
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.CommonPrefix.CommonPrefix
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.CommonPrefix.CommonPrefix
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.CommonPrefix.CommonPrefix


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.CompletedPart

-- | Details of the parts that were uploaded.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCompletedPart</a> smart constructor.
data CompletedPart
CompletedPart' :: Int -> ETag -> CompletedPart

-- | Part number that identifies the part. This is a positive integer
--   between 1 and 10,000.
[$sel:partNumber:CompletedPart'] :: CompletedPart -> Int

-- | Entity tag returned when the part was uploaded.
[$sel:eTag:CompletedPart'] :: CompletedPart -> ETag

-- | Create a value of <a>CompletedPart</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:partNumber:CompletedPart'</a>, <a>completedPart_partNumber</a>
--   - Part number that identifies the part. This is a positive integer
--   between 1 and 10,000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eTag:CompletedPart'</a>, <a>completedPart_eTag</a> - Entity
--   tag returned when the part was uploaded.
newCompletedPart :: Int -> ETag -> CompletedPart

-- | Part number that identifies the part. This is a positive integer
--   between 1 and 10,000.
completedPart_partNumber :: Lens' CompletedPart Int

-- | Entity tag returned when the part was uploaded.
completedPart_eTag :: Lens' CompletedPart ETag
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.CompletedPart.CompletedPart
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.CompletedPart.CompletedPart
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.CompletedPart.CompletedPart

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Condition

-- | A container for describing a condition that must be met for the
--   specified redirect to apply. For example, 1. If request is for pages
--   in the <tt>/docs</tt> folder, redirect to the <tt>/documents</tt>
--   folder. 2. If request results in HTTP error 4xx, redirect request to
--   another host where you might process the error.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCondition</a> smart constructor.
data Condition
Condition' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Condition

-- | The object key name prefix when the redirect is applied. For example,
--   to redirect requests for <tt>ExamplePage.html</tt>, the key prefix
--   will be <tt>ExamplePage.html</tt>. To redirect request for all pages
--   with the prefix <tt>docs/</tt>, the key prefix will be <tt>/docs</tt>,
--   which identifies all objects in the <tt>docs/</tt> folder. Required
--   when the parent element <tt>Condition</tt> is specified and sibling
--   <tt>HttpErrorCodeReturnedEquals</tt> is not specified. If both
--   conditions are specified, both must be true for the redirect to be
--   applied.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:keyPrefixEquals:Condition'] :: Condition -> Maybe Text

-- | The HTTP error code when the redirect is applied. In the event of an
--   error, if the error code equals this value, then the specified
--   redirect is applied. Required when parent element <tt>Condition</tt>
--   is specified and sibling <tt>KeyPrefixEquals</tt> is not specified. If
--   both are specified, then both must be true for the redirect to be
--   applied.
[$sel:httpErrorCodeReturnedEquals:Condition'] :: Condition -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Condition</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyPrefixEquals:Condition'</a>,
--   <a>condition_keyPrefixEquals</a> - The object key name prefix when the
--   redirect is applied. For example, to redirect requests for
--   <tt>ExamplePage.html</tt>, the key prefix will be
--   <tt>ExamplePage.html</tt>. To redirect request for all pages with the
--   prefix <tt>docs/</tt>, the key prefix will be <tt>/docs</tt>, which
--   identifies all objects in the <tt>docs/</tt> folder. Required when the
--   parent element <tt>Condition</tt> is specified and sibling
--   <tt>HttpErrorCodeReturnedEquals</tt> is not specified. If both
--   conditions are specified, both must be true for the redirect to be
--   applied.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpErrorCodeReturnedEquals:Condition'</a>,
--   <a>condition_httpErrorCodeReturnedEquals</a> - The HTTP error code
--   when the redirect is applied. In the event of an error, if the error
--   code equals this value, then the specified redirect is applied.
--   Required when parent element <tt>Condition</tt> is specified and
--   sibling <tt>KeyPrefixEquals</tt> is not specified. If both are
--   specified, then both must be true for the redirect to be applied.
newCondition :: Condition

-- | The object key name prefix when the redirect is applied. For example,
--   to redirect requests for <tt>ExamplePage.html</tt>, the key prefix
--   will be <tt>ExamplePage.html</tt>. To redirect request for all pages
--   with the prefix <tt>docs/</tt>, the key prefix will be <tt>/docs</tt>,
--   which identifies all objects in the <tt>docs/</tt> folder. Required
--   when the parent element <tt>Condition</tt> is specified and sibling
--   <tt>HttpErrorCodeReturnedEquals</tt> is not specified. If both
--   conditions are specified, both must be true for the redirect to be
--   applied.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
condition_keyPrefixEquals :: Lens' Condition (Maybe Text)

-- | The HTTP error code when the redirect is applied. In the event of an
--   error, if the error code equals this value, then the specified
--   redirect is applied. Required when parent element <tt>Condition</tt>
--   is specified and sibling <tt>KeyPrefixEquals</tt> is not specified. If
--   both are specified, then both must be true for the redirect to be
--   applied.
condition_httpErrorCodeReturnedEquals :: Lens' Condition (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Condition.Condition
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Condition.Condition
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Condition.Condition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Condition.Condition
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Condition.Condition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.Condition.Condition
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.Condition.Condition
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Condition.Condition

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCopyObjectResult</a> smart constructor.
data CopyObjectResult
CopyObjectResult' :: Maybe ETag -> Maybe ISO8601 -> CopyObjectResult

-- | Returns the ETag of the new object. The ETag reflects only changes to
--   the contents of an object, not its metadata.
[$sel:eTag:CopyObjectResult'] :: CopyObjectResult -> Maybe ETag

-- | Creation date of the object.
[$sel:lastModified:CopyObjectResult'] :: CopyObjectResult -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>CopyObjectResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:eTag:CopyObjectResult'</a>, <a>copyObjectResult_eTag</a> -
--   Returns the ETag of the new object. The ETag reflects only changes to
--   the contents of an object, not its metadata.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModified:CopyObjectResult'</a>,
--   <a>copyObjectResult_lastModified</a> - Creation date of the object.
newCopyObjectResult :: CopyObjectResult

-- | Returns the ETag of the new object. The ETag reflects only changes to
--   the contents of an object, not its metadata.
copyObjectResult_eTag :: Lens' CopyObjectResult (Maybe ETag)

-- | Creation date of the object.
copyObjectResult_lastModified :: Lens' CopyObjectResult (Maybe UTCTime)

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeleteMarkerReplication

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 replicates delete markers. If you specify
--   a <tt>Filter</tt> in your replication configuration, you must also
--   include a <tt>DeleteMarkerReplication</tt> element. If your
--   <tt>Filter</tt> includes a <tt>Tag</tt> element, the
--   <tt>DeleteMarkerReplication</tt> <tt>Status</tt> must be set to
--   Disabled, because Amazon S3 does not support replicating delete
--   markers for tag-based rules. For an example configuration, see
--   <a>Basic Rule Configuration</a>.
--   
--   For more information about delete marker replication, see <a>Basic
--   Rule Configuration</a>.
--   
--   If you are using an earlier version of the replication configuration,
--   Amazon S3 handles replication of delete markers differently. For more
--   information, see <a>Backward Compatibility</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteMarkerReplication</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteMarkerReplication
DeleteMarkerReplication' :: Maybe DeleteMarkerReplicationStatus -> DeleteMarkerReplication

-- | Indicates whether to replicate delete markers.
--   
--   Indicates whether to replicate delete markers.
[$sel:status:DeleteMarkerReplication'] :: DeleteMarkerReplication -> Maybe DeleteMarkerReplicationStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteMarkerReplication</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DeleteMarkerReplication'</a>,
--   <a>deleteMarkerReplication_status</a> - Indicates whether to replicate
--   delete markers.
--   
--   Indicates whether to replicate delete markers.
newDeleteMarkerReplication :: DeleteMarkerReplication

-- | Indicates whether to replicate delete markers.
--   
--   Indicates whether to replicate delete markers.
deleteMarkerReplication_status :: Lens' DeleteMarkerReplication (Maybe DeleteMarkerReplicationStatus)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeleteMarkerReplication.DeleteMarkerReplication
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeleteMarkerReplication.DeleteMarkerReplication
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeleteMarkerReplication.DeleteMarkerReplication
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeleteMarkerReplication.DeleteMarkerReplication
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeleteMarkerReplication.DeleteMarkerReplication
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeleteMarkerReplication.DeleteMarkerReplication
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeleteMarkerReplication.DeleteMarkerReplication
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeleteMarkerReplication.DeleteMarkerReplication


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeletedObject

-- | Information about the deleted object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeletedObject</a> smart constructor.
data DeletedObject
DeletedObject' :: Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ObjectKey -> DeletedObject

-- | The version ID of the deleted object.
[$sel:versionId:DeletedObject'] :: DeletedObject -> Maybe ObjectVersionId

-- | Specifies whether the versioned object that was permanently deleted
--   was (true) or was not (false) a delete marker. In a simple DELETE,
--   this header indicates whether (true) or not (false) a delete marker
--   was created.
[$sel:deleteMarker:DeletedObject'] :: DeletedObject -> Maybe Bool

-- | The version ID of the delete marker created as a result of the DELETE
--   operation. If you delete a specific object version, the value returned
--   by this header is the version ID of the object version deleted.
[$sel:deleteMarkerVersionId:DeletedObject'] :: DeletedObject -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the deleted object.
[$sel:key:DeletedObject'] :: DeletedObject -> Maybe ObjectKey

-- | Create a value of <a>DeletedObject</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:DeletedObject'</a>, <a>deletedObject_versionId</a> -
--   The version ID of the deleted object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteMarker:DeletedObject'</a>,
--   <a>deletedObject_deleteMarker</a> - Specifies whether the versioned
--   object that was permanently deleted was (true) or was not (false) a
--   delete marker. In a simple DELETE, this header indicates whether
--   (true) or not (false) a delete marker was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteMarkerVersionId:DeletedObject'</a>,
--   <a>deletedObject_deleteMarkerVersionId</a> - The version ID of the
--   delete marker created as a result of the DELETE operation. If you
--   delete a specific object version, the value returned by this header is
--   the version ID of the object version deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:DeletedObject'</a>, <a>deletedObject_key</a> - The name of
--   the deleted object.
newDeletedObject :: DeletedObject

-- | The version ID of the deleted object.
deletedObject_versionId :: Lens' DeletedObject (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | Specifies whether the versioned object that was permanently deleted
--   was (true) or was not (false) a delete marker. In a simple DELETE,
--   this header indicates whether (true) or not (false) a delete marker
--   was created.
deletedObject_deleteMarker :: Lens' DeletedObject (Maybe Bool)

-- | The version ID of the delete marker created as a result of the DELETE
--   operation. If you delete a specific object version, the value returned
--   by this header is the version ID of the object version deleted.
deletedObject_deleteMarkerVersionId :: Lens' DeletedObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the deleted object.
deletedObject_key :: Lens' DeletedObject (Maybe ObjectKey)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeletedObject.DeletedObject
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeletedObject.DeletedObject
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeletedObject.DeletedObject
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeletedObject.DeletedObject
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeletedObject.DeletedObject
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeletedObject.DeletedObject
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.DeletedObject.DeletedObject


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncodingType

-- | Requests Amazon S3 to encode the object keys in the response and
--   specifies the encoding method to use. An object key may contain any
--   Unicode character; however, XML 1.0 parser cannot parse some
--   characters, such as characters with an ASCII value from 0 to 10. For
--   characters that are not supported in XML 1.0, you can add this
--   parameter to request that Amazon S3 encode the keys in the response.
newtype EncodingType
EncodingType' :: Text -> EncodingType
[fromEncodingType] :: EncodingType -> Text
pattern EncodingType_Url :: EncodingType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncodingType.EncodingType

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncodingType.EncodingType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncodingType.EncodingType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncodingType.EncodingType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncodingType.EncodingType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncodingType.EncodingType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncodingType.EncodingType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncodingType.EncodingType

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncryptionConfiguration

-- | Specifies encryption-related information for an Amazon S3 bucket that
--   is a destination for replicated objects.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEncryptionConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data EncryptionConfiguration
EncryptionConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> EncryptionConfiguration

-- | Specifies the ID (Key ARN or Alias ARN) of the customer managed Amazon
--   Web Services KMS key stored in Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service (KMS) for the destination bucket. Amazon S3 uses this key to
--   encrypt replica objects. Amazon S3 only supports symmetric, customer
--   managed KMS keys. For more information, see <a>Using symmetric and
--   asymmetric keys</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:replicaKmsKeyID:EncryptionConfiguration'] :: EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EncryptionConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicaKmsKeyID:EncryptionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>encryptionConfiguration_replicaKmsKeyID</a> - Specifies the ID (Key
--   ARN or Alias ARN) of the customer managed Amazon Web Services KMS key
--   stored in Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) for the
--   destination bucket. Amazon S3 uses this key to encrypt replica
--   objects. Amazon S3 only supports symmetric, customer managed KMS keys.
--   For more information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon Web Services Key Management Service Developer
--   Guide</i>.
newEncryptionConfiguration :: EncryptionConfiguration

-- | Specifies the ID (Key ARN or Alias ARN) of the customer managed Amazon
--   Web Services KMS key stored in Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service (KMS) for the destination bucket. Amazon S3 uses this key to
--   encrypt replica objects. Amazon S3 only supports symmetric, customer
--   managed KMS keys. For more information, see <a>Using symmetric and
--   asymmetric keys</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service Developer Guide</i>.
encryptionConfiguration_replicaKmsKeyID :: Lens' EncryptionConfiguration (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.EncryptionConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ErrorDocument

-- | The error information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newErrorDocument</a> smart constructor.
data ErrorDocument

-- | The object key name to use when a 4XX class error occurs.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:key:ErrorDocument'] :: ErrorDocument -> ObjectKey

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   key name to use when a 4XX class error occurs.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
newErrorDocument :: ObjectKey -> ErrorDocument

-- | The object key name to use when a 4XX class error occurs.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
errorDocument_key :: Lens' ErrorDocument ObjectKey

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.ErrorDocument.ErrorDocument
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ErrorDocument.ErrorDocument

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVInput

-- | Describes how an uncompressed comma-separated values (CSV)-formatted
--   input object is formatted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCSVInput</a> smart constructor.
data CSVInput
CSVInput' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe FileHeaderInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CSVInput

-- | A single character used for escaping when the field delimiter is part
--   of the value. For example, if the value is <tt>a, b</tt>, Amazon S3
--   wraps this field value in quotation marks, as follows: <tt>" a , b
--   "</tt>.
--   
--   Type: String
--   
--   Default: <tt>"</tt>
--   
--   Ancestors: <tt>CSV</tt>
[$sel:quoteCharacter:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe Text

-- | A single character used to separate individual records in the input.
--   Instead of the default value, you can specify an arbitrary delimiter.
[$sel:recordDelimiter:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies that CSV field values may contain quoted record delimiters
--   and such records should be allowed. Default value is FALSE. Setting
--   this value to TRUE may lower performance.
[$sel:allowQuotedRecordDelimiter:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe Bool

-- | Describes the first line of input. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>NONE</tt>: First line is not a header.</li>
--   <li><tt>IGNORE</tt>: First line is a header, but you can't use the
--   header values to indicate the column in an expression. You can use
--   column position (such as _1, _2, …) to indicate the column (<tt>SELECT
--   s._1 FROM OBJECT s</tt>).</li>
--   <li><tt>Use</tt>: First line is a header, and you can use the header
--   value to identify a column in an expression (<tt>SELECT "name" FROM
--   OBJECT</tt>).</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:fileHeaderInfo:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe FileHeaderInfo

-- | A single character used for escaping the quotation mark character
--   inside an already escaped value. For example, the value """ a , b """
--   is parsed as " a , b ".
[$sel:quoteEscapeCharacter:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe Text

-- | A single character used to indicate that a row should be ignored when
--   the character is present at the start of that row. You can specify any
--   character to indicate a comment line.
[$sel:comments:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe Text

-- | A single character used to separate individual fields in a record. You
--   can specify an arbitrary delimiter.
[$sel:fieldDelimiter:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CSVInput</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteCharacter:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_quoteCharacter</a> -
--   A single character used for escaping when the field delimiter is part
--   of the value. For example, if the value is <tt>a, b</tt>, Amazon S3
--   wraps this field value in quotation marks, as follows: <tt>" a , b
--   "</tt>.
--   
--   Type: String
--   
--   Default: <tt>"</tt>
--   
--   Ancestors: <tt>CSV</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordDelimiter:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_recordDelimiter</a>
--   - A single character used to separate individual records in the input.
--   Instead of the default value, you can specify an arbitrary delimiter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowQuotedRecordDelimiter:CSVInput'</a>,
--   <a>cSVInput_allowQuotedRecordDelimiter</a> - Specifies that CSV field
--   values may contain quoted record delimiters and such records should be
--   allowed. Default value is FALSE. Setting this value to TRUE may lower
--   performance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileHeaderInfo:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_fileHeaderInfo</a> -
--   Describes the first line of input. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>NONE</tt>: First line is not a header.</li>
--   <li><tt>IGNORE</tt>: First line is a header, but you can't use the
--   header values to indicate the column in an expression. You can use
--   column position (such as _1, _2, …) to indicate the column (<tt>SELECT
--   s._1 FROM OBJECT s</tt>).</li>
--   <li><tt>Use</tt>: First line is a header, and you can use the header
--   value to identify a column in an expression (<tt>SELECT "name" FROM
--   OBJECT</tt>).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteEscapeCharacter:CSVInput'</a>,
--   <a>cSVInput_quoteEscapeCharacter</a> - A single character used for
--   escaping the quotation mark character inside an already escaped value.
--   For example, the value """ a , b """ is parsed as " a , b ".
--   
--   <a>$sel:comments:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_comments</a> - A single
--   character used to indicate that a row should be ignored when the
--   character is present at the start of that row. You can specify any
--   character to indicate a comment line.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fieldDelimiter:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_fieldDelimiter</a> -
--   A single character used to separate individual fields in a record. You
--   can specify an arbitrary delimiter.
newCSVInput :: CSVInput

-- | A single character used for escaping when the field delimiter is part
--   of the value. For example, if the value is <tt>a, b</tt>, Amazon S3
--   wraps this field value in quotation marks, as follows: <tt>" a , b
--   "</tt>.
--   
--   Type: String
--   
--   Default: <tt>"</tt>
--   
--   Ancestors: <tt>CSV</tt>
cSVInput_quoteCharacter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A single character used to separate individual records in the input.
--   Instead of the default value, you can specify an arbitrary delimiter.
cSVInput_recordDelimiter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies that CSV field values may contain quoted record delimiters
--   and such records should be allowed. Default value is FALSE. Setting
--   this value to TRUE may lower performance.
cSVInput_allowQuotedRecordDelimiter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Bool)

-- | Describes the first line of input. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>NONE</tt>: First line is not a header.</li>
--   <li><tt>IGNORE</tt>: First line is a header, but you can't use the
--   header values to indicate the column in an expression. You can use
--   column position (such as _1, _2, …) to indicate the column (<tt>SELECT
--   s._1 FROM OBJECT s</tt>).</li>
--   <li><tt>Use</tt>: First line is a header, and you can use the header
--   value to identify a column in an expression (<tt>SELECT "name" FROM
--   OBJECT</tt>).</li>
--   </ul>
cSVInput_fileHeaderInfo :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe FileHeaderInfo)

-- | A single character used for escaping the quotation mark character
--   inside an already escaped value. For example, the value """ a , b """
--   is parsed as " a , b ".
cSVInput_quoteEscapeCharacter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A single character used to indicate that a row should be ignored when
--   the character is present at the start of that row. You can specify any
--   character to indicate a comment line.
cSVInput_comments :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A single character used to separate individual fields in a record. You
--   can specify an arbitrary delimiter.
cSVInput_fieldDelimiter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput

[fromFilterRuleName] :: FilterRuleName -> Text

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.FilterRuleName.FilterRuleName


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.FilterRule

-- | Specifies the Amazon S3 object key name to filter on and whether to
--   filter on the suffix or prefix of the key name.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFilterRule</a> smart constructor.
data FilterRule
FilterRule' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe FilterRuleName -> FilterRule

-- | The value that the filter searches for in object key names.
[$sel:value:FilterRule'] :: FilterRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The object key name prefix or suffix identifying one or more objects
--   to which the filtering rule applies. The maximum length is 1,024
--   characters. Overlapping prefixes and suffixes are not supported. For
--   more information, see <a>Configuring Event Notifications</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:name:FilterRule'] :: FilterRule -> Maybe FilterRuleName

-- | Create a value of <a>FilterRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:FilterRule'</a>, <a>filterRule_value</a> - The value
--   that the filter searches for in object key names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:FilterRule'</a>, <a>filterRule_name</a> - The object key
--   name prefix or suffix identifying one or more objects to which the
--   filtering rule applies. The maximum length is 1,024 characters.
--   Overlapping prefixes and suffixes are not supported. For more
--   information, see <a>Configuring Event Notifications</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
newFilterRule :: FilterRule

-- | The value that the filter searches for in object key names.
filterRule_value :: Lens' FilterRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The object key name prefix or suffix identifying one or more objects
--   to which the filtering rule applies. The maximum length is 1,024
--   characters. Overlapping prefixes and suffixes are not supported. For
--   more information, see <a>Configuring Event Notifications</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
filterRule_name :: Lens' FilterRule (Maybe FilterRuleName)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.FilterRule.FilterRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.FilterRule.FilterRule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.FilterRule.FilterRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.FilterRule.FilterRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.FilterRule.FilterRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.FilterRule.FilterRule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.FilterRule.FilterRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.FilterRule.FilterRule


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.IndexDocument

-- | Container for the <tt>Suffix</tt> element.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIndexDocument</a> smart constructor.
data IndexDocument
IndexDocument' :: Text -> IndexDocument

-- | A suffix that is appended to a request that is for a directory on the
--   website endpoint (for example,if the suffix is index.html and you make
--   a request to samplebucket/images/ the data that is returned will be
--   for the object with the key name images/index.html) The suffix must
--   not be empty and must not include a slash character.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:suffix:IndexDocument'] :: IndexDocument -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IndexDocument</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suffix:IndexDocument'</a>, <a>indexDocument_suffix</a> - A
--   suffix that is appended to a request that is for a directory on the
--   website endpoint (for example,if the suffix is index.html and you make
--   a request to samplebucket/images/ the data that is returned will be
--   for the object with the key name images/index.html) The suffix must
--   not be empty and must not include a slash character.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
newIndexDocument :: Text -> IndexDocument

-- | A suffix that is appended to a request that is for a directory on the
--   website endpoint (for example,if the suffix is index.html and you make
--   a request to samplebucket/images/ the data that is returned will be
--   for the object with the key name images/index.html) The suffix must
--   not be empty and must not include a slash character.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
indexDocument_suffix :: Lens' IndexDocument Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.IndexDocument.IndexDocument
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.IndexDocument.IndexDocument
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.IndexDocument.IndexDocument
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.IndexDocument.IndexDocument
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.IndexDocument.IndexDocument
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.IndexDocument.IndexDocument
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.IndexDocument.IndexDocument
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.IndexDocument.IndexDocument


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Initiator

-- | Container element that identifies who initiated the multipart upload.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInitiator</a> smart constructor.
data Initiator
Initiator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Initiator

-- | Name of the Principal.
[$sel:displayName:Initiator'] :: Initiator -> Maybe Text

-- | If the principal is an Amazon Web Services account, it provides the
--   Canonical User ID. If the principal is an IAM User, it provides a user
--   ARN value.
[$sel:id:Initiator'] :: Initiator -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Initiator</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:Initiator'</a>, <a>initiator_displayName</a> -
--   Name of the Principal.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Initiator'</a>, <a>initiator_id</a> - If the principal is
--   an Amazon Web Services account, it provides the Canonical User ID. If
--   the principal is an IAM User, it provides a user ARN value.
newInitiator :: Initiator

-- | Name of the Principal.
initiator_displayName :: Lens' Initiator (Maybe Text)

-- | If the principal is an Amazon Web Services account, it provides the
--   Canonical User ID. If the principal is an IAM User, it provides a user
--   ARN value.
initiator_id :: Lens' Initiator (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Initiator.Initiator
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Initiator.Initiator
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Initiator.Initiator
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Initiator.Initiator
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Initiator.Initiator
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.Initiator.Initiator
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.Initiator.Initiator

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.InventoryFilter

-- | Specifies an inventory filter. The inventory only includes objects
--   that meet the filter's criteria.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInventoryFilter</a> smart constructor.
data InventoryFilter
InventoryFilter' :: Text -> InventoryFilter

-- | The prefix that an object must have to be included in the inventory
--   results.
[$sel:prefix:InventoryFilter'] :: InventoryFilter -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InventoryFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:InventoryFilter'</a>, <a>inventoryFilter_prefix</a> -
--   The prefix that an object must have to be included in the inventory
--   results.
newInventoryFilter :: Text -> InventoryFilter

-- | The prefix that an object must have to be included in the inventory
--   results.
inventoryFilter_prefix :: Lens' InventoryFilter Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.InventoryFilter.InventoryFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.InventoryFilter.InventoryFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.InventoryFilter.InventoryFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.InventoryFilter.InventoryFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.InventoryFilter.InventoryFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.InventoryFilter.InventoryFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.InventoryFilter.InventoryFilter

--   inventory results are produced.

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.JSONOutput

-- | Specifies JSON as request's output serialization format.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJSONOutput</a> smart constructor.
data JSONOutput
JSONOutput' :: Maybe Text -> JSONOutput

-- | The value used to separate individual records in the output. If no
--   value is specified, Amazon S3 uses a newline character ('\n').
[$sel:recordDelimiter:JSONOutput'] :: JSONOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>JSONOutput</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordDelimiter:JSONOutput'</a>,
--   <a>jSONOutput_recordDelimiter</a> - The value used to separate
--   individual records in the output. If no value is specified, Amazon S3
--   uses a newline character ('\n').
newJSONOutput :: JSONOutput

-- | The value used to separate individual records in the output. If no
--   value is specified, Amazon S3 uses a newline character ('\n').
jSONOutput_recordDelimiter :: Lens' JSONOutput (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.JSONOutput.JSONOutput
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.JSONOutput.JSONOutput
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.JSONOutput.JSONOutput
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.JSONOutput.JSONOutput
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.JSONOutput.JSONOutput
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.JSONOutput.JSONOutput
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.JSONOutput.JSONOutput


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.JSONType

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleExpiration

-- | Container for the expiration for the lifecycle of the object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycleExpiration</a> smart constructor.
data LifecycleExpiration
LifecycleExpiration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Bool -> LifecycleExpiration

-- | Indicates the lifetime, in days, of the objects that are subject to
--   the rule. The value must be a non-zero positive integer.
[$sel:days:LifecycleExpiration'] :: LifecycleExpiration -> Maybe Int

-- | Indicates at what date the object is to be moved or deleted. Should be
--   in GMT ISO 8601 Format.
[$sel:date:LifecycleExpiration'] :: LifecycleExpiration -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Indicates whether Amazon S3 will remove a delete marker with no
--   noncurrent versions. If set to true, the delete marker will be
--   expired; if set to false the policy takes no action. This cannot be
--   specified with Days or Date in a Lifecycle Expiration Policy.
[$sel:expiredObjectDeleteMarker:LifecycleExpiration'] :: LifecycleExpiration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>LifecycleExpiration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:days:LifecycleExpiration'</a>, <a>lifecycleExpiration_days</a>
--   - Indicates the lifetime, in days, of the objects that are subject to
--   the rule. The value must be a non-zero positive integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:date:LifecycleExpiration'</a>, <a>lifecycleExpiration_date</a>
--   - Indicates at what date the object is to be moved or deleted. Should
--   be in GMT ISO 8601 Format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiredObjectDeleteMarker:LifecycleExpiration'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleExpiration_expiredObjectDeleteMarker</a> - Indicates
--   whether Amazon S3 will remove a delete marker with no noncurrent
--   versions. If set to true, the delete marker will be expired; if set to
--   false the policy takes no action. This cannot be specified with Days
--   or Date in a Lifecycle Expiration Policy.
newLifecycleExpiration :: LifecycleExpiration

-- | Indicates the lifetime, in days, of the objects that are subject to
--   the rule. The value must be a non-zero positive integer.
lifecycleExpiration_days :: Lens' LifecycleExpiration (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates at what date the object is to be moved or deleted. Should be
--   in GMT ISO 8601 Format.
lifecycleExpiration_date :: Lens' LifecycleExpiration (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Indicates whether Amazon S3 will remove a delete marker with no
--   noncurrent versions. If set to true, the delete marker will be
--   expired; if set to false the policy takes no action. This cannot be
--   specified with Days or Date in a Lifecycle Expiration Policy.
lifecycleExpiration_expiredObjectDeleteMarker :: Lens' LifecycleExpiration (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleExpiration.LifecycleExpiration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleExpiration.LifecycleExpiration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleExpiration.LifecycleExpiration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleExpiration.LifecycleExpiration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleExpiration.LifecycleExpiration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleExpiration.LifecycleExpiration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleExpiration.LifecycleExpiration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleExpiration.LifecycleExpiration

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetadataEntry</a> smart constructor.

-- | Value of the Object.

-- | Name of the Object.

--   omitted.

--   of the Object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:MetadataEntry'</a>, <a>metadataEntry_name</a> - Name of
--   the Object.
newMetadataEntry :: MetadataEntry

-- | Value of the Object.
metadataEntry_value :: Lens' MetadataEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | Name of the Object.
metadataEntry_name :: Lens' MetadataEntry (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionExpiration

-- | Specifies when noncurrent object versions expire. Upon expiration,
--   Amazon S3 permanently deletes the noncurrent object versions. You set
--   this lifecycle configuration action on a bucket that has versioning
--   enabled (or suspended) to request that Amazon S3 delete noncurrent
--   object versions at a specific period in the object's lifetime.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNoncurrentVersionExpiration</a> smart constructor.
data NoncurrentVersionExpiration
NoncurrentVersionExpiration' :: Int -> NoncurrentVersionExpiration

-- | Specifies the number of days an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3
--   can perform the associated action. For information about the
--   noncurrent days calculations, see <a>How Amazon S3 Calculates When an
--   Object Became Noncurrent</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:noncurrentDays:NoncurrentVersionExpiration'] :: NoncurrentVersionExpiration -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>NoncurrentVersionExpiration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:noncurrentDays:NoncurrentVersionExpiration'</a>,
--   <a>noncurrentVersionExpiration_noncurrentDays</a> - Specifies the
--   number of days an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3 can perform
--   the associated action. For information about the noncurrent days
--   calculations, see <a>How Amazon S3 Calculates When an Object Became
--   Noncurrent</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
newNoncurrentVersionExpiration :: Int -> NoncurrentVersionExpiration

-- | Specifies the number of days an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3
--   can perform the associated action. For information about the
--   noncurrent days calculations, see <a>How Amazon S3 Calculates When an
--   Object Became Noncurrent</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
noncurrentVersionExpiration_noncurrentDays :: Lens' NoncurrentVersionExpiration Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionExpiration.NoncurrentVersionExpiration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionExpiration.NoncurrentVersionExpiration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionExpiration.NoncurrentVersionExpiration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionExpiration.NoncurrentVersionExpiration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionExpiration.NoncurrentVersionExpiration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionExpiration.NoncurrentVersionExpiration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionExpiration.NoncurrentVersionExpiration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionExpiration.NoncurrentVersionExpiration

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectIdentifier

-- | Object Identifier is unique value to identify objects.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectIdentifier</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectIdentifier
ObjectIdentifier' :: Maybe ObjectVersionId -> ObjectKey -> ObjectIdentifier

-- | VersionId for the specific version of the object to delete.
[$sel:versionId:ObjectIdentifier'] :: ObjectIdentifier -> Maybe ObjectVersionId

-- | Key name of the object.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:key:ObjectIdentifier'] :: ObjectIdentifier -> ObjectKey

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectIdentifier</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:ObjectIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>objectIdentifier_versionId</a> - VersionId for the specific version
--   of the object to delete.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:ObjectIdentifier'</a>, <a>objectIdentifier_key</a> - Key
--   name of the object.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
newObjectIdentifier :: ObjectKey -> ObjectIdentifier

-- | VersionId for the specific version of the object to delete.
objectIdentifier_versionId :: Lens' ObjectIdentifier (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | Key name of the object.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
objectIdentifier_key :: Lens' ObjectIdentifier ObjectKey
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectIdentifier.ObjectIdentifier
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectIdentifier.ObjectIdentifier
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectIdentifier.ObjectIdentifier
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectIdentifier.ObjectIdentifier
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectIdentifier.ObjectIdentifier
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectIdentifier.ObjectIdentifier
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectIdentifier.ObjectIdentifier


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Delete

-- | Container for the objects to delete.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDelete</a> smart constructor.
data Delete
Delete' :: Maybe Bool -> [ObjectIdentifier] -> Delete

-- | Element to enable quiet mode for the request. When you add this
--   element, you must set its value to true.
[$sel:quiet:Delete'] :: Delete -> Maybe Bool

-- | The objects to delete.
[$sel:objects:Delete'] :: Delete -> [ObjectIdentifier]

-- | Create a value of <a>Delete</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:quiet:Delete'</a>, <a>delete_quiet</a> - Element to enable
--   quiet mode for the request. When you add this element, you must set
--   its value to true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objects:Delete'</a>, <a>delete_objects</a> - The objects to
--   delete.
newDelete :: Delete

-- | Element to enable quiet mode for the request. When you add this
--   element, you must set its value to true.
delete_quiet :: Lens' Delete (Maybe Bool)

-- | The objects to delete.
delete_objects :: Lens' Delete [ObjectIdentifier]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Delete.Delete
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Delete.Delete
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Delete.Delete
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Delete.Delete
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.Delete.Delete
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.Delete.Delete
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Delete.Delete


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockEnabled
newtype ObjectLockEnabled
ObjectLockEnabled' :: Text -> ObjectLockEnabled
[fromObjectLockEnabled] :: ObjectLockEnabled -> Text
pattern ObjectLockEnabled_Enabled :: ObjectLockEnabled

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockRetention

data ObjectLockRetention

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   - Indicates the Retention mode for the specified object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retainUntilDate:ObjectLockRetention'</a>,
--   <a>objectLockRetention_retainUntilDate</a> - The date on which this
--   Object Lock Retention will expire.
newObjectLockRetention :: ObjectLockRetention

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.DefaultRetention

-- | The container element for specifying the default Object Lock retention
--   settings for new objects placed in the specified bucket.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The <tt>DefaultRetention</tt> settings require both a mode and a
--   period.</li>
--   <li>The <tt>DefaultRetention</tt> period can be either <tt>Days</tt>
--   or <tt>Years</tt> but you must select one. You cannot specify
--   <tt>Days</tt> and <tt>Years</tt> at the same time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultRetention</a> smart constructor.
data DefaultRetention
DefaultRetention' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe ObjectLockRetentionMode -> Maybe Int -> DefaultRetention

-- | The number of days that you want to specify for the default retention
--   period. Must be used with <tt>Mode</tt>.
[$sel:days:DefaultRetention'] :: DefaultRetention -> Maybe Int

-- | The default Object Lock retention mode you want to apply to new
--   objects placed in the specified bucket. Must be used with either
--   <tt>Days</tt> or <tt>Years</tt>.
[$sel:mode:DefaultRetention'] :: DefaultRetention -> Maybe ObjectLockRetentionMode

-- | The number of years that you want to specify for the default retention
--   period. Must be used with <tt>Mode</tt>.
[$sel:years:DefaultRetention'] :: DefaultRetention -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultRetention</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:days:DefaultRetention'</a>, <a>defaultRetention_days</a> - The
--   number of days that you want to specify for the default retention
--   period. Must be used with <tt>Mode</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mode:DefaultRetention'</a>, <a>defaultRetention_mode</a> - The
--   default Object Lock retention mode you want to apply to new objects
--   placed in the specified bucket. Must be used with either <tt>Days</tt>
--   or <tt>Years</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:years:DefaultRetention'</a>, <a>defaultRetention_years</a> -
--   The number of years that you want to specify for the default retention
--   period. Must be used with <tt>Mode</tt>.
newDefaultRetention :: DefaultRetention

-- | The number of days that you want to specify for the default retention
--   period. Must be used with <tt>Mode</tt>.
defaultRetention_days :: Lens' DefaultRetention (Maybe Int)

-- | The default Object Lock retention mode you want to apply to new
--   objects placed in the specified bucket. Must be used with either
--   <tt>Days</tt> or <tt>Years</tt>.
defaultRetention_mode :: Lens' DefaultRetention (Maybe ObjectLockRetentionMode)

-- | The number of years that you want to specify for the default retention
--   period. Must be used with <tt>Mode</tt>.
defaultRetention_years :: Lens' DefaultRetention (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.DefaultRetention.DefaultRetention
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.DefaultRetention.DefaultRetention
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.DefaultRetention.DefaultRetention
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.DefaultRetention.DefaultRetention
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.DefaultRetention.DefaultRetention
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.DefaultRetention.DefaultRetention
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.DefaultRetention.DefaultRetention
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.DefaultRetention.DefaultRetention


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockRule

-- | The container element for an Object Lock rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectLockRule</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectLockRule
ObjectLockRule' :: Maybe DefaultRetention -> ObjectLockRule

-- | The default Object Lock retention mode and period that you want to
--   apply to new objects placed in the specified bucket. Bucket settings
--   require both a mode and a period. The period can be either
--   <tt>Days</tt> or <tt>Years</tt> but you must select one. You cannot
--   specify <tt>Days</tt> and <tt>Years</tt> at the same time.
[$sel:defaultRetention:ObjectLockRule'] :: ObjectLockRule -> Maybe DefaultRetention

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectLockRule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultRetention:ObjectLockRule'</a>,
--   <a>objectLockRule_defaultRetention</a> - The default Object Lock
--   retention mode and period that you want to apply to new objects placed
--   in the specified bucket. Bucket settings require both a mode and a
--   period. The period can be either <tt>Days</tt> or <tt>Years</tt> but
--   you must select one. You cannot specify <tt>Days</tt> and
--   <tt>Years</tt> at the same time.
newObjectLockRule :: ObjectLockRule

-- | The default Object Lock retention mode and period that you want to
--   apply to new objects placed in the specified bucket. Bucket settings
--   require both a mode and a period. The period can be either
--   <tt>Days</tt> or <tt>Years</tt> but you must select one. You cannot
--   specify <tt>Days</tt> and <tt>Years</tt> at the same time.
objectLockRule_defaultRetention :: Lens' ObjectLockRule (Maybe DefaultRetention)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockRule.ObjectLockRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockRule.ObjectLockRule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockRule.ObjectLockRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockRule.ObjectLockRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockRule.ObjectLockRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockRule.ObjectLockRule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockRule.ObjectLockRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockRule.ObjectLockRule


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockConfiguration

-- | The container element for Object Lock configuration parameters.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectLockConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectLockConfiguration
ObjectLockConfiguration' :: Maybe ObjectLockEnabled -> Maybe ObjectLockRule -> ObjectLockConfiguration

-- | Indicates whether this bucket has an Object Lock configuration
--   enabled. Enable <tt>ObjectLockEnabled</tt> when you apply
--   <tt>ObjectLockConfiguration</tt> to a bucket.
[$sel:objectLockEnabled:ObjectLockConfiguration'] :: ObjectLockConfiguration -> Maybe ObjectLockEnabled

-- | Specifies the Object Lock rule for the specified object. Enable the
--   this rule when you apply <tt>ObjectLockConfiguration</tt> to a bucket.
--   Bucket settings require both a mode and a period. The period can be
--   either <tt>Days</tt> or <tt>Years</tt> but you must select one. You
--   cannot specify <tt>Days</tt> and <tt>Years</tt> at the same time.
[$sel:rule:ObjectLockConfiguration'] :: ObjectLockConfiguration -> Maybe ObjectLockRule

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectLockConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectLockEnabled:ObjectLockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>objectLockConfiguration_objectLockEnabled</a> - Indicates whether
--   this bucket has an Object Lock configuration enabled. Enable
--   <tt>ObjectLockEnabled</tt> when you apply
--   <tt>ObjectLockConfiguration</tt> to a bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rule:ObjectLockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>objectLockConfiguration_rule</a> - Specifies the Object Lock rule
--   for the specified object. Enable the this rule when you apply
--   <tt>ObjectLockConfiguration</tt> to a bucket. Bucket settings require
--   both a mode and a period. The period can be either <tt>Days</tt> or
--   <tt>Years</tt> but you must select one. You cannot specify
--   <tt>Days</tt> and <tt>Years</tt> at the same time.
newObjectLockConfiguration :: ObjectLockConfiguration

-- | Indicates whether this bucket has an Object Lock configuration
--   enabled. Enable <tt>ObjectLockEnabled</tt> when you apply
--   <tt>ObjectLockConfiguration</tt> to a bucket.
objectLockConfiguration_objectLockEnabled :: Lens' ObjectLockConfiguration (Maybe ObjectLockEnabled)

-- | Specifies the Object Lock rule for the specified object. Enable the
--   this rule when you apply <tt>ObjectLockConfiguration</tt> to a bucket.
--   Bucket settings require both a mode and a period. The period can be
--   either <tt>Days</tt> or <tt>Years</tt> but you must select one. You
--   cannot specify <tt>Days</tt> and <tt>Years</tt> at the same time.
objectLockConfiguration_rule :: Lens' ObjectLockConfiguration (Maybe ObjectLockRule)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockConfiguration.ObjectLockConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockConfiguration.ObjectLockConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockConfiguration.ObjectLockConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockConfiguration.ObjectLockConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockConfiguration.ObjectLockConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockConfiguration.ObjectLockConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectLockConfiguration.ObjectLockConfiguration

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership

-- | The container element for object ownership for a bucket's ownership
--   controls.
--   
--   BucketOwnerPreferred - Objects uploaded to the bucket change ownership
--   to the bucket owner if the objects are uploaded with the
--   <tt>bucket-owner-full-control</tt> canned ACL.
--   
--   ObjectWriter - The uploading account will own the object if the object
--   is uploaded with the <tt>bucket-owner-full-control</tt> canned ACL.
newtype ObjectOwnership
ObjectOwnership' :: Text -> ObjectOwnership
[fromObjectOwnership] :: ObjectOwnership -> Text
pattern ObjectOwnership_BucketOwnerPreferred :: ObjectOwnership
pattern ObjectOwnership_ObjectWriter :: ObjectOwnership
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectOwnership.ObjectOwnership

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Owner

-- | Container for the owner's display name and ID.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOwner</a> smart constructor.
data Owner
Owner' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Owner

-- | Container for the display name of the owner.
[$sel:displayName:Owner'] :: Owner -> Maybe Text

-- | Container for the ID of the owner.
[$sel:id:Owner'] :: Owner -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Owner</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:Owner'</a>, <a>owner_displayName</a> - Container
--   for the display name of the owner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Owner'</a>, <a>owner_id</a> - Container for the ID of the
--   owner.
newOwner :: Owner

-- | Container for the display name of the owner.

-- | Container for the ID of the owner.
owner_id :: Lens' Owner (Maybe Text)
