module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectVersion

-- | The version of an object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectVersion</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectVersion
ObjectVersion' :: Maybe ETag -> Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Owner -> Maybe ObjectKey -> Maybe ObjectVersionStorageClass -> Maybe ISO8601 -> ObjectVersion

-- | The entity tag is an MD5 hash of that version of the object.
[$sel:eTag:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe ETag

-- | Version ID of an object.
[$sel:versionId:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe ObjectVersionId

-- | Size in bytes of the object.
[$sel:size:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe Integer

-- | Specifies whether the object is (true) or is not (false) the latest
--   version of an object.
[$sel:isLatest:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the owner of the object.
[$sel:owner:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe Owner

-- | The object key.
[$sel:key:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe ObjectKey

-- | The class of storage used to store the object.
[$sel:storageClass:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe ObjectVersionStorageClass

-- | Date and time the object was last modified.
[$sel:lastModified:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectVersion</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eTag:ObjectVersion'</a>, <a>objectVersion_eTag</a> - The
--   entity tag is an MD5 hash of that version of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:ObjectVersion'</a>, <a>objectVersion_versionId</a> -
--   Version ID of an object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:ObjectVersion'</a>, <a>objectVersion_size</a> - Size in
--   bytes of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isLatest:ObjectVersion'</a>, <a>objectVersion_isLatest</a> -
--   Specifies whether the object is (true) or is not (false) the latest
--   version of an object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:ObjectVersion'</a>, <a>objectVersion_owner</a> -
--   Specifies the owner of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:ObjectVersion'</a>, <a>objectVersion_key</a> - The object
--   key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:ObjectVersion'</a>,
--   <a>objectVersion_storageClass</a> - The class of storage used to store
--   the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModified:ObjectVersion'</a>,
--   <a>objectVersion_lastModified</a> - Date and time the object was last
--   modified.
newObjectVersion :: ObjectVersion

-- | The entity tag is an MD5 hash of that version of the object.
objectVersion_eTag :: Lens' ObjectVersion (Maybe ETag)

-- | Version ID of an object.
objectVersion_versionId :: Lens' ObjectVersion (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | Size in bytes of the object.
objectVersion_size :: Lens' ObjectVersion (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies whether the object is (true) or is not (false) the latest
--   version of an object.
objectVersion_isLatest :: Lens' ObjectVersion (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the owner of the object.
objectVersion_owner :: Lens' ObjectVersion (Maybe Owner)

-- | The object key.
objectVersion_key :: Lens' ObjectVersion (Maybe ObjectKey)

-- | The class of storage used to store the object.
objectVersion_storageClass :: Lens' ObjectVersion (Maybe ObjectVersionStorageClass)

-- | Date and time the object was last modified.
objectVersion_lastModified :: Lens' ObjectVersion (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectVersion.ObjectVersion
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectVersion.ObjectVersion
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectVersion.ObjectVersion
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectVersion.ObjectVersion
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectVersion.ObjectVersion
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectVersion.ObjectVersion
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.ObjectVersion.ObjectVersion


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Object

-- | An object consists of data and its descriptive metadata.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObject</a> smart constructor.
data Object
Object' :: Maybe Owner -> ETag -> Integer -> ObjectKey -> ObjectStorageClass -> ISO8601 -> Object

-- | The owner of the object
[$sel:owner:Object'] :: Object -> Maybe Owner

-- | The entity tag is a hash of the object. The ETag reflects changes only
--   to the contents of an object, not its metadata. The ETag may or may
--   not be an MD5 digest of the object data. Whether or not it is depends
--   on how the object was created and how it is encrypted as described
--   below:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-S3 or plaintext, have ETags that are an MD5 digest of
--   their object data.</li>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-C or SSE-KMS, have ETags that are not an MD5 digest
--   of their object data.</li>
--   <li>If an object is created by either the Multipart Upload or Part
--   Copy operation, the ETag is not an MD5 digest, regardless of the
--   method of encryption.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:eTag:Object'] :: Object -> ETag

-- | Size in bytes of the object
[$sel:size:Object'] :: Object -> Integer

-- | The name that you assign to an object. You use the object key to
--   retrieve the object.
[$sel:key:Object'] :: Object -> ObjectKey

-- | The class of storage used to store the object.
[$sel:storageClass:Object'] :: Object -> ObjectStorageClass

-- | Creation date of the object.
[$sel:lastModified:Object'] :: Object -> ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>Object</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:Object'</a>, <a>object_owner</a> - The owner of the
--   object
--   
--   <a>$sel:eTag:Object'</a>, <a>object_eTag</a> - The entity tag is a
--   hash of the object. The ETag reflects changes only to the contents of
--   an object, not its metadata. The ETag may or may not be an MD5 digest
--   of the object data. Whether or not it is depends on how the object was
--   created and how it is encrypted as described below:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-S3 or plaintext, have ETags that are an MD5 digest of
--   their object data.</li>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-C or SSE-KMS, have ETags that are not an MD5 digest
--   of their object data.</li>
--   <li>If an object is created by either the Multipart Upload or Part
--   Copy operation, the ETag is not an MD5 digest, regardless of the
--   method of encryption.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:Object'</a>, <a>object_size</a> - Size in bytes of the
--   object
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Object'</a>, <a>object_key</a> - The name that you assign
--   to an object. You use the object key to retrieve the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:Object'</a>, <a>object_storageClass</a> - The
--   class of storage used to store the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModified:Object'</a>, <a>object_lastModified</a> -
--   Creation date of the object.
newObject :: ETag -> Integer -> ObjectKey -> ObjectStorageClass -> UTCTime -> Object

-- | The owner of the object
object_owner :: Lens' Object (Maybe Owner)

-- | The entity tag is a hash of the object. The ETag reflects changes only
--   to the contents of an object, not its metadata. The ETag may or may
--   not be an MD5 digest of the object data. Whether or not it is depends
--   on how the object was created and how it is encrypted as described
--   below:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-S3 or plaintext, have ETags that are an MD5 digest of
--   their object data.</li>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-C or SSE-KMS, have ETags that are not an MD5 digest
--   of their object data.</li>
--   <li>If an object is created by either the Multipart Upload or Part
--   Copy operation, the ETag is not an MD5 digest, regardless of the
--   method of encryption.</li>
--   </ul>
object_eTag :: Lens' Object ETag

-- | Size in bytes of the object
object_size :: Lens' Object Integer

-- | The name that you assign to an object. You use the object key to
--   retrieve the object.
object_key :: Lens' Object ObjectKey

-- | The class of storage used to store the object.
object_storageClass :: Lens' Object ObjectStorageClass

-- | Creation date of the object.
object_lastModified :: Lens' Object UTCTime
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Object.Object
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Object.Object
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Object.Object
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Object.Object
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Object.Object
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.Object.Object
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.Object.Object

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ParquetInput.ParquetInput
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.ParquetInput.ParquetInput
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ParquetInput.ParquetInput


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.InputSerialization

-- | Describes the serialization format of the object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSerialization</a> smart constructor.
data InputSerialization
InputSerialization' :: Maybe JSONInput -> Maybe CSVInput -> Maybe ParquetInput -> Maybe CompressionType -> InputSerialization

-- | Specifies JSON as object's input serialization format.
[$sel:json:InputSerialization'] :: InputSerialization -> Maybe JSONInput

-- | Describes the serialization of a CSV-encoded object.
[$sel:csv:InputSerialization'] :: InputSerialization -> Maybe CSVInput

-- | Specifies Parquet as object's input serialization format.
[$sel:parquet:InputSerialization'] :: InputSerialization -> Maybe ParquetInput

-- | Specifies object's compression format. Valid values: NONE, GZIP,
--   BZIP2. Default Value: NONE.
[$sel:compressionType:InputSerialization'] :: InputSerialization -> Maybe CompressionType

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSerialization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:json:InputSerialization'</a>, <a>inputSerialization_json</a> -
--   Specifies JSON as object's input serialization format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:csv:InputSerialization'</a>, <a>inputSerialization_csv</a> -
--   Describes the serialization of a CSV-encoded object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parquet:InputSerialization'</a>,
--   <a>inputSerialization_parquet</a> - Specifies Parquet as object's
--   input serialization format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compressionType:InputSerialization'</a>,
--   <a>inputSerialization_compressionType</a> - Specifies object's
--   compression format. Valid values: NONE, GZIP, BZIP2. Default Value:
--   NONE.
newInputSerialization :: InputSerialization

-- | Specifies JSON as object's input serialization format.
inputSerialization_json :: Lens' InputSerialization (Maybe JSONInput)

-- | Describes the serialization of a CSV-encoded object.
inputSerialization_csv :: Lens' InputSerialization (Maybe CSVInput)

-- | Specifies Parquet as object's input serialization format.
inputSerialization_parquet :: Lens' InputSerialization (Maybe ParquetInput)

-- | Specifies object's compression format. Valid values: NONE, GZIP,
--   BZIP2. Default Value: NONE.
inputSerialization_compressionType :: Lens' InputSerialization (Maybe CompressionType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Part

-- | Container for elements related to a part.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPart</a> smart constructor.
data Part
Part' :: Maybe ETag -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Part

-- | Entity tag returned when the part was uploaded.
[$sel:eTag:Part'] :: Part -> Maybe ETag

-- | Size in bytes of the uploaded part data.
[$sel:size:Part'] :: Part -> Maybe Integer

-- | Part number identifying the part. This is a positive integer between 1
--   and 10,000.
[$sel:partNumber:Part'] :: Part -> Maybe Int

-- | Date and time at which the part was uploaded.
[$sel:lastModified:Part'] :: Part -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>Part</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eTag:Part'</a>, <a>part_eTag</a> - Entity tag returned when
--   the part was uploaded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:Part'</a>, <a>part_size</a> - Size in bytes of the
--   uploaded part data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partNumber:Part'</a>, <a>part_partNumber</a> - Part number
--   identifying the part. This is a positive integer between 1 and 10,000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModified:Part'</a>, <a>part_lastModified</a> - Date and
--   time at which the part was uploaded.
newPart :: Part

-- | Entity tag returned when the part was uploaded.
part_eTag :: Lens' Part (Maybe ETag)

-- | Size in bytes of the uploaded part data.
part_size :: Lens' Part (Maybe Integer)

-- | Part number identifying the part. This is a positive integer between 1
--   and 10,000.
part_partNumber :: Lens' Part (Maybe Int)

-- | Date and time at which the part was uploaded.
part_lastModified :: Lens' Part (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Part.Part
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Part.Part
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Part.Part
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Part.Part
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Part.Part
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.Part.Part
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.Part.Part

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.PolicyStatus

-- | The container element for a bucket's policy status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyStatus</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyStatus
PolicyStatus' :: Maybe Bool -> PolicyStatus

-- | The policy status for this bucket. <tt>TRUE</tt> indicates that this
--   bucket is public. <tt>FALSE</tt> indicates that the bucket is not
--   public.
[$sel:isPublic:PolicyStatus'] :: PolicyStatus -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isPublic:PolicyStatus'</a>, <a>policyStatus_isPublic</a> - The
--   policy status for this bucket. <tt>TRUE</tt> indicates that this
--   bucket is public. <tt>FALSE</tt> indicates that the bucket is not
--   public.
newPolicyStatus :: PolicyStatus

-- | The policy status for this bucket. <tt>TRUE</tt> indicates that this
--   bucket is public. <tt>FALSE</tt> indicates that the bucket is not
--   public.
policyStatus_isPublic :: Lens' PolicyStatus (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.PolicyStatus.PolicyStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.PolicyStatus.PolicyStatus

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Progress

-- | This data type contains information about progress of an operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProgress</a> smart constructor.
data Progress
Progress' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Progress

-- | The current number of bytes of records payload data returned.
[$sel:bytesReturned:Progress'] :: Progress -> Maybe Integer

-- | The current number of object bytes scanned.
[$sel:bytesScanned:Progress'] :: Progress -> Maybe Integer

-- | The current number of uncompressed object bytes processed.
[$sel:bytesProcessed:Progress'] :: Progress -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>Progress</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bytesReturned:Progress'</a>, <a>progress_bytesReturned</a> -
--   The current number of bytes of records payload data returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bytesScanned:Progress'</a>, <a>progress_bytesScanned</a> - The
--   current number of object bytes scanned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bytesProcessed:Progress'</a>, <a>progress_bytesProcessed</a> -
--   The current number of uncompressed object bytes processed.
newProgress :: Progress

-- | The current number of bytes of records payload data returned.
progress_bytesReturned :: Lens' Progress (Maybe Integer)

-- | The current number of object bytes scanned.
progress_bytesScanned :: Lens' Progress (Maybe Integer)

-- | The current number of uncompressed object bytes processed.
progress_bytesProcessed :: Lens' Progress (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Progress.Progress
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Progress.Progress
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Progress.Progress
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Progress.Progress

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration

-- | The PublicAccessBlock configuration that you want to apply to this
--   Amazon S3 bucket. You can enable the configuration options in any
--   combination. For more information about when Amazon S3 considers a
--   bucket or object public, see <a>The Meaning of "Public"</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPublicAccessBlockConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PublicAccessBlockConfiguration
PublicAccessBlockConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> PublicAccessBlockConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should ignore public ACLs for this bucket
--   and objects in this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt>
--   causes Amazon S3 to ignore all public ACLs on this bucket and objects
--   in this bucket.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect the persistence of any existing
--   ACLs and doesn't prevent new public ACLs from being set.
[$sel:ignorePublicAcls:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'] :: PublicAccessBlockConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should block public access control lists
--   (ACLs) for this bucket and objects in this bucket. Setting this
--   element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes the following behavior:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT Bucket acl and PUT Object acl calls fail if the specified ACL
--   is public.</li>
--   <li>PUT Object calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   <li>PUT Bucket calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing policies or ACLs.
[$sel:blockPublicAcls:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'] :: PublicAccessBlockConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should restrict public bucket policies for
--   this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> restricts access to
--   this bucket to only Amazon Web Service principals and authorized users
--   within this account if the bucket has a public policy.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect previously stored bucket
--   policies, except that public and cross-account access within any
--   public bucket policy, including non-public delegation to specific
--   accounts, is blocked.
[$sel:restrictPublicBuckets:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'] :: PublicAccessBlockConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should block public bucket policies for
--   this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes Amazon S3 to
--   reject calls to PUT Bucket policy if the specified bucket policy
--   allows public access.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing bucket policies.
[$sel:blockPublicPolicy:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'] :: PublicAccessBlockConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PublicAccessBlockConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ignorePublicAcls:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>publicAccessBlockConfiguration_ignorePublicAcls</a> - Specifies
--   whether Amazon S3 should ignore public ACLs for this bucket and
--   objects in this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes
--   Amazon S3 to ignore all public ACLs on this bucket and objects in this
--   bucket.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect the persistence of any existing
--   ACLs and doesn't prevent new public ACLs from being set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicAcls:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>publicAccessBlockConfiguration_blockPublicAcls</a> - Specifies
--   whether Amazon S3 should block public access control lists (ACLs) for
--   this bucket and objects in this bucket. Setting this element to
--   <tt>TRUE</tt> causes the following behavior:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT Bucket acl and PUT Object acl calls fail if the specified ACL
--   is public.</li>
--   <li>PUT Object calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   <li>PUT Bucket calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing policies or ACLs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restrictPublicBuckets:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>publicAccessBlockConfiguration_restrictPublicBuckets</a> -
--   Specifies whether Amazon S3 should restrict public bucket policies for
--   this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> restricts access to
--   this bucket to only Amazon Web Service principals and authorized users
--   within this account if the bucket has a public policy.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect previously stored bucket
--   policies, except that public and cross-account access within any
--   public bucket policy, including non-public delegation to specific
--   accounts, is blocked.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicPolicy:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>publicAccessBlockConfiguration_blockPublicPolicy</a> - Specifies
--   whether Amazon S3 should block public bucket policies for this bucket.
--   Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes Amazon S3 to reject calls
--   to PUT Bucket policy if the specified bucket policy allows public
--   access.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing bucket policies.
newPublicAccessBlockConfiguration :: PublicAccessBlockConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should ignore public ACLs for this bucket
--   and objects in this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt>
--   causes Amazon S3 to ignore all public ACLs on this bucket and objects
--   in this bucket.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect the persistence of any existing
--   ACLs and doesn't prevent new public ACLs from being set.
publicAccessBlockConfiguration_ignorePublicAcls :: Lens' PublicAccessBlockConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should block public access control lists
--   (ACLs) for this bucket and objects in this bucket. Setting this
--   element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes the following behavior:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT Bucket acl and PUT Object acl calls fail if the specified ACL
--   is public.</li>
--   <li>PUT Object calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   <li>PUT Bucket calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing policies or ACLs.
publicAccessBlockConfiguration_blockPublicAcls :: Lens' PublicAccessBlockConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should restrict public bucket policies for
--   this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> restricts access to
--   this bucket to only Amazon Web Service principals and authorized users
--   within this account if the bucket has a public policy.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect previously stored bucket
--   policies, except that public and cross-account access within any
--   public bucket policy, including non-public delegation to specific
--   accounts, is blocked.
publicAccessBlockConfiguration_restrictPublicBuckets :: Lens' PublicAccessBlockConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should block public bucket policies for
--   this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes Amazon S3 to
--   reject calls to PUT Bucket policy if the specified bucket policy
--   allows public access.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing bucket policies.
publicAccessBlockConfiguration_blockPublicPolicy :: Lens' PublicAccessBlockConfiguration (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration.PublicAccessBlockConfiguration

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.QuoteFields.QuoteFields
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.QuoteFields.QuoteFields
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.QuoteFields.QuoteFields


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVOutput

-- | Describes how uncompressed comma-separated values (CSV)-formatted
--   results are formatted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCSVOutput</a> smart constructor.
data CSVOutput
CSVOutput' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe QuoteFields -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CSVOutput

-- | A single character used for escaping when the field delimiter is part
--   of the value. For example, if the value is <tt>a, b</tt>, Amazon S3
--   wraps this field value in quotation marks, as follows: <tt>" a , b
--   "</tt>.
[$sel:quoteCharacter:CSVOutput'] :: CSVOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether to use quotation marks around output fields.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALWAYS</tt>: Always use quotation marks for output
--   fields.</li>
--   <li><tt>ASNEEDED</tt>: Use quotation marks for output fields when
--   needed.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:quoteFields:CSVOutput'] :: CSVOutput -> Maybe QuoteFields

-- | A single character used to separate individual records in the output.
--   Instead of the default value, you can specify an arbitrary delimiter.
[$sel:recordDelimiter:CSVOutput'] :: CSVOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | The single character used for escaping the quote character inside an
--   already escaped value.
[$sel:quoteEscapeCharacter:CSVOutput'] :: CSVOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | The value used to separate individual fields in a record. You can
--   specify an arbitrary delimiter.
[$sel:fieldDelimiter:CSVOutput'] :: CSVOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CSVOutput</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteCharacter:CSVOutput'</a>, <a>cSVOutput_quoteCharacter</a>
--   - A single character used for escaping when the field delimiter is
--   part of the value. For example, if the value is <tt>a, b</tt>, Amazon
--   S3 wraps this field value in quotation marks, as follows: <tt>" a , b
--   "</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteFields:CSVOutput'</a>, <a>cSVOutput_quoteFields</a> -
--   Indicates whether to use quotation marks around output fields.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALWAYS</tt>: Always use quotation marks for output
--   fields.</li>
--   <li><tt>ASNEEDED</tt>: Use quotation marks for output fields when
--   needed.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordDelimiter:CSVOutput'</a>,
--   <a>cSVOutput_recordDelimiter</a> - A single character used to separate
--   individual records in the output. Instead of the default value, you
--   can specify an arbitrary delimiter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteEscapeCharacter:CSVOutput'</a>,
--   <a>cSVOutput_quoteEscapeCharacter</a> - The single character used for
--   escaping the quote character inside an already escaped value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fieldDelimiter:CSVOutput'</a>, <a>cSVOutput_fieldDelimiter</a>
--   - The value used to separate individual fields in a record. You can
--   specify an arbitrary delimiter.
newCSVOutput :: CSVOutput

-- | A single character used for escaping when the field delimiter is part
--   of the value. For example, if the value is <tt>a, b</tt>, Amazon S3
--   wraps this field value in quotation marks, as follows: <tt>" a , b
--   "</tt>.
cSVOutput_quoteCharacter :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether to use quotation marks around output fields.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALWAYS</tt>: Always use quotation marks for output
--   fields.</li>
--   <li><tt>ASNEEDED</tt>: Use quotation marks for output fields when
--   needed.</li>
--   </ul>
cSVOutput_quoteFields :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe QuoteFields)

-- | A single character used to separate individual records in the output.
--   Instead of the default value, you can specify an arbitrary delimiter.
cSVOutput_recordDelimiter :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | The single character used for escaping the quote character inside an
--   already escaped value.
cSVOutput_quoteEscapeCharacter :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | The value used to separate individual fields in a record. You can
--   specify an arbitrary delimiter.
cSVOutput_fieldDelimiter :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.OutputSerialization

-- | Describes how results of the Select job are serialized.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutputSerialization</a> smart constructor.
data OutputSerialization
OutputSerialization' :: Maybe JSONOutput -> Maybe CSVOutput -> OutputSerialization

-- | Specifies JSON as request's output serialization format.
[$sel:json:OutputSerialization'] :: OutputSerialization -> Maybe JSONOutput

-- | Describes the serialization of CSV-encoded Select results.
[$sel:csv:OutputSerialization'] :: OutputSerialization -> Maybe CSVOutput

-- | Create a value of <a>OutputSerialization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:json:OutputSerialization'</a>, <a>outputSerialization_json</a>
--   - Specifies JSON as request's output serialization format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:csv:OutputSerialization'</a>, <a>outputSerialization_csv</a> -
--   Describes the serialization of CSV-encoded Select results.
newOutputSerialization :: OutputSerialization

-- | Specifies JSON as request's output serialization format.
outputSerialization_json :: Lens' OutputSerialization (Maybe JSONOutput)

-- | Describes the serialization of CSV-encoded Select results.
outputSerialization_csv :: Lens' OutputSerialization (Maybe CSVOutput)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.OutputSerialization.OutputSerialization
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.OutputSerialization.OutputSerialization

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.RecordsEvent

-- | The container for the records event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecordsEvent</a> smart constructor.
data RecordsEvent
RecordsEvent' :: Maybe Base64 -> RecordsEvent

-- | The byte array of partial, one or more result records.
[$sel:payload:RecordsEvent'] :: RecordsEvent -> Maybe Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>RecordsEvent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:payload:RecordsEvent'</a>, <a>recordsEvent_payload</a> - The
--   byte array of partial, one or more result records.-- -- <i>Note:</i>
--   This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. --
--   The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during
--   -- serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
newRecordsEvent :: RecordsEvent

-- | The byte array of partial, one or more result records.-- --
--   <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes
--   Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64
--   representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
recordsEvent_payload :: Lens' RecordsEvent (Maybe ByteString)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.RecordsEvent.RecordsEvent
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.RecordsEvent.RecordsEvent
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.RecordsEvent.RecordsEvent
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.RecordsEvent.RecordsEvent
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.RecordsEvent.RecordsEvent
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.RecordsEvent.RecordsEvent
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.RecordsEvent.RecordsEvent


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Redirect

-- | Specifies how requests are redirected. In the event of an error, you
--   can specify a different error code to return.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRedirect</a> smart constructor.
data Redirect
Redirect' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Protocol -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Redirect

-- | The host name to use in the redirect request.
[$sel:hostName:Redirect'] :: Redirect -> Maybe Text

-- | Protocol to use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol
--   that is used in the original request.
[$sel:protocol:Redirect'] :: Redirect -> Maybe Protocol

-- | The HTTP redirect code to use on the response. Not required if one of
--   the siblings is present.
[$sel:httpRedirectCode:Redirect'] :: Redirect -> Maybe Text

-- | The specific object key to use in the redirect request. For example,
--   redirect request to <tt>error.html</tt>. Not required if one of the
--   siblings is present. Can be present only if
--   <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:replaceKeyWith:Redirect'] :: Redirect -> Maybe Text

-- | The object key prefix to use in the redirect request. For example, to
--   redirect requests for all pages with prefix <tt>docs/</tt> (objects in
--   the <tt>docs/</tt> folder) to <tt>documents/</tt>, you can set a
--   condition block with <tt>KeyPrefixEquals</tt> set to <tt>docs/</tt>
--   and in the Redirect set <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> to
--   <tt>/documents</tt>. Not required if one of the siblings is present.
--   Can be present only if <tt>ReplaceKeyWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:replaceKeyPrefixWith:Redirect'] :: Redirect -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Redirect</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostName:Redirect'</a>, <a>redirect_hostName</a> - The host
--   name to use in the redirect request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:Redirect'</a>, <a>redirect_protocol</a> - Protocol to
--   use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol that is
--   used in the original request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpRedirectCode:Redirect'</a>,
--   <a>redirect_httpRedirectCode</a> - The HTTP redirect code to use on
--   the response. Not required if one of the siblings is present.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replaceKeyWith:Redirect'</a>, <a>redirect_replaceKeyWith</a> -
--   The specific object key to use in the redirect request. For example,
--   redirect request to <tt>error.html</tt>. Not required if one of the
--   siblings is present. Can be present only if
--   <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replaceKeyPrefixWith:Redirect'</a>,
--   <a>redirect_replaceKeyPrefixWith</a> - The object key prefix to use in
--   the redirect request. For example, to redirect requests for all pages
--   with prefix <tt>docs/</tt> (objects in the <tt>docs/</tt> folder) to
--   <tt>documents/</tt>, you can set a condition block with
--   <tt>KeyPrefixEquals</tt> set to <tt>docs/</tt> and in the Redirect set
--   <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> to <tt>/documents</tt>. Not required if
--   one of the siblings is present. Can be present only if
--   <tt>ReplaceKeyWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
newRedirect :: Redirect

-- | The host name to use in the redirect request.
redirect_hostName :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Text)

-- | Protocol to use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol
--   that is used in the original request.
redirect_protocol :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Protocol)

-- | The HTTP redirect code to use on the response. Not required if one of
--   the siblings is present.
redirect_httpRedirectCode :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Text)

-- | The specific object key to use in the redirect request. For example,
--   redirect request to <tt>error.html</tt>. Not required if one of the
--   siblings is present. Can be present only if
--   <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
redirect_replaceKeyWith :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Text)

-- | The object key prefix to use in the redirect request. For example, to
--   redirect requests for all pages with prefix <tt>docs/</tt> (objects in
--   the <tt>docs/</tt> folder) to <tt>documents/</tt>, you can set a
--   condition block with <tt>KeyPrefixEquals</tt> set to <tt>docs/</tt>
--   and in the Redirect set <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> to
--   <tt>/documents</tt>. Not required if one of the siblings is present.
--   Can be present only if <tt>ReplaceKeyWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
redirect_replaceKeyPrefixWith :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Redirect.Redirect
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Redirect.Redirect
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Redirect.Redirect
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Redirect.Redirect
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Redirect.Redirect
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.Redirect.Redirect
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.Redirect.Redirect
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Redirect.Redirect


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.RedirectAllRequestsTo

-- | Specifies the redirect behavior of all requests to a website endpoint
--   of an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRedirectAllRequestsTo</a> smart constructor.
data RedirectAllRequestsTo
RedirectAllRequestsTo' :: Maybe Protocol -> Text -> RedirectAllRequestsTo

-- | Protocol to use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol
--   that is used in the original request.
[$sel:protocol:RedirectAllRequestsTo'] :: RedirectAllRequestsTo -> Maybe Protocol

-- | Name of the host where requests are redirected.
[$sel:hostName:RedirectAllRequestsTo'] :: RedirectAllRequestsTo -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RedirectAllRequestsTo</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>redirectAllRequestsTo_protocol</a> - Protocol to use when
--   redirecting requests. The default is the protocol that is used in the
--   original request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostName:RedirectAllRequestsTo'</a>,
--   <a>redirectAllRequestsTo_hostName</a> - Name of the host where
--   requests are redirected.
newRedirectAllRequestsTo :: Text -> RedirectAllRequestsTo

-- | Protocol to use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol
--   that is used in the original request.
redirectAllRequestsTo_protocol :: Lens' RedirectAllRequestsTo (Maybe Protocol)

-- | Name of the host where requests are redirected.
redirectAllRequestsTo_hostName :: Lens' RedirectAllRequestsTo Text

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicaModifications

-- | A filter that you can specify for selection for modifications on
--   replicas. Amazon S3 doesn't replicate replica modifications by
--   default. In the latest version of replication configuration (when
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is specified), you can specify this element and set
--   the status to <tt>Enabled</tt> to replicate modifications on replicas.
--   
--   If you don't specify the <tt>Filter</tt> element, Amazon S3 assumes
--   that the replication configuration is the earlier version, V1. In the
--   earlier version, this element is not allowed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicaModifications</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicaModifications
ReplicaModifications' :: ReplicaModificationsStatus -> ReplicaModifications

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 replicates modifications on replicas.
[$sel:status:ReplicaModifications'] :: ReplicaModifications -> ReplicaModificationsStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicaModifications</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReplicaModifications'</a>,
--   <a>replicaModifications_status</a> - Specifies whether Amazon S3
--   replicates modifications on replicas.
newReplicaModifications :: ReplicaModificationsStatus -> ReplicaModifications

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 replicates modifications on replicas.
replicaModifications_status :: Lens' ReplicaModifications ReplicaModificationsStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicaModifications.ReplicaModifications
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicaModifications.ReplicaModifications
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicaModifications.ReplicaModifications
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicaModifications.ReplicaModifications
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicaModifications.ReplicaModifications
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicaModifications.ReplicaModifications
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicaModifications.ReplicaModifications
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicaModifications.ReplicaModifications

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationTimeValue

--

--   fields.

--   time in minutes.

--   Valid value: 15

--   Valid value: 15

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationTime

-- | A container specifying S3 Replication Time Control (S3 RTC) related
--   information, including whether S3 RTC is enabled and the time when all
--   objects and operations on objects must be replicated. Must be
--   specified together with a <tt>Metrics</tt> block.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationTime</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationTime
ReplicationTime' :: ReplicationTimeStatus -> ReplicationTimeValue -> ReplicationTime

-- | Specifies whether the replication time is enabled.
[$sel:status:ReplicationTime'] :: ReplicationTime -> ReplicationTimeStatus

-- | A container specifying the time by which replication should be
--   complete for all objects and operations on objects.
[$sel:time:ReplicationTime'] :: ReplicationTime -> ReplicationTimeValue

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationTime</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReplicationTime'</a>, <a>replicationTime_status</a> -
--   Specifies whether the replication time is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:time:ReplicationTime'</a>, <a>replicationTime_time</a> - A
--   container specifying the time by which replication should be complete
--   for all objects and operations on objects.
newReplicationTime :: ReplicationTimeStatus -> ReplicationTimeValue -> ReplicationTime

-- | Specifies whether the replication time is enabled.
replicationTime_status :: Lens' ReplicationTime ReplicationTimeStatus

-- | A container specifying the time by which replication should be
--   complete for all objects and operations on objects.
replicationTime_time :: Lens' ReplicationTime ReplicationTimeValue
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationTime.ReplicationTime
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationTime.ReplicationTime
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationTime.ReplicationTime
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationTime.ReplicationTime
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationTime.ReplicationTime
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationTime.ReplicationTime
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationTime.ReplicationTime
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationTime.ReplicationTime


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Metrics

-- | A container specifying replication metrics-related settings enabling
--   replication metrics and events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetrics</a> smart constructor.
data Metrics
Metrics' :: Maybe ReplicationTimeValue -> MetricsStatus -> Metrics

-- | A container specifying the time threshold for emitting the
--   <tt>s3:Replication:OperationMissedThreshold</tt> event.
[$sel:eventThreshold:Metrics'] :: Metrics -> Maybe ReplicationTimeValue

-- | Specifies whether the replication metrics are enabled.
[$sel:status:Metrics'] :: Metrics -> MetricsStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>Metrics</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventThreshold:Metrics'</a>, <a>metrics_eventThreshold</a> - A
--   container specifying the time threshold for emitting the
--   <tt>s3:Replication:OperationMissedThreshold</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Metrics'</a>, <a>metrics_status</a> - Specifies whether
--   the replication metrics are enabled.
newMetrics :: MetricsStatus -> Metrics

-- | A container specifying the time threshold for emitting the
--   <tt>s3:Replication:OperationMissedThreshold</tt> event.
metrics_eventThreshold :: Lens' Metrics (Maybe ReplicationTimeValue)

-- | Specifies whether the replication metrics are enabled.
metrics_status :: Lens' Metrics MetricsStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Metrics.Metrics
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Metrics.Metrics
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Metrics.Metrics

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.RoutingRule

-- | Specifies the redirect behavior and when a redirect is applied. For
--   more information about routing rules, see <a>Configuring advanced
--   conditional redirects</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRoutingRule</a> smart constructor.
data RoutingRule
RoutingRule' :: Maybe Condition -> Redirect -> RoutingRule

-- | A container for describing a condition that must be met for the
--   specified redirect to apply. For example, 1. If request is for pages
--   in the <tt>/docs</tt> folder, redirect to the <tt>/documents</tt>
--   folder. 2. If request results in HTTP error 4xx, redirect request to
--   another host where you might process the error.
[$sel:condition:RoutingRule'] :: RoutingRule -> Maybe Condition

-- | Container for redirect information. You can redirect requests to
--   another host, to another page, or with another protocol. In the event
--   of an error, you can specify a different error code to return.
[$sel:redirect:RoutingRule'] :: RoutingRule -> Redirect

-- | Create a value of <a>RoutingRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:condition:RoutingRule'</a>, <a>routingRule_condition</a> - A
--   container for describing a condition that must be met for the
--   specified redirect to apply. For example, 1. If request is for pages
--   in the <tt>/docs</tt> folder, redirect to the <tt>/documents</tt>
--   folder. 2. If request results in HTTP error 4xx, redirect request to
--   another host where you might process the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redirect:RoutingRule'</a>, <a>routingRule_redirect</a> -
--   Container for redirect information. You can redirect requests to
--   another host, to another page, or with another protocol. In the event
--   of an error, you can specify a different error code to return.
newRoutingRule :: Redirect -> RoutingRule

-- | A container for describing a condition that must be met for the
--   specified redirect to apply. For example, 1. If request is for pages
--   in the <tt>/docs</tt> folder, redirect to the <tt>/documents</tt>
--   folder. 2. If request results in HTTP error 4xx, redirect request to
--   another host where you might process the error.
routingRule_condition :: Lens' RoutingRule (Maybe Condition)

-- | Container for redirect information. You can redirect requests to
--   another host, to another page, or with another protocol. In the event
--   of an error, you can specify a different error code to return.
routingRule_redirect :: Lens' RoutingRule Redirect
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.RoutingRule.RoutingRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.RoutingRule.RoutingRule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.RoutingRule.RoutingRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.RoutingRule.RoutingRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.RoutingRule.RoutingRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.RoutingRule.RoutingRule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.RoutingRule.RoutingRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.RoutingRule.RoutingRule

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfigurationFilter.NotificationConfigurationFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfigurationFilter.NotificationConfigurationFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfigurationFilter.NotificationConfigurationFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfigurationFilter.NotificationConfigurationFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfigurationFilter.NotificationConfigurationFilter


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.QueueConfiguration

-- | Specifies the configuration for publishing messages to an Amazon
--   Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue when Amazon S3 detects
--   specified events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newQueueConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data QueueConfiguration
QueueConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter -> Text -> [Event] -> QueueConfiguration
[$sel:id:QueueConfiguration'] :: QueueConfiguration -> Maybe Text
[$sel:filter':QueueConfiguration'] :: QueueConfiguration -> Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SQS queue to which Amazon
--   S3 publishes a message when it detects events of the specified type.
[$sel:queueArn:QueueConfiguration'] :: QueueConfiguration -> Text

-- | A collection of bucket events for which to send notifications
[$sel:events:QueueConfiguration'] :: QueueConfiguration -> [Event]

-- | Create a value of <a>QueueConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:QueueConfiguration'</a>, <a>queueConfiguration_id</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':QueueConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>queueConfiguration_filter</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueArn:QueueConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>queueConfiguration_queueArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the Amazon SQS queue to which Amazon S3 publishes a message when it
--   detects events of the specified type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:events:QueueConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>queueConfiguration_events</a> - A collection of bucket events for
--   which to send notifications
newQueueConfiguration :: Text -> QueueConfiguration

-- | Undocumented member.
queueConfiguration_id :: Lens' QueueConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
queueConfiguration_filter :: Lens' QueueConfiguration (Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SQS queue to which Amazon
--   S3 publishes a message when it detects events of the specified type.
queueConfiguration_queueArn :: Lens' QueueConfiguration Text

-- | A collection of bucket events for which to send notifications
queueConfiguration_events :: Lens' QueueConfiguration [Event]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.QueueConfiguration.QueueConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.QueueConfiguration.QueueConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.QueueConfiguration.QueueConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.QueueConfiguration.QueueConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.QueueConfiguration.QueueConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.QueueConfiguration.QueueConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.QueueConfiguration.QueueConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.QueueConfiguration.QueueConfiguration


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.LambdaFunctionConfiguration

-- | A container for specifying the configuration for Lambda notifications.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLambdaFunctionConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data LambdaFunctionConfiguration
LambdaFunctionConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter -> Text -> [Event] -> LambdaFunctionConfiguration
[$sel:id:LambdaFunctionConfiguration'] :: LambdaFunctionConfiguration -> Maybe Text
[$sel:filter':LambdaFunctionConfiguration'] :: LambdaFunctionConfiguration -> Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function that Amazon S3
--   invokes when the specified event type occurs.
[$sel:lambdaFunctionArn:LambdaFunctionConfiguration'] :: LambdaFunctionConfiguration -> Text

-- | The Amazon S3 bucket event for which to invoke the Lambda function.
--   For more information, see <a>Supported Event Types</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:events:LambdaFunctionConfiguration'] :: LambdaFunctionConfiguration -> [Event]

-- | Create a value of <a>LambdaFunctionConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:LambdaFunctionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionConfiguration_id</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':LambdaFunctionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionConfiguration_filter</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambdaFunctionArn:LambdaFunctionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionConfiguration_lambdaFunctionArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function that Amazon S3 invokes when
--   the specified event type occurs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:events:LambdaFunctionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>lambdaFunctionConfiguration_events</a> - The Amazon S3 bucket event
--   for which to invoke the Lambda function. For more information, see
--   <a>Supported Event Types</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
newLambdaFunctionConfiguration :: Text -> LambdaFunctionConfiguration

-- | Undocumented member.
lambdaFunctionConfiguration_id :: Lens' LambdaFunctionConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
lambdaFunctionConfiguration_filter :: Lens' LambdaFunctionConfiguration (Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Lambda function that Amazon S3
--   invokes when the specified event type occurs.
lambdaFunctionConfiguration_lambdaFunctionArn :: Lens' LambdaFunctionConfiguration Text

-- | The Amazon S3 bucket event for which to invoke the Lambda function.
--   For more information, see <a>Supported Event Types</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
lambdaFunctionConfiguration_events :: Lens' LambdaFunctionConfiguration [Event]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.LambdaFunctionConfiguration.LambdaFunctionConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.LambdaFunctionConfiguration.LambdaFunctionConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.LambdaFunctionConfiguration.LambdaFunctionConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.LambdaFunctionConfiguration.LambdaFunctionConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.LambdaFunctionConfiguration.LambdaFunctionConfiguration
