module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Encryption

-- | Contains the type of server-side encryption used.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEncryption</a> smart constructor.
data Encryption
Encryption' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> ServerSideEncryption -> Encryption

-- | If the encryption type is <tt>aws:kms</tt>, this optional value
--   specifies the ID of the symmetric customer managed key to use for
--   encryption of job results. Amazon S3 only supports symmetric keys. For
--   more information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon Web Services Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:Encryption'] :: Encryption -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | If the encryption type is <tt>aws:kms</tt>, this optional value can be
--   used to specify the encryption context for the restore results.
[$sel:kmsContext:Encryption'] :: Encryption -> Maybe Text

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing job results in
--   Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
[$sel:encryptionType:Encryption'] :: Encryption -> ServerSideEncryption

-- | Create a value of <a>Encryption</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:Encryption'</a>, <a>encryption_kmsKeyId</a> - If the
--   encryption type is <tt>aws:kms</tt>, this optional value specifies the
--   ID of the symmetric customer managed key to use for encryption of job
--   results. Amazon S3 only supports symmetric keys. For more information,
--   see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in the <i>Amazon Web
--   Services Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsContext:Encryption'</a>, <a>encryption_kmsContext</a> - If
--   the encryption type is <tt>aws:kms</tt>, this optional value can be
--   used to specify the encryption context for the restore results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionType:Encryption'</a>,
--   <a>encryption_encryptionType</a> - The server-side encryption
--   algorithm used when storing job results in Amazon S3 (for example,
--   AES256, aws:kms).
newEncryption :: ServerSideEncryption -> Encryption

-- | If the encryption type is <tt>aws:kms</tt>, this optional value
--   specifies the ID of the symmetric customer managed key to use for
--   encryption of job results. Amazon S3 only supports symmetric keys. For
--   more information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon Web Services Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
encryption_kmsKeyId :: Lens' Encryption (Maybe Text)

-- | If the encryption type is <tt>aws:kms</tt>, this optional value can be
--   used to specify the encryption context for the restore results.
encryption_kmsContext :: Lens' Encryption (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing job results in
--   Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
encryption_encryptionType :: Lens' Encryption ServerSideEncryption
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Encryption.Encryption
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Encryption.Encryption
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Encryption.Encryption
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.Encryption.Encryption
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.Encryption.Encryption
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Encryption.Encryption


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault

-- | Describes the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects
--   in the bucket. If a PUT Object request doesn't specify any server-side
--   encryption, this default encryption will be applied. For more
--   information, see <a>PUT Bucket encryption</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 API
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServerSideEncryptionByDefault</a> smart constructor.
data ServerSideEncryptionByDefault
ServerSideEncryptionByDefault' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> ServerSideEncryption -> ServerSideEncryptionByDefault

-- | Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) customer Amazon Web
--   Services KMS key ID to use for the default encryption. This parameter
--   is allowed if and only if <tt>SSEAlgorithm</tt> is set to
--   <tt>aws:kms</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   KMS key. However, if you are using encryption with cross-account
--   operations, you must use a fully qualified KMS key ARN. For more
--   information, see <a>Using encryption for cross-account operations</a>.
--   
--   <b>For example:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Amazon S3 only supports symmetric KMS keys and not asymmetric KMS
--   keys. For more information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric
--   keys</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services Key Management Service
--   Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:kmsMasterKeyID:ServerSideEncryptionByDefault'] :: ServerSideEncryptionByDefault -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Server-side encryption algorithm to use for the default encryption.
[$sel:sSEAlgorithm:ServerSideEncryptionByDefault'] :: ServerSideEncryptionByDefault -> ServerSideEncryption

-- | Create a value of <a>ServerSideEncryptionByDefault</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsMasterKeyID:ServerSideEncryptionByDefault'</a>,
--   <a>serverSideEncryptionByDefault_kmsMasterKeyID</a> - Amazon Web
--   Services Key Management Service (KMS) customer Amazon Web Services KMS
--   key ID to use for the default encryption. This parameter is allowed if
--   and only if <tt>SSEAlgorithm</tt> is set to <tt>aws:kms</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   KMS key. However, if you are using encryption with cross-account
--   operations, you must use a fully qualified KMS key ARN. For more
--   information, see <a>Using encryption for cross-account operations</a>.
--   
--   <b>For example:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Amazon S3 only supports symmetric KMS keys and not asymmetric KMS
--   keys. For more information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric
--   keys</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services Key Management Service
--   Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSEAlgorithm:ServerSideEncryptionByDefault'</a>,
--   <a>serverSideEncryptionByDefault_sSEAlgorithm</a> - Server-side
--   encryption algorithm to use for the default encryption.
newServerSideEncryptionByDefault :: ServerSideEncryption -> ServerSideEncryptionByDefault

-- | Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) customer Amazon Web
--   Services KMS key ID to use for the default encryption. This parameter
--   is allowed if and only if <tt>SSEAlgorithm</tt> is set to
--   <tt>aws:kms</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   KMS key. However, if you are using encryption with cross-account
--   operations, you must use a fully qualified KMS key ARN. For more
--   information, see <a>Using encryption for cross-account operations</a>.
--   
--   <b>For example:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Amazon S3 only supports symmetric KMS keys and not asymmetric KMS
--   keys. For more information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric
--   keys</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services Key Management Service
--   Developer Guide</i>.
serverSideEncryptionByDefault_kmsMasterKeyID :: Lens' ServerSideEncryptionByDefault (Maybe Text)

-- | Server-side encryption algorithm to use for the default encryption.
serverSideEncryptionByDefault_sSEAlgorithm :: Lens' ServerSideEncryptionByDefault ServerSideEncryption
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault.ServerSideEncryptionByDefault


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionRule

-- | Specifies the default server-side encryption configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServerSideEncryptionRule</a> smart constructor.
data ServerSideEncryptionRule
ServerSideEncryptionRule' :: Maybe ServerSideEncryptionByDefault -> Maybe Bool -> ServerSideEncryptionRule

-- | Specifies the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects
--   in the bucket. If a PUT Object request doesn't specify any server-side
--   encryption, this default encryption will be applied.
[$sel:applyServerSideEncryptionByDefault:ServerSideEncryptionRule'] :: ServerSideEncryptionRule -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionByDefault

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should use an S3 Bucket Key with
--   server-side encryption using KMS (SSE-KMS) for new objects in the
--   bucket. Existing objects are not affected. Setting the
--   <tt>BucketKeyEnabled</tt> element to <tt>true</tt> causes Amazon S3 to
--   use an S3 Bucket Key. By default, S3 Bucket Key is not enabled.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon S3 Bucket Keys</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:ServerSideEncryptionRule'] :: ServerSideEncryptionRule -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ServerSideEncryptionRule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:applyServerSideEncryptionByDefault:ServerSideEncryptionRule'</a>,
--   <a>serverSideEncryptionRule_applyServerSideEncryptionByDefault</a> -
--   Specifies the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects
--   in the bucket. If a PUT Object request doesn't specify any server-side
--   encryption, this default encryption will be applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:ServerSideEncryptionRule'</a>,
--   <a>serverSideEncryptionRule_bucketKeyEnabled</a> - Specifies whether
--   Amazon S3 should use an S3 Bucket Key with server-side encryption
--   using KMS (SSE-KMS) for new objects in the bucket. Existing objects
--   are not affected. Setting the <tt>BucketKeyEnabled</tt> element to
--   <tt>true</tt> causes Amazon S3 to use an S3 Bucket Key. By default, S3
--   Bucket Key is not enabled.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon S3 Bucket Keys</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
newServerSideEncryptionRule :: ServerSideEncryptionRule

-- | Specifies the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects
--   in the bucket. If a PUT Object request doesn't specify any server-side
--   encryption, this default encryption will be applied.
serverSideEncryptionRule_applyServerSideEncryptionByDefault :: Lens' ServerSideEncryptionRule (Maybe ServerSideEncryptionByDefault)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should use an S3 Bucket Key with
--   server-side encryption using KMS (SSE-KMS) for new objects in the
--   bucket. Existing objects are not affected. Setting the
--   <tt>BucketKeyEnabled</tt> element to <tt>true</tt> causes Amazon S3 to
--   use an S3 Bucket Key. By default, S3 Bucket Key is not enabled.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon S3 Bucket Keys</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
serverSideEncryptionRule_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' ServerSideEncryptionRule (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionRule.ServerSideEncryptionRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionRule.ServerSideEncryptionRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionRule.ServerSideEncryptionRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionRule.ServerSideEncryptionRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ServerSideEncryptionRule.ServerSideEncryptionRule

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.SourceSelectionCriteria

-- | A container that describes additional filters for identifying the
--   source objects that you want to replicate. You can choose to enable or
--   disable the replication of these objects. Currently, Amazon S3
--   supports only the filter that you can specify for objects created with
--   server-side encryption using a customer managed key stored in Amazon
--   Web Services Key Management Service (SSE-KMS).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSourceSelectionCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data SourceSelectionCriteria
SourceSelectionCriteria' :: Maybe ReplicaModifications -> Maybe SseKmsEncryptedObjects -> SourceSelectionCriteria

-- | A filter that you can specify for selections for modifications on
--   replicas. Amazon S3 doesn't replicate replica modifications by
--   default. In the latest version of replication configuration (when
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is specified), you can specify this element and set
--   the status to <tt>Enabled</tt> to replicate modifications on replicas.
--   
--   If you don't specify the <tt>Filter</tt> element, Amazon S3 assumes
--   that the replication configuration is the earlier version, V1. In the
--   earlier version, this element is not allowed
[$sel:replicaModifications:SourceSelectionCriteria'] :: SourceSelectionCriteria -> Maybe ReplicaModifications

-- | A container for filter information for the selection of Amazon S3
--   objects encrypted with Amazon Web Services KMS. If you include
--   <tt>SourceSelectionCriteria</tt> in the replication configuration,
--   this element is required.
[$sel:sseKmsEncryptedObjects:SourceSelectionCriteria'] :: SourceSelectionCriteria -> Maybe SseKmsEncryptedObjects

-- | Create a value of <a>SourceSelectionCriteria</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicaModifications:SourceSelectionCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>sourceSelectionCriteria_replicaModifications</a> - A filter that
--   you can specify for selections for modifications on replicas. Amazon
--   S3 doesn't replicate replica modifications by default. In the latest
--   version of replication configuration (when <tt>Filter</tt> is
--   specified), you can specify this element and set the status to
--   <tt>Enabled</tt> to replicate modifications on replicas.
--   
--   If you don't specify the <tt>Filter</tt> element, Amazon S3 assumes
--   that the replication configuration is the earlier version, V1. In the
--   earlier version, this element is not allowed
--   
--   <a>$sel:sseKmsEncryptedObjects:SourceSelectionCriteria'</a>,
--   <a>sourceSelectionCriteria_sseKmsEncryptedObjects</a> - A container
--   for filter information for the selection of Amazon S3 objects
--   encrypted with Amazon Web Services KMS. If you include
--   <tt>SourceSelectionCriteria</tt> in the replication configuration,
--   this element is required.
newSourceSelectionCriteria :: SourceSelectionCriteria

-- | A filter that you can specify for selections for modifications on
--   replicas. Amazon S3 doesn't replicate replica modifications by
--   default. In the latest version of replication configuration (when
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is specified), you can specify this element and set
--   the status to <tt>Enabled</tt> to replicate modifications on replicas.
--   
--   If you don't specify the <tt>Filter</tt> element, Amazon S3 assumes
--   that the replication configuration is the earlier version, V1. In the
--   earlier version, this element is not allowed
sourceSelectionCriteria_replicaModifications :: Lens' SourceSelectionCriteria (Maybe ReplicaModifications)

-- | A container for filter information for the selection of Amazon S3
--   objects encrypted with Amazon Web Services KMS. If you include
--   <tt>SourceSelectionCriteria</tt> in the replication configuration,
--   this element is required.
sourceSelectionCriteria_sseKmsEncryptedObjects :: Lens' SourceSelectionCriteria (Maybe SseKmsEncryptedObjects)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.SourceSelectionCriteria.SourceSelectionCriteria
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.SourceSelectionCriteria.SourceSelectionCriteria
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.SourceSelectionCriteria.SourceSelectionCriteria
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.SourceSelectionCriteria.SourceSelectionCriteria
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.SourceSelectionCriteria.SourceSelectionCriteria
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.SourceSelectionCriteria.SourceSelectionCriteria
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.SourceSelectionCriteria.SourceSelectionCriteria
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.SourceSelectionCriteria.SourceSelectionCriteria


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Stats

-- | Container for the stats details.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStats</a> smart constructor.
data Stats
Stats' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Stats

-- | The total number of bytes of records payload data returned.
[$sel:bytesReturned:Stats'] :: Stats -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of object bytes scanned.
[$sel:bytesScanned:Stats'] :: Stats -> Maybe Integer

[$sel:bytesProcessed:Stats'] :: Stats -> Maybe Integer

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   total number of bytes of records payload data returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bytesScanned:Stats'</a>, <a>stats_bytesScanned</a> - The total
--   number of object bytes scanned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bytesProcessed:Stats'</a>, <a>stats_bytesProcessed</a> - The
--   total number of uncompressed object bytes processed.
newStats :: Stats

-- | The total number of bytes of records payload data returned.
stats_bytesReturned :: Lens' Stats (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of object bytes scanned.
stats_bytesScanned :: Lens' Stats (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of uncompressed object bytes processed.
stats_bytesProcessed :: Lens' Stats (Maybe Integer)

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.MultipartUpload

-- | Container for the <tt>MultipartUpload</tt> for the Amazon S3 object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMultipartUpload</a> smart constructor.
data MultipartUpload
MultipartUpload' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Initiator -> Maybe Owner -> Maybe ObjectKey -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe Text -> MultipartUpload

-- | Date and time at which the multipart upload was initiated.
[$sel:initiated:MultipartUpload'] :: MultipartUpload -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Identifies who initiated the multipart upload.
[$sel:initiator:MultipartUpload'] :: MultipartUpload -> Maybe Initiator

-- | Specifies the owner of the object that is part of the multipart
--   upload.
[$sel:owner:MultipartUpload'] :: MultipartUpload -> Maybe Owner

-- | Key of the object for which the multipart upload was initiated.
[$sel:key:MultipartUpload'] :: MultipartUpload -> Maybe ObjectKey

-- | The class of storage used to store the object.
[$sel:storageClass:MultipartUpload'] :: MultipartUpload -> Maybe StorageClass

-- | Upload ID that identifies the multipart upload.
[$sel:uploadId:MultipartUpload'] :: MultipartUpload -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MultipartUpload</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:initiated:MultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>multipartUpload_initiated</a> - Date and time at which the
--   multipart upload was initiated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:initiator:MultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>multipartUpload_initiator</a> - Identifies who initiated the
--   multipart upload.
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:MultipartUpload'</a>, <a>multipartUpload_owner</a> -
--   Specifies the owner of the object that is part of the multipart
--   upload.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:MultipartUpload'</a>, <a>multipartUpload_key</a> - Key of
--   the object for which the multipart upload was initiated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:MultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>multipartUpload_storageClass</a> - The class of storage used to
--   store the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadId:MultipartUpload'</a>, <a>multipartUpload_uploadId</a>
--   - Upload ID that identifies the multipart upload.
newMultipartUpload :: MultipartUpload

-- | Date and time at which the multipart upload was initiated.
multipartUpload_initiated :: Lens' MultipartUpload (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Identifies who initiated the multipart upload.
multipartUpload_initiator :: Lens' MultipartUpload (Maybe Initiator)

-- | Specifies the owner of the object that is part of the multipart
--   upload.
multipartUpload_owner :: Lens' MultipartUpload (Maybe Owner)

-- | Key of the object for which the multipart upload was initiated.
multipartUpload_key :: Lens' MultipartUpload (Maybe ObjectKey)

-- | The class of storage used to store the object.
multipartUpload_storageClass :: Lens' MultipartUpload (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | Upload ID that identifies the multipart upload.
multipartUpload_uploadId :: Lens' MultipartUpload (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.MultipartUpload.MultipartUpload
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.MultipartUpload.MultipartUpload
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.MultipartUpload.MultipartUpload
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.MultipartUpload.MultipartUpload
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.MultipartUpload.MultipartUpload
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.MultipartUpload.MultipartUpload
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.MultipartUpload.MultipartUpload


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Destination

-- | Specifies information about where to publish analysis or configuration
--   results for an Amazon S3 bucket and S3 Replication Time Control (S3
--   RTC).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDestination</a> smart constructor.
data Destination
Destination' :: Maybe Metrics -> Maybe AccessControlTranslation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe ReplicationTime -> BucketName -> Destination

-- | A container specifying replication metrics-related settings enabling
--   replication metrics and events.
[$sel:metrics:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe Metrics

-- | Specify this only in a cross-account scenario (where source and
--   destination bucket owners are not the same), and you want to change
--   replica ownership to the Amazon Web Services account that owns the
--   destination bucket. If this is not specified in the replication
--   configuration, the replicas are owned by same Amazon Web Services
--   account that owns the source object.
[$sel:accessControlTranslation:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe AccessControlTranslation

-- | Destination bucket owner account ID. In a cross-account scenario, if
--   you direct Amazon S3 to change replica ownership to the Amazon Web
--   Services account that owns the destination bucket by specifying the
--   <tt>AccessControlTranslation</tt> property, this is the account ID of
--   the destination bucket owner. For more information, see <a>Replication
--   Additional Configuration: Changing the Replica Owner</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:account:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe Text

-- | The storage class to use when replicating objects, such as S3 Standard
--   or reduced redundancy. By default, Amazon S3 uses the storage class of
--   the source object to create the object replica.
--   
--   For valid values, see the <tt>StorageClass</tt> element of the <a>PUT
--   Bucket replication</a> action in the <i>Amazon S3 API Reference</i>.
[$sel:storageClass:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe StorageClass

-- | A container that provides information about encryption. If
--   <tt>SourceSelectionCriteria</tt> is specified, you must specify this
--   element.
[$sel:encryptionConfiguration:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration

-- | A container specifying S3 Replication Time Control (S3 RTC), including
--   whether S3 RTC is enabled and the time when all objects and operations
--   on objects must be replicated. Must be specified together with a
--   <tt>Metrics</tt> block.
[$sel:replicationTime:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe ReplicationTime

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket where you want Amazon S3
--   to store the results.
[$sel:bucket:Destination'] :: Destination -> BucketName

-- | Create a value of <a>Destination</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_metrics</a> - A
--   container specifying replication metrics-related settings enabling
--   replication metrics and events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessControlTranslation:Destination'</a>,
--   <a>destination_accessControlTranslation</a> - Specify this only in a
--   cross-account scenario (where source and destination bucket owners are
--   not the same), and you want to change replica ownership to the Amazon
--   Web Services account that owns the destination bucket. If this is not
--   specified in the replication configuration, the replicas are owned by
--   same Amazon Web Services account that owns the source object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:account:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_account</a> -
--   Destination bucket owner account ID. In a cross-account scenario, if
--   you direct Amazon S3 to change replica ownership to the Amazon Web
--   Services account that owns the destination bucket by specifying the
--   <tt>AccessControlTranslation</tt> property, this is the account ID of
--   the destination bucket owner. For more information, see <a>Replication
--   Additional Configuration: Changing the Replica Owner</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_storageClass</a>
--   - The storage class to use when replicating objects, such as S3
--   Standard or reduced redundancy. By default, Amazon S3 uses the storage
--   class of the source object to create the object replica.
--   
--   For valid values, see the <tt>StorageClass</tt> element of the <a>PUT
--   Bucket replication</a> action in the <i>Amazon S3 API Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionConfiguration:Destination'</a>,
--   <a>destination_encryptionConfiguration</a> - A container that provides
--   information about encryption. If <tt>SourceSelectionCriteria</tt> is
--   specified, you must specify this element.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTime:Destination'</a>,
--   <a>destination_replicationTime</a> - A container specifying S3
--   Replication Time Control (S3 RTC), including whether S3 RTC is enabled
--   and the time when all objects and operations on objects must be
--   replicated. Must be specified together with a <tt>Metrics</tt> block.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_bucket</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket where you want Amazon S3 to
--   store the results.
newDestination :: BucketName -> Destination

-- | A container specifying replication metrics-related settings enabling
--   replication metrics and events.
destination_metrics :: Lens' Destination (Maybe Metrics)

-- | Specify this only in a cross-account scenario (where source and
--   destination bucket owners are not the same), and you want to change
--   replica ownership to the Amazon Web Services account that owns the
--   destination bucket. If this is not specified in the replication
--   configuration, the replicas are owned by same Amazon Web Services
--   account that owns the source object.
destination_accessControlTranslation :: Lens' Destination (Maybe AccessControlTranslation)

-- | Destination bucket owner account ID. In a cross-account scenario, if
--   you direct Amazon S3 to change replica ownership to the Amazon Web
--   Services account that owns the destination bucket by specifying the
--   <tt>AccessControlTranslation</tt> property, this is the account ID of
--   the destination bucket owner. For more information, see <a>Replication
--   Additional Configuration: Changing the Replica Owner</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
destination_account :: Lens' Destination (Maybe Text)

-- | The storage class to use when replicating objects, such as S3 Standard
--   or reduced redundancy. By default, Amazon S3 uses the storage class of
--   the source object to create the object replica.
--   
--   For valid values, see the <tt>StorageClass</tt> element of the <a>PUT
--   Bucket replication</a> action in the <i>Amazon S3 API Reference</i>.
destination_storageClass :: Lens' Destination (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | A container that provides information about encryption. If
--   <tt>SourceSelectionCriteria</tt> is specified, you must specify this
--   element.
destination_encryptionConfiguration :: Lens' Destination (Maybe EncryptionConfiguration)

-- | A container specifying S3 Replication Time Control (S3 RTC), including
--   whether S3 RTC is enabled and the time when all objects and operations
--   on objects must be replicated. Must be specified together with a
--   <tt>Metrics</tt> block.
destination_replicationTime :: Lens' Destination (Maybe ReplicationTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket where you want Amazon S3
--   to store the results.
destination_bucket :: Lens' Destination BucketName
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Destination.Destination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Destination.Destination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Destination.Destination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Destination.Destination
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Destination.Destination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.Destination.Destination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.Destination.Destination
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Destination.Destination

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Tag

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: ObjectKey -> Text -> Tag

-- | Name of the object key.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> ObjectKey

-- | Value of the tag.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - Name of the object key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - Value of the tag.
newTag :: ObjectKey -> Text -> Tag

-- | Name of the object key.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag ObjectKey

-- | Value of the tag.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleAndOperator

-- | A container for specifying rule filters. The filters determine the
--   subset of objects to which the rule applies. This element is required
--   only if you specify more than one filter.
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify both a <tt>Prefix</tt> and a <tt>Tag</tt> filter,
--   wrap these filters in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   <li>If you specify a filter based on multiple tags, wrap the
--   <tt>Tag</tt> elements in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationRuleAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationRuleAndOperator
ReplicationRuleAndOperator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> ReplicationRuleAndOperator

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
[$sel:prefix:ReplicationRuleAndOperator'] :: ReplicationRuleAndOperator -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of tags containing key and value pairs.
[$sel:tags:ReplicationRuleAndOperator'] :: ReplicationRuleAndOperator -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationRuleAndOperator</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ReplicationRuleAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRuleAndOperator_prefix</a> - An object key name prefix
--   that identifies the subset of objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ReplicationRuleAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRuleAndOperator_tags</a> - An array of tags containing
--   key and value pairs.
newReplicationRuleAndOperator :: ReplicationRuleAndOperator

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
replicationRuleAndOperator_prefix :: Lens' ReplicationRuleAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of tags containing key and value pairs.
replicationRuleAndOperator_tags :: Lens' ReplicationRuleAndOperator (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleAndOperator.ReplicationRuleAndOperator
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleAndOperator.ReplicationRuleAndOperator
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleAndOperator.ReplicationRuleAndOperator
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleAndOperator.ReplicationRuleAndOperator
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleAndOperator.ReplicationRuleAndOperator
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleAndOperator.ReplicationRuleAndOperator
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleAndOperator.ReplicationRuleAndOperator
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleAndOperator.ReplicationRuleAndOperator


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleFilter

-- | A filter that identifies the subset of objects to which the
--   replication rule applies. A <tt>Filter</tt> must specify exactly one
--   <tt>Prefix</tt>, <tt>Tag</tt>, or an <tt>And</tt> child element.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationRuleFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationRuleFilter
ReplicationRuleFilter' :: Maybe Tag -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReplicationRuleAndOperator -> ReplicationRuleFilter

-- | A container for specifying a tag key and value.
--   
--   The rule applies only to objects that have the tag in their tag set.
[$sel:tag:ReplicationRuleFilter'] :: ReplicationRuleFilter -> Maybe Tag

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:prefix:ReplicationRuleFilter'] :: ReplicationRuleFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | A container for specifying rule filters. The filters determine the
--   subset of objects to which the rule applies. This element is required
--   only if you specify more than one filter. For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify both a <tt>Prefix</tt> and a <tt>Tag</tt> filter,
--   wrap these filters in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   <li>If you specify a filter based on multiple tags, wrap the
--   <tt>Tag</tt> elements in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:and:ReplicationRuleFilter'] :: ReplicationRuleFilter -> Maybe ReplicationRuleAndOperator

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationRuleFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tag:ReplicationRuleFilter'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRuleFilter_tag</a> - A container for specifying a tag
--   key and value.
--   
--   The rule applies only to objects that have the tag in their tag set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ReplicationRuleFilter'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRuleFilter_prefix</a> - An object key name prefix that
--   identifies the subset of objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:ReplicationRuleFilter'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRuleFilter_and</a> - A container for specifying rule
--   filters. The filters determine the subset of objects to which the rule
--   applies. This element is required only if you specify more than one
--   filter. For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify both a <tt>Prefix</tt> and a <tt>Tag</tt> filter,
--   wrap these filters in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   <li>If you specify a filter based on multiple tags, wrap the
--   <tt>Tag</tt> elements in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   </ul>
newReplicationRuleFilter :: ReplicationRuleFilter

-- | A container for specifying a tag key and value.
--   
--   The rule applies only to objects that have the tag in their tag set.
replicationRuleFilter_tag :: Lens' ReplicationRuleFilter (Maybe Tag)

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
replicationRuleFilter_prefix :: Lens' ReplicationRuleFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | A container for specifying rule filters. The filters determine the
--   subset of objects to which the rule applies. This element is required
--   only if you specify more than one filter. For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify both a <tt>Prefix</tt> and a <tt>Tag</tt> filter,
--   wrap these filters in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   <li>If you specify a filter based on multiple tags, wrap the
--   <tt>Tag</tt> elements in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   </ul>
replicationRuleFilter_and :: Lens' ReplicationRuleFilter (Maybe ReplicationRuleAndOperator)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleFilter.ReplicationRuleFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleFilter.ReplicationRuleFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleFilter.ReplicationRuleFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleFilter.ReplicationRuleFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleFilter.ReplicationRuleFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleFilter.ReplicationRuleFilter

instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRuleFilter.ReplicationRuleFilter


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRule

-- | Specifies which Amazon S3 objects to replicate and where to store the
--   replicas.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationRule</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationRule
ReplicationRule' :: Maybe DeleteMarkerReplication -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ExistingObjectReplication -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReplicationRuleFilter -> Maybe SourceSelectionCriteria -> ReplicationRuleStatus -> Destination -> ReplicationRule
[$sel:deleteMarkerReplication:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe DeleteMarkerReplication

-- | The priority indicates which rule has precedence whenever two or more
--   replication rules conflict. Amazon S3 will attempt to replicate
--   objects according to all replication rules. However, if there are two
--   or more rules with the same destination bucket, then objects will be
--   replicated according to the rule with the highest priority. The higher
--   the number, the higher the priority.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:priority:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe Int

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the object or objects to
--   which the rule applies. The maximum prefix length is 1,024 characters.
--   To include all objects in a bucket, specify an empty string.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:prefix:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe Text
[$sel:existingObjectReplication:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe ExistingObjectReplication

-- | A unique identifier for the rule. The maximum value is 255 characters.
[$sel:id:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe Text
[$sel:filter':ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe ReplicationRuleFilter

-- | A container that describes additional filters for identifying the
--   source objects that you want to replicate. You can choose to enable or
--   disable the replication of these objects. Currently, Amazon S3
--   supports only the filter that you can specify for objects created with
--   server-side encryption using a customer managed key stored in Amazon
--   Web Services Key Management Service (SSE-KMS).
[$sel:sourceSelectionCriteria:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe SourceSelectionCriteria

-- | Specifies whether the rule is enabled.
[$sel:status:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> ReplicationRuleStatus

-- | A container for information about the replication destination and its
--   configurations including enabling the S3 Replication Time Control (S3
--   RTC).
[$sel:destination:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Destination

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationRule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteMarkerReplication:ReplicationRule'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRule_deleteMarkerReplication</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:ReplicationRule'</a>, <a>replicationRule_priority</a>
--   - The priority indicates which rule has precedence whenever two or
--   more replication rules conflict. Amazon S3 will attempt to replicate
--   objects according to all replication rules. However, if there are two
--   or more rules with the same destination bucket, then objects will be
--   replicated according to the rule with the highest priority. The higher
--   the number, the higher the priority.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ReplicationRule'</a>, <a>replicationRule_prefix</a> -
--   An object key name prefix that identifies the object or objects to
--   which the rule applies. The maximum prefix length is 1,024 characters.
--   To include all objects in a bucket, specify an empty string.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:existingObjectReplication:ReplicationRule'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRule_existingObjectReplication</a> -
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ReplicationRule'</a>, <a>replicationRule_id</a> - A unique
--   identifier for the rule. The maximum value is 255 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ReplicationRule'</a>, <a>replicationRule_filter</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceSelectionCriteria:ReplicationRule'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRule_sourceSelectionCriteria</a> - A container that
--   describes additional filters for identifying the source objects that
--   you want to replicate. You can choose to enable or disable the
--   replication of these objects. Currently, Amazon S3 supports only the
--   filter that you can specify for objects created with server-side
--   encryption using a customer managed key stored in Amazon Web Services
--   Key Management Service (SSE-KMS).
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReplicationRule'</a>, <a>replicationRule_status</a> -
--   Specifies whether the rule is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:ReplicationRule'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRule_destination</a> - A container for information about
--   the replication destination and its configurations including enabling
--   the S3 Replication Time Control (S3 RTC).
newReplicationRule :: ReplicationRuleStatus -> Destination -> ReplicationRule

-- | Undocumented member.
replicationRule_deleteMarkerReplication :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe DeleteMarkerReplication)

-- | The priority indicates which rule has precedence whenever two or more
--   replication rules conflict. Amazon S3 will attempt to replicate
--   objects according to all replication rules. However, if there are two
--   or more rules with the same destination bucket, then objects will be
--   replicated according to the rule with the highest priority. The higher
--   the number, the higher the priority.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
replicationRule_priority :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe Int)

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the object or objects to
--   which the rule applies. The maximum prefix length is 1,024 characters.
--   To include all objects in a bucket, specify an empty string.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
replicationRule_prefix :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe Text)

replicationRule_existingObjectReplication :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe ExistingObjectReplication)

-- | A unique identifier for the rule. The maximum value is 255 characters.
replicationRule_id :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
replicationRule_filter :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe ReplicationRuleFilter)

-- | A container that describes additional filters for identifying the
--   source objects that you want to replicate. You can choose to enable or
--   disable the replication of these objects. Currently, Amazon S3
--   supports only the filter that you can specify for objects created with
--   server-side encryption using a customer managed key stored in Amazon
--   Web Services Key Management Service (SSE-KMS).
replicationRule_sourceSelectionCriteria :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe SourceSelectionCriteria)

-- | Specifies whether the rule is enabled.
replicationRule_status :: Lens' ReplicationRule ReplicationRuleStatus

-- | A container for information about the replication destination and its
--   configurations including enabling the S3 Replication Time Control (S3
--   RTC).
replicationRule_destination :: Lens' ReplicationRule Destination
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRule.ReplicationRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRule.ReplicationRule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRule.ReplicationRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRule.ReplicationRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRule.ReplicationRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRule.ReplicationRule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRule.ReplicationRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationRule.ReplicationRule


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationConfiguration

-- | A container for replication rules. You can add up to 1,000 rules. The
--   maximum size of a replication configuration is 2 MB.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationConfiguration
ReplicationConfiguration' :: Text -> [ReplicationRule] -> ReplicationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role that Amazon S3 assumes when replicating objects. For more
--   information, see <a>How to Set Up Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3
--   User Guide</i>.
[$sel:role':ReplicationConfiguration'] :: ReplicationConfiguration -> Text

-- | A container for one or more replication rules. A replication
--   configuration must have at least one rule and can contain a maximum of
--   1,000 rules.
[$sel:rules:ReplicationConfiguration'] :: ReplicationConfiguration -> [ReplicationRule]

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:role':ReplicationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>replicationConfiguration_role</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that Amazon S3
--   assumes when replicating objects. For more information, see <a>How to
--   Set Up Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:ReplicationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>replicationConfiguration_rules</a> - A container for one or more
--   replication rules. A replication configuration must have at least one
--   rule and can contain a maximum of 1,000 rules.
newReplicationConfiguration :: Text -> ReplicationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role that Amazon S3 assumes when replicating objects. For more
--   information, see <a>How to Set Up Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3
--   User Guide</i>.
replicationConfiguration_role :: Lens' ReplicationConfiguration Text

-- | A container for one or more replication rules. A replication
--   configuration must have at least one rule and can contain a maximum of
--   1,000 rules.
replicationConfiguration_rules :: Lens' ReplicationConfiguration [ReplicationRule]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationConfiguration.ReplicationConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationConfiguration.ReplicationConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationConfiguration.ReplicationConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationConfiguration.ReplicationConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationConfiguration.ReplicationConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationConfiguration.ReplicationConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationConfiguration.ReplicationConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.ReplicationConfiguration.ReplicationConfiguration


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsAndOperator

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and
--   an object must match all of the predicates in order for the filter to
--   apply.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricsAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data MetricsAndOperator
MetricsAndOperator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> MetricsAndOperator

-- | The prefix used when evaluating an AND predicate.
[$sel:prefix:MetricsAndOperator'] :: MetricsAndOperator -> Maybe Text

-- | The access point ARN used when evaluating an AND predicate.
[$sel:accessPointArn:MetricsAndOperator'] :: MetricsAndOperator -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags used when evaluating an AND predicate.
[$sel:tags:MetricsAndOperator'] :: MetricsAndOperator -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricsAndOperator</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:MetricsAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>metricsAndOperator_prefix</a> - The prefix used when evaluating an
--   AND predicate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPointArn:MetricsAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>metricsAndOperator_accessPointArn</a> - The access point ARN used
--   when evaluating an AND predicate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:MetricsAndOperator'</a>, <a>metricsAndOperator_tags</a> -
--   The list of tags used when evaluating an AND predicate.
newMetricsAndOperator :: MetricsAndOperator

-- | The prefix used when evaluating an AND predicate.
metricsAndOperator_prefix :: Lens' MetricsAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | The access point ARN used when evaluating an AND predicate.
metricsAndOperator_accessPointArn :: Lens' MetricsAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags used when evaluating an AND predicate.
metricsAndOperator_tags :: Lens' MetricsAndOperator (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsAndOperator.MetricsAndOperator
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsAndOperator.MetricsAndOperator
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsAndOperator.MetricsAndOperator
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsAndOperator.MetricsAndOperator
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsAndOperator.MetricsAndOperator
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsAndOperator.MetricsAndOperator
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsAndOperator.MetricsAndOperator
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsAndOperator.MetricsAndOperator


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsFilter

-- | Specifies a metrics configuration filter. The metrics configuration
--   only includes objects that meet the filter's criteria. A filter must
--   be a prefix, an object tag, an access point ARN, or a conjunction
--   (MetricsAndOperator). For more information, see
--   <a>PutBucketMetricsConfiguration</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricsFilter</a> smart constructor.
data MetricsFilter
MetricsFilter' :: Maybe Tag -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MetricsAndOperator -> Maybe Text -> MetricsFilter

-- | The tag used when evaluating a metrics filter.
[$sel:tag:MetricsFilter'] :: MetricsFilter -> Maybe Tag

-- | The prefix used when evaluating a metrics filter.
[$sel:prefix:MetricsFilter'] :: MetricsFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and
--   an object must match all of the predicates in order for the filter to
--   apply.
[$sel:and:MetricsFilter'] :: MetricsFilter -> Maybe MetricsAndOperator

-- | The access point ARN used when evaluating a metrics filter.
[$sel:accessPointArn:MetricsFilter'] :: MetricsFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricsFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tag:MetricsFilter'</a>, <a>metricsFilter_tag</a> - The tag
--   used when evaluating a metrics filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:MetricsFilter'</a>, <a>metricsFilter_prefix</a> - The
--   prefix used when evaluating a metrics filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:MetricsFilter'</a>, <a>metricsFilter_and</a> - A
--   conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating a
--   metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and an
--   object must match all of the predicates in order for the filter to
--   apply.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPointArn:MetricsFilter'</a>,
--   <a>metricsFilter_accessPointArn</a> - The access point ARN used when
--   evaluating a metrics filter.
newMetricsFilter :: MetricsFilter

-- | The tag used when evaluating a metrics filter.
metricsFilter_tag :: Lens' MetricsFilter (Maybe Tag)

-- | The prefix used when evaluating a metrics filter.
metricsFilter_prefix :: Lens' MetricsFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and
--   an object must match all of the predicates in order for the filter to
--   apply.
metricsFilter_and :: Lens' MetricsFilter (Maybe MetricsAndOperator)

-- | The access point ARN used when evaluating a metrics filter.
metricsFilter_accessPointArn :: Lens' MetricsFilter (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsFilter.MetricsFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsFilter.MetricsFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsFilter.MetricsFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsFilter.MetricsFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsFilter.MetricsFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsFilter.MetricsFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsFilter.MetricsFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsFilter.MetricsFilter


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsConfiguration

-- | Specifies a metrics configuration for the CloudWatch request metrics
--   (specified by the metrics configuration ID) from an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   If you're updating an existing metrics configuration, note that this
--   is a full replacement of the existing metrics configuration. If you
--   don't include the elements you want to keep, they are erased. For more
--   information, see <a>PutBucketMetricsConfiguration</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricsConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data MetricsConfiguration
MetricsConfiguration' :: Maybe MetricsFilter -> Text -> MetricsConfiguration

-- | Specifies a metrics configuration filter. The metrics configuration
--   will only include objects that meet the filter's criteria. A filter
--   must be a prefix, an object tag, an access point ARN, or a conjunction
--   (MetricsAndOperator).
[$sel:filter':MetricsConfiguration'] :: MetricsConfiguration -> Maybe MetricsFilter

-- | The ID used to identify the metrics configuration.
[$sel:id:MetricsConfiguration'] :: MetricsConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricsConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':MetricsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>metricsConfiguration_filter</a> - Specifies a metrics configuration
--   filter. The metrics configuration will only include objects that meet
--   the filter's criteria. A filter must be a prefix, an object tag, an
--   access point ARN, or a conjunction (MetricsAndOperator).
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:MetricsConfiguration'</a>, <a>metricsConfiguration_id</a> -
--   The ID used to identify the metrics configuration.
newMetricsConfiguration :: Text -> MetricsConfiguration

-- | Specifies a metrics configuration filter. The metrics configuration
--   will only include objects that meet the filter's criteria. A filter
--   must be a prefix, an object tag, an access point ARN, or a conjunction
--   (MetricsAndOperator).
metricsConfiguration_filter :: Lens' MetricsConfiguration (Maybe MetricsFilter)

-- | The ID used to identify the metrics configuration.
metricsConfiguration_id :: Lens' MetricsConfiguration Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsConfiguration.MetricsConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsConfiguration.MetricsConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsConfiguration.MetricsConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsConfiguration.MetricsConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsConfiguration.MetricsConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsConfiguration.MetricsConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsConfiguration.MetricsConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.MetricsConfiguration.MetricsConfiguration


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleAndOperator

-- | This is used in a Lifecycle Rule Filter to apply a logical AND to two
--   or more predicates. The Lifecycle Rule will apply to any object
--   matching all of the predicates configured inside the And operator.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycleRuleAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data LifecycleRuleAndOperator
LifecycleRuleAndOperator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> LifecycleRuleAndOperator

-- | Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.
[$sel:prefix:LifecycleRuleAndOperator'] :: LifecycleRuleAndOperator -> Maybe Text

-- | All of these tags must exist in the object's tag set in order for the
--   rule to apply.
[$sel:tags:LifecycleRuleAndOperator'] :: LifecycleRuleAndOperator -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>LifecycleRuleAndOperator</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:LifecycleRuleAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRuleAndOperator_prefix</a> - Prefix identifying one or
--   more objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:LifecycleRuleAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRuleAndOperator_tags</a> - All of these tags must exist in
--   the object's tag set in order for the rule to apply.
newLifecycleRuleAndOperator :: LifecycleRuleAndOperator

-- | Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.
lifecycleRuleAndOperator_prefix :: Lens' LifecycleRuleAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | All of these tags must exist in the object's tag set in order for the
--   rule to apply.
lifecycleRuleAndOperator_tags :: Lens' LifecycleRuleAndOperator (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleAndOperator.LifecycleRuleAndOperator
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleAndOperator.LifecycleRuleAndOperator
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleAndOperator.LifecycleRuleAndOperator
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleAndOperator.LifecycleRuleAndOperator
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleAndOperator.LifecycleRuleAndOperator
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleAndOperator.LifecycleRuleAndOperator
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleAndOperator.LifecycleRuleAndOperator
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleAndOperator.LifecycleRuleAndOperator


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleFilter

-- | The <tt>Filter</tt> is used to identify objects that a Lifecycle Rule
--   applies to. A <tt>Filter</tt> must have exactly one of
--   <tt>Prefix</tt>, <tt>Tag</tt>, or <tt>And</tt> specified.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycleRuleFilter</a> smart constructor.
data LifecycleRuleFilter
LifecycleRuleFilter' :: Maybe Tag -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LifecycleRuleAndOperator -> LifecycleRuleFilter

-- | This tag must exist in the object's tag set in order for the rule to
--   apply.
[$sel:tag:LifecycleRuleFilter'] :: LifecycleRuleFilter -> Maybe Tag

-- | Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:prefix:LifecycleRuleFilter'] :: LifecycleRuleFilter -> Maybe Text
[$sel:and:LifecycleRuleFilter'] :: LifecycleRuleFilter -> Maybe LifecycleRuleAndOperator

-- | Create a value of <a>LifecycleRuleFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tag:LifecycleRuleFilter'</a>, <a>lifecycleRuleFilter_tag</a> -
--   This tag must exist in the object's tag set in order for the rule to
--   apply.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:LifecycleRuleFilter'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRuleFilter_prefix</a> - Prefix identifying one or more
--   objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:LifecycleRuleFilter'</a>, <a>lifecycleRuleFilter_and</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
newLifecycleRuleFilter :: LifecycleRuleFilter

-- | This tag must exist in the object's tag set in order for the rule to
--   apply.
lifecycleRuleFilter_tag :: Lens' LifecycleRuleFilter (Maybe Tag)

-- | Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
lifecycleRuleFilter_prefix :: Lens' LifecycleRuleFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
lifecycleRuleFilter_and :: Lens' LifecycleRuleFilter (Maybe LifecycleRuleAndOperator)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleFilter.LifecycleRuleFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleFilter.LifecycleRuleFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleFilter.LifecycleRuleFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleFilter.LifecycleRuleFilter

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleFilter.LifecycleRuleFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRuleFilter.LifecycleRuleFilter


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringAndOperator

-- | A container for specifying S3 Intelligent-Tiering filters. The filters
--   determine the subset of objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIntelligentTieringAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data IntelligentTieringAndOperator
IntelligentTieringAndOperator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> IntelligentTieringAndOperator

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the configuration applies.
[$sel:prefix:IntelligentTieringAndOperator'] :: IntelligentTieringAndOperator -> Maybe Text

-- | All of these tags must exist in the object's tag set in order for the
--   configuration to apply.
[$sel:tags:IntelligentTieringAndOperator'] :: IntelligentTieringAndOperator -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>IntelligentTieringAndOperator</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:IntelligentTieringAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringAndOperator_prefix</a> - An object key name
--   prefix that identifies the subset of objects to which the
--   configuration applies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:IntelligentTieringAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringAndOperator_tags</a> - All of these tags must
--   exist in the object's tag set in order for the configuration to apply.
newIntelligentTieringAndOperator :: IntelligentTieringAndOperator

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the configuration applies.
intelligentTieringAndOperator_prefix :: Lens' IntelligentTieringAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | All of these tags must exist in the object's tag set in order for the
--   configuration to apply.
intelligentTieringAndOperator_tags :: Lens' IntelligentTieringAndOperator (Maybe [Tag])

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringAndOperator.IntelligentTieringAndOperator
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringAndOperator.IntelligentTieringAndOperator
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringAndOperator.IntelligentTieringAndOperator
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringAndOperator.IntelligentTieringAndOperator
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringAndOperator.IntelligentTieringAndOperator
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringAndOperator.IntelligentTieringAndOperator
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringAndOperator.IntelligentTieringAndOperator


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringFilter

-- | The <tt>Filter</tt> is used to identify objects that the S3
--   Intelligent-Tiering configuration applies to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIntelligentTieringFilter</a> smart constructor.
data IntelligentTieringFilter
IntelligentTieringFilter' :: Maybe Tag -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IntelligentTieringAndOperator -> IntelligentTieringFilter
[$sel:tag:IntelligentTieringFilter'] :: IntelligentTieringFilter -> Maybe Tag

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:prefix:IntelligentTieringFilter'] :: IntelligentTieringFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and
--   an object must match all of the predicates in order for the filter to
--   apply.
[$sel:and:IntelligentTieringFilter'] :: IntelligentTieringFilter -> Maybe IntelligentTieringAndOperator

-- | Create a value of <a>IntelligentTieringFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tag:IntelligentTieringFilter'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringFilter_tag</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:IntelligentTieringFilter'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringFilter_prefix</a> - An object key name prefix
--   that identifies the subset of objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:IntelligentTieringFilter'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringFilter_and</a> - A conjunction (logical AND) of
--   predicates, which is used in evaluating a metrics filter. The operator
--   must have at least two predicates, and an object must match all of the
--   predicates in order for the filter to apply.
newIntelligentTieringFilter :: IntelligentTieringFilter

-- | Undocumented member.
intelligentTieringFilter_tag :: Lens' IntelligentTieringFilter (Maybe Tag)

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
intelligentTieringFilter_prefix :: Lens' IntelligentTieringFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and
--   an object must match all of the predicates in order for the filter to
--   apply.
intelligentTieringFilter_and :: Lens' IntelligentTieringFilter (Maybe IntelligentTieringAndOperator)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringFilter.IntelligentTieringFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringFilter.IntelligentTieringFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringFilter.IntelligentTieringFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringFilter.IntelligentTieringFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringFilter.IntelligentTieringFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringFilter.IntelligentTieringFilter
