instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringFilter.IntelligentTieringFilter


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsAndOperator

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates in
--   any combination, and an object must match all of the predicates for
--   the filter to apply.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnalyticsAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data AnalyticsAndOperator
AnalyticsAndOperator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> AnalyticsAndOperator

-- | The prefix to use when evaluating an AND predicate: The prefix that an
--   object must have to be included in the metrics results.
[$sel:prefix:AnalyticsAndOperator'] :: AnalyticsAndOperator -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags to use when evaluating an AND predicate.
[$sel:tags:AnalyticsAndOperator'] :: AnalyticsAndOperator -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>AnalyticsAndOperator</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:AnalyticsAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsAndOperator_prefix</a> - The prefix to use when evaluating
--   an AND predicate: The prefix that an object must have to be included
--   in the metrics results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:AnalyticsAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsAndOperator_tags</a> - The list of tags to use when
--   evaluating an AND predicate.
newAnalyticsAndOperator :: AnalyticsAndOperator

-- | The prefix to use when evaluating an AND predicate: The prefix that an
--   object must have to be included in the metrics results.
analyticsAndOperator_prefix :: Lens' AnalyticsAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags to use when evaluating an AND predicate.
analyticsAndOperator_tags :: Lens' AnalyticsAndOperator (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsAndOperator.AnalyticsAndOperator
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsAndOperator.AnalyticsAndOperator
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsAndOperator.AnalyticsAndOperator
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsAndOperator.AnalyticsAndOperator
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsAndOperator.AnalyticsAndOperator
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsAndOperator.AnalyticsAndOperator
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsAndOperator.AnalyticsAndOperator
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsAndOperator.AnalyticsAndOperator


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsFilter

-- | The filter used to describe a set of objects for analyses. A filter
--   must have exactly one prefix, one tag, or one conjunction
--   (AnalyticsAndOperator). If no filter is provided, all objects will be
--   considered in any analysis.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnalyticsFilter</a> smart constructor.
data AnalyticsFilter
AnalyticsFilter' :: Maybe Tag -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AnalyticsAndOperator -> AnalyticsFilter

-- | The tag to use when evaluating an analytics filter.
[$sel:tag:AnalyticsFilter'] :: AnalyticsFilter -> Maybe Tag

-- | The prefix to use when evaluating an analytics filter.
[$sel:prefix:AnalyticsFilter'] :: AnalyticsFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   an analytics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates.
[$sel:and:AnalyticsFilter'] :: AnalyticsFilter -> Maybe AnalyticsAndOperator

-- | Create a value of <a>AnalyticsFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tag:AnalyticsFilter'</a>, <a>analyticsFilter_tag</a> - The tag
--   to use when evaluating an analytics filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:AnalyticsFilter'</a>, <a>analyticsFilter_prefix</a> -
--   The prefix to use when evaluating an analytics filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:AnalyticsFilter'</a>, <a>analyticsFilter_and</a> - A
--   conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   an analytics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates.
newAnalyticsFilter :: AnalyticsFilter

-- | The tag to use when evaluating an analytics filter.
analyticsFilter_tag :: Lens' AnalyticsFilter (Maybe Tag)

-- | The prefix to use when evaluating an analytics filter.
analyticsFilter_prefix :: Lens' AnalyticsFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   an analytics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates.
analyticsFilter_and :: Lens' AnalyticsFilter (Maybe AnalyticsAndOperator)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsFilter.AnalyticsFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsFilter.AnalyticsFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsFilter.AnalyticsFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsFilter.AnalyticsFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsFilter.AnalyticsFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsFilter.AnalyticsFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsFilter.AnalyticsFilter
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsFilter.AnalyticsFilter


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsConfiguration

-- | Specifies the configuration and any analyses for the analytics filter
--   of an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnalyticsConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data AnalyticsConfiguration
AnalyticsConfiguration' :: Maybe AnalyticsFilter -> Text -> StorageClassAnalysis -> AnalyticsConfiguration

-- | The filter used to describe a set of objects for analyses. A filter
--   must have exactly one prefix, one tag, or one conjunction
--   (AnalyticsAndOperator). If no filter is provided, all objects will be
--   considered in any analysis.
[$sel:filter':AnalyticsConfiguration'] :: AnalyticsConfiguration -> Maybe AnalyticsFilter

-- | The ID that identifies the analytics configuration.
[$sel:id:AnalyticsConfiguration'] :: AnalyticsConfiguration -> Text

-- | Contains data related to access patterns to be collected and made
--   available to analyze the tradeoffs between different storage classes.
[$sel:storageClassAnalysis:AnalyticsConfiguration'] :: AnalyticsConfiguration -> StorageClassAnalysis

-- | Create a value of <a>AnalyticsConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':AnalyticsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsConfiguration_filter</a> - The filter used to describe a
--   set of objects for analyses. A filter must have exactly one prefix,
--   one tag, or one conjunction (AnalyticsAndOperator). If no filter is
--   provided, all objects will be considered in any analysis.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:AnalyticsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsConfiguration_id</a> - The ID that identifies the
--   analytics configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClassAnalysis:AnalyticsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsConfiguration_storageClassAnalysis</a> - Contains data
--   related to access patterns to be collected and made available to
--   analyze the tradeoffs between different storage classes.
newAnalyticsConfiguration :: Text -> StorageClassAnalysis -> AnalyticsConfiguration

-- | The filter used to describe a set of objects for analyses. A filter
--   must have exactly one prefix, one tag, or one conjunction
--   (AnalyticsAndOperator). If no filter is provided, all objects will be
--   considered in any analysis.
analyticsConfiguration_filter :: Lens' AnalyticsConfiguration (Maybe AnalyticsFilter)

-- | The ID that identifies the analytics configuration.
analyticsConfiguration_id :: Lens' AnalyticsConfiguration Text

-- | Contains data related to access patterns to be collected and made
--   available to analyze the tradeoffs between different storage classes.
analyticsConfiguration_storageClassAnalysis :: Lens' AnalyticsConfiguration StorageClassAnalysis
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsConfiguration.AnalyticsConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsConfiguration.AnalyticsConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsConfiguration.AnalyticsConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsConfiguration.AnalyticsConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsConfiguration.AnalyticsConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsConfiguration.AnalyticsConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsConfiguration.AnalyticsConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.AnalyticsConfiguration.AnalyticsConfiguration

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Tiering

-- | The S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class is designed to optimize
--   storage costs by automatically moving data to the most cost-effective
--   storage access tier, without additional operational overhead.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTiering</a> smart constructor.
data Tiering
Tiering' :: Int -> IntelligentTieringAccessTier -> Tiering

-- | The number of consecutive days of no access after which an object will
--   be eligible to be transitioned to the corresponding tier. The minimum
--   number of days specified for Archive Access tier must be at least 90
--   days and Deep Archive Access tier must be at least 180 days. The
--   maximum can be up to 2 years (730 days).
[$sel:days:Tiering'] :: Tiering -> Int

-- | S3 Intelligent-Tiering access tier. See <a>Storage class for
--   automatically optimizing frequently and infrequently accessed
--   objects</a> for a list of access tiers in the S3 Intelligent-Tiering
--   storage class.
[$sel:accessTier:Tiering'] :: Tiering -> IntelligentTieringAccessTier

-- | Create a value of <a>Tiering</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:days:Tiering'</a>, <a>tiering_days</a> - The number of
--   consecutive days of no access after which an object will be eligible
--   to be transitioned to the corresponding tier. The minimum number of
--   days specified for Archive Access tier must be at least 90 days and
--   Deep Archive Access tier must be at least 180 days. The maximum can be
--   up to 2 years (730 days).
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessTier:Tiering'</a>, <a>tiering_accessTier</a> - S3
--   Intelligent-Tiering access tier. See <a>Storage class for
--   automatically optimizing frequently and infrequently accessed
--   objects</a> for a list of access tiers in the S3 Intelligent-Tiering
--   storage class.
newTiering :: Int -> IntelligentTieringAccessTier -> Tiering

-- | The number of consecutive days of no access after which an object will
--   be eligible to be transitioned to the corresponding tier. The minimum
--   number of days specified for Archive Access tier must be at least 90
--   days and Deep Archive Access tier must be at least 180 days. The
--   maximum can be up to 2 years (730 days).
tiering_days :: Lens' Tiering Int

-- | S3 Intelligent-Tiering access tier. See <a>Storage class for
--   automatically optimizing frequently and infrequently accessed
--   objects</a> for a list of access tiers in the S3 Intelligent-Tiering
--   storage class.
tiering_accessTier :: Lens' Tiering IntelligentTieringAccessTier
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Tiering.Tiering
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Tiering.Tiering
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Tiering.Tiering
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Tiering.Tiering
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Tiering.Tiering
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.Tiering.Tiering
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.Tiering.Tiering
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Tiering.Tiering


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringConfiguration

-- | Specifies the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration for an Amazon S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   For information about the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class, see
--   <a>Storage class for automatically optimizing frequently and
--   infrequently accessed objects</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIntelligentTieringConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data IntelligentTieringConfiguration
IntelligentTieringConfiguration' :: Maybe IntelligentTieringFilter -> Text -> IntelligentTieringStatus -> [Tiering] -> IntelligentTieringConfiguration

-- | Specifies a bucket filter. The configuration only includes objects
--   that meet the filter's criteria.
[$sel:filter':IntelligentTieringConfiguration'] :: IntelligentTieringConfiguration -> Maybe IntelligentTieringFilter

-- | The ID used to identify the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration.
[$sel:id:IntelligentTieringConfiguration'] :: IntelligentTieringConfiguration -> Text

-- | Specifies the status of the configuration.
[$sel:status:IntelligentTieringConfiguration'] :: IntelligentTieringConfiguration -> IntelligentTieringStatus

-- | Specifies the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class tier of the
--   configuration.
[$sel:tierings:IntelligentTieringConfiguration'] :: IntelligentTieringConfiguration -> [Tiering]

-- | Create a value of <a>IntelligentTieringConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':IntelligentTieringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringConfiguration_filter</a> - Specifies a bucket
--   filter. The configuration only includes objects that meet the filter's
--   criteria.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:IntelligentTieringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringConfiguration_id</a> - The ID used to identify
--   the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:IntelligentTieringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringConfiguration_status</a> - Specifies the status
--   of the configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tierings:IntelligentTieringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringConfiguration_tierings</a> - Specifies the S3
--   Intelligent-Tiering storage class tier of the configuration.
newIntelligentTieringConfiguration :: Text -> IntelligentTieringStatus -> IntelligentTieringConfiguration

-- | Specifies a bucket filter. The configuration only includes objects
--   that meet the filter's criteria.
intelligentTieringConfiguration_filter :: Lens' IntelligentTieringConfiguration (Maybe IntelligentTieringFilter)

-- | The ID used to identify the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration.
intelligentTieringConfiguration_id :: Lens' IntelligentTieringConfiguration Text

-- | Specifies the status of the configuration.
intelligentTieringConfiguration_status :: Lens' IntelligentTieringConfiguration IntelligentTieringStatus

-- | Specifies the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class tier of the
--   configuration.
intelligentTieringConfiguration_tierings :: Lens' IntelligentTieringConfiguration [Tiering]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringConfiguration.IntelligentTieringConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringConfiguration.IntelligentTieringConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringConfiguration.IntelligentTieringConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringConfiguration.IntelligentTieringConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringConfiguration.IntelligentTieringConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringConfiguration.IntelligentTieringConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringConfiguration.IntelligentTieringConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.IntelligentTieringConfiguration.IntelligentTieringConfiguration


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.TopicConfiguration

-- | A container for specifying the configuration for publication of
--   messages to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic
--   when Amazon S3 detects specified events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTopicConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data TopicConfiguration
TopicConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter -> Text -> [Event] -> TopicConfiguration
[$sel:id:TopicConfiguration'] :: TopicConfiguration -> Maybe Text
[$sel:filter':TopicConfiguration'] :: TopicConfiguration -> Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to which Amazon
--   S3 publishes a message when it detects events of the specified type.
[$sel:topicArn:TopicConfiguration'] :: TopicConfiguration -> Text

-- | The Amazon S3 bucket event about which to send notifications. For more
--   information, see <a>Supported Event Types</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:events:TopicConfiguration'] :: TopicConfiguration -> [Event]

-- | Create a value of <a>TopicConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:TopicConfiguration'</a>, <a>topicConfiguration_id</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':TopicConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>topicConfiguration_filter</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicArn:TopicConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>topicConfiguration_topicArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the Amazon SNS topic to which Amazon S3 publishes a message when it
--   detects events of the specified type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:events:TopicConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>topicConfiguration_events</a> - The Amazon S3 bucket event about
--   which to send notifications. For more information, see <a>Supported
--   Event Types</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
newTopicConfiguration :: Text -> TopicConfiguration

-- | Undocumented member.
topicConfiguration_id :: Lens' TopicConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
topicConfiguration_filter :: Lens' TopicConfiguration (Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to which Amazon
--   S3 publishes a message when it detects events of the specified type.
topicConfiguration_topicArn :: Lens' TopicConfiguration Text

-- | The Amazon S3 bucket event about which to send notifications. For more
--   information, see <a>Supported Event Types</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
topicConfiguration_events :: Lens' TopicConfiguration [Event]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.TopicConfiguration.TopicConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.TopicConfiguration.TopicConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.TopicConfiguration.TopicConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.TopicConfiguration.TopicConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.TopicConfiguration.TopicConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.TopicConfiguration.TopicConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.TopicConfiguration.TopicConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.TopicConfiguration.TopicConfiguration


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfiguration

-- | A container for specifying the notification configuration of the
--   bucket. If this element is empty, notifications are turned off for the
--   bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotificationConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data NotificationConfiguration
NotificationConfiguration' :: Maybe [QueueConfiguration] -> Maybe [TopicConfiguration] -> Maybe [LambdaFunctionConfiguration] -> NotificationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Simple Queue Service queues to publish messages to and the
--   events for which to publish messages.
[$sel:queueConfigurations:NotificationConfiguration'] :: NotificationConfiguration -> Maybe [QueueConfiguration]

-- | The topic to which notifications are sent and the events for which
--   notifications are generated.
[$sel:topicConfigurations:NotificationConfiguration'] :: NotificationConfiguration -> Maybe [TopicConfiguration]

-- | Describes the Lambda functions to invoke and the events for which to
--   invoke them.
[$sel:lambdaFunctionConfigurations:NotificationConfiguration'] :: NotificationConfiguration -> Maybe [LambdaFunctionConfiguration]

-- | Create a value of <a>NotificationConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueConfigurations:NotificationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>notificationConfiguration_queueConfigurations</a> - The Amazon
--   Simple Queue Service queues to publish messages to and the events for
--   which to publish messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicConfigurations:NotificationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>notificationConfiguration_topicConfigurations</a> - The topic to
--   which notifications are sent and the events for which notifications
--   are generated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambdaFunctionConfigurations:NotificationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>notificationConfiguration_lambdaFunctionConfigurations</a> -
--   Describes the Lambda functions to invoke and the events for which to
--   invoke them.
newNotificationConfiguration :: NotificationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Simple Queue Service queues to publish messages to and the
--   events for which to publish messages.
notificationConfiguration_queueConfigurations :: Lens' NotificationConfiguration (Maybe [QueueConfiguration])

-- | The topic to which notifications are sent and the events for which
--   notifications are generated.
notificationConfiguration_topicConfigurations :: Lens' NotificationConfiguration (Maybe [TopicConfiguration])

-- | Describes the Lambda functions to invoke and the events for which to
--   invoke them.
notificationConfiguration_lambdaFunctionConfigurations :: Lens' NotificationConfiguration (Maybe [LambdaFunctionConfiguration])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfiguration.NotificationConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfiguration.NotificationConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfiguration.NotificationConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfiguration.NotificationConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfiguration.NotificationConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfiguration.NotificationConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfiguration.NotificationConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.NotificationConfiguration.NotificationConfiguration


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.TransitionStorageClass

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.TransitionStorageClass.TransitionStorageClass


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Transition

-- | Specifies when an object transitions to a specified storage class. For
--   more information about Amazon S3 lifecycle configuration rules, see
--   <a>Transitioning Objects Using Amazon S3 Lifecycle</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTransition</a> smart constructor.
data Transition
Transition' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe TransitionStorageClass -> Transition

-- | Indicates the number of days after creation when objects are
--   transitioned to the specified storage class. The value must be a
--   positive integer.
[$sel:days:Transition'] :: Transition -> Maybe Int

-- | Indicates when objects are transitioned to the specified storage
--   class. The date value must be in ISO 8601 format. The time is always
--   midnight UTC.
[$sel:date:Transition'] :: Transition -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The storage class to which you want the object to transition.
[$sel:storageClass:Transition'] :: Transition -> Maybe TransitionStorageClass

-- | Create a value of <a>Transition</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:days:Transition'</a>, <a>transition_days</a> - Indicates the
--   number of days after creation when objects are transitioned to the
--   specified storage class. The value must be a positive integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:date:Transition'</a>, <a>transition_date</a> - Indicates when
--   objects are transitioned to the specified storage class. The date
--   value must be in ISO 8601 format. The time is always midnight UTC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:Transition'</a>, <a>transition_storageClass</a> -
--   The storage class to which you want the object to transition.
newTransition :: Transition

-- | Indicates the number of days after creation when objects are
--   transitioned to the specified storage class. The value must be a
--   positive integer.
transition_days :: Lens' Transition (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates when objects are transitioned to the specified storage
--   class. The date value must be in ISO 8601 format. The time is always
--   midnight UTC.
transition_date :: Lens' Transition (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The storage class to which you want the object to transition.
transition_storageClass :: Lens' Transition (Maybe TransitionStorageClass)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Transition.Transition
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Transition.Transition
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Transition.Transition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Transition.Transition
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Transition.Transition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.Transition.Transition
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.Transition.Transition
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Transition.Transition


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionTransition

-- | Container for the transition rule that describes when noncurrent
--   objects transition to the <tt>STANDARD_IA</tt>, <tt>ONEZONE_IA</tt>,
--   <tt>INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>, <tt>GLACIER</tt>, or
--   <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt> storage class. If your bucket is
--   versioning-enabled (or versioning is suspended), you can set this
--   action to request that Amazon S3 transition noncurrent object versions
--   to the <tt>STANDARD_IA</tt>, <tt>ONEZONE_IA</tt>,
--   <tt>INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>, <tt>GLACIER</tt>, or
--   <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt> storage class at a specific period in the
--   object's lifetime.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNoncurrentVersionTransition</a> smart constructor.
data NoncurrentVersionTransition
NoncurrentVersionTransition' :: Int -> TransitionStorageClass -> NoncurrentVersionTransition

-- | Specifies the number of days an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3
--   can perform the associated action. For information about the
--   noncurrent days calculations, see <a>How Amazon S3 Calculates How Long
--   an Object Has Been Noncurrent</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:noncurrentDays:NoncurrentVersionTransition'] :: NoncurrentVersionTransition -> Int

-- | The class of storage used to store the object.
[$sel:storageClass:NoncurrentVersionTransition'] :: NoncurrentVersionTransition -> TransitionStorageClass

-- | Create a value of <a>NoncurrentVersionTransition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:noncurrentDays:NoncurrentVersionTransition'</a>,
--   <a>noncurrentVersionTransition_noncurrentDays</a> - Specifies the
--   number of days an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3 can perform
--   the associated action. For information about the noncurrent days
--   calculations, see <a>How Amazon S3 Calculates How Long an Object Has
--   Been Noncurrent</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:NoncurrentVersionTransition'</a>,
--   <a>noncurrentVersionTransition_storageClass</a> - The class of storage
--   used to store the object.
newNoncurrentVersionTransition :: Int -> TransitionStorageClass -> NoncurrentVersionTransition

-- | Specifies the number of days an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3
--   can perform the associated action. For information about the
--   noncurrent days calculations, see <a>How Amazon S3 Calculates How Long
--   an Object Has Been Noncurrent</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
noncurrentVersionTransition_noncurrentDays :: Lens' NoncurrentVersionTransition Int

-- | The class of storage used to store the object.
noncurrentVersionTransition_storageClass :: Lens' NoncurrentVersionTransition TransitionStorageClass
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionTransition.NoncurrentVersionTransition
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionTransition.NoncurrentVersionTransition
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionTransition.NoncurrentVersionTransition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionTransition.NoncurrentVersionTransition
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionTransition.NoncurrentVersionTransition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionTransition.NoncurrentVersionTransition
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionTransition.NoncurrentVersionTransition
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.NoncurrentVersionTransition.NoncurrentVersionTransition


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRule

-- | A lifecycle rule for individual objects in an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycleRule</a> smart constructor.
data LifecycleRule
LifecycleRule' :: Maybe [Transition] -> Maybe NoncurrentVersionExpiration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [NoncurrentVersionTransition] -> Maybe LifecycleExpiration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LifecycleRuleFilter -> Maybe AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload -> ExpirationStatus -> LifecycleRule

-- | Specifies when an Amazon S3 object transitions to a specified storage
--   class.
[$sel:transitions:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe [Transition]
[$sel:noncurrentVersionExpiration:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe NoncurrentVersionExpiration

-- | Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies. This
--   is no longer used; use <tt>Filter</tt> instead.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:prefix:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the transition rule for the lifecycle rule that describes
--   when noncurrent objects transition to a specific storage class. If
--   your bucket is versioning-enabled (or versioning is suspended), you
--   can set this action to request that Amazon S3 transition noncurrent
--   object versions to a specific storage class at a set period in the
--   object's lifetime.
[$sel:noncurrentVersionTransitions:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe [NoncurrentVersionTransition]

-- | Specifies the expiration for the lifecycle of the object in the form
--   of date, days and, whether the object has a delete marker.
[$sel:expiration:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe LifecycleExpiration

-- | Unique identifier for the rule. The value cannot be longer than 255
--   characters.
[$sel:id:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The <tt>Filter</tt> is used to identify objects that a Lifecycle Rule
--   applies to. A <tt>Filter</tt> must have exactly one of
--   <tt>Prefix</tt>, <tt>Tag</tt>, or <tt>And</tt> specified.
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is required if the <tt>LifecycleRule</tt> does not
--   containt a <tt>Prefix</tt> element.
[$sel:filter':LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe LifecycleRuleFilter
[$sel:abortIncompleteMultipartUpload:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload

-- | If 'Enabled', the rule is currently being applied. If 'Disabled', the
--   rule is not currently being applied.
[$sel:status:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> ExpirationStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>LifecycleRule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:transitions:LifecycleRule'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRule_transitions</a> - Specifies when an Amazon S3 object
--   transitions to a specified storage class.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noncurrentVersionExpiration:LifecycleRule'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRule_noncurrentVersionExpiration</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_prefix</a> -
--   Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies. This
--   is no longer used; use <tt>Filter</tt> instead.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noncurrentVersionTransitions:LifecycleRule'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRule_noncurrentVersionTransitions</a> - Specifies the
--   transition rule for the lifecycle rule that describes when noncurrent
--   objects transition to a specific storage class. If your bucket is
--   versioning-enabled (or versioning is suspended), you can set this
--   action to request that Amazon S3 transition noncurrent object versions
--   to a specific storage class at a set period in the object's lifetime.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiration:LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_expiration</a>
--   - Specifies the expiration for the lifecycle of the object in the form
--   of date, days and, whether the object has a delete marker.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_id</a> - Unique
--   identifier for the rule. The value cannot be longer than 255
--   characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_filter</a> - The
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is used to identify objects that a Lifecycle Rule
--   applies to. A <tt>Filter</tt> must have exactly one of
--   <tt>Prefix</tt>, <tt>Tag</tt>, or <tt>And</tt> specified.
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is required if the <tt>LifecycleRule</tt> does not
--   containt a <tt>Prefix</tt> element.
--   
--   <a>$sel:abortIncompleteMultipartUpload:LifecycleRule'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRule_abortIncompleteMultipartUpload</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_status</a> - If
--   'Enabled', the rule is currently being applied. If 'Disabled', the
--   rule is not currently being applied.
newLifecycleRule :: ExpirationStatus -> LifecycleRule

-- | Specifies when an Amazon S3 object transitions to a specified storage
--   class.
lifecycleRule_transitions :: Lens' LifecycleRule (Maybe [Transition])

-- | Undocumented member.
lifecycleRule_noncurrentVersionExpiration :: Lens' LifecycleRule (Maybe NoncurrentVersionExpiration)

-- | Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies. This
--   is no longer used; use <tt>Filter</tt> instead.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
lifecycleRule_prefix :: Lens' LifecycleRule (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the transition rule for the lifecycle rule that describes
--   when noncurrent objects transition to a specific storage class. If
--   your bucket is versioning-enabled (or versioning is suspended), you
--   can set this action to request that Amazon S3 transition noncurrent
--   object versions to a specific storage class at a set period in the
--   object's lifetime.
lifecycleRule_noncurrentVersionTransitions :: Lens' LifecycleRule (Maybe [NoncurrentVersionTransition])

-- | Specifies the expiration for the lifecycle of the object in the form
--   of date, days and, whether the object has a delete marker.
lifecycleRule_expiration :: Lens' LifecycleRule (Maybe LifecycleExpiration)

-- | Unique identifier for the rule. The value cannot be longer than 255
--   characters.
lifecycleRule_id :: Lens' LifecycleRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>Filter</tt> is used to identify objects that a Lifecycle Rule
--   applies to. A <tt>Filter</tt> must have exactly one of
--   <tt>Prefix</tt>, <tt>Tag</tt>, or <tt>And</tt> specified.
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is required if the <tt>LifecycleRule</tt> does not
--   containt a <tt>Prefix</tt> element.
lifecycleRule_filter :: Lens' LifecycleRule (Maybe LifecycleRuleFilter)

-- | Undocumented member.
lifecycleRule_abortIncompleteMultipartUpload :: Lens' LifecycleRule (Maybe AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload)

-- | If 'Enabled', the rule is currently being applied. If 'Disabled', the
--   rule is not currently being applied.
lifecycleRule_status :: Lens' LifecycleRule ExpirationStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRule.LifecycleRule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRule.LifecycleRule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRule.LifecycleRule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRule.LifecycleRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRule.LifecycleRule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRule.LifecycleRule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRule.LifecycleRule
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.LifecycleRule.LifecycleRule

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Type.Type


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.Grantee

-- | Container for the person being granted permissions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGrantee</a> smart constructor.
data Grantee
Grantee' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Type -> Grantee

-- | URI of the grantee group.
[$sel:uri:Grantee'] :: Grantee -> Maybe Text

-- | Email address of the grantee.
--   
--   Using email addresses to specify a grantee is only supported in the
--   following Amazon Web Services Regions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>US East (N. Virginia)</li>
--   <li>US West (N. California)</li>
--   <li>US West (Oregon)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Singapore)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Sydney)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Tokyo)</li>
--   <li>Europe (Ireland)</li>
--   <li>South America (São Paulo)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For a list of all the Amazon S3 supported Regions and endpoints, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a> in the Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference.
[$sel:emailAddress:Grantee'] :: Grantee -> Maybe Text

-- | Screen name of the grantee.
[$sel:displayName:Grantee'] :: Grantee -> Maybe Text

-- | The canonical user ID of the grantee.
[$sel:id:Grantee'] :: Grantee -> Maybe Text

-- | Type of grantee
[$sel:type':Grantee'] :: Grantee -> Type

-- | Create a value of <a>Grantee</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:uri:Grantee'</a>, <a>grantee_uri</a> - URI of the grantee
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailAddress:Grantee'</a>, <a>grantee_emailAddress</a> - Email
--   address of the grantee.
--   
--   Using email addresses to specify a grantee is only supported in the
--   following Amazon Web Services Regions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>US East (N. Virginia)</li>
--   <li>US West (N. California)</li>
--   <li>US West (Oregon)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Singapore)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Sydney)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Tokyo)</li>
--   <li>Europe (Ireland)</li>
--   <li>South America (São Paulo)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For a list of all the Amazon S3 supported Regions and endpoints, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a> in the Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:Grantee'</a>, <a>grantee_displayName</a> - Screen
--   name of the grantee.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Grantee'</a>, <a>grantee_id</a> - The canonical user ID of
--   the grantee.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Grantee'</a>, <a>grantee_type</a> - Type of grantee
newGrantee :: Type -> Grantee

-- | URI of the grantee group.
grantee_uri :: Lens' Grantee (Maybe Text)

-- | Email address of the grantee.
--   
--   Using email addresses to specify a grantee is only supported in the
--   following Amazon Web Services Regions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>US East (N. Virginia)</li>
--   <li>US West (N. California)</li>
--   <li>US West (Oregon)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Singapore)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Sydney)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Tokyo)</li>
--   <li>Europe (Ireland)</li>
--   <li>South America (São Paulo)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For a list of all the Amazon S3 supported Regions and endpoints, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a> in the Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference.
grantee_emailAddress :: Lens' Grantee (Maybe Text)

-- | Screen name of the grantee.
grantee_displayName :: Lens' Grantee (Maybe Text)

-- | The canonical user ID of the grantee.
grantee_id :: Lens' Grantee (Maybe Text)

-- | Type of grantee
grantee_type :: Lens' Grantee Type
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.Grantee.Grantee
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.Grantee.Grantee
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.Grantee.Grantee
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.Grantee.Grantee
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Grantee.Grantee
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.Grantee.Grantee
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.Grantee.Grantee
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.Grantee.Grantee


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.TargetGrant

-- | Container for granting information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTargetGrant</a> smart constructor.
data TargetGrant
TargetGrant' :: Maybe BucketLogsPermission -> Maybe Grantee -> TargetGrant

-- | Logging permissions assigned to the grantee for the bucket.
[$sel:permission:TargetGrant'] :: TargetGrant -> Maybe BucketLogsPermission

-- | Container for the person being granted permissions.
[$sel:grantee:TargetGrant'] :: TargetGrant -> Maybe Grantee

-- | Create a value of <a>TargetGrant</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:permission:TargetGrant'</a>, <a>targetGrant_permission</a> -
--   Logging permissions assigned to the grantee for the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantee:TargetGrant'</a>, <a>targetGrant_grantee</a> -
--   Container for the person being granted permissions.
newTargetGrant :: TargetGrant

-- | Logging permissions assigned to the grantee for the bucket.
targetGrant_permission :: Lens' TargetGrant (Maybe BucketLogsPermission)

-- | Container for the person being granted permissions.
targetGrant_grantee :: Lens' TargetGrant (Maybe Grantee)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.TargetGrant.TargetGrant
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.TargetGrant.TargetGrant

instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.TargetGrant.TargetGrant


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.LoggingEnabled

-- | Describes where logs are stored and the prefix that Amazon S3 assigns
--   to all log object keys for a bucket. For more information, see <a>PUT
--   Bucket logging</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 API Reference</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoggingEnabled</a> smart constructor.
data LoggingEnabled
LoggingEnabled' :: Maybe [TargetGrant] -> Text -> Text -> LoggingEnabled

-- | Container for granting information.
[$sel:targetGrants:LoggingEnabled'] :: LoggingEnabled -> Maybe [TargetGrant]

-- | Specifies the bucket where you want Amazon S3 to store server access
--   logs. You can have your logs delivered to any bucket that you own,
--   including the same bucket that is being logged. You can also configure
--   multiple buckets to deliver their logs to the same target bucket. In
--   this case, you should choose a different <tt>TargetPrefix</tt> for
--   each source bucket so that the delivered log files can be
--   distinguished by key.
[$sel:targetBucket:LoggingEnabled'] :: LoggingEnabled -> Text

-- | A prefix for all log object keys. If you store log files from multiple
--   Amazon S3 buckets in a single bucket, you can use a prefix to
--   distinguish which log files came from which bucket.
[$sel:targetPrefix:LoggingEnabled'] :: LoggingEnabled -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoggingEnabled</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetGrants:LoggingEnabled'</a>,
--   <a>loggingEnabled_targetGrants</a> - Container for granting
--   information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetBucket:LoggingEnabled'</a>,
--   <a>loggingEnabled_targetBucket</a> - Specifies the bucket where you
--   want Amazon S3 to store server access logs. You can have your logs
--   delivered to any bucket that you own, including the same bucket that
--   is being logged. You can also configure multiple buckets to deliver
--   their logs to the same target bucket. In this case, you should choose
--   a different <tt>TargetPrefix</tt> for each source bucket so that the
--   delivered log files can be distinguished by key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetPrefix:LoggingEnabled'</a>,
--   <a>loggingEnabled_targetPrefix</a> - A prefix for all log object keys.
--   If you store log files from multiple Amazon S3 buckets in a single
--   bucket, you can use a prefix to distinguish which log files came from
--   which bucket.
newLoggingEnabled :: Text -> Text -> LoggingEnabled

-- | Container for granting information.
loggingEnabled_targetGrants :: Lens' LoggingEnabled (Maybe [TargetGrant])

-- | Specifies the bucket where you want Amazon S3 to store server access
--   logs. You can have your logs delivered to any bucket that you own,
--   including the same bucket that is being logged. You can also configure
--   multiple buckets to deliver their logs to the same target bucket. In
--   this case, you should choose a different <tt>TargetPrefix</tt> for
--   each source bucket so that the delivered log files can be
--   distinguished by key.
loggingEnabled_targetBucket :: Lens' LoggingEnabled Text

-- | A prefix for all log object keys. If you store log files from multiple
--   Amazon S3 buckets in a single bucket, you can use a prefix to
--   distinguish which log files came from which bucket.
loggingEnabled_targetPrefix :: Lens' LoggingEnabled Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.LoggingEnabled.LoggingEnabled
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.LoggingEnabled.LoggingEnabled
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.LoggingEnabled.LoggingEnabled
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.LoggingEnabled.LoggingEnabled
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.LoggingEnabled.LoggingEnabled
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.LoggingEnabled.LoggingEnabled
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.LoggingEnabled.LoggingEnabled
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.LoggingEnabled.LoggingEnabled

--   granted permissions.

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.S3Location

-- | Describes an Amazon S3 location that will receive the results of the
--   restore request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Location</a> smart constructor.
data S3Location
S3Location' :: Maybe ObjectCannedACL -> Maybe [Grant] -> Maybe [MetadataEntry] -> Maybe Encryption -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe Tagging -> BucketName -> Text -> S3Location

-- | The canned ACL to apply to the restore results.
[$sel:cannedACL:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe ObjectCannedACL

-- | A list of grants that control access to the staged results.
[$sel:accessControlList:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe [Grant]

-- | A list of metadata to store with the restore results in S3.
[$sel:userMetadata:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe [MetadataEntry]
[$sel:encryption:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe Encryption

-- | The class of storage used to store the restore results.
[$sel:storageClass:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe StorageClass

-- | The tag-set that is applied to the restore results.
[$sel:tagging:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe Tagging

-- | The name of the bucket where the restore results will be placed.
[$sel:bucketName:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> BucketName

-- | The prefix that is prepended to the restore results for this request.
[$sel:prefix:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Location</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cannedACL:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_cannedACL</a> - The
--   canned ACL to apply to the restore results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessControlList:S3Location'</a>,
--   <a>s3Location_accessControlList</a> - A list of grants that control
--   access to the staged results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userMetadata:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_userMetadata</a> -
--   A list of metadata to store with the restore results in S3.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryption:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_encryption</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_storageClass</a> -
--   The class of storage used to store the restore results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagging:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_tagging</a> - The
--   tag-set that is applied to the restore results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_bucketName</a> - The
--   name of the bucket where the restore results will be placed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_prefix</a> - The prefix
--   that is prepended to the restore results for this request.
newS3Location :: BucketName -> Text -> S3Location

-- | The canned ACL to apply to the restore results.
s3Location_cannedACL :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe ObjectCannedACL)

-- | A list of grants that control access to the staged results.
s3Location_accessControlList :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe [Grant])

-- | A list of metadata to store with the restore results in S3.
s3Location_userMetadata :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe [MetadataEntry])

-- | Undocumented member.
s3Location_encryption :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe Encryption)

-- | The class of storage used to store the restore results.
s3Location_storageClass :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | The tag-set that is applied to the restore results.
s3Location_tagging :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe Tagging)

-- | The name of the bucket where the restore results will be placed.
s3Location_bucketName :: Lens' S3Location BucketName

-- | The prefix that is prepended to the restore results for this request.
s3Location_prefix :: Lens' S3Location Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.S3Location.S3Location
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.S3Location.S3Location
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.S3Location.S3Location
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.S3Location.S3Location
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.S3Location.S3Location
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.S3Location.S3Location


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.OutputLocation

data OutputLocation
OutputLocation' :: Maybe S3Location -> OutputLocation

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.RestoreRequest

-- | Container for restore job parameters.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRestoreRequest</a> smart constructor.
data RestoreRequest
RestoreRequest' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe SelectParameters -> Maybe OutputLocation -> Maybe Tier -> Maybe GlacierJobParameters -> Maybe RestoreRequestType -> Maybe Text -> RestoreRequest

-- | Lifetime of the active copy in days. Do not use with restores that
--   specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
--   
--   The Days element is required for regular restores, and must not be
--   provided for select requests.
[$sel:days:RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe Int

-- | Describes the parameters for Select job types.
[$sel:selectParameters:RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe SelectParameters

-- | Describes the location where the restore job's output is stored.
[$sel:outputLocation:RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe OutputLocation

-- | Retrieval tier at which the restore will be processed.
[$sel:tier:RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe Tier

-- | S3 Glacier related parameters pertaining to this job. Do not use with
--   restores that specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
[$sel:glacierJobParameters:RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe GlacierJobParameters

-- | Type of restore request.
[$sel:type':RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe RestoreRequestType

-- | The optional description for the job.
[$sel:description:RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RestoreRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:days:RestoreRequest'</a>, <a>restoreRequest_days</a> -
--   Lifetime of the active copy in days. Do not use with restores that
--   specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
--   
--   The Days element is required for regular restores, and must not be
--   provided for select requests.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectParameters:RestoreRequest'</a>,
--   <a>restoreRequest_selectParameters</a> - Describes the parameters for
--   Select job types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLocation:RestoreRequest'</a>,
--   <a>restoreRequest_outputLocation</a> - Describes the location where
--   the restore job's output is stored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tier:RestoreRequest'</a>, <a>restoreRequest_tier</a> -
--   Retrieval tier at which the restore will be processed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:glacierJobParameters:RestoreRequest'</a>,
--   <a>restoreRequest_glacierJobParameters</a> - S3 Glacier related
--   parameters pertaining to this job. Do not use with restores that
--   specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':RestoreRequest'</a>, <a>restoreRequest_type</a> - Type
--   of restore request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RestoreRequest'</a>,
--   <a>restoreRequest_description</a> - The optional description for the
--   job.
newRestoreRequest :: RestoreRequest

-- | Lifetime of the active copy in days. Do not use with restores that
--   specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
--   
--   The Days element is required for regular restores, and must not be
--   provided for select requests.
restoreRequest_days :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe Int)

-- | Describes the parameters for Select job types.
restoreRequest_selectParameters :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe SelectParameters)

-- | Describes the location where the restore job's output is stored.
restoreRequest_outputLocation :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe OutputLocation)

-- | Retrieval tier at which the restore will be processed.
restoreRequest_tier :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe Tier)

-- | S3 Glacier related parameters pertaining to this job. Do not use with
--   restores that specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
restoreRequest_glacierJobParameters :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe GlacierJobParameters)

-- | Type of restore request.
restoreRequest_type :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe RestoreRequestType)

-- | The optional description for the job.
restoreRequest_description :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.RestoreRequest.RestoreRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.RestoreRequest.RestoreRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.RestoreRequest.RestoreRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.RestoreRequest.RestoreRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.RestoreRequest.RestoreRequest
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.RestoreRequest.RestoreRequest


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccessControlPolicy

-- | Contains the elements that set the ACL permissions for an object per
--   grantee.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessControlPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data AccessControlPolicy
AccessControlPolicy' :: Maybe [Grant] -> Maybe Owner -> AccessControlPolicy

-- | A list of grants.
[$sel:grants:AccessControlPolicy'] :: AccessControlPolicy -> Maybe [Grant]

-- | Container for the bucket owner's display name and ID.
[$sel:owner:AccessControlPolicy'] :: AccessControlPolicy -> Maybe Owner

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessControlPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:grants:AccessControlPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>accessControlPolicy_grants</a> - A list of grants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:AccessControlPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>accessControlPolicy_owner</a> - Container for the bucket owner's
--   display name and ID.
newAccessControlPolicy :: AccessControlPolicy

-- | A list of grants.
accessControlPolicy_grants :: Lens' AccessControlPolicy (Maybe [Grant])

-- | Container for the bucket owner's display name and ID.
accessControlPolicy_owner :: Lens' AccessControlPolicy (Maybe Owner)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccessControlPolicy.AccessControlPolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccessControlPolicy.AccessControlPolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccessControlPolicy.AccessControlPolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccessControlPolicy.AccessControlPolicy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccessControlPolicy.AccessControlPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccessControlPolicy.AccessControlPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.AccessControlPolicy.AccessControlPolicy


module Network.AWS.S3.Types.VersioningConfiguration

-- | Describes the versioning state of an Amazon S3 bucket. For more
--   information, see <a>PUT Bucket versioning</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 API
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVersioningConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data VersioningConfiguration
VersioningConfiguration' :: Maybe BucketVersioningStatus -> Maybe MFADelete -> VersioningConfiguration

-- | The versioning state of the bucket.
[$sel:status:VersioningConfiguration'] :: VersioningConfiguration -> Maybe BucketVersioningStatus

-- | Specifies whether MFA delete is enabled in the bucket versioning
--   configuration. This element is only returned if the bucket has been
--   configured with MFA delete. If the bucket has never been so
--   configured, this element is not returned.
[$sel:mfaDelete:VersioningConfiguration'] :: VersioningConfiguration -> Maybe MFADelete

-- | Create a value of <a>VersioningConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:VersioningConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>versioningConfiguration_status</a> - The versioning state of the
--   bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mfaDelete:VersioningConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>versioningConfiguration_mfaDelete</a> - Specifies whether MFA
--   delete is enabled in the bucket versioning configuration. This element
--   is only returned if the bucket has been configured with MFA delete. If
--   the bucket has never been so configured, this element is not returned.
newVersioningConfiguration :: VersioningConfiguration

-- | The versioning state of the bucket.
versioningConfiguration_status :: Lens' VersioningConfiguration (Maybe BucketVersioningStatus)

-- | Specifies whether MFA delete is enabled in the bucket versioning
--   configuration. This element is only returned if the bucket has been
--   configured with MFA delete. If the bucket has never been so
--   configured, this element is not returned.
versioningConfiguration_mfaDelete :: Lens' VersioningConfiguration (Maybe MFADelete)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.VersioningConfiguration.VersioningConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.VersioningConfiguration.VersioningConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.VersioningConfiguration.VersioningConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.VersioningConfiguration.VersioningConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.VersioningConfiguration.VersioningConfiguration

module Network.AWS.S3.Types.WebsiteConfiguration

-- | Specifies website configuration parameters for an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWebsiteConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data WebsiteConfiguration
WebsiteConfiguration' :: Maybe RedirectAllRequestsTo -> Maybe ErrorDocument -> Maybe IndexDocument -> Maybe [RoutingRule] -> WebsiteConfiguration

-- | The redirect behavior for every request to this bucket's website
--   endpoint.
--   
--   If you specify this property, you can't specify any other property.
[$sel:redirectAllRequestsTo:WebsiteConfiguration'] :: WebsiteConfiguration -> Maybe RedirectAllRequestsTo

-- | The name of the error document for the website.
[$sel:errorDocument:WebsiteConfiguration'] :: WebsiteConfiguration -> Maybe ErrorDocument

-- | The name of the index document for the website.
[$sel:indexDocument:WebsiteConfiguration'] :: WebsiteConfiguration -> Maybe IndexDocument

-- | Rules that define when a redirect is applied and the redirect
--   behavior.
[$sel:routingRules:WebsiteConfiguration'] :: WebsiteConfiguration -> Maybe [RoutingRule]

-- | Create a value of <a>WebsiteConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:redirectAllRequestsTo:WebsiteConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>websiteConfiguration_redirectAllRequestsTo</a> - The redirect
--   behavior for every request to this bucket's website endpoint.
--   
--   If you specify this property, you can't specify any other property.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errorDocument:WebsiteConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>websiteConfiguration_errorDocument</a> - The name of the error
--   document for the website.
--   
--   <a>$sel:indexDocument:WebsiteConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>websiteConfiguration_indexDocument</a> - The name of the index
--   document for the website.
--   
--   <a>$sel:routingRules:WebsiteConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>websiteConfiguration_routingRules</a> - Rules that define when a
--   redirect is applied and the redirect behavior.
newWebsiteConfiguration :: WebsiteConfiguration

-- | The redirect behavior for every request to this bucket's website
--   endpoint.
--   
--   If you specify this property, you can't specify any other property.
websiteConfiguration_redirectAllRequestsTo :: Lens' WebsiteConfiguration (Maybe RedirectAllRequestsTo)

-- | The name of the error document for the website.
websiteConfiguration_errorDocument :: Lens' WebsiteConfiguration (Maybe ErrorDocument)

-- | The name of the index document for the website.
websiteConfiguration_indexDocument :: Lens' WebsiteConfiguration (Maybe IndexDocument)

-- | Rules that define when a redirect is applied and the redirect
--   behavior.
websiteConfiguration_routingRules :: Lens' WebsiteConfiguration (Maybe [RoutingRule])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.Types.WebsiteConfiguration.WebsiteConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.Types.WebsiteConfiguration.WebsiteConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.Types.WebsiteConfiguration.WebsiteConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.Types.WebsiteConfiguration.WebsiteConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.Types.WebsiteConfiguration.WebsiteConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.Types.WebsiteConfiguration.WebsiteConfiguration
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.S3.Types.WebsiteConfiguration.WebsiteConfiguration


module Network.AWS.S3.Types

-- | API version <tt>2006-03-01</tt> of the Amazon Simple Storage Service
--   SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The bucket you tried to create already exists, and you own it. Amazon
--   S3 returns this error in all Amazon Web Services Regions except in the
--   North Virginia Region. For legacy compatibility, if you re-create an
--   existing bucket that you already own in the North Virginia Region,
--   Amazon S3 returns 200 OK and resets the bucket access control lists
--   (ACLs).
_BucketAlreadyOwnedByYou :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | This action is not allowed against this storage tier.
_ObjectAlreadyInActiveTierError :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested bucket name is not available. The bucket namespace is
--   shared by all users of the system. Select a different name and try
--   again.
_BucketAlreadyExists :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The source object of the COPY action is not in the active tier and is
--   only stored in Amazon S3 Glacier.
_ObjectNotInActiveTierError :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified multipart upload does not exist.
_NoSuchUpload :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified bucket does not exist.
_NoSuchBucket :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified key does not exist.
_NoSuchKey :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Object is archived and inaccessible until restored.
_InvalidObjectState :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Requests Amazon S3 to encode the object keys in the response and
--   specifies the encoding method to use. An object key may contain any
--   Unicode character; however, XML 1.0 parser cannot parse some
--   characters, such as characters with an ASCII value from 0 to 10. For
--   characters that are not supported in XML 1.0, you can add this
--   parameter to request that Amazon S3 encode the keys in the response.

-- | The container element for object ownership for a bucket's ownership
--   controls.
--   
--   BucketOwnerPreferred - Objects uploaded to the bucket change ownership
--   to the bucket owner if the objects are uploaded with the
--   <tt>bucket-owner-full-control</tt> canned ACL.

--   is uploaded with the <tt>bucket-owner-full-control</tt> canned ACL.

-- | Specifies the days since the initiation of an incomplete multipart
--   upload that Amazon S3 will wait before permanently removing all parts
--   of the upload. For more information, see <a>Aborting Incomplete
--   Multipart Uploads Using a Bucket Lifecycle Policy</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAbortIncompleteMultipartUpload</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload
AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload' :: Maybe Int -> AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload

-- | Specifies the number of days after which Amazon S3 aborts an
--   incomplete multipart upload.
[$sel:daysAfterInitiation:AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload'] :: AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:daysAfterInitiation:AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>abortIncompleteMultipartUpload_daysAfterInitiation</a> - Specifies
--   the number of days after which Amazon S3 aborts an incomplete
--   multipart upload.
newAbortIncompleteMultipartUpload :: AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload

-- | Specifies the number of days after which Amazon S3 aborts an
--   incomplete multipart upload.
abortIncompleteMultipartUpload_daysAfterInitiation :: Lens' AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload (Maybe Int)

-- | Configures the transfer acceleration state for an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon S3 Transfer Acceleration</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccelerateConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data AccelerateConfiguration
AccelerateConfiguration' :: Maybe BucketAccelerateStatus -> AccelerateConfiguration

-- | Specifies the transfer acceleration status of the bucket.
[$sel:status:AccelerateConfiguration'] :: AccelerateConfiguration -> Maybe BucketAccelerateStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>AccelerateConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AccelerateConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>accelerateConfiguration_status</a> - Specifies the transfer
--   acceleration status of the bucket.
newAccelerateConfiguration :: AccelerateConfiguration

-- | Specifies the transfer acceleration status of the bucket.
accelerateConfiguration_status :: Lens' AccelerateConfiguration (Maybe BucketAccelerateStatus)

-- | Contains the elements that set the ACL permissions for an object per
--   grantee.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessControlPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data AccessControlPolicy
AccessControlPolicy' :: Maybe [Grant] -> Maybe Owner -> AccessControlPolicy

-- | A list of grants.
[$sel:grants:AccessControlPolicy'] :: AccessControlPolicy -> Maybe [Grant]

-- | Container for the bucket owner's display name and ID.
[$sel:owner:AccessControlPolicy'] :: AccessControlPolicy -> Maybe Owner

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessControlPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>accessControlPolicy_grants</a> - A list of grants.
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:AccessControlPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>accessControlPolicy_owner</a> - Container for the bucket owner's
--   display name and ID.
newAccessControlPolicy :: AccessControlPolicy

-- | A list of grants.
accessControlPolicy_grants :: Lens' AccessControlPolicy (Maybe [Grant])

-- | Container for the bucket owner's display name and ID.
accessControlPolicy_owner :: Lens' AccessControlPolicy (Maybe Owner)

-- | A container for information about access control for replicas.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessControlTranslation</a> smart constructor.
data AccessControlTranslation
AccessControlTranslation' :: OwnerOverride -> AccessControlTranslation

-- | Specifies the replica ownership. For default and valid values, see
--   <a>PUT bucket replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 API Reference</i>.
[$sel:owner:AccessControlTranslation'] :: AccessControlTranslation -> OwnerOverride

--   replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 API Reference</i>.
newAccessControlTranslation :: OwnerOverride -> AccessControlTranslation

--   <a>PUT bucket replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 API Reference</i>.
accessControlTranslation_owner :: Lens' AccessControlTranslation OwnerOverride

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates in
--   any combination, and an object must match all of the predicates for
--   the filter to apply.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnalyticsAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data AnalyticsAndOperator
AnalyticsAndOperator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> AnalyticsAndOperator

-- | The prefix to use when evaluating an AND predicate: The prefix that an
--   object must have to be included in the metrics results.
[$sel:prefix:AnalyticsAndOperator'] :: AnalyticsAndOperator -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags to use when evaluating an AND predicate.
[$sel:tags:AnalyticsAndOperator'] :: AnalyticsAndOperator -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>AnalyticsAndOperator</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:AnalyticsAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsAndOperator_prefix</a> - The prefix to use when evaluating
--   an AND predicate: The prefix that an object must have to be included
--   in the metrics results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:AnalyticsAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsAndOperator_tags</a> - The list of tags to use when
--   evaluating an AND predicate.
newAnalyticsAndOperator :: AnalyticsAndOperator

-- | The prefix to use when evaluating an AND predicate: The prefix that an
--   object must have to be included in the metrics results.
analyticsAndOperator_prefix :: Lens' AnalyticsAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags to use when evaluating an AND predicate.
analyticsAndOperator_tags :: Lens' AnalyticsAndOperator (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Specifies the configuration and any analyses for the analytics filter
--   of an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnalyticsConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data AnalyticsConfiguration
AnalyticsConfiguration' :: Maybe AnalyticsFilter -> Text -> StorageClassAnalysis -> AnalyticsConfiguration

-- | The filter used to describe a set of objects for analyses. A filter
--   must have exactly one prefix, one tag, or one conjunction
--   (AnalyticsAndOperator). If no filter is provided, all objects will be
--   considered in any analysis.
[$sel:filter':AnalyticsConfiguration'] :: AnalyticsConfiguration -> Maybe AnalyticsFilter

-- | The ID that identifies the analytics configuration.
[$sel:id:AnalyticsConfiguration'] :: AnalyticsConfiguration -> Text

-- | Contains data related to access patterns to be collected and made
--   available to analyze the tradeoffs between different storage classes.
[$sel:storageClassAnalysis:AnalyticsConfiguration'] :: AnalyticsConfiguration -> StorageClassAnalysis

-- | Create a value of <a>AnalyticsConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':AnalyticsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsConfiguration_filter</a> - The filter used to describe a
--   set of objects for analyses. A filter must have exactly one prefix,
--   one tag, or one conjunction (AnalyticsAndOperator). If no filter is
--   provided, all objects will be considered in any analysis.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:AnalyticsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsConfiguration_id</a> - The ID that identifies the
--   analytics configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClassAnalysis:AnalyticsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsConfiguration_storageClassAnalysis</a> - Contains data
--   related to access patterns to be collected and made available to
--   analyze the tradeoffs between different storage classes.
newAnalyticsConfiguration :: Text -> StorageClassAnalysis -> AnalyticsConfiguration

-- | The filter used to describe a set of objects for analyses. A filter
--   must have exactly one prefix, one tag, or one conjunction
--   (AnalyticsAndOperator). If no filter is provided, all objects will be
--   considered in any analysis.

-- | Contains information about where to publish the analytics results.

data AnalyticsS3BucketDestination

-- | The account ID that owns the destination S3 bucket. If no account ID
--   is provided, the owner is not validated before exporting data.

--   to help prevent problems if the destination bucket ownership changes.
