-- | Container for the person being granted permissions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGrantee</a> smart constructor.
data Grantee
Grantee' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Type -> Grantee

-- | URI of the grantee group.
[$sel:uri:Grantee'] :: Grantee -> Maybe Text

-- | Email address of the grantee.
--   
--   Using email addresses to specify a grantee is only supported in the
--   following Amazon Web Services Regions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>US East (N. Virginia)</li>
--   <li>US West (N. California)</li>
--   <li>US West (Oregon)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Singapore)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Sydney)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Tokyo)</li>
--   <li>Europe (Ireland)</li>
--   <li>South America (São Paulo)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For a list of all the Amazon S3 supported Regions and endpoints, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a> in the Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference.
[$sel:emailAddress:Grantee'] :: Grantee -> Maybe Text

-- | Screen name of the grantee.
[$sel:displayName:Grantee'] :: Grantee -> Maybe Text

-- | The canonical user ID of the grantee.
[$sel:id:Grantee'] :: Grantee -> Maybe Text

-- | Type of grantee
[$sel:type':Grantee'] :: Grantee -> Type

-- | Create a value of <a>Grantee</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:uri:Grantee'</a>, <a>grantee_uri</a> - URI of the grantee
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailAddress:Grantee'</a>, <a>grantee_emailAddress</a> - Email
--   address of the grantee.
--   
--   Using email addresses to specify a grantee is only supported in the
--   following Amazon Web Services Regions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>US East (N. Virginia)</li>
--   <li>US West (N. California)</li>
--   <li>US West (Oregon)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Singapore)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Sydney)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Tokyo)</li>
--   <li>Europe (Ireland)</li>
--   <li>South America (São Paulo)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For a list of all the Amazon S3 supported Regions and endpoints, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a> in the Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference.
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:Grantee'</a>, <a>grantee_displayName</a> - Screen
--   name of the grantee.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Grantee'</a>, <a>grantee_id</a> - The canonical user ID of
--   the grantee.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Grantee'</a>, <a>grantee_type</a> - Type of grantee
newGrantee :: Type -> Grantee

-- | URI of the grantee group.
grantee_uri :: Lens' Grantee (Maybe Text)

-- | Email address of the grantee.
--   
--   Using email addresses to specify a grantee is only supported in the
--   following Amazon Web Services Regions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>US East (N. Virginia)</li>
--   <li>US West (N. California)</li>
--   <li>US West (Oregon)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Singapore)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Sydney)</li>
--   <li>Asia Pacific (Tokyo)</li>
--   <li>Europe (Ireland)</li>
--   <li>South America (São Paulo)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For a list of all the Amazon S3 supported Regions and endpoints, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a> in the Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference.
grantee_emailAddress :: Lens' Grantee (Maybe Text)

-- | Screen name of the grantee.
grantee_displayName :: Lens' Grantee (Maybe Text)

-- | The canonical user ID of the grantee.
grantee_id :: Lens' Grantee (Maybe Text)

-- | Type of grantee
grantee_type :: Lens' Grantee Type

-- | Container for the <tt>Suffix</tt> element.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIndexDocument</a> smart constructor.
data IndexDocument
IndexDocument' :: Text -> IndexDocument

-- | A suffix that is appended to a request that is for a directory on the
--   website endpoint (for example,if the suffix is index.html and you make
--   a request to samplebucket/images/ the data that is returned will be
--   for the object with the key name images/index.html) The suffix must
--   not be empty and must not include a slash character.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:suffix:IndexDocument'] :: IndexDocument -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IndexDocument</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:suffix:IndexDocument'</a>, <a>indexDocument_suffix</a> - A
--   suffix that is appended to a request that is for a directory on the
--   website endpoint (for example,if the suffix is index.html and you make
--   a request to samplebucket/images/ the data that is returned will be
--   for the object with the key name images/index.html) The suffix must
--   not be empty and must not include a slash character.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
newIndexDocument :: Text -> IndexDocument

-- | A suffix that is appended to a request that is for a directory on the
--   website endpoint (for example,if the suffix is index.html and you make
--   a request to samplebucket/images/ the data that is returned will be
--   for the object with the key name images/index.html) The suffix must
--   not be empty and must not include a slash character.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
indexDocument_suffix :: Lens' IndexDocument Text

-- | Container element that identifies who initiated the multipart upload.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInitiator</a> smart constructor.
data Initiator
Initiator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Initiator

-- | Name of the Principal.
[$sel:displayName:Initiator'] :: Initiator -> Maybe Text

-- | If the principal is an Amazon Web Services account, it provides the
--   Canonical User ID. If the principal is an IAM User, it provides a user
--   ARN value.
[$sel:id:Initiator'] :: Initiator -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Initiator</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayName:Initiator'</a>, <a>initiator_displayName</a> -
--   Name of the Principal.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Initiator'</a>, <a>initiator_id</a> - If the principal is
--   an Amazon Web Services account, it provides the Canonical User ID. If
--   the principal is an IAM User, it provides a user ARN value.
newInitiator :: Initiator

-- | Name of the Principal.
initiator_displayName :: Lens' Initiator (Maybe Text)

-- | If the principal is an Amazon Web Services account, it provides the
--   Canonical User ID. If the principal is an IAM User, it provides a user
--   ARN value.
initiator_id :: Lens' Initiator (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the serialization format of the object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSerialization</a> smart constructor.
data InputSerialization
InputSerialization' :: Maybe JSONInput -> Maybe CSVInput -> Maybe ParquetInput -> Maybe CompressionType -> InputSerialization

-- | Specifies JSON as object's input serialization format.
[$sel:json:InputSerialization'] :: InputSerialization -> Maybe JSONInput

-- | Describes the serialization of a CSV-encoded object.
[$sel:csv:InputSerialization'] :: InputSerialization -> Maybe CSVInput

-- | Specifies Parquet as object's input serialization format.
[$sel:parquet:InputSerialization'] :: InputSerialization -> Maybe ParquetInput

-- | Specifies object's compression format. Valid values: NONE, GZIP,
--   BZIP2. Default Value: NONE.
[$sel:compressionType:InputSerialization'] :: InputSerialization -> Maybe CompressionType

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSerialization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:json:InputSerialization'</a>, <a>inputSerialization_json</a> -
--   Specifies JSON as object's input serialization format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:csv:InputSerialization'</a>, <a>inputSerialization_csv</a> -
--   Describes the serialization of a CSV-encoded object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parquet:InputSerialization'</a>,
--   <a>inputSerialization_parquet</a> - Specifies Parquet as object's
--   input serialization format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:compressionType:InputSerialization'</a>,
--   <a>inputSerialization_compressionType</a> - Specifies object's
--   compression format. Valid values: NONE, GZIP, BZIP2. Default Value:
--   NONE.
newInputSerialization :: InputSerialization

-- | Specifies JSON as object's input serialization format.
inputSerialization_json :: Lens' InputSerialization (Maybe JSONInput)

-- | Describes the serialization of a CSV-encoded object.
inputSerialization_csv :: Lens' InputSerialization (Maybe CSVInput)

-- | Specifies Parquet as object's input serialization format.
inputSerialization_parquet :: Lens' InputSerialization (Maybe ParquetInput)

-- | Specifies object's compression format. Valid values: NONE, GZIP,
--   BZIP2. Default Value: NONE.
inputSerialization_compressionType :: Lens' InputSerialization (Maybe CompressionType)

-- | A container for specifying S3 Intelligent-Tiering filters. The filters
--   determine the subset of objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIntelligentTieringAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data IntelligentTieringAndOperator
IntelligentTieringAndOperator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> IntelligentTieringAndOperator

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the configuration applies.
[$sel:prefix:IntelligentTieringAndOperator'] :: IntelligentTieringAndOperator -> Maybe Text

-- | All of these tags must exist in the object's tag set in order for the
--   configuration to apply.
[$sel:tags:IntelligentTieringAndOperator'] :: IntelligentTieringAndOperator -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>IntelligentTieringAndOperator</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:IntelligentTieringAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringAndOperator_prefix</a> - An object key name
--   prefix that identifies the subset of objects to which the
--   configuration applies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:IntelligentTieringAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringAndOperator_tags</a> - All of these tags must
--   exist in the object's tag set in order for the configuration to apply.
newIntelligentTieringAndOperator :: IntelligentTieringAndOperator

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the configuration applies.
intelligentTieringAndOperator_prefix :: Lens' IntelligentTieringAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | All of these tags must exist in the object's tag set in order for the
--   configuration to apply.
intelligentTieringAndOperator_tags :: Lens' IntelligentTieringAndOperator (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Specifies the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration for an Amazon S3
--   bucket.
--   
--   For information about the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class, see
--   <a>Storage class for automatically optimizing frequently and
--   infrequently accessed objects</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIntelligentTieringConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data IntelligentTieringConfiguration
IntelligentTieringConfiguration' :: Maybe IntelligentTieringFilter -> Text -> IntelligentTieringStatus -> [Tiering] -> IntelligentTieringConfiguration

-- | Specifies a bucket filter. The configuration only includes objects
--   that meet the filter's criteria.
[$sel:filter':IntelligentTieringConfiguration'] :: IntelligentTieringConfiguration -> Maybe IntelligentTieringFilter

-- | The ID used to identify the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration.
[$sel:id:IntelligentTieringConfiguration'] :: IntelligentTieringConfiguration -> Text

-- | Specifies the status of the configuration.
[$sel:status:IntelligentTieringConfiguration'] :: IntelligentTieringConfiguration -> IntelligentTieringStatus

-- | Specifies the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class tier of the
--   configuration.
[$sel:tierings:IntelligentTieringConfiguration'] :: IntelligentTieringConfiguration -> [Tiering]

-- | Create a value of <a>IntelligentTieringConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':IntelligentTieringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringConfiguration_filter</a> - Specifies a bucket
--   filter. The configuration only includes objects that meet the filter's
--   criteria.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:IntelligentTieringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringConfiguration_id</a> - The ID used to identify
--   the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:IntelligentTieringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringConfiguration_status</a> - Specifies the status
--   of the configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tierings:IntelligentTieringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringConfiguration_tierings</a> - Specifies the S3
--   Intelligent-Tiering storage class tier of the configuration.
newIntelligentTieringConfiguration :: Text -> IntelligentTieringStatus -> IntelligentTieringConfiguration

-- | Specifies a bucket filter. The configuration only includes objects
--   that meet the filter's criteria.
intelligentTieringConfiguration_filter :: Lens' IntelligentTieringConfiguration (Maybe IntelligentTieringFilter)

-- | The ID used to identify the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration.
intelligentTieringConfiguration_id :: Lens' IntelligentTieringConfiguration Text

-- | Specifies the status of the configuration.
intelligentTieringConfiguration_status :: Lens' IntelligentTieringConfiguration IntelligentTieringStatus

-- | Specifies the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class tier of the
--   configuration.
intelligentTieringConfiguration_tierings :: Lens' IntelligentTieringConfiguration [Tiering]

-- | The <tt>Filter</tt> is used to identify objects that the S3
--   Intelligent-Tiering configuration applies to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIntelligentTieringFilter</a> smart constructor.
data IntelligentTieringFilter
IntelligentTieringFilter' :: Maybe Tag -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IntelligentTieringAndOperator -> IntelligentTieringFilter
[$sel:tag:IntelligentTieringFilter'] :: IntelligentTieringFilter -> Maybe Tag

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:prefix:IntelligentTieringFilter'] :: IntelligentTieringFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and
--   an object must match all of the predicates in order for the filter to
--   apply.
[$sel:and:IntelligentTieringFilter'] :: IntelligentTieringFilter -> Maybe IntelligentTieringAndOperator

-- | Create a value of <a>IntelligentTieringFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tag:IntelligentTieringFilter'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringFilter_tag</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:IntelligentTieringFilter'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringFilter_prefix</a> - An object key name prefix
--   that identifies the subset of objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:IntelligentTieringFilter'</a>,
--   <a>intelligentTieringFilter_and</a> - A conjunction (logical AND) of
--   predicates, which is used in evaluating a metrics filter. The operator
--   must have at least two predicates, and an object must match all of the
--   predicates in order for the filter to apply.
newIntelligentTieringFilter :: IntelligentTieringFilter

-- | Undocumented member.
intelligentTieringFilter_tag :: Lens' IntelligentTieringFilter (Maybe Tag)

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
intelligentTieringFilter_prefix :: Lens' IntelligentTieringFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and
--   an object must match all of the predicates in order for the filter to
--   apply.
intelligentTieringFilter_and :: Lens' IntelligentTieringFilter (Maybe IntelligentTieringAndOperator)

-- | Specifies the inventory configuration for an Amazon S3 bucket. For
--   more information, see <a>GET Bucket inventory</a> in the <i>Amazon S3
--   API Reference</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInventoryConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data InventoryConfiguration
InventoryConfiguration' :: Maybe [InventoryOptionalField] -> Maybe InventoryFilter -> InventoryDestination -> Bool -> Text -> InventoryIncludedObjectVersions -> InventorySchedule -> InventoryConfiguration

-- | Contains the optional fields that are included in the inventory
--   results.
[$sel:optionalFields:InventoryConfiguration'] :: InventoryConfiguration -> Maybe [InventoryOptionalField]

-- | Specifies an inventory filter. The inventory only includes objects
--   that meet the filter's criteria.
[$sel:filter':InventoryConfiguration'] :: InventoryConfiguration -> Maybe InventoryFilter

-- | Contains information about where to publish the inventory results.
[$sel:destination:InventoryConfiguration'] :: InventoryConfiguration -> InventoryDestination

-- | Specifies whether the inventory is enabled or disabled. If set to
--   <tt>True</tt>, an inventory list is generated. If set to
--   <tt>False</tt>, no inventory list is generated.
[$sel:isEnabled:InventoryConfiguration'] :: InventoryConfiguration -> Bool

-- | The ID used to identify the inventory configuration.
[$sel:id:InventoryConfiguration'] :: InventoryConfiguration -> Text

-- | Object versions to include in the inventory list. If set to
--   <tt>All</tt>, the list includes all the object versions, which adds
--   the version-related fields <tt>VersionId</tt>, <tt>IsLatest</tt>, and
--   <tt>DeleteMarker</tt> to the list. If set to <tt>Current</tt>, the
--   list does not contain these version-related fields.
[$sel:includedObjectVersions:InventoryConfiguration'] :: InventoryConfiguration -> InventoryIncludedObjectVersions

-- | Specifies the schedule for generating inventory results.
[$sel:schedule:InventoryConfiguration'] :: InventoryConfiguration -> InventorySchedule

-- | Create a value of <a>InventoryConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:optionalFields:InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_optionalFields</a> - Contains the optional
--   fields that are included in the inventory results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_filter</a> - Specifies an inventory filter.
--   The inventory only includes objects that meet the filter's criteria.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_destination</a> - Contains information about
--   where to publish the inventory results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isEnabled:InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_isEnabled</a> - Specifies whether the
--   inventory is enabled or disabled. If set to <tt>True</tt>, an
--   inventory list is generated. If set to <tt>False</tt>, no inventory
--   list is generated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_id</a> - The ID used to identify the
--   inventory configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includedObjectVersions:InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_includedObjectVersions</a> - Object versions
--   to include in the inventory list. If set to <tt>All</tt>, the list
--   includes all the object versions, which adds the version-related
--   fields <tt>VersionId</tt>, <tt>IsLatest</tt>, and
--   <tt>DeleteMarker</tt> to the list. If set to <tt>Current</tt>, the
--   list does not contain these version-related fields.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_schedule</a> - Specifies the schedule for
--   generating inventory results.
newInventoryConfiguration :: InventoryDestination -> Bool -> Text -> InventoryIncludedObjectVersions -> InventorySchedule -> InventoryConfiguration

-- | Contains the optional fields that are included in the inventory
--   results.
inventoryConfiguration_optionalFields :: Lens' InventoryConfiguration (Maybe [InventoryOptionalField])

-- | Specifies an inventory filter. The inventory only includes objects
--   that meet the filter's criteria.
inventoryConfiguration_filter :: Lens' InventoryConfiguration (Maybe InventoryFilter)

-- | Contains information about where to publish the inventory results.
inventoryConfiguration_destination :: Lens' InventoryConfiguration InventoryDestination

-- | Specifies whether the inventory is enabled or disabled. If set to
--   <tt>True</tt>, an inventory list is generated. If set to
--   <tt>False</tt>, no inventory list is generated.
inventoryConfiguration_isEnabled :: Lens' InventoryConfiguration Bool

-- | The ID used to identify the inventory configuration.
inventoryConfiguration_id :: Lens' InventoryConfiguration Text

-- | Object versions to include in the inventory list. If set to
--   <tt>All</tt>, the list includes all the object versions, which adds
--   the version-related fields <tt>VersionId</tt>, <tt>IsLatest</tt>, and
--   <tt>DeleteMarker</tt> to the list. If set to <tt>Current</tt>, the
--   list does not contain these version-related fields.
inventoryConfiguration_includedObjectVersions :: Lens' InventoryConfiguration InventoryIncludedObjectVersions

-- | Specifies the schedule for generating inventory results.
inventoryConfiguration_schedule :: Lens' InventoryConfiguration InventorySchedule

data InventoryDestination

data InventoryEncryption

--   encrypt delivered inventory reports.

--   <a>$sel:ssekms:InventoryEncryption'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryEncryption_ssekms</a> - Specifies the use of SSE-KMS to
--   encrypt delivered inventory reports.
newInventoryEncryption :: InventoryEncryption

-- | Specifies an inventory filter. The inventory only includes objects
--   that meet the filter's criteria.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInventoryFilter</a> smart constructor.
data InventoryFilter
InventoryFilter' :: Text -> InventoryFilter

-- | The prefix that an object must have to be included in the inventory
--   results.
[$sel:prefix:InventoryFilter'] :: InventoryFilter -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InventoryFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   The prefix that an object must have to be included in the inventory
--   results.
newInventoryFilter :: Text -> InventoryFilter

-- | The prefix that an object must have to be included in the inventory
--   results.
inventoryFilter_prefix :: Lens' InventoryFilter Text

-- | Contains the bucket name, file format, bucket owner (optional), and
--   prefix (optional) where inventory results are published.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInventoryS3BucketDestination</a> smart constructor.
data InventoryS3BucketDestination
InventoryS3BucketDestination' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InventoryEncryption -> BucketName -> InventoryFormat -> InventoryS3BucketDestination

-- | The prefix that is prepended to all inventory results.
[$sel:prefix:InventoryS3BucketDestination'] :: InventoryS3BucketDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID that owns the destination S3 bucket. If no account ID
--   is provided, the owner is not validated before exporting data.
--   
--   Although this value is optional, we strongly recommend that you set it
--   to help prevent problems if the destination bucket ownership changes.
[$sel:accountId:InventoryS3BucketDestination'] :: InventoryS3BucketDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains the type of server-side encryption used to encrypt the
--   inventory results.
[$sel:encryption:InventoryS3BucketDestination'] :: InventoryS3BucketDestination -> Maybe InventoryEncryption

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket where inventory results
--   will be published.
[$sel:bucket:InventoryS3BucketDestination'] :: InventoryS3BucketDestination -> BucketName

-- | Specifies the output format of the inventory results.
[$sel:format:InventoryS3BucketDestination'] :: InventoryS3BucketDestination -> InventoryFormat

-- | Create a value of <a>InventoryS3BucketDestination</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:InventoryS3BucketDestination'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryS3BucketDestination_prefix</a> - The prefix that is
--   prepended to all inventory results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:InventoryS3BucketDestination'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryS3BucketDestination_accountId</a> - The account ID that
--   owns the destination S3 bucket. If no account ID is provided, the
--   owner is not validated before exporting data.
--   
--   Although this value is optional, we strongly recommend that you set it
--   to help prevent problems if the destination bucket ownership changes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryption:InventoryS3BucketDestination'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryS3BucketDestination_encryption</a> - Contains the type of
--   server-side encryption used to encrypt the inventory results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:InventoryS3BucketDestination'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryS3BucketDestination_bucket</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the bucket where inventory results will be published.
--   
--   <a>$sel:format:InventoryS3BucketDestination'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryS3BucketDestination_format</a> - Specifies the output
--   format of the inventory results.
newInventoryS3BucketDestination :: BucketName -> InventoryFormat -> InventoryS3BucketDestination

-- | The prefix that is prepended to all inventory results.
inventoryS3BucketDestination_prefix :: Lens' InventoryS3BucketDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | The account ID that owns the destination S3 bucket. If no account ID
--   is provided, the owner is not validated before exporting data.
--   
--   Although this value is optional, we strongly recommend that you set it
--   to help prevent problems if the destination bucket ownership changes.
inventoryS3BucketDestination_accountId :: Lens' InventoryS3BucketDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the type of server-side encryption used to encrypt the
--   inventory results.
inventoryS3BucketDestination_encryption :: Lens' InventoryS3BucketDestination (Maybe InventoryEncryption)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket where inventory results
--   will be published.
inventoryS3BucketDestination_bucket :: Lens' InventoryS3BucketDestination BucketName

-- | Specifies the output format of the inventory results.
inventoryS3BucketDestination_format :: Lens' InventoryS3BucketDestination InventoryFormat

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInventorySchedule</a> smart constructor.
data InventorySchedule

-- | Specifies how frequently inventory results are produced.
[$sel:frequency:InventorySchedule'] :: InventorySchedule -> InventoryFrequency

-- | Create a value of <a>InventorySchedule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   fields.

inventorySchedule_frequency :: Lens' InventorySchedule InventoryFrequency

-- | Container for the expiration for the lifecycle of the object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycleExpiration</a> smart constructor.
data LifecycleExpiration
LifecycleExpiration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Bool -> LifecycleExpiration

-- | Indicates the lifetime, in days, of the objects that are subject to
--   the rule. The value must be a non-zero positive integer.
[$sel:days:LifecycleExpiration'] :: LifecycleExpiration -> Maybe Int

-- | Indicates at what date the object is to be moved or deleted. Should be
--   in GMT ISO 8601 Format.
[$sel:date:LifecycleExpiration'] :: LifecycleExpiration -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Indicates whether Amazon S3 will remove a delete marker with no
--   noncurrent versions. If set to true, the delete marker will be
--   expired; if set to false the policy takes no action. This cannot be
--   specified with Days or Date in a Lifecycle Expiration Policy.
[$sel:expiredObjectDeleteMarker:LifecycleExpiration'] :: LifecycleExpiration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>LifecycleExpiration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:days:LifecycleExpiration'</a>, <a>lifecycleExpiration_days</a>
--   - Indicates the lifetime, in days, of the objects that are subject to
--   the rule. The value must be a non-zero positive integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:date:LifecycleExpiration'</a>, <a>lifecycleExpiration_date</a>
--   - Indicates at what date the object is to be moved or deleted. Should
--   be in GMT ISO 8601 Format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiredObjectDeleteMarker:LifecycleExpiration'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleExpiration_expiredObjectDeleteMarker</a> - Indicates
--   whether Amazon S3 will remove a delete marker with no noncurrent
--   versions. If set to true, the delete marker will be expired; if set to
--   false the policy takes no action. This cannot be specified with Days
--   or Date in a Lifecycle Expiration Policy.
newLifecycleExpiration :: LifecycleExpiration

-- | Indicates the lifetime, in days, of the objects that are subject to
--   the rule. The value must be a non-zero positive integer.
lifecycleExpiration_days :: Lens' LifecycleExpiration (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates at what date the object is to be moved or deleted. Should be
--   in GMT ISO 8601 Format.
lifecycleExpiration_date :: Lens' LifecycleExpiration (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Indicates whether Amazon S3 will remove a delete marker with no
--   noncurrent versions. If set to true, the delete marker will be
--   expired; if set to false the policy takes no action. This cannot be
--   specified with Days or Date in a Lifecycle Expiration Policy.
lifecycleExpiration_expiredObjectDeleteMarker :: Lens' LifecycleExpiration (Maybe Bool)

-- | A lifecycle rule for individual objects in an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycleRule</a> smart constructor.
data LifecycleRule
LifecycleRule' :: Maybe [Transition] -> Maybe NoncurrentVersionExpiration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [NoncurrentVersionTransition] -> Maybe LifecycleExpiration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LifecycleRuleFilter -> Maybe AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload -> ExpirationStatus -> LifecycleRule

-- | Specifies when an Amazon S3 object transitions to a specified storage
--   class.
[$sel:transitions:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe [Transition]
[$sel:noncurrentVersionExpiration:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe NoncurrentVersionExpiration

-- | Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies. This
--   is no longer used; use <tt>Filter</tt> instead.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:prefix:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the transition rule for the lifecycle rule that describes
--   when noncurrent objects transition to a specific storage class. If
--   your bucket is versioning-enabled (or versioning is suspended), you
--   can set this action to request that Amazon S3 transition noncurrent
--   object versions to a specific storage class at a set period in the
--   object's lifetime.
[$sel:noncurrentVersionTransitions:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe [NoncurrentVersionTransition]

-- | Specifies the expiration for the lifecycle of the object in the form
--   of date, days and, whether the object has a delete marker.
[$sel:expiration:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe LifecycleExpiration

-- | Unique identifier for the rule. The value cannot be longer than 255
--   characters.
[$sel:id:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe Text

-- | The <tt>Filter</tt> is used to identify objects that a Lifecycle Rule
--   applies to. A <tt>Filter</tt> must have exactly one of
--   <tt>Prefix</tt>, <tt>Tag</tt>, or <tt>And</tt> specified.
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is required if the <tt>LifecycleRule</tt> does not
--   containt a <tt>Prefix</tt> element.
[$sel:filter':LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe LifecycleRuleFilter
[$sel:abortIncompleteMultipartUpload:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> Maybe AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload

-- | If 'Enabled', the rule is currently being applied. If 'Disabled', the
--   rule is not currently being applied.
[$sel:status:LifecycleRule'] :: LifecycleRule -> ExpirationStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>LifecycleRule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:transitions:LifecycleRule'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRule_transitions</a> - Specifies when an Amazon S3 object
--   transitions to a specified storage class.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noncurrentVersionExpiration:LifecycleRule'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRule_noncurrentVersionExpiration</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_prefix</a> -
--   Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies. This
--   is no longer used; use <tt>Filter</tt> instead.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noncurrentVersionTransitions:LifecycleRule'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRule_noncurrentVersionTransitions</a> - Specifies the
--   transition rule for the lifecycle rule that describes when noncurrent
--   objects transition to a specific storage class. If your bucket is
--   versioning-enabled (or versioning is suspended), you can set this
--   action to request that Amazon S3 transition noncurrent object versions
--   to a specific storage class at a set period in the object's lifetime.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiration:LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_expiration</a>
--   - Specifies the expiration for the lifecycle of the object in the form
--   of date, days and, whether the object has a delete marker.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_id</a> - Unique
--   identifier for the rule. The value cannot be longer than 255
--   characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_filter</a> - The
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is used to identify objects that a Lifecycle Rule
--   applies to. A <tt>Filter</tt> must have exactly one of
--   <tt>Prefix</tt>, <tt>Tag</tt>, or <tt>And</tt> specified.

--   containt a <tt>Prefix</tt> element.

--   <a>lifecycleRule_abortIncompleteMultipartUpload</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_status</a> - If
--   'Enabled', the rule is currently being applied. If 'Disabled', the
--   rule is not currently being applied.
newLifecycleRule :: ExpirationStatus -> LifecycleRule

--   class.

--   is no longer used; use <tt>Filter</tt> instead.

--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
lifecycleRule_prefix :: Lens' LifecycleRule (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the transition rule for the lifecycle rule that describes
--   when noncurrent objects transition to a specific storage class. If
--   your bucket is versioning-enabled (or versioning is suspended), you

--   characters.
lifecycleRule_id :: Lens' LifecycleRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>Filter</tt> is used to identify objects that a Lifecycle Rule
--   applies to. A <tt>Filter</tt> must have exactly one of
--   <tt>Prefix</tt>, <tt>Tag</tt>, or <tt>And</tt> specified.

-- | If 'Enabled', the rule is currently being applied. If 'Disabled', the
--   rule is not currently being applied.
lifecycleRule_status :: Lens' LifecycleRule ExpirationStatus

-- | This is used in a Lifecycle Rule Filter to apply a logical AND to two
--   or more predicates. The Lifecycle Rule will apply to any object
--   matching all of the predicates configured inside the And operator.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycleRuleAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data LifecycleRuleAndOperator
LifecycleRuleAndOperator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> LifecycleRuleAndOperator

-- | Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.
[$sel:prefix:LifecycleRuleAndOperator'] :: LifecycleRuleAndOperator -> Maybe Text

-- | All of these tags must exist in the object's tag set in order for the
--   rule to apply.
[$sel:tags:LifecycleRuleAndOperator'] :: LifecycleRuleAndOperator -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>LifecycleRuleAndOperator</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>lifecycleRuleAndOperator_prefix</a> - Prefix identifying one or
--   more objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:LifecycleRuleAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRuleAndOperator_tags</a> - All of these tags must exist in
--   the object's tag set in order for the rule to apply.
newLifecycleRuleAndOperator :: LifecycleRuleAndOperator

-- | Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.
lifecycleRuleAndOperator_prefix :: Lens' LifecycleRuleAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | All of these tags must exist in the object's tag set in order for the
--   rule to apply.
lifecycleRuleAndOperator_tags :: Lens' LifecycleRuleAndOperator (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The <tt>Filter</tt> is used to identify objects that a Lifecycle Rule
--   applies to. A <tt>Filter</tt> must have exactly one of

-- | Describes where logs are stored and the prefix that Amazon S3 assigns
--   to all log object keys for a bucket. For more information, see <a>PUT
--   Bucket logging</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 API Reference</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoggingEnabled</a> smart constructor.
data LoggingEnabled
LoggingEnabled' :: Maybe [TargetGrant] -> Text -> Text -> LoggingEnabled

-- | Container for granting information.
[$sel:targetGrants:LoggingEnabled'] :: LoggingEnabled -> Maybe [TargetGrant]

-- | Specifies the bucket where you want Amazon S3 to store server access
--   logs. You can have your logs delivered to any bucket that you own,
--   including the same bucket that is being logged. You can also configure
--   multiple buckets to deliver their logs to the same target bucket. In
--   this case, you should choose a different <tt>TargetPrefix</tt> for
--   each source bucket so that the delivered log files can be
--   distinguished by key.
[$sel:targetBucket:LoggingEnabled'] :: LoggingEnabled -> Text

-- | A prefix for all log object keys. If you store log files from multiple
--   Amazon S3 buckets in a single bucket, you can use a prefix to
--   distinguish which log files came from which bucket.
[$sel:targetPrefix:LoggingEnabled'] :: LoggingEnabled -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoggingEnabled</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetGrants:LoggingEnabled'</a>,
--   <a>loggingEnabled_targetGrants</a> - Container for granting
--   information.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetBucket:LoggingEnabled'</a>,
--   <a>loggingEnabled_targetBucket</a> - Specifies the bucket where you
--   want Amazon S3 to store server access logs. You can have your logs
--   delivered to any bucket that you own, including the same bucket that
--   is being logged. You can also configure multiple buckets to deliver
--   their logs to the same target bucket. In this case, you should choose
--   a different <tt>TargetPrefix</tt> for each source bucket so that the
--   delivered log files can be distinguished by key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetPrefix:LoggingEnabled'</a>,
--   <a>loggingEnabled_targetPrefix</a> - A prefix for all log object keys.
--   If you store log files from multiple Amazon S3 buckets in a single
--   bucket, you can use a prefix to distinguish which log files came from
--   which bucket.
newLoggingEnabled :: Text -> Text -> LoggingEnabled

-- | Container for granting information.
loggingEnabled_targetGrants :: Lens' LoggingEnabled (Maybe [TargetGrant])

-- | Specifies the bucket where you want Amazon S3 to store server access
--   logs. You can have your logs delivered to any bucket that you own,
--   including the same bucket that is being logged. You can also configure
--   multiple buckets to deliver their logs to the same target bucket. In
--   this case, you should choose a different <tt>TargetPrefix</tt> for
--   each source bucket so that the delivered log files can be
--   distinguished by key.
loggingEnabled_targetBucket :: Lens' LoggingEnabled Text

-- | A prefix for all log object keys. If you store log files from multiple
--   Amazon S3 buckets in a single bucket, you can use a prefix to
--   distinguish which log files came from which bucket.
loggingEnabled_targetPrefix :: Lens' LoggingEnabled Text

-- | A metadata key-value pair to store with an object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetadataEntry</a> smart constructor.
data MetadataEntry

-- | Value of the Object.
[$sel:value:MetadataEntry'] :: MetadataEntry -> Maybe Text

[$sel:name:MetadataEntry'] :: MetadataEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MetadataEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   of the Object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:MetadataEntry'</a>, <a>metadataEntry_name</a> - Name of
--   the Object.
newMetadataEntry :: MetadataEntry

-- | Name of the Object.
metadataEntry_name :: Lens' MetadataEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | A container specifying replication metrics-related settings enabling
--   replication metrics and events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetrics</a> smart constructor.
data Metrics
Metrics' :: Maybe ReplicationTimeValue -> MetricsStatus -> Metrics

-- | A container specifying the time threshold for emitting the
--   <tt>s3:Replication:OperationMissedThreshold</tt> event.
[$sel:eventThreshold:Metrics'] :: Metrics -> Maybe ReplicationTimeValue

-- | Specifies whether the replication metrics are enabled.
[$sel:status:Metrics'] :: Metrics -> MetricsStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>Metrics</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   container specifying the time threshold for emitting the
--   <tt>s3:Replication:OperationMissedThreshold</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Metrics'</a>, <a>metrics_status</a> - Specifies whether
--   the replication metrics are enabled.
newMetrics :: MetricsStatus -> Metrics

-- | A container specifying the time threshold for emitting the
--   <tt>s3:Replication:OperationMissedThreshold</tt> event.
metrics_eventThreshold :: Lens' Metrics (Maybe ReplicationTimeValue)

-- | Specifies whether the replication metrics are enabled.
metrics_status :: Lens' Metrics MetricsStatus

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and
--   an object must match all of the predicates in order for the filter to
--   apply.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricsAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data MetricsAndOperator
MetricsAndOperator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> MetricsAndOperator

-- | The prefix used when evaluating an AND predicate.
[$sel:prefix:MetricsAndOperator'] :: MetricsAndOperator -> Maybe Text

-- | The access point ARN used when evaluating an AND predicate.
[$sel:accessPointArn:MetricsAndOperator'] :: MetricsAndOperator -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags used when evaluating an AND predicate.
[$sel:tags:MetricsAndOperator'] :: MetricsAndOperator -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricsAndOperator</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:MetricsAndOperator'</a>,

--   AND predicate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPointArn:MetricsAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>metricsAndOperator_accessPointArn</a> - The access point ARN used
--   when evaluating an AND predicate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:MetricsAndOperator'</a>, <a>metricsAndOperator_tags</a> -
--   The list of tags used when evaluating an AND predicate.
newMetricsAndOperator :: MetricsAndOperator

-- | The prefix used when evaluating an AND predicate.
metricsAndOperator_prefix :: Lens' MetricsAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | The access point ARN used when evaluating an AND predicate.
metricsAndOperator_accessPointArn :: Lens' MetricsAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags used when evaluating an AND predicate.
metricsAndOperator_tags :: Lens' MetricsAndOperator (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Specifies a metrics configuration for the CloudWatch request metrics
--   (specified by the metrics configuration ID) from an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   If you're updating an existing metrics configuration, note that this
--   is a full replacement of the existing metrics configuration. If you
--   don't include the elements you want to keep, they are erased. For more
--   information, see <a>PutBucketMetricsConfiguration</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricsConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data MetricsConfiguration
MetricsConfiguration' :: Maybe MetricsFilter -> Text -> MetricsConfiguration

-- | Specifies a metrics configuration filter. The metrics configuration
--   will only include objects that meet the filter's criteria. A filter
--   must be a prefix, an object tag, an access point ARN, or a conjunction
--   (MetricsAndOperator).
[$sel:filter':MetricsConfiguration'] :: MetricsConfiguration -> Maybe MetricsFilter

-- | The ID used to identify the metrics configuration.
[$sel:id:MetricsConfiguration'] :: MetricsConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricsConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':MetricsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>metricsConfiguration_filter</a> - Specifies a metrics configuration
--   filter. The metrics configuration will only include objects that meet
--   the filter's criteria. A filter must be a prefix, an object tag, an
--   access point ARN, or a conjunction (MetricsAndOperator).
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:MetricsConfiguration'</a>, <a>metricsConfiguration_id</a> -
--   The ID used to identify the metrics configuration.
newMetricsConfiguration :: Text -> MetricsConfiguration

-- | Specifies a metrics configuration filter. The metrics configuration
--   will only include objects that meet the filter's criteria. A filter
--   must be a prefix, an object tag, an access point ARN, or a conjunction
--   (MetricsAndOperator).
metricsConfiguration_filter :: Lens' MetricsConfiguration (Maybe MetricsFilter)

-- | The ID used to identify the metrics configuration.
metricsConfiguration_id :: Lens' MetricsConfiguration Text

-- | Specifies a metrics configuration filter. The metrics configuration
--   only includes objects that meet the filter's criteria. A filter must
--   be a prefix, an object tag, an access point ARN, or a conjunction
--   (MetricsAndOperator). For more information, see
--   <a>PutBucketMetricsConfiguration</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricsFilter</a> smart constructor.
data MetricsFilter
MetricsFilter' :: Maybe Tag -> Maybe Text -> Maybe MetricsAndOperator -> Maybe Text -> MetricsFilter

-- | The tag used when evaluating a metrics filter.
[$sel:tag:MetricsFilter'] :: MetricsFilter -> Maybe Tag

-- | The prefix used when evaluating a metrics filter.
[$sel:prefix:MetricsFilter'] :: MetricsFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and
--   an object must match all of the predicates in order for the filter to
--   apply.
[$sel:and:MetricsFilter'] :: MetricsFilter -> Maybe MetricsAndOperator

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   used when evaluating a metrics filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:MetricsFilter'</a>, <a>metricsFilter_prefix</a> - The
--   prefix used when evaluating a metrics filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:MetricsFilter'</a>, <a>metricsFilter_and</a> - A
--   conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating a
--   metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and an
--   object must match all of the predicates in order for the filter to

--   evaluating a metrics filter.
newMetricsFilter :: MetricsFilter

--   apply.
metricsFilter_and :: Lens' MetricsFilter (Maybe MetricsAndOperator)

metricsFilter_accessPointArn :: Lens' MetricsFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies when noncurrent object versions expire. Upon expiration,
--   Amazon S3 permanently deletes the noncurrent object versions. You set
--   this lifecycle configuration action on a bucket that has versioning
--   enabled (or suspended) to request that Amazon S3 delete noncurrent
--   object versions at a specific period in the object's lifetime.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNoncurrentVersionExpiration</a> smart constructor.
data NoncurrentVersionExpiration
NoncurrentVersionExpiration' :: Int -> NoncurrentVersionExpiration

-- | Specifies the number of days an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3
--   can perform the associated action. For information about the
--   noncurrent days calculations, see <a>How Amazon S3 Calculates When an
--   Object Became Noncurrent</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:noncurrentDays:NoncurrentVersionExpiration'] :: NoncurrentVersionExpiration -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>NoncurrentVersionExpiration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:noncurrentDays:NoncurrentVersionExpiration'</a>,
--   <a>noncurrentVersionExpiration_noncurrentDays</a> - Specifies the
--   number of days an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3 can perform
--   the associated action. For information about the noncurrent days
--   calculations, see <a>How Amazon S3 Calculates When an Object Became
--   Noncurrent</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
newNoncurrentVersionExpiration :: Int -> NoncurrentVersionExpiration

-- | Specifies the number of days an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3
--   can perform the associated action. For information about the
--   noncurrent days calculations, see <a>How Amazon S3 Calculates When an
--   Object Became Noncurrent</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
noncurrentVersionExpiration_noncurrentDays :: Lens' NoncurrentVersionExpiration Int

-- | Container for the transition rule that describes when noncurrent
--   objects transition to the <tt>STANDARD_IA</tt>, <tt>ONEZONE_IA</tt>,
--   <tt>INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>, <tt>GLACIER</tt>, or
--   <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt> storage class. If your bucket is
--   versioning-enabled (or versioning is suspended), you can set this
--   action to request that Amazon S3 transition noncurrent object versions
--   to the <tt>STANDARD_IA</tt>, <tt>ONEZONE_IA</tt>,
--   <tt>INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>, <tt>GLACIER</tt>, or
--   <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt> storage class at a specific period in the
--   object's lifetime.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNoncurrentVersionTransition</a> smart constructor.
data NoncurrentVersionTransition

--   can perform the associated action. For information about the
--   noncurrent days calculations, see <a>How Amazon S3 Calculates How Long
--   an Object Has Been Noncurrent</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.

-- | An object consists of data and its descriptive metadata.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObject</a> smart constructor.
data Object
Object' :: Maybe Owner -> ETag -> Integer -> ObjectKey -> ObjectStorageClass -> ISO8601 -> Object

-- | The owner of the object
[$sel:owner:Object'] :: Object -> Maybe Owner

-- | The entity tag is a hash of the object. The ETag reflects changes only
--   to the contents of an object, not its metadata. The ETag may or may
--   not be an MD5 digest of the object data. Whether or not it is depends
--   on how the object was created and how it is encrypted as described
--   below:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-S3 or plaintext, have ETags that are an MD5 digest of
--   their object data.</li>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-C or SSE-KMS, have ETags that are not an MD5 digest
--   of their object data.</li>
--   <li>If an object is created by either the Multipart Upload or Part
--   Copy operation, the ETag is not an MD5 digest, regardless of the
--   method of encryption.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:eTag:Object'] :: Object -> ETag

-- | Size in bytes of the object
[$sel:size:Object'] :: Object -> Integer

-- | The name that you assign to an object. You use the object key to
--   retrieve the object.
[$sel:key:Object'] :: Object -> ObjectKey

-- | The class of storage used to store the object.
[$sel:storageClass:Object'] :: Object -> ObjectStorageClass

-- | Creation date of the object.
[$sel:lastModified:Object'] :: Object -> ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>Object</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:Object'</a>, <a>object_owner</a> - The owner of the
--   object
--   
--   <a>$sel:eTag:Object'</a>, <a>object_eTag</a> - The entity tag is a
--   hash of the object. The ETag reflects changes only to the contents of
--   an object, not its metadata. The ETag may or may not be an MD5 digest
--   of the object data. Whether or not it is depends on how the object was
--   created and how it is encrypted as described below:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-S3 or plaintext, have ETags that are an MD5 digest of
--   their object data.</li>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-C or SSE-KMS, have ETags that are not an MD5 digest
--   of their object data.</li>
--   <li>If an object is created by either the Multipart Upload or Part
--   Copy operation, the ETag is not an MD5 digest, regardless of the
--   method of encryption.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:Object'</a>, <a>object_size</a> - Size in bytes of the
--   object
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Object'</a>, <a>object_key</a> - The name that you assign
--   to an object. You use the object key to retrieve the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:Object'</a>, <a>object_storageClass</a> - The
--   class of storage used to store the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModified:Object'</a>, <a>object_lastModified</a> -
--   Creation date of the object.
newObject :: ETag -> Integer -> ObjectKey -> ObjectStorageClass -> UTCTime -> Object

-- | The owner of the object
object_owner :: Lens' Object (Maybe Owner)

-- | The entity tag is a hash of the object. The ETag reflects changes only
--   to the contents of an object, not its metadata. The ETag may or may
--   not be an MD5 digest of the object data. Whether or not it is depends
--   on how the object was created and how it is encrypted as described
--   below:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-S3 or plaintext, have ETags that are an MD5 digest of
--   their object data.</li>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-C or SSE-KMS, have ETags that are not an MD5 digest
--   of their object data.</li>
--   <li>If an object is created by either the Multipart Upload or Part
--   Copy operation, the ETag is not an MD5 digest, regardless of the
--   method of encryption.</li>
--   </ul>
object_eTag :: Lens' Object ETag

-- | Size in bytes of the object
object_size :: Lens' Object Integer

-- | The name that you assign to an object. You use the object key to
--   retrieve the object.
object_key :: Lens' Object ObjectKey

-- | The class of storage used to store the object.
object_storageClass :: Lens' Object ObjectStorageClass

-- | Creation date of the object.
object_lastModified :: Lens' Object UTCTime

-- | Object Identifier is unique value to identify objects.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectIdentifier</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectIdentifier
ObjectIdentifier' :: Maybe ObjectVersionId -> ObjectKey -> ObjectIdentifier

-- | VersionId for the specific version of the object to delete.
[$sel:versionId:ObjectIdentifier'] :: ObjectIdentifier -> Maybe ObjectVersionId

-- | Key name of the object.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:key:ObjectIdentifier'] :: ObjectIdentifier -> ObjectKey

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectIdentifier</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:ObjectIdentifier'</a>,
--   <a>objectIdentifier_versionId</a> - VersionId for the specific version
--   of the object to delete.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:ObjectIdentifier'</a>, <a>objectIdentifier_key</a> - Key
--   name of the object.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
newObjectIdentifier :: ObjectKey -> ObjectIdentifier

-- | VersionId for the specific version of the object to delete.
objectIdentifier_versionId :: Lens' ObjectIdentifier (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | Key name of the object.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
objectIdentifier_key :: Lens' ObjectIdentifier ObjectKey

-- | The container element for Object Lock configuration parameters.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectLockConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectLockConfiguration
ObjectLockConfiguration' :: Maybe ObjectLockEnabled -> Maybe ObjectLockRule -> ObjectLockConfiguration

-- | Indicates whether this bucket has an Object Lock configuration
--   enabled. Enable <tt>ObjectLockEnabled</tt> when you apply
--   <tt>ObjectLockConfiguration</tt> to a bucket.
[$sel:objectLockEnabled:ObjectLockConfiguration'] :: ObjectLockConfiguration -> Maybe ObjectLockEnabled

-- | Specifies the Object Lock rule for the specified object. Enable the
--   this rule when you apply <tt>ObjectLockConfiguration</tt> to a bucket.
--   Bucket settings require both a mode and a period. The period can be
--   either <tt>Days</tt> or <tt>Years</tt> but you must select one. You
--   cannot specify <tt>Days</tt> and <tt>Years</tt> at the same time.
[$sel:rule:ObjectLockConfiguration'] :: ObjectLockConfiguration -> Maybe ObjectLockRule

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectLockConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectLockEnabled:ObjectLockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>objectLockConfiguration_objectLockEnabled</a> - Indicates whether
--   this bucket has an Object Lock configuration enabled. Enable
--   <tt>ObjectLockEnabled</tt> when you apply
--   <tt>ObjectLockConfiguration</tt> to a bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rule:ObjectLockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>objectLockConfiguration_rule</a> - Specifies the Object Lock rule
--   for the specified object. Enable the this rule when you apply
--   <tt>ObjectLockConfiguration</tt> to a bucket. Bucket settings require
--   both a mode and a period. The period can be either <tt>Days</tt> or
--   <tt>Years</tt> but you must select one. You cannot specify
--   <tt>Days</tt> and <tt>Years</tt> at the same time.
newObjectLockConfiguration :: ObjectLockConfiguration

-- | Indicates whether this bucket has an Object Lock configuration
--   enabled. Enable <tt>ObjectLockEnabled</tt> when you apply
--   <tt>ObjectLockConfiguration</tt> to a bucket.
objectLockConfiguration_objectLockEnabled :: Lens' ObjectLockConfiguration (Maybe ObjectLockEnabled)

-- | Specifies the Object Lock rule for the specified object. Enable the
--   this rule when you apply <tt>ObjectLockConfiguration</tt> to a bucket.
--   Bucket settings require both a mode and a period. The period can be
--   either <tt>Days</tt> or <tt>Years</tt> but you must select one. You
--   cannot specify <tt>Days</tt> and <tt>Years</tt> at the same time.
objectLockConfiguration_rule :: Lens' ObjectLockConfiguration (Maybe ObjectLockRule)

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObjectVersion</a> smart constructor.
data ObjectVersion
ObjectVersion' :: Maybe ETag -> Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Owner -> Maybe ObjectKey -> Maybe ObjectVersionStorageClass -> Maybe ISO8601 -> ObjectVersion

-- | The entity tag is an MD5 hash of that version of the object.
[$sel:eTag:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe ETag

-- | Version ID of an object.
[$sel:versionId:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe ObjectVersionId

-- | Size in bytes of the object.
[$sel:size:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe Integer

-- | Specifies whether the object is (true) or is not (false) the latest
--   version of an object.
[$sel:isLatest:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies the owner of the object.
[$sel:owner:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe Owner

-- | The object key.
[$sel:key:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe ObjectKey

-- | The class of storage used to store the object.
[$sel:storageClass:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe ObjectVersionStorageClass

-- | Date and time the object was last modified.
[$sel:lastModified:ObjectVersion'] :: ObjectVersion -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>ObjectVersion</a> with all optional fields

--   Version ID of an object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:ObjectVersion'</a>, <a>objectVersion_size</a> - Size in
--   bytes of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isLatest:ObjectVersion'</a>, <a>objectVersion_isLatest</a> -
--   Specifies whether the object is (true) or is not (false) the latest
--   version of an object.

--   Specifies the owner of the object.

--   key.

-- | The PublicAccessBlock configuration that you want to apply to this
--   Amazon S3 bucket. You can enable the configuration options in any
--   combination. For more information about when Amazon S3 considers a
--   bucket or object public, see <a>The Meaning of "Public"</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPublicAccessBlockConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PublicAccessBlockConfiguration
PublicAccessBlockConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> PublicAccessBlockConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should ignore public ACLs for this bucket
--   and objects in this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt>
--   causes Amazon S3 to ignore all public ACLs on this bucket and objects
--   in this bucket.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect the persistence of any existing
--   ACLs and doesn't prevent new public ACLs from being set.
[$sel:ignorePublicAcls:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'] :: PublicAccessBlockConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should block public access control lists
--   (ACLs) for this bucket and objects in this bucket. Setting this
--   element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes the following behavior:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT Bucket acl and PUT Object acl calls fail if the specified ACL
--   is public.</li>
--   <li>PUT Object calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   <li>PUT Bucket calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing policies or ACLs.
[$sel:blockPublicAcls:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'] :: PublicAccessBlockConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should restrict public bucket policies for
--   this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> restricts access to
--   this bucket to only Amazon Web Service principals and authorized users
--   within this account if the bucket has a public policy.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect previously stored bucket
--   policies, except that public and cross-account access within any
--   public bucket policy, including non-public delegation to specific
--   accounts, is blocked.
[$sel:restrictPublicBuckets:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'] :: PublicAccessBlockConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should block public bucket policies for
--   this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes Amazon S3 to
--   reject calls to PUT Bucket policy if the specified bucket policy
--   allows public access.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing bucket policies.
[$sel:blockPublicPolicy:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'] :: PublicAccessBlockConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PublicAccessBlockConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ignorePublicAcls:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>publicAccessBlockConfiguration_ignorePublicAcls</a> - Specifies
--   whether Amazon S3 should ignore public ACLs for this bucket and
--   objects in this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes
--   Amazon S3 to ignore all public ACLs on this bucket and objects in this
--   bucket.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect the persistence of any existing
--   ACLs and doesn't prevent new public ACLs from being set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicAcls:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>publicAccessBlockConfiguration_blockPublicAcls</a> - Specifies
--   whether Amazon S3 should block public access control lists (ACLs) for
--   this bucket and objects in this bucket. Setting this element to
--   <tt>TRUE</tt> causes the following behavior:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT Bucket acl and PUT Object acl calls fail if the specified ACL
--   is public.</li>
--   <li>PUT Object calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   <li>PUT Bucket calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing policies or ACLs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restrictPublicBuckets:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>publicAccessBlockConfiguration_restrictPublicBuckets</a> -
--   Specifies whether Amazon S3 should restrict public bucket policies for
--   this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> restricts access to
--   this bucket to only Amazon Web Service principals and authorized users
--   within this account if the bucket has a public policy.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect previously stored bucket
--   policies, except that public and cross-account access within any
--   public bucket policy, including non-public delegation to specific
--   accounts, is blocked.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockPublicPolicy:PublicAccessBlockConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>publicAccessBlockConfiguration_blockPublicPolicy</a> - Specifies
--   whether Amazon S3 should block public bucket policies for this bucket.
--   Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes Amazon S3 to reject calls
--   to PUT Bucket policy if the specified bucket policy allows public
--   access.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing bucket policies.
newPublicAccessBlockConfiguration :: PublicAccessBlockConfiguration

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should ignore public ACLs for this bucket
--   and objects in this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt>
--   causes Amazon S3 to ignore all public ACLs on this bucket and objects
--   in this bucket.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect the persistence of any existing
--   ACLs and doesn't prevent new public ACLs from being set.
publicAccessBlockConfiguration_ignorePublicAcls :: Lens' PublicAccessBlockConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should block public access control lists
--   (ACLs) for this bucket and objects in this bucket. Setting this
--   element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes the following behavior:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT Bucket acl and PUT Object acl calls fail if the specified ACL
--   is public.</li>
--   <li>PUT Object calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   <li>PUT Bucket calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing policies or ACLs.
publicAccessBlockConfiguration_blockPublicAcls :: Lens' PublicAccessBlockConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should restrict public bucket policies for
--   this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> restricts access to
--   this bucket to only Amazon Web Service principals and authorized users
--   within this account if the bucket has a public policy.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect previously stored bucket
--   policies, except that public and cross-account access within any
--   public bucket policy, including non-public delegation to specific
--   accounts, is blocked.
publicAccessBlockConfiguration_restrictPublicBuckets :: Lens' PublicAccessBlockConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should block public bucket policies for
--   this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes Amazon S3 to
--   reject calls to PUT Bucket policy if the specified bucket policy
--   allows public access.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing bucket policies.
publicAccessBlockConfiguration_blockPublicPolicy :: Lens' PublicAccessBlockConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the configuration for publishing messages to an Amazon
--   Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue when Amazon S3 detects
--   specified events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newQueueConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data QueueConfiguration
QueueConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter -> Text -> [Event] -> QueueConfiguration
[$sel:id:QueueConfiguration'] :: QueueConfiguration -> Maybe Text
[$sel:filter':QueueConfiguration'] :: QueueConfiguration -> Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SQS queue to which Amazon
--   S3 publishes a message when it detects events of the specified type.
[$sel:queueArn:QueueConfiguration'] :: QueueConfiguration -> Text

-- | A collection of bucket events for which to send notifications
[$sel:events:QueueConfiguration'] :: QueueConfiguration -> [Event]

-- | Create a value of <a>QueueConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:QueueConfiguration'</a>, <a>queueConfiguration_id</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':QueueConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>queueConfiguration_filter</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueArn:QueueConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>queueConfiguration_queueArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the Amazon SQS queue to which Amazon S3 publishes a message when it
--   detects events of the specified type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:events:QueueConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>queueConfiguration_events</a> - A collection of bucket events for
--   which to send notifications
newQueueConfiguration :: Text -> QueueConfiguration

-- | Undocumented member.

--   S3 publishes a message when it detects events of the specified type.

queueConfiguration_events :: Lens' QueueConfiguration [Event]

data RecordsEvent
