recordsEvent_payload :: Lens' RecordsEvent (Maybe ByteString)

-- | Specifies how requests are redirected. In the event of an error, you
--   can specify a different error code to return.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRedirect</a> smart constructor.
data Redirect
Redirect' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Protocol -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Redirect

-- | The host name to use in the redirect request.
[$sel:hostName:Redirect'] :: Redirect -> Maybe Text

-- | Protocol to use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol
--   that is used in the original request.
[$sel:protocol:Redirect'] :: Redirect -> Maybe Protocol

-- | The HTTP redirect code to use on the response. Not required if one of
--   the siblings is present.
[$sel:httpRedirectCode:Redirect'] :: Redirect -> Maybe Text

-- | The specific object key to use in the redirect request. For example,
--   redirect request to <tt>error.html</tt>. Not required if one of the
--   siblings is present. Can be present only if
--   <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:replaceKeyWith:Redirect'] :: Redirect -> Maybe Text

-- | The object key prefix to use in the redirect request. For example, to
--   redirect requests for all pages with prefix <tt>docs/</tt> (objects in
--   the <tt>docs/</tt> folder) to <tt>documents/</tt>, you can set a
--   condition block with <tt>KeyPrefixEquals</tt> set to <tt>docs/</tt>
--   and in the Redirect set <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> to
--   <tt>/documents</tt>. Not required if one of the siblings is present.
--   Can be present only if <tt>ReplaceKeyWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:replaceKeyPrefixWith:Redirect'] :: Redirect -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Redirect</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostName:Redirect'</a>, <a>redirect_hostName</a> - The host
--   name to use in the redirect request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:Redirect'</a>, <a>redirect_protocol</a> - Protocol to
--   use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol that is
--   used in the original request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpRedirectCode:Redirect'</a>,
--   <a>redirect_httpRedirectCode</a> - The HTTP redirect code to use on
--   the response. Not required if one of the siblings is present.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replaceKeyWith:Redirect'</a>, <a>redirect_replaceKeyWith</a> -
--   The specific object key to use in the redirect request. For example,
--   redirect request to <tt>error.html</tt>. Not required if one of the
--   siblings is present. Can be present only if
--   <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replaceKeyPrefixWith:Redirect'</a>,
--   <a>redirect_replaceKeyPrefixWith</a> - The object key prefix to use in
--   the redirect request. For example, to redirect requests for all pages
--   with prefix <tt>docs/</tt> (objects in the <tt>docs/</tt> folder) to
--   <tt>documents/</tt>, you can set a condition block with
--   <tt>KeyPrefixEquals</tt> set to <tt>docs/</tt> and in the Redirect set
--   <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> to <tt>/documents</tt>. Not required if
--   one of the siblings is present. Can be present only if
--   <tt>ReplaceKeyWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
newRedirect :: Redirect

-- | The host name to use in the redirect request.
redirect_hostName :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Text)

-- | Protocol to use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol
--   that is used in the original request.
redirect_protocol :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Protocol)

-- | The HTTP redirect code to use on the response. Not required if one of
--   the siblings is present.
redirect_httpRedirectCode :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Text)

-- | The specific object key to use in the redirect request. For example,
--   redirect request to <tt>error.html</tt>. Not required if one of the
--   siblings is present. Can be present only if
--   <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
redirect_replaceKeyWith :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Text)

-- | The object key prefix to use in the redirect request. For example, to
--   redirect requests for all pages with prefix <tt>docs/</tt> (objects in
--   the <tt>docs/</tt> folder) to <tt>documents/</tt>, you can set a
--   condition block with <tt>KeyPrefixEquals</tt> set to <tt>docs/</tt>
--   and in the Redirect set <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> to
--   <tt>/documents</tt>. Not required if one of the siblings is present.
--   Can be present only if <tt>ReplaceKeyWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
redirect_replaceKeyPrefixWith :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Text)

-- | A filter that you can specify for selection for modifications on
--   replicas. Amazon S3 doesn't replicate replica modifications by
--   default. In the latest version of replication configuration (when
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is specified), you can specify this element and set
--   the status to <tt>Enabled</tt> to replicate modifications on replicas.
--   
--   If you don't specify the <tt>Filter</tt> element, Amazon S3 assumes
--   that the replication configuration is the earlier version, V1. In the
--   earlier version, this element is not allowed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicaModifications</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicaModifications
ReplicaModifications' :: ReplicaModificationsStatus -> ReplicaModifications

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 replicates modifications on replicas.
[$sel:status:ReplicaModifications'] :: ReplicaModifications -> ReplicaModificationsStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicaModifications</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReplicaModifications'</a>,
--   <a>replicaModifications_status</a> - Specifies whether Amazon S3
--   replicates modifications on replicas.
newReplicaModifications :: ReplicaModificationsStatus -> ReplicaModifications

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 replicates modifications on replicas.
replicaModifications_status :: Lens' ReplicaModifications ReplicaModificationsStatus

-- | A container for replication rules. You can add up to 1,000 rules. The
--   maximum size of a replication configuration is 2 MB.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationConfiguration
ReplicationConfiguration' :: Text -> [ReplicationRule] -> ReplicationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role that Amazon S3 assumes when replicating objects. For more
--   information, see <a>How to Set Up Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3
--   User Guide</i>.
[$sel:role':ReplicationConfiguration'] :: ReplicationConfiguration -> Text

-- | A container for one or more replication rules. A replication
--   configuration must have at least one rule and can contain a maximum of
--   1,000 rules.
[$sel:rules:ReplicationConfiguration'] :: ReplicationConfiguration -> [ReplicationRule]

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that Amazon S3
--   assumes when replicating objects. For more information, see <a>How to
--   Set Up Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rules:ReplicationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>replicationConfiguration_rules</a> - A container for one or more
--   replication rules. A replication configuration must have at least one
--   rule and can contain a maximum of 1,000 rules.
newReplicationConfiguration :: Text -> ReplicationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role that Amazon S3 assumes when replicating objects. For more
--   information, see <a>How to Set Up Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3
--   User Guide</i>.
replicationConfiguration_role :: Lens' ReplicationConfiguration Text

-- | A container for one or more replication rules. A replication
--   configuration must have at least one rule and can contain a maximum of
--   1,000 rules.
replicationConfiguration_rules :: Lens' ReplicationConfiguration [ReplicationRule]

-- | Specifies which Amazon S3 objects to replicate and where to store the
--   replicas.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationRule</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationRule
ReplicationRule' :: Maybe DeleteMarkerReplication -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ExistingObjectReplication -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReplicationRuleFilter -> Maybe SourceSelectionCriteria -> ReplicationRuleStatus -> Destination -> ReplicationRule
[$sel:deleteMarkerReplication:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe DeleteMarkerReplication

-- | The priority indicates which rule has precedence whenever two or more
--   replication rules conflict. Amazon S3 will attempt to replicate
--   objects according to all replication rules. However, if there are two
--   or more rules with the same destination bucket, then objects will be
--   replicated according to the rule with the highest priority. The higher
--   the number, the higher the priority.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:priority:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe Int

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the object or objects to
--   which the rule applies. The maximum prefix length is 1,024 characters.
--   To include all objects in a bucket, specify an empty string.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:prefix:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe Text
[$sel:existingObjectReplication:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe ExistingObjectReplication

-- | A unique identifier for the rule. The maximum value is 255 characters.
[$sel:id:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe Text
[$sel:filter':ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe ReplicationRuleFilter

-- | A container that describes additional filters for identifying the
--   source objects that you want to replicate. You can choose to enable or
--   disable the replication of these objects. Currently, Amazon S3
--   supports only the filter that you can specify for objects created with
--   server-side encryption using a customer managed key stored in Amazon
--   Web Services Key Management Service (SSE-KMS).
[$sel:sourceSelectionCriteria:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Maybe SourceSelectionCriteria

-- | Specifies whether the rule is enabled.
[$sel:status:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> ReplicationRuleStatus

-- | A container for information about the replication destination and its
--   configurations including enabling the S3 Replication Time Control (S3
--   RTC).
[$sel:destination:ReplicationRule'] :: ReplicationRule -> Destination

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationRule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteMarkerReplication:ReplicationRule'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRule_deleteMarkerReplication</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:ReplicationRule'</a>, <a>replicationRule_priority</a>
--   - The priority indicates which rule has precedence whenever two or
--   more replication rules conflict. Amazon S3 will attempt to replicate
--   objects according to all replication rules. However, if there are two
--   or more rules with the same destination bucket, then objects will be
--   replicated according to the rule with the highest priority. The higher
--   the number, the higher the priority.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ReplicationRule'</a>, <a>replicationRule_prefix</a> -
--   An object key name prefix that identifies the object or objects to
--   which the rule applies. The maximum prefix length is 1,024 characters.
--   To include all objects in a bucket, specify an empty string.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:existingObjectReplication:ReplicationRule'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRule_existingObjectReplication</a> -
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ReplicationRule'</a>, <a>replicationRule_id</a> - A unique
--   identifier for the rule. The maximum value is 255 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ReplicationRule'</a>, <a>replicationRule_filter</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceSelectionCriteria:ReplicationRule'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRule_sourceSelectionCriteria</a> - A container that
--   describes additional filters for identifying the source objects that
--   you want to replicate. You can choose to enable or disable the
--   replication of these objects. Currently, Amazon S3 supports only the
--   filter that you can specify for objects created with server-side
--   encryption using a customer managed key stored in Amazon Web Services

--   <a>$sel:status:ReplicationRule'</a>, <a>replicationRule_status</a> -
--   Specifies whether the rule is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:ReplicationRule'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRule_destination</a> - A container for information about
--   the replication destination and its configurations including enabling
--   the S3 Replication Time Control (S3 RTC).
newReplicationRule :: ReplicationRuleStatus -> Destination -> ReplicationRule

-- | Undocumented member.
replicationRule_deleteMarkerReplication :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe DeleteMarkerReplication)

-- | The priority indicates which rule has precedence whenever two or more
--   replication rules conflict. Amazon S3 will attempt to replicate
--   objects according to all replication rules. However, if there are two
--   or more rules with the same destination bucket, then objects will be
--   replicated according to the rule with the highest priority. The higher
--   the number, the higher the priority.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
replicationRule_priority :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe Int)

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the object or objects to
--   which the rule applies. The maximum prefix length is 1,024 characters.
--   To include all objects in a bucket, specify an empty string.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.

-- | A container that describes additional filters for identifying the
--   source objects that you want to replicate. You can choose to enable or
--   disable the replication of these objects. Currently, Amazon S3
--   supports only the filter that you can specify for objects created with
--   server-side encryption using a customer managed key stored in Amazon
--   Web Services Key Management Service (SSE-KMS).
replicationRule_sourceSelectionCriteria :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe SourceSelectionCriteria)

-- | Specifies whether the rule is enabled.
replicationRule_status :: Lens' ReplicationRule ReplicationRuleStatus

-- | A container for information about the replication destination and its
--   configurations including enabling the S3 Replication Time Control (S3
--   RTC).
replicationRule_destination :: Lens' ReplicationRule Destination

-- | A container for specifying rule filters. The filters determine the
--   subset of objects to which the rule applies. This element is required
--   only if you specify more than one filter.
--   
--   For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify both a <tt>Prefix</tt> and a <tt>Tag</tt> filter,
--   wrap these filters in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   <li>If you specify a filter based on multiple tags, wrap the
--   <tt>Tag</tt> elements in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationRuleAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationRuleAndOperator
ReplicationRuleAndOperator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> ReplicationRuleAndOperator

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
[$sel:prefix:ReplicationRuleAndOperator'] :: ReplicationRuleAndOperator -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of tags containing key and value pairs.
[$sel:tags:ReplicationRuleAndOperator'] :: ReplicationRuleAndOperator -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationRuleAndOperator</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ReplicationRuleAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRuleAndOperator_prefix</a> - An object key name prefix
--   that identifies the subset of objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ReplicationRuleAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRuleAndOperator_tags</a> - An array of tags containing
--   key and value pairs.
newReplicationRuleAndOperator :: ReplicationRuleAndOperator

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
replicationRuleAndOperator_prefix :: Lens' ReplicationRuleAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of tags containing key and value pairs.
replicationRuleAndOperator_tags :: Lens' ReplicationRuleAndOperator (Maybe [Tag])

-- | A filter that identifies the subset of objects to which the
--   replication rule applies. A <tt>Filter</tt> must specify exactly one
--   <tt>Prefix</tt>, <tt>Tag</tt>, or an <tt>And</tt> child element.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationRuleFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationRuleFilter
ReplicationRuleFilter' :: Maybe Tag -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReplicationRuleAndOperator -> ReplicationRuleFilter

-- | A container for specifying a tag key and value.
--   
--   The rule applies only to objects that have the tag in their tag set.
[$sel:tag:ReplicationRuleFilter'] :: ReplicationRuleFilter -> Maybe Tag

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
[$sel:prefix:ReplicationRuleFilter'] :: ReplicationRuleFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | A container for specifying rule filters. The filters determine the
--   subset of objects to which the rule applies. This element is required
--   only if you specify more than one filter. For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify both a <tt>Prefix</tt> and a <tt>Tag</tt> filter,
--   wrap these filters in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   <li>If you specify a filter based on multiple tags, wrap the
--   <tt>Tag</tt> elements in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:and:ReplicationRuleFilter'] :: ReplicationRuleFilter -> Maybe ReplicationRuleAndOperator

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationRuleFilter</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tag:ReplicationRuleFilter'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRuleFilter_tag</a> - A container for specifying a tag
--   key and value.
--   
--   The rule applies only to objects that have the tag in their tag set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ReplicationRuleFilter'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRuleFilter_prefix</a> - An object key name prefix that
--   identifies the subset of objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:and:ReplicationRuleFilter'</a>,
--   <a>replicationRuleFilter_and</a> - A container for specifying rule
--   filters. The filters determine the subset of objects to which the rule
--   applies. This element is required only if you specify more than one
--   filter. For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify both a <tt>Prefix</tt> and a <tt>Tag</tt> filter,
--   wrap these filters in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   <li>If you specify a filter based on multiple tags, wrap the
--   <tt>Tag</tt> elements in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   </ul>
newReplicationRuleFilter :: ReplicationRuleFilter

-- | A container for specifying a tag key and value.
--   
--   The rule applies only to objects that have the tag in their tag set.
replicationRuleFilter_tag :: Lens' ReplicationRuleFilter (Maybe Tag)

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
replicationRuleFilter_prefix :: Lens' ReplicationRuleFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | A container for specifying rule filters. The filters determine the
--   subset of objects to which the rule applies. This element is required
--   only if you specify more than one filter. For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify both a <tt>Prefix</tt> and a <tt>Tag</tt> filter,
--   wrap these filters in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   <li>If you specify a filter based on multiple tags, wrap the
--   <tt>Tag</tt> elements in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   </ul>
replicationRuleFilter_and :: Lens' ReplicationRuleFilter (Maybe ReplicationRuleAndOperator)

-- | A container specifying S3 Replication Time Control (S3 RTC) related
--   information, including whether S3 RTC is enabled and the time when all
--   objects and operations on objects must be replicated. Must be
--   specified together with a <tt>Metrics</tt> block.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationTime</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationTime
ReplicationTime' :: ReplicationTimeStatus -> ReplicationTimeValue -> ReplicationTime

-- | Specifies whether the replication time is enabled.
[$sel:status:ReplicationTime'] :: ReplicationTime -> ReplicationTimeStatus

-- | A container specifying the time by which replication should be
--   complete for all objects and operations on objects.
[$sel:time:ReplicationTime'] :: ReplicationTime -> ReplicationTimeValue

-- | Create a value of <a>ReplicationTime</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ReplicationTime'</a>, <a>replicationTime_status</a> -
--   Specifies whether the replication time is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:time:ReplicationTime'</a>, <a>replicationTime_time</a> - A
--   container specifying the time by which replication should be complete
--   for all objects and operations on objects.
newReplicationTime :: ReplicationTimeStatus -> ReplicationTimeValue -> ReplicationTime

-- | Specifies whether the replication time is enabled.
replicationTime_status :: Lens' ReplicationTime ReplicationTimeStatus

-- | A container specifying the time by which replication should be
--   complete for all objects and operations on objects.
replicationTime_time :: Lens' ReplicationTime ReplicationTimeValue

-- | A container specifying the time value for S3 Replication Time Control
--   (S3 RTC) and replication metrics <tt>EventThreshold</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReplicationTimeValue</a> smart constructor.
data ReplicationTimeValue

--   
--   Valid value: 15

--   fields.

--   time in minutes.
--   
--   Valid value: 15
newReplicationTimeValue :: ReplicationTimeValue

-- | Contains an integer specifying time in minutes.
--   
--   Valid value: 15
replicationTimeValue_minutes :: Lens' ReplicationTimeValue (Maybe Int)

-- | Container for restore job parameters.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRestoreRequest</a> smart constructor.
data RestoreRequest
RestoreRequest' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe SelectParameters -> Maybe OutputLocation -> Maybe Tier -> Maybe GlacierJobParameters -> Maybe RestoreRequestType -> Maybe Text -> RestoreRequest

-- | Lifetime of the active copy in days. Do not use with restores that
--   specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
--   
--   The Days element is required for regular restores, and must not be
--   provided for select requests.
[$sel:days:RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe Int

-- | Describes the parameters for Select job types.
[$sel:selectParameters:RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe SelectParameters

-- | Describes the location where the restore job's output is stored.
[$sel:outputLocation:RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe OutputLocation

-- | Retrieval tier at which the restore will be processed.
[$sel:tier:RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe Tier

-- | S3 Glacier related parameters pertaining to this job. Do not use with
--   restores that specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
[$sel:glacierJobParameters:RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe GlacierJobParameters

-- | Type of restore request.
[$sel:type':RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe RestoreRequestType

-- | The optional description for the job.
[$sel:description:RestoreRequest'] :: RestoreRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RestoreRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   Lifetime of the active copy in days. Do not use with restores that
--   specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
--   
--   The Days element is required for regular restores, and must not be
--   provided for select requests.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectParameters:RestoreRequest'</a>,
--   <a>restoreRequest_selectParameters</a> - Describes the parameters for
--   Select job types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLocation:RestoreRequest'</a>,
--   <a>restoreRequest_outputLocation</a> - Describes the location where
--   the restore job's output is stored.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tier:RestoreRequest'</a>, <a>restoreRequest_tier</a> -
--   Retrieval tier at which the restore will be processed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:glacierJobParameters:RestoreRequest'</a>,
--   <a>restoreRequest_glacierJobParameters</a> - S3 Glacier related
--   parameters pertaining to this job. Do not use with restores that
--   specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
--

--   of restore request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RestoreRequest'</a>,
--   <a>restoreRequest_description</a> - The optional description for the
--   job.
newRestoreRequest :: RestoreRequest

-- | Lifetime of the active copy in days. Do not use with restores that
--   specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
--   
--   The Days element is required for regular restores, and must not be
--   provided for select requests.
restoreRequest_days :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe Int)

-- | Describes the parameters for Select job types.
restoreRequest_selectParameters :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe SelectParameters)

-- | Describes the location where the restore job's output is stored.
restoreRequest_outputLocation :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe OutputLocation)

-- | Retrieval tier at which the restore will be processed.
restoreRequest_tier :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe Tier)

-- | S3 Glacier related parameters pertaining to this job. Do not use with
--   restores that specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
restoreRequest_glacierJobParameters :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe GlacierJobParameters)

-- | Type of restore request.
restoreRequest_type :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe RestoreRequestType)

-- | The optional description for the job.
restoreRequest_description :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the redirect behavior and when a redirect is applied. For
--   more information about routing rules, see <a>Configuring advanced
--   conditional redirects</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRoutingRule</a> smart constructor.
data RoutingRule
RoutingRule' :: Maybe Condition -> Redirect -> RoutingRule

-- | A container for describing a condition that must be met for the
--   specified redirect to apply. For example, 1. If request is for pages
--   in the <tt>/docs</tt> folder, redirect to the <tt>/documents</tt>
--   folder. 2. If request results in HTTP error 4xx, redirect request to
--   another host where you might process the error.
[$sel:condition:RoutingRule'] :: RoutingRule -> Maybe Condition

-- | Container for redirect information. You can redirect requests to
--   another host, to another page, or with another protocol. In the event
--   of an error, you can specify a different error code to return.
[$sel:redirect:RoutingRule'] :: RoutingRule -> Redirect

-- | Create a value of <a>RoutingRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:condition:RoutingRule'</a>, <a>routingRule_condition</a> - A
--   container for describing a condition that must be met for the
--   specified redirect to apply. For example, 1. If request is for pages
--   in the <tt>/docs</tt> folder, redirect to the <tt>/documents</tt>
--   folder. 2. If request results in HTTP error 4xx, redirect request to
--   another host where you might process the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:redirect:RoutingRule'</a>, <a>routingRule_redirect</a> -
--   Container for redirect information. You can redirect requests to
--   another host, to another page, or with another protocol. In the event
--   of an error, you can specify a different error code to return.
newRoutingRule :: Redirect -> RoutingRule

-- | A container for describing a condition that must be met for the
--   specified redirect to apply. For example, 1. If request is for pages
--   in the <tt>/docs</tt> folder, redirect to the <tt>/documents</tt>
--   folder. 2. If request results in HTTP error 4xx, redirect request to
--   another host where you might process the error.
routingRule_condition :: Lens' RoutingRule (Maybe Condition)

-- | Container for redirect information. You can redirect requests to
--   another host, to another page, or with another protocol. In the event
--   of an error, you can specify a different error code to return.
routingRule_redirect :: Lens' RoutingRule Redirect

data S3KeyFilter

-- | Describes an Amazon S3 location that will receive the results of the
--   restore request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3Location</a> smart constructor.
data S3Location
S3Location' :: Maybe ObjectCannedACL -> Maybe [Grant] -> Maybe [MetadataEntry] -> Maybe Encryption -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe Tagging -> BucketName -> Text -> S3Location

-- | The canned ACL to apply to the restore results.
[$sel:cannedACL:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe ObjectCannedACL

-- | A list of grants that control access to the staged results.
[$sel:accessControlList:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe [Grant]

-- | A list of metadata to store with the restore results in S3.
[$sel:userMetadata:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe [MetadataEntry]
[$sel:encryption:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe Encryption

-- | The class of storage used to store the restore results.
[$sel:storageClass:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe StorageClass

-- | The tag-set that is applied to the restore results.
[$sel:tagging:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Maybe Tagging

-- | The name of the bucket where the restore results will be placed.
[$sel:bucketName:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> BucketName

-- | The prefix that is prepended to the restore results for this request.
[$sel:prefix:S3Location'] :: S3Location -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Location</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cannedACL:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_cannedACL</a> - The
--   canned ACL to apply to the restore results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessControlList:S3Location'</a>,
--   <a>s3Location_accessControlList</a> - A list of grants that control
--   access to the staged results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userMetadata:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_userMetadata</a> -
--   A list of metadata to store with the restore results in S3.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryption:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_encryption</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_storageClass</a> -
--   The class of storage used to store the restore results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagging:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_tagging</a> - The
--   tag-set that is applied to the restore results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_bucketName</a> - The
--   name of the bucket where the restore results will be placed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_prefix</a> - The prefix
--   that is prepended to the restore results for this request.
newS3Location :: BucketName -> Text -> S3Location

-- | The canned ACL to apply to the restore results.
s3Location_cannedACL :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe ObjectCannedACL)

-- | A list of grants that control access to the staged results.
s3Location_accessControlList :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe [Grant])

-- | A list of metadata to store with the restore results in S3.
s3Location_userMetadata :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe [MetadataEntry])

-- | Undocumented member.
s3Location_encryption :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe Encryption)

-- | The class of storage used to store the restore results.
s3Location_storageClass :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | The tag-set that is applied to the restore results.
s3Location_tagging :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe Tagging)

-- | The name of the bucket where the restore results will be placed.
s3Location_bucketName :: Lens' S3Location BucketName

-- | The prefix that is prepended to the restore results for this request.
s3Location_prefix :: Lens' S3Location Text

-- | Container for all error elements.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newS3ServiceError</a> smart constructor.
data S3ServiceError
S3ServiceError' :: Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe ObjectKey -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> S3ServiceError

-- | The version ID of the error.
[$sel:versionId:S3ServiceError'] :: S3ServiceError -> Maybe ObjectVersionId

-- | The error key.
[$sel:key:S3ServiceError'] :: S3ServiceError -> Maybe ObjectKey

-- | The error code is a string that uniquely identifies an error
--   condition. It is meant to be read and understood by programs that
--   detect and handle errors by type.
--   
--   <b>Amazon S3 error codes</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> AccessDenied<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Access
--   Denied</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> AccountProblem<ul><li><i>Description:</i> There is
--   a problem with your Amazon Web Services account that prevents the
--   action from completing successfully. Contact Amazon Web Services
--   Support for further assistance.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403
--   Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> AllAccessDisabled<ul><li><i>Description:</i> All
--   access to this Amazon S3 resource has been disabled. Contact Amazon
--   Web Services Support for further assistance.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   AmbiguousGrantByEmailAddress<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The email
--   address you provided is associated with more than one
--   account.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   AuthorizationHeaderMalformed<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   authorization header you provided is invalid.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i>
--   N/A</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BadDigest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   Content-MD5 you specified did not match what we
--   received.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BucketAlreadyExists<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   requested bucket name is not available. The bucket namespace is shared
--   by all users of the system. Please select a different name and try
--   again.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 409 Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BucketAlreadyOwnedByYou<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   The bucket you tried to create already exists, and you own it. Amazon
--   S3 returns this error in all Amazon Web Services Regions except in the
--   North Virginia Region. For legacy compatibility, if you re-create an
--   existing bucket that you already own in the North Virginia Region,
--   Amazon S3 returns 200 OK and resets the bucket access control lists
--   (ACLs).</li><li><i>Code:</i> 409 Conflict (in all Regions except the
--   North Virginia Region)</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BucketNotEmpty<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   bucket you tried to delete is not empty.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 409 Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> CredentialsNotSupported<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   This request does not support credentials.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   CrossLocationLoggingProhibited<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Cross-location logging not allowed. Buckets in one geographic location
--   cannot log information to a bucket in another
--   location.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403
--   Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> EntityTooSmall<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your
--   proposed upload is smaller than the minimum allowed object
--   size.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> EntityTooLarge<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your
--   proposed upload exceeds the maximum allowed object
--   size.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> ExpiredToken<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   provided token has expired.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   IllegalVersioningConfigurationException<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Indicates that the versioning configuration specified in the request
--   is invalid.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> IncompleteBody<ul><li><i>Description:</i> You did
--   not provide the number of bytes specified by the Content-Length HTTP
--   header</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   IncorrectNumberOfFilesInPostRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> POST
--   requires exactly one file upload per request.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InlineDataTooLarge<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Inline data exceeds the maximum allowed size.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InternalError<ul><li><i>Description:</i> We
--   encountered an internal error. Please try again.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 500 Internal Server Error</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Server</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidAccessKeyId<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   Amazon Web Services access key ID you provided does not exist in our
--   records.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403
--   Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidAddressingHeader<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   You must specify the Anonymous role.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i>
--   N/A</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidArgument<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Invalid

--   The bucket POST must contain the specified field name. If it is

--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:code:S3ServiceError'] :: S3ServiceError -> Maybe Text

-- | The error message contains a generic description of the error
--   condition in English. It is intended for a human audience. Simple
--   programs display the message directly to the end user if they
--   encounter an error condition they don't know how or don't care to
--   handle. Sophisticated programs with more exhaustive error handling and
--   proper internationalization are more likely to ignore the error
--   message.
[$sel:message:S3ServiceError'] :: S3ServiceError -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>S3ServiceError</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:S3ServiceError'</a>, <a>s3ServiceError_versionId</a>
--   - The version ID of the error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:S3ServiceError'</a>, <a>s3ServiceError_key</a> - The error
--   key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:S3ServiceError'</a>, <a>s3ServiceError_code</a> - The
--   error code is a string that uniquely identifies an error condition. It
--   is meant to be read and understood by programs that detect and handle
--   errors by type.
--   
--   <b>Amazon S3 error codes</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> AccessDenied<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Access
--   Denied</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> AccountProblem<ul><li><i>Description:</i> There is
--   a problem with your Amazon Web Services account that prevents the
--   action from completing successfully. Contact Amazon Web Services
--   Support for further assistance.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403
--   Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> AllAccessDisabled<ul><li><i>Description:</i> All
--   access to this Amazon S3 resource has been disabled. Contact Amazon
--   Web Services Support for further assistance.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   AmbiguousGrantByEmailAddress<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The email
--   address you provided is associated with more than one
--   account.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   AuthorizationHeaderMalformed<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   authorization header you provided is invalid.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i>
--   N/A</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BadDigest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   Content-MD5 you specified did not match what we
--   received.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BucketAlreadyExists<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   requested bucket name is not available. The bucket namespace is shared
--   by all users of the system. Please select a different name and try
--   again.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 409 Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BucketAlreadyOwnedByYou<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   The bucket you tried to create already exists, and you own it. Amazon
--   S3 returns this error in all Amazon Web Services Regions except in the
--   North Virginia Region. For legacy compatibility, if you re-create an
--   existing bucket that you already own in the North Virginia Region,
--   Amazon S3 returns 200 OK and resets the bucket access control lists
--   (ACLs).</li><li><i>Code:</i> 409 Conflict (in all Regions except the
--   North Virginia Region)</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BucketNotEmpty<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   bucket you tried to delete is not empty.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 409 Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> CredentialsNotSupported<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   This request does not support credentials.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   CrossLocationLoggingProhibited<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Cross-location logging not allowed. Buckets in one geographic location
--   cannot log information to a bucket in another
--   location.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403
--   Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> EntityTooSmall<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your
--   proposed upload is smaller than the minimum allowed object
--   size.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> EntityTooLarge<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your
--   proposed upload exceeds the maximum allowed object
--   size.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> ExpiredToken<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   provided token has expired.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   IllegalVersioningConfigurationException<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Indicates that the versioning configuration specified in the request
--   is invalid.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> IncompleteBody<ul><li><i>Description:</i> You did
--   not provide the number of bytes specified by the Content-Length HTTP

--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   IncorrectNumberOfFilesInPostRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> POST
--   requires exactly one file upload per request.</li><li><i>HTTP Status

--   Found</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NoSuchVersion<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Indicates

--   Found</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NotImplemented<ul><li><i>Description:</i> A header
--   you provided implies functionality that is not
--   implemented.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 501 Not
--   Implemented</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Server</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NotSignedUp<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your account
--   is not signed up for the Amazon S3 service. You must sign up before
--   you can use Amazon S3. You can sign up at the following URL: <a>Amazon
--   S3</a></li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> OperationAborted<ul><li><i>Description:</i> A
--   conflicting conditional action is currently in progress against this
--   resource. Try again.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 409
--   Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> PermanentRedirect<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   bucket you are attempting to access must be addressed using the
--   specified endpoint. Send all future requests to this
--   endpoint.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 301 Moved
--   Permanently</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> PreconditionFailed<ul><li><i>Description:</i> At
--   least one of the preconditions you specified did not
--   hold.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 412 Precondition
--   Failed</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> Redirect<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Temporary
--   redirect.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 307 Moved
--   Temporarily</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> RestoreAlreadyInProgress<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Object restore is already in progress.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 409 Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   RequestIsNotMultiPartContent<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Bucket POST
--   must be of the enclosure-type multipart/form-data.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> RequestTimeout<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your
--   socket connection to the server was not read from or written to within
--   the timeout period.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> RequestTimeTooSkewed<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   difference between the request time and the server's time is too
--   large.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   RequestTorrentOfBucketError<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Requesting the
--   torrent file of a bucket is not permitted.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> SignatureDoesNotMatch<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   The request signature we calculated does not match the signature you
--   provided. Check your Amazon Web Services secret access key and signing
--   method. For more information, see <a>REST Authentication</a> and
--   <a>SOAP Authentication</a> for details.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> ServiceUnavailable<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Reduce your request rate.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 503 Service
--   Unavailable</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Server</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> SlowDown<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Reduce your
--   request rate.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 503 Slow
--   Down</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Server</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> TemporaryRedirect<ul><li><i>Description:</i> You
--   are being redirected to the bucket while DNS updates.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 307 Moved Temporarily</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> TokenRefreshRequired<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   provided token must be refreshed.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400
--   Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> TooManyBuckets<ul><li><i>Description:</i> You have
--   attempted to create more buckets than allowed.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> UnexpectedContent<ul><li><i>Description:</i> This
--   request does not support content.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400
--   Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   UnresolvableGrantByEmailAddress<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The email
--   address you provided does not match any account on
--   record.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> UserKeyMustBeSpecified<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   The bucket POST must contain the specified field name. If it is
--   specified, check the order of the fields.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:S3ServiceError'</a>, <a>s3ServiceError_message</a> -
--   The error message contains a generic description of the error
--   condition in English. It is intended for a human audience. Simple
--   programs display the message directly to the end user if they
--   encounter an error condition they don't know how or don't care to
--   handle. Sophisticated programs with more exhaustive error handling and
--   proper internationalization are more likely to ignore the error
--   message.
newS3ServiceError :: S3ServiceError

-- | The version ID of the error.
s3ServiceError_versionId :: Lens' S3ServiceError (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | The error key.
s3ServiceError_key :: Lens' S3ServiceError (Maybe ObjectKey)

-- | The error code is a string that uniquely identifies an error
--   condition. It is meant to be read and understood by programs that
--   detect and handle errors by type.
--   
--   <b>Amazon S3 error codes</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> AccessDenied<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Access
--   Denied</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> AccountProblem<ul><li><i>Description:</i> There is
--   a problem with your Amazon Web Services account that prevents the
--   action from completing successfully. Contact Amazon Web Services
--   Support for further assistance.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403
--   Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> AllAccessDisabled<ul><li><i>Description:</i> All
--   access to this Amazon S3 resource has been disabled. Contact Amazon
--   Web Services Support for further assistance.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   AmbiguousGrantByEmailAddress<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The email
--   address you provided is associated with more than one
--   account.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   AuthorizationHeaderMalformed<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   authorization header you provided is invalid.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i>
--   N/A</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BadDigest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   Content-MD5 you specified did not match what we
--   received.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BucketAlreadyExists<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   requested bucket name is not available. The bucket namespace is shared
--   by all users of the system. Please select a different name and try
--   again.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 409 Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BucketAlreadyOwnedByYou<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   The bucket you tried to create already exists, and you own it. Amazon
--   S3 returns this error in all Amazon Web Services Regions except in the
--   North Virginia Region. For legacy compatibility, if you re-create an
--   existing bucket that you already own in the North Virginia Region,
--   Amazon S3 returns 200 OK and resets the bucket access control lists
--   (ACLs).</li><li><i>Code:</i> 409 Conflict (in all Regions except the
--   North Virginia Region)</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BucketNotEmpty<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   bucket you tried to delete is not empty.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 409 Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> CredentialsNotSupported<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   This request does not support credentials.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   CrossLocationLoggingProhibited<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Cross-location logging not allowed. Buckets in one geographic location
--   cannot log information to a bucket in another
--   location.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403
--   Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> EntityTooSmall<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your
--   proposed upload is smaller than the minimum allowed object

--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> EntityTooLarge<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your

--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>

--   specified multipart upload does not exist. The upload ID might be
--   invalid, or the multipart upload might have been aborted or

--   Found</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NoSuchVersion<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Indicates
--   that the version ID specified in the request does not match an
--   existing version.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 404 Not
--   Found</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NotImplemented<ul><li><i>Description:</i> A header
--   you provided implies functionality that is not
--   implemented.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 501 Not
--   Implemented</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Server</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NotSignedUp<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your account
--   is not signed up for the Amazon S3 service. You must sign up before
--   you can use Amazon S3. You can sign up at the following URL: <a>Amazon
--   S3</a></li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> OperationAborted<ul><li><i>Description:</i> A
--   conflicting conditional action is currently in progress against this
--   resource. Try again.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 409
--   Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> PermanentRedirect<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   bucket you are attempting to access must be addressed using the
--   specified endpoint. Send all future requests to this
--   endpoint.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 301 Moved
--   Permanently</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> PreconditionFailed<ul><li><i>Description:</i> At
--   least one of the preconditions you specified did not
--   hold.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 412 Precondition
--   Failed</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> Redirect<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Temporary
--   redirect.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 307 Moved
--   Temporarily</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> RestoreAlreadyInProgress<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Object restore is already in progress.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 409 Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   RequestIsNotMultiPartContent<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Bucket POST
--   must be of the enclosure-type multipart/form-data.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> RequestTimeout<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your
--   socket connection to the server was not read from or written to within

--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> RequestTimeTooSkewed<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   difference between the request time and the server's time is too
--   large.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   RequestTorrentOfBucketError<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Requesting the
--   torrent file of a bucket is not permitted.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> SignatureDoesNotMatch<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   The request signature we calculated does not match the signature you
--   provided. Check your Amazon Web Services secret access key and signing
--   method. For more information, see <a>REST Authentication</a> and
--   <a>SOAP Authentication</a> for details.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> ServiceUnavailable<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Reduce your request rate.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 503 Service
--   Unavailable</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Server</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> SlowDown<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Reduce your
--   request rate.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 503 Slow
--   Down</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Server</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> TemporaryRedirect<ul><li><i>Description:</i> You
--   are being redirected to the bucket while DNS updates.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 307 Moved Temporarily</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> TokenRefreshRequired<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   provided token must be refreshed.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400
--   Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> TooManyBuckets<ul><li><i>Description:</i> You have
--   attempted to create more buckets than allowed.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> UnexpectedContent<ul><li><i>Description:</i> This
--   request does not support content.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400
--   Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   UnresolvableGrantByEmailAddress<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The email
--   address you provided does not match any account on
--   record.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> UserKeyMustBeSpecified<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   The bucket POST must contain the specified field name. If it is
--   specified, check the order of the fields.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
s3ServiceError_code :: Lens' S3ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | The error message contains a generic description of the error
--   condition in English. It is intended for a human audience. Simple
--   programs display the message directly to the end user if they
--   encounter an error condition they don't know how or don't care to
--   handle. Sophisticated programs with more exhaustive error handling and
--   proper internationalization are more likely to ignore the error
--   message.
s3ServiceError_message :: Lens' S3ServiceError (Maybe Text)

newSSES3 :: SSES3

-- | Specifies the byte range of the object to get the records from. A
--   record is processed when its first byte is contained by the range.
--   This parameter is optional, but when specified, it must not be empty.
--   See RFC 2616, Section 14.35.1 about how to specify the start and end
--   of the range.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScanRange</a> smart constructor.
data ScanRange
ScanRange' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> ScanRange

-- | Specifies the start of the byte range. This parameter is optional.
--   Valid values: non-negative integers. The default value is 0. If only
--   start is supplied, it means scan from that point to the end of the
--   file.For example;
--   <tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;start&gt;50&lt;/start&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   means scan from byte 50 until the end of the file.
[$sel:start:ScanRange'] :: ScanRange -> Maybe Integer

-- | Specifies the end of the byte range. This parameter is optional. Valid
--   values: non-negative integers. The default value is one less than the
--   size of the object being queried. If only the End parameter is
--   supplied, it is interpreted to mean scan the last N bytes of the file.
--   For example,
--   <tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;end&gt;50&lt;/end&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   means scan the last 50 bytes.
[$sel:end:ScanRange'] :: ScanRange -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>ScanRange</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:start:ScanRange'</a>, <a>scanRange_start</a> - Specifies the
--   start of the byte range. This parameter is optional. Valid values:
--   non-negative integers. The default value is 0. If only start is
--   supplied, it means scan from that point to the end of the file.For
--   example;
--   <tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;start&gt;50&lt;/start&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   means scan from byte 50 until the end of the file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:end:ScanRange'</a>, <a>scanRange_end</a> - Specifies the end
--   of the byte range. This parameter is optional. Valid values:
--   non-negative integers. The default value is one less than the size of
--   the object being queried. If only the End parameter is supplied, it is
--   interpreted to mean scan the last N bytes of the file. For example,
--   <tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;end&gt;50&lt;/end&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   means scan the last 50 bytes.
newScanRange :: ScanRange

-- | Specifies the start of the byte range. This parameter is optional.
--   Valid values: non-negative integers. The default value is 0. If only
--   start is supplied, it means scan from that point to the end of the
--   file.For example;
--   <tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;start&gt;50&lt;/start&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   means scan from byte 50 until the end of the file.
scanRange_start :: Lens' ScanRange (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies the end of the byte range. This parameter is optional. Valid
--   values: non-negative integers. The default value is one less than the
--   size of the object being queried. If only the End parameter is
--   supplied, it is interpreted to mean scan the last N bytes of the file.
--   For example,
--   <tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;end&gt;50&lt;/end&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   means scan the last 50 bytes.
scanRange_end :: Lens' ScanRange (Maybe Integer)

[$sel:outputSerialization:SelectParameters'] :: SelectParameters -> OutputSerialization

--   omitted.

selectParameters_outputSerialization :: Lens' SelectParameters OutputSerialization

-- | Describes the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects
--   in the bucket. If a PUT Object request doesn't specify any server-side
--   encryption, this default encryption will be applied. For more
--   information, see <a>PUT Bucket encryption</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 API
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServerSideEncryptionByDefault</a> smart constructor.
data ServerSideEncryptionByDefault
ServerSideEncryptionByDefault' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> ServerSideEncryption -> ServerSideEncryptionByDefault

-- | Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) customer Amazon Web
--   Services KMS key ID to use for the default encryption. This parameter
--   is allowed if and only if <tt>SSEAlgorithm</tt> is set to
--   <tt>aws:kms</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   KMS key. However, if you are using encryption with cross-account
--   operations, you must use a fully qualified KMS key ARN. For more
--   information, see <a>Using encryption for cross-account operations</a>.
--   
--   <b>For example:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Amazon S3 only supports symmetric KMS keys and not asymmetric KMS
--   keys. For more information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric
--   keys</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services Key Management Service
--   Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:kmsMasterKeyID:ServerSideEncryptionByDefault'] :: ServerSideEncryptionByDefault -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Server-side encryption algorithm to use for the default encryption.
[$sel:sSEAlgorithm:ServerSideEncryptionByDefault'] :: ServerSideEncryptionByDefault -> ServerSideEncryption

-- | Create a value of <a>ServerSideEncryptionByDefault</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsMasterKeyID:ServerSideEncryptionByDefault'</a>,
--   <a>serverSideEncryptionByDefault_kmsMasterKeyID</a> - Amazon Web
--   Services Key Management Service (KMS) customer Amazon Web Services KMS
--   key ID to use for the default encryption. This parameter is allowed if
--   and only if <tt>SSEAlgorithm</tt> is set to <tt>aws:kms</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   KMS key. However, if you are using encryption with cross-account
--   operations, you must use a fully qualified KMS key ARN. For more
--   information, see <a>Using encryption for cross-account operations</a>.
--   
--   <b>For example:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Amazon S3 only supports symmetric KMS keys and not asymmetric KMS
--   keys. For more information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric
--   keys</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services Key Management Service
--   Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSEAlgorithm:ServerSideEncryptionByDefault'</a>,
--   <a>serverSideEncryptionByDefault_sSEAlgorithm</a> - Server-side
--   encryption algorithm to use for the default encryption.
newServerSideEncryptionByDefault :: ServerSideEncryption -> ServerSideEncryptionByDefault

-- | Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) customer Amazon Web
--   Services KMS key ID to use for the default encryption. This parameter
--   is allowed if and only if <tt>SSEAlgorithm</tt> is set to
--   <tt>aws:kms</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   KMS key. However, if you are using encryption with cross-account
--   operations, you must use a fully qualified KMS key ARN. For more
--   information, see <a>Using encryption for cross-account operations</a>.
--   
--   <b>For example:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Amazon S3 only supports symmetric KMS keys and not asymmetric KMS
--   keys. For more information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric
--   keys</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services Key Management Service
--   Developer Guide</i>.
serverSideEncryptionByDefault_kmsMasterKeyID :: Lens' ServerSideEncryptionByDefault (Maybe Text)

-- | Server-side encryption algorithm to use for the default encryption.
serverSideEncryptionByDefault_sSEAlgorithm :: Lens' ServerSideEncryptionByDefault ServerSideEncryption

data ServerSideEncryptionRule
ServerSideEncryptionRule' :: Maybe ServerSideEncryptionByDefault -> Maybe Bool -> ServerSideEncryptionRule

-- | Specifies the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects
--   in the bucket. If a PUT Object request doesn't specify any server-side
--   encryption, this default encryption will be applied.
[$sel:applyServerSideEncryptionByDefault:ServerSideEncryptionRule'] :: ServerSideEncryptionRule -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionByDefault

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should use an S3 Bucket Key with
--   server-side encryption using KMS (SSE-KMS) for new objects in the
--   bucket. Existing objects are not affected. Setting the
--   <tt>BucketKeyEnabled</tt> element to <tt>true</tt> causes Amazon S3 to
--   use an S3 Bucket Key. By default, S3 Bucket Key is not enabled.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon S3 Bucket Keys</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:ServerSideEncryptionRule'] :: ServerSideEncryptionRule -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ServerSideEncryptionRule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   Specifies the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects
--   in the bucket. If a PUT Object request doesn't specify any server-side
--   encryption, this default encryption will be applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:ServerSideEncryptionRule'</a>,
--   <a>serverSideEncryptionRule_bucketKeyEnabled</a> - Specifies whether
--   Amazon S3 should use an S3 Bucket Key with server-side encryption
--   using KMS (SSE-KMS) for new objects in the bucket. Existing objects
--   are not affected. Setting the <tt>BucketKeyEnabled</tt> element to
--   <tt>true</tt> causes Amazon S3 to use an S3 Bucket Key. By default, S3
--   Bucket Key is not enabled.

--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.

-- | A container that describes additional filters for identifying the
--   source objects that you want to replicate. You can choose to enable or
--   disable the replication of these objects. Currently, Amazon S3
--   supports only the filter that you can specify for objects created with
--   server-side encryption using a customer managed key stored in Amazon
--   Web Services Key Management Service (SSE-KMS).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSourceSelectionCriteria</a> smart constructor.
data SourceSelectionCriteria
SourceSelectionCriteria' :: Maybe ReplicaModifications -> Maybe SseKmsEncryptedObjects -> SourceSelectionCriteria

-- | A filter that you can specify for selections for modifications on
--   replicas. Amazon S3 doesn't replicate replica modifications by
--   default. In the latest version of replication configuration (when
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is specified), you can specify this element and set
--   the status to <tt>Enabled</tt> to replicate modifications on replicas.
--   
--   If you don't specify the <tt>Filter</tt> element, Amazon S3 assumes
--   that the replication configuration is the earlier version, V1. In the
--   earlier version, this element is not allowed
[$sel:replicaModifications:SourceSelectionCriteria'] :: SourceSelectionCriteria -> Maybe ReplicaModifications

-- | A container for filter information for the selection of Amazon S3
--   objects encrypted with Amazon Web Services KMS. If you include
--   <tt>SourceSelectionCriteria</tt> in the replication configuration,
--   this element is required.
[$sel:sseKmsEncryptedObjects:SourceSelectionCriteria'] :: SourceSelectionCriteria -> Maybe SseKmsEncryptedObjects

-- | Create a value of <a>SourceSelectionCriteria</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--
