-- | Sets the <tt>cors</tt> configuration for your bucket. If the
--   configuration exists, Amazon S3 replaces it.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must be allowed to perform the
--   <tt>s3:PutBucketCORS</tt> action. By default, the bucket owner has
--   this permission and can grant it to others.
--   
--   You set this configuration on a bucket so that the bucket can service
--   cross-origin requests. For example, you might want to enable a request
--   whose origin is <tt>http://www.example.com</tt> to access your Amazon
--   S3 bucket at <tt>my.example.bucket.com</tt> by using the browser's
--   <tt>XMLHttpRequest</tt> capability.
--   
--   To enable cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) on a bucket, you add
--   the <tt>cors</tt> subresource to the bucket. The <tt>cors</tt>
--   subresource is an XML document in which you configure rules that
--   identify origins and the HTTP methods that can be executed on your
--   bucket. The document is limited to 64 KB in size.
--   
--   When Amazon S3 receives a cross-origin request (or a pre-flight
--   OPTIONS request) against a bucket, it evaluates the <tt>cors</tt>
--   configuration on the bucket and uses the first <tt>CORSRule</tt> rule
--   that matches the incoming browser request to enable a cross-origin
--   request. For a rule to match, the following conditions must be met:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The request's <tt>Origin</tt> header must match
--   <tt>AllowedOrigin</tt> elements.</li>
--   <li>The request method (for example, GET, PUT, HEAD, and so on) or the
--   <tt>Access-Control-Request-Method</tt> header in case of a pre-flight
--   <tt>OPTIONS</tt> request must be one of the <tt>AllowedMethod</tt>
--   elements.</li>
--   <li>Every header specified in the
--   <tt>Access-Control-Request-Headers</tt> request header of a pre-flight
--   request must match an <tt>AllowedHeader</tt> element.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about CORS, go to <a>Enabling Cross-Origin
--   Resource Sharing</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <b>Related Resources</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetBucketCors</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketCors</a></li>
--   <li><a>RESTOPTIONSobject</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.PutBucketCors

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutBucketCors</a> smart constructor.
data PutBucketCors
PutBucketCors' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> CORSConfiguration -> PutBucketCors

-- | The base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the data. This header must be
--   used as a message integrity check to verify that the request body was
--   not corrupted in transit. For more information, go to <a>RFC 1864.</a>
--   
--   For requests made using the Amazon Web Services Command Line Interface
--   (CLI) or Amazon Web Services SDKs, this field is calculated
--   automatically.

--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.

-- | Describes the cross-origin access configuration for objects in an
--   Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see <a>Enabling Cross-Origin
--   Resource Sharing</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:cORSConfiguration:PutBucketCors'] :: PutBucketCors -> CORSConfiguration

--   1864.</a>
--   
--   For requests made using the Amazon Web Services Command Line Interface
--   (CLI) or Amazon Web Services SDKs, this field is calculated
--   automatically.

--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:PutBucketCors'</a>,

--   expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account,
--   the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.

-- | Sets an analytics configuration for the bucket (specified by the
--   analytics configuration ID). You can have up to 1,000 analytics
--   configurations per bucket.
--   
--   You can choose to have storage class analysis export analysis reports
--   sent to a comma-separated values (CSV) flat file. See the
--   <tt>DataExport</tt> request element. Reports are updated daily and are
--   based on the object filters that you configure. When selecting data
--   export, you specify a destination bucket and an optional destination
--   prefix where the file is written. You can export the data to a
--   destination bucket in a different account. However, the destination
--   bucket must be in the same Region as the bucket that you are making
--   the PUT analytics configuration to. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon S3 Analytics – Storage Class Analysis</a>.
--   
--   You must create a bucket policy on the destination bucket where the
--   exported file is written to grant permissions to Amazon S3 to write
--   objects to the bucket. For an example policy, see <a>Granting
--   Permissions for Amazon S3 Inventory and Storage Class Analysis</a>.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permissions to perform the
--   <tt>s3:PutAnalyticsConfiguration</tt> action. The bucket owner has
--   this permission by default. The bucket owner can grant this permission
--   to others. For more information about permissions, see <a>Permissions
--   Related to Bucket Subresource Operations</a> and <a>Managing Access
--   Permissions to Your Amazon S3 Resources</a>.
--   
--   <b>Special Errors</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>- <i>HTTP Error: HTTP 400 Bad Request</i><ul><li><i>Code:
--   InvalidArgument</i></li><li><i>Cause: Invalid
--   argument.</i></li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>HTTP Error: HTTP 400 Bad Request</i><ul><li><i>Code:
--   TooManyConfigurations</i></li><li>/Cause: You are attempting to create
--   a new configuration but have already reached the 1,000-configuration
--   limit./</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>HTTP Error: HTTP 403 Forbidden</i><ul><li><i>Code:
--   AccessDenied</i></li><li>/Cause: You are not the owner of the
--   specified bucket, or you do not have the s3:PutAnalyticsConfiguration
--   bucket permission to set the configuration on the
--   bucket./</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>Related Resources</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketAnalyticsConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.PutBucketAnalyticsConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutBucketAnalyticsConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | Sets the permissions on an existing bucket using access control lists
--   (ACL). For more information, see <a>Using ACLs</a>. To set the ACL of
--   a bucket, you must have <tt>WRITE_ACP</tt> permission.
--   
--   You can use one of the following two ways to set a bucket's
--   permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify the ACL in the request body</li>
--   <li>Specify permissions using request headers</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You cannot specify access permission using both the body and the
--   request headers.
--   
--   Depending on your application needs, you may choose to set the ACL on
--   a bucket using either the request body or the headers. For example, if
--   you have an existing application that updates a bucket ACL using the
--   request body, then you can continue to use that approach.
--   
--   <b>Access Permissions</b>
--   
--   You can set access permissions using one of the following methods:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify a canned ACL with the <tt>x-amz-acl</tt> request header.
--   Amazon S3 supports a set of predefined ACLs, known as <i>canned
--   ACLs</i>. Each canned ACL has a predefined set of grantees and
--   permissions. Specify the canned ACL name as the value of
--   <tt>x-amz-acl</tt>. If you use this header, you cannot use other
--   access control-specific headers in your request. For more information,
--   see <a>Canned ACL</a>.</li>
--   <li>Specify access permissions explicitly with the
--   <tt>x-amz-grant-read</tt>, <tt>x-amz-grant-read-acp</tt>,
--   <tt>x-amz-grant-write-acp</tt>, and <tt>x-amz-grant-full-control</tt>
--   headers. When using these headers, you specify explicit access
--   permissions and grantees (Amazon Web Services accounts or Amazon S3
--   groups) who will receive the permission. If you use these ACL-specific
--   headers, you cannot use the <tt>x-amz-acl</tt> header to set a canned
--   ACL. These parameters map to the set of permissions that Amazon S3
--   supports in an ACL. For more information, see <a>Access Control List
--   (ACL) Overview</a>.You specify each grantee as a type=value pair,
--   where the type is one of the following:<ul><li><tt>id</tt> – if the
--   value specified is the canonical user ID of an Amazon Web Services
--   account</li><li><tt>uri</tt> – if you are granting permissions to a
--   predefined group</li><li><tt>emailAddress</tt> – if the value
--   specified is the email address of an Amazon Web Services accountUsing
--   email addresses to specify a grantee is only supported in the
--   following Amazon Web Services Regions:<ul><li>US East (N.
--   Virginia)</li><li>US West (N. California)</li><li>US West
--   (Oregon)</li><li>Asia Pacific (Singapore)</li><li>Asia Pacific
--   (Sydney)</li><li>Asia Pacific (Tokyo)</li><li>Europe
--   (Ireland)</li><li>South America (São Paulo)</li></ul>For a list of all
--   the Amazon S3 supported Regions and endpoints, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a> in the Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference.</li></ul>For example, the following
--   <tt>x-amz-grant-write</tt> header grants create, overwrite, and delete
--   objects permission to LogDelivery group predefined by Amazon S3 and
--   two Amazon Web Services accounts identified by their email
--   addresses.<pre>x-amz-grant-write:
--   uri="http://acs.amazonaws.com/groups/s3/LogDelivery",
--   id="111122223333", id="555566667777"</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You can use either a canned ACL or specify access permissions
--   explicitly. You cannot do both.
--   
--   <b>Grantee Values</b>
--   
--   You can specify the person (grantee) to whom you're assigning access
--   rights (using request elements) in the following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>By the person's ID:<pre>&lt;Grantee
--   xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
--   xsi:type="CanonicalUser"&gt;&lt;ID&gt;&lt;&gt;ID&lt;&gt;&lt;/ID&gt;&lt;DisplayName&gt;&lt;&gt;GranteesEmail&lt;&gt;&lt;/DisplayName&gt;
--   &lt;/Grantee&gt;</pre>DisplayName is optional and ignored in the
--   request</li>
--   <li>By URI:<pre>&lt;Grantee
--   xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
--   xsi:type="Group"&gt;&lt;URI&gt;&lt;&gt;http://acs.amazonaws.com/groups/global/AuthenticatedUsers&lt;&gt;&lt;/URI&gt;&lt;/Grantee&gt;</pre></li>
--   <li>By Email address:<pre>&lt;Grantee
--   xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
--   xsi:type="AmazonCustomerByEmail"&gt;&lt;EmailAddress&gt;&lt;&gt;Grantees@email.com&lt;&gt;&lt;/EmailAddress&gt;lt;/Grantee&gt;</pre>The
--   grantee is resolved to the CanonicalUser and, in a response to a GET
--   Object acl request, appears as the CanonicalUser.Using email addresses
--   to specify a grantee is only supported in the following Amazon Web
--   Services Regions:<ul><li>US East (N. Virginia)</li><li>US West (N.
--   California)</li><li>US West (Oregon)</li><li>Asia Pacific
--   (Singapore)</li><li>Asia Pacific (Sydney)</li><li>Asia Pacific
--   (Tokyo)</li><li>Europe (Ireland)</li><li>South America (São
--   Paulo)</li></ul>For a list of all the Amazon S3 supported Regions and
--   endpoints, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a> in the Amazon Web Services
--   General Reference.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>Related Resources</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>CreateBucket</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucket</a></li>
--   <li><a>GetObjectAcl</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.PutBucketAcl

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutBucketAcl</a> smart constructor.
data PutBucketAcl
PutBucketAcl' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AccessControlPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BucketCannedACL -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> PutBucketAcl

-- | Allows grantee to read the bucket ACL.
[$sel:grantReadACP:PutBucketAcl'] :: PutBucketAcl -> Maybe Text

-- | Allows grantee to write the ACL for the applicable bucket.
[$sel:grantWriteACP:PutBucketAcl'] :: PutBucketAcl -> Maybe Text

-- | Allows grantee to list the objects in the bucket.
[$sel:grantRead:PutBucketAcl'] :: PutBucketAcl -> Maybe Text

-- | Allows grantee the read, write, read ACP, and write ACP permissions on
--   the bucket.
[$sel:grantFullControl:PutBucketAcl'] :: PutBucketAcl -> Maybe Text

-- | The base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the data. This header must be
--   used as a message integrity check to verify that the request body was
--   not corrupted in transit. For more information, go to <a>RFC 1864.</a>
--   
--   For requests made using the Amazon Web Services Command Line Interface
--   (CLI) or Amazon Web Services SDKs, this field is calculated
--   automatically.
[$sel:contentMD5:PutBucketAcl'] :: PutBucketAcl -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains the elements that set the ACL permissions for an object per
--   grantee.
[$sel:accessControlPolicy:PutBucketAcl'] :: PutBucketAcl -> Maybe AccessControlPolicy

-- | Allows grantee to create new objects in the bucket.
--   
--   For the bucket and object owners of existing objects, also allows
--   deletions and overwrites of those objects.
[$sel:grantWrite:PutBucketAcl'] :: PutBucketAcl -> Maybe Text

-- | The canned ACL to apply to the bucket.
[$sel:acl:PutBucketAcl'] :: PutBucketAcl -> Maybe BucketCannedACL

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:PutBucketAcl'] :: PutBucketAcl -> Maybe Text

-- | The bucket to which to apply the ACL.
[$sel:bucket:PutBucketAcl'] :: PutBucketAcl -> BucketName

-- | Create a value of <a>PutBucketAcl</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

-- | Sets the accelerate configuration of an existing bucket. Amazon S3
--   Transfer Acceleration is a bucket-level feature that enables you to
--   perform faster data transfers to Amazon S3.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permission to perform the
--   s3:PutAccelerateConfiguration action. The bucket owner has this
--   permission by default. The bucket owner can grant this permission to
--   others. For more information about permissions, see <a>Permissions
--   Related to Bucket Subresource Operations</a> and <a>Managing Access
--   Permissions to Your Amazon S3 Resources</a>.
--   
--   The Transfer Acceleration state of a bucket can be set to one of the
--   following two values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Enabled – Enables accelerated data transfers to the bucket.</li>
--   <li>Suspended – Disables accelerated data transfers to the
--   bucket.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The <a>GetBucketAccelerateConfiguration</a> action returns the
--   transfer acceleration state of a bucket.
--   
--   After setting the Transfer Acceleration state of a bucket to Enabled,
--   it might take up to thirty minutes before the data transfer rates to
--   the bucket increase.
--   
--   The name of the bucket used for Transfer Acceleration must be
--   DNS-compliant and must not contain periods (".").
--   
--   For more information about transfer acceleration, see <a>Transfer
--   Acceleration</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to
--   <tt>PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetBucketAccelerateConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>CreateBucket</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutBucketAccelerateConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration
PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> BucketName -> AccelerateConfiguration -> PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration'] :: PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bucket for which the accelerate configuration is set.
[$sel:bucket:PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration'] :: PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration -> BucketName

-- | Container for setting the transfer acceleration state.
[$sel:accelerateConfiguration:PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration'] :: PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration -> AccelerateConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBucketAccelerateConfiguration_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The
--   account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a
--   different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access
--   Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBucketAccelerateConfiguration_bucket</a> - The name of the
--   bucket for which the accelerate configuration is set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accelerateConfiguration:PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>putBucketAccelerateConfiguration_accelerateConfiguration</a> -
--   Container for setting the transfer acceleration state.
newPutBucketAccelerateConfiguration :: BucketName -> AccelerateConfiguration -> PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration

--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.

-- | Lists the parts that have been uploaded for a specific multipart
--   upload. This operation must include the upload ID, which you obtain by
--   sending the initiate multipart upload request (see
--   <a>CreateMultipartUpload</a>). This request returns a maximum of 1,000
--   uploaded parts. The default number of parts returned is 1,000 parts.
--   You can restrict the number of parts returned by specifying the
--   <tt>max-parts</tt> request parameter. If your multipart upload
--   consists of more than 1,000 parts, the response returns an
--   <tt>IsTruncated</tt> field with the value of true, and a
--   <tt>NextPartNumberMarker</tt> element. In subsequent
--   <tt>ListParts</tt> requests you can include the part-number-marker
--   query string parameter and set its value to the
--   <tt>NextPartNumberMarker</tt> field value from the previous response.
--   
--   For more information on multipart uploads, see <a>Uploading Objects
--   Using Multipart Upload</a>.
--   
--   For information on permissions required to use the multipart upload
--   API, see <a>Multipart Upload and Permissions</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>ListParts</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>CreateMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>UploadPart</a></li>
--   <li><a>CompleteMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>AbortMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListMultipartUploads</a></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.S3.ListParts

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListParts</a> smart constructor.
data ListParts
ListParts' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ObjectKey -> Text -> ListParts

-- | Sets the maximum number of parts to return.
[$sel:maxParts:ListParts'] :: ListParts -> Maybe Int
[$sel:requestPayer:ListParts'] :: ListParts -> Maybe RequestPayer

-- | Specifies the part after which listing should begin. Only parts with
--   higher part numbers will be listed.
[$sel:partNumberMarker:ListParts'] :: ListParts -> Maybe Int

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:ListParts'] :: ListParts -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bucket to which the parts are being uploaded.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:ListParts'] :: ListParts -> BucketName

-- | Object key for which the multipart upload was initiated.
[$sel:key:ListParts'] :: ListParts -> ObjectKey

-- | Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose parts are being
--   listed.
[$sel:uploadId:ListParts'] :: ListParts -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListParts</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxParts:ListParts'</a>, <a>listParts_maxParts</a> - Sets the
--   maximum number of parts to return.

--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partNumberMarker:ListParts'</a>,
--   <a>listParts_partNumberMarker</a> - Specifies the part after which
--   listing should begin. Only parts with higher part numbers will be
--   listed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:ListParts'</a>,

--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.

--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.

--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.

--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the

--   which the multipart upload was initiated.

--   identifying the multipart upload whose parts are being listed.

--   higher part numbers will be listed.

--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
listParts_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' ListParts (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the bucket to which the parts are being uploaded.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
listParts_bucket :: Lens' ListParts BucketName

-- | Object key for which the multipart upload was initiated.
listParts_key :: Lens' ListParts ObjectKey

-- | Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose parts are being
--   listed.
listParts_uploadId :: Lens' ListParts Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPartsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListPartsResponse
ListPartsResponse' :: Maybe [Part] -> Maybe RequestCharged -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Initiator -> Maybe BucketName -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Owner -> Maybe ObjectKey -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ListPartsResponse

-- | Container for elements related to a particular part. A response can
--   contain zero or more <tt>Part</tt> elements.
[$sel:parts:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe [Part]
[$sel:requestCharged:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe RequestCharged

-- | Maximum number of parts that were allowed in the response.
[$sel:maxParts:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | Container element that identifies who initiated the multipart upload.
--   If the initiator is an Amazon Web Services account, this element
--   provides the same information as the <tt>Owner</tt> element. If the
--   initiator is an IAM User, this element provides the user ARN and
--   display name.
[$sel:initiator:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe Initiator

-- | The name of the bucket to which the multipart upload was initiated.
--   Does not return the access point ARN or access point alias if used.
[$sel:bucket:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe BucketName

-- | If the bucket has a lifecycle rule configured with an action to abort
--   incomplete multipart uploads and the prefix in the lifecycle rule
--   matches the object name in the request, then the response includes
--   this header indicating when the initiated multipart upload will become
--   eligible for abort operation. For more information, see <a>Aborting
--   Incomplete Multipart Uploads Using a Bucket Lifecycle Policy</a>.
--   
--   The response will also include the <tt>x-amz-abort-rule-id</tt> header
--   that will provide the ID of the lifecycle configuration rule that
--   defines this action.
[$sel:abortDate:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | When a list is truncated, this element specifies the last part in the
--   list, as well as the value to use for the part-number-marker request
--   parameter in a subsequent request.
[$sel:nextPartNumberMarker:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | This header is returned along with the <tt>x-amz-abort-date</tt>
--   header. It identifies applicable lifecycle configuration rule that
--   defines the action to abort incomplete multipart uploads.
[$sel:abortRuleId:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Container element that identifies the object owner, after the object
--   is created. If multipart upload is initiated by an IAM user, this
--   element provides the parent account ID and display name.
[$sel:owner:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe Owner

-- | Object key for which the multipart upload was initiated.
[$sel:key:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe ObjectKey

-- | Class of storage (STANDARD or REDUCED_REDUNDANCY) used to store the
--   uploaded object.
[$sel:storageClass:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe StorageClass

-- | Indicates whether the returned list of parts is truncated. A true
--   value indicates that the list was truncated. A list can be truncated
--   if the number of parts exceeds the limit returned in the MaxParts
--   element.
[$sel:isTruncated:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | When a list is truncated, this element specifies the last part in the
--   list, as well as the value to use for the part-number-marker request
--   parameter in a subsequent request.
[$sel:partNumberMarker:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose parts are being
--   listed.
[$sel:uploadId:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListPartsResponse'] :: ListPartsResponse -> Int

-- | Returns some or all (up to 1,000) of the objects in a bucket with each
--   request. You can use the request parameters as selection criteria to
--   return a subset of the objects in a bucket. A <tt>200 OK</tt> response
--   can contain valid or invalid XML. Make sure to design your application
--   to parse the contents of the response and handle it appropriately.
--   Objects are returned sorted in an ascending order of the respective
--   key names in the list. For more information about listing objects, see
--   <a>Listing object keys programmatically</a>
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have READ access to the bucket.
--   
--   To use this action in an Identity and Access Management (IAM) policy,
--   you must have permissions to perform the <tt>s3:ListBucket</tt>
--   action. The bucket owner has this permission by default and can grant
--   this permission to others. For more information about permissions, see
--   <a>Permissions Related to Bucket Subresource Operations</a> and
--   <a>Managing Access Permissions to Your Amazon S3 Resources</a>.
--   
--   This section describes the latest revision of this action. We
--   recommend that you use this revised API for application development.
--   For backward compatibility, Amazon S3 continues to support the prior
--   version of this API, <a>ListObjects</a>.
--   
--   To get a list of your buckets, see <a>ListBuckets</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>ListObjectsV2</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetObject</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutObject</a></li>
--   <li><a>CreateBucket</a></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.S3.ListObjectsV2

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListObjectsV2</a> smart constructor.

--   S3 starts listing after this specified key. StartAfter can be any key
--   in the bucket.

-- | ContinuationToken indicates Amazon S3 that the list is being continued
--   on this bucket with a token. ContinuationToken is obfuscated and is
--   not a real key.
[$sel:continuationToken:ListObjectsV2'] :: ListObjectsV2 -> Maybe Text

-- | The owner field is not present in listV2 by default, if you want to
--   return owner field with each key in the result then set the fetch
--   owner field to true.
[$sel:fetchOwner:ListObjectsV2'] :: ListObjectsV2 -> Maybe Bool

-- | Limits the response to keys that begin with the specified prefix.
[$sel:prefix:ListObjectsV2'] :: ListObjectsV2 -> Maybe Text

-- | Encoding type used by Amazon S3 to encode object keys in the response.

-- | Confirms that the requester knows that she or he will be charged for
--   the list objects request in V2 style. Bucket owners need not specify
--   this parameter in their requests.

--   the action returns up to 1,000 key names. The response might contain
--   fewer keys but will never contain more.

--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.

-- | Bucket name to list.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListObjectsV2Response</a> smart constructor.
data ListObjectsV2Response
ListObjectsV2Response' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Object] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [CommonPrefix] -> Maybe EncodingType -> Maybe BucketName -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Delimiter -> Int -> ListObjectsV2Response

-- | If StartAfter was sent with the request, it is included in the
--   response.
[$sel:startAfter:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Maybe Text

-- | KeyCount is the number of keys returned with this request. KeyCount
--   will always be less than or equals to MaxKeys field. Say you ask for
--   50 keys, your result will include less than equals 50 keys
[$sel:keyCount:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Maybe Int

-- | Metadata about each object returned.
[$sel:contents:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Maybe [Object]

-- | If ContinuationToken was sent with the request, it is included in the
--   response.
[$sel:continuationToken:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Maybe Text

-- | Keys that begin with the indicated prefix.
[$sel:prefix:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Maybe Text

-- | All of the keys (up to 1,000) rolled up into a common prefix count as
--   a single return when calculating the number of returns.
--   
--   A response can contain <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> only if you specify a
--   delimiter.
--   
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> contains all (if there are any) keys between
--   <tt>Prefix</tt> and the next occurrence of the string specified by a
--   delimiter.
--   
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> lists keys that act like subdirectories in the
--   directory specified by <tt>Prefix</tt>.
--   
--   For example, if the prefix is <tt>notes/</tt> and the delimiter is a
--   slash (<tt>/</tt>) as in <tt>notes/summer/july</tt>, the common prefix
--   is <tt>notes/summer/</tt>. All of the keys that roll up into a common
--   prefix count as a single return when calculating the number of
--   returns.
[$sel:commonPrefixes:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Maybe [CommonPrefix]

-- | Encoding type used by Amazon S3 to encode object key names in the XML
--   response.
--   
--   If you specify the encoding-type request parameter, Amazon S3 includes
--   this element in the response, and returns encoded key name values in
--   the following response elements:
--   
--   <tt>Delimiter, Prefix, Key,</tt> and <tt>StartAfter</tt>.
[$sel:encodingType:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Maybe EncodingType

-- | The bucket name.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:name:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Maybe BucketName

-- | <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt> is sent when <tt>isTruncated</tt> is
--   true, which means there are more keys in the bucket that can be
--   listed. The next list requests to Amazon S3 can be continued with this
--   <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt>. <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt> is
--   obfuscated and is not a real key
[$sel:nextContinuationToken:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Maybe Text

-- | Sets the maximum number of keys returned in the response. By default
--   the action returns up to 1,000 key names. The response might contain
--   fewer keys but will never contain more.
[$sel:maxKeys:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Maybe Int

-- | Set to false if all of the results were returned. Set to true if more
--   keys are available to return. If the number of results exceeds that
--   specified by MaxKeys, all of the results might not be returned.
[$sel:isTruncated:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Maybe Bool

-- | Causes keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the
--   first occurrence of the delimiter to be rolled up into a single result
--   element in the CommonPrefixes collection. These rolled-up keys are not
--   returned elsewhere in the response. Each rolled-up result counts as
--   only one return against the <tt>MaxKeys</tt> value.
[$sel:delimiter:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Maybe Delimiter

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListObjectsV2Response'] :: ListObjectsV2Response -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListObjectsV2Response</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startAfter:ListObjectsV2'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_startAfter</a> - If StartAfter was sent with
--   the request, it is included in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyCount:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_keyCount</a> - KeyCount is the number of keys
--   returned with this request. KeyCount will always be less than or
--   equals to MaxKeys field. Say you ask for 50 keys, your result will
--   include less than equals 50 keys
--   
--   <a>$sel:contents:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_contents</a> - Metadata about each object
--   returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:continuationToken:ListObjectsV2'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_continuationToken</a> - If ContinuationToken
--   was sent with the request, it is included in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ListObjectsV2'</a>, <a>listObjectsV2Response_prefix</a>
--   - Keys that begin with the indicated prefix.
--   
--   <a>$sel:commonPrefixes:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_commonPrefixes</a> - All of the keys (up to
--   1,000) rolled up into a common prefix count as a single return when
--   calculating the number of returns.
--   
--   A response can contain <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> only if you specify a
--   delimiter.
--   
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> contains all (if there are any) keys between
--   <tt>Prefix</tt> and the next occurrence of the string specified by a
--   delimiter.
--   
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> lists keys that act like subdirectories in the
--   directory specified by <tt>Prefix</tt>.
--   
--   For example, if the prefix is <tt>notes/</tt> and the delimiter is a
--   slash (<tt>/</tt>) as in <tt>notes/summer/july</tt>, the common prefix
--   is <tt>notes/summer/</tt>. All of the keys that roll up into a common
--   prefix count as a single return when calculating the number of
--   returns.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encodingType:ListObjectsV2'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_encodingType</a> - Encoding type used by
--   Amazon S3 to encode object key names in the XML response.
--   
--   If you specify the encoding-type request parameter, Amazon S3 includes
--   this element in the response, and returns encoded key name values in
--   the following response elements:
--   
--   <tt>Delimiter, Prefix, Key,</tt> and <tt>StartAfter</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_name</a> - The bucket name.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextContinuationToken:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_nextContinuationToken</a> -
--   <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt> is sent when <tt>isTruncated</tt> is
--   true, which means there are more keys in the bucket that can be
--   listed. The next list requests to Amazon S3 can be continued with this
--   <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt>. <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt> is
--   obfuscated and is not a real key
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxKeys:ListObjectsV2'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_maxKeys</a> - Sets the maximum number of keys
--   returned in the response. By default the action returns up to 1,000
--   key names. The response might contain fewer keys but will never
--   contain more.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isTruncated:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_isTruncated</a> - Set to false if all of the
--   results were returned. Set to true if more keys are available to
--   return. If the number of results exceeds that specified by MaxKeys,
--   all of the results might not be returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:delimiter:ListObjectsV2'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_delimiter</a> - Causes keys that contain the
--   same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the
--   delimiter to be rolled up into a single result element in the
--   CommonPrefixes collection. These rolled-up keys are not returned
--   elsewhere in the response. Each rolled-up result counts as only one
--   return against the <tt>MaxKeys</tt> value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.

-- | Returns some or all (up to 1,000) of the objects in a bucket. You can
--   use the request parameters as selection criteria to return a subset of
--   the objects in a bucket. A 200 OK response can contain valid or
--   invalid XML. Be sure to design your application to parse the contents
--   of the response and handle it appropriately.
--   
--   This action has been revised. We recommend that you use the newer
--   version, <a>ListObjectsV2</a>, when developing applications. For
--   backward compatibility, Amazon S3 continues to support
--   <tt>ListObjects</tt>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>ListObjects</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ListObjectsV2</a></li>
--   <li><a>GetObject</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutObject</a></li>
--   <li><a>CreateBucket</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListBuckets</a></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.S3.ListObjects

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListObjects</a> smart constructor.
data ListObjects
ListObjects' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EncodingType -> Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Delimiter -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ListObjects

[$sel:prefix:ListObjects'] :: ListObjects -> Maybe Text
[$sel:encodingType:ListObjects'] :: ListObjects -> Maybe EncodingType

-- | Confirms that the requester knows that she or he will be charged for
--   the list objects request. Bucket owners need not specify this
--   parameter in their requests.
[$sel:requestPayer:ListObjects'] :: ListObjects -> Maybe RequestPayer

-- | Marker is where you want Amazon S3 to start listing from. Amazon S3
--   starts listing after this specified key. Marker can be any key in the
--   bucket.
[$sel:marker:ListObjects'] :: ListObjects -> Maybe Text

-- | Sets the maximum number of keys returned in the response. By default
--   the action returns up to 1,000 key names. The response might contain
--   fewer keys but will never contain more.

-- | A delimiter is a character you use to group keys.

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:ListObjects'] :: ListObjects -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bucket containing the objects.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListObjectsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListObjectsResponse
ListObjectsResponse' :: Maybe [Object] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [CommonPrefix] -> Maybe EncodingType -> Maybe BucketName -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Delimiter -> Int -> ListObjectsResponse

-- | Metadata about each object returned.
[$sel:contents:ListObjectsResponse'] :: ListObjectsResponse -> Maybe [Object]

-- | Keys that begin with the indicated prefix.
[$sel:prefix:ListObjectsResponse'] :: ListObjectsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | All of the keys (up to 1,000) rolled up in a common prefix count as a
--   single return when calculating the number of returns.
--   
--   A response can contain CommonPrefixes only if you specify a delimiter.
--   
--   CommonPrefixes contains all (if there are any) keys between Prefix and
--   the next occurrence of the string specified by the delimiter.
--   
--   CommonPrefixes lists keys that act like subdirectories in the
--   directory specified by Prefix.
--   
--   For example, if the prefix is notes/ and the delimiter is a slash (/)
--   as in notes/summer/july, the common prefix is notes/summer/. All of
--   the keys that roll up into a common prefix count as a single return
--   when calculating the number of returns.
[$sel:commonPrefixes:ListObjectsResponse'] :: ListObjectsResponse -> Maybe [CommonPrefix]

-- | Encoding type used by Amazon S3 to encode object keys in the response.
[$sel:encodingType:ListObjectsResponse'] :: ListObjectsResponse -> Maybe EncodingType

-- | The bucket name.
[$sel:name:ListObjectsResponse'] :: ListObjectsResponse -> Maybe BucketName

-- | Indicates where in the bucket listing begins. Marker is included in
--   the response if it was sent with the request.
[$sel:marker:ListObjectsResponse'] :: ListObjectsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | When response is truncated (the IsTruncated element value in the
--   response is true), you can use the key name in this field as marker in
--   the subsequent request to get next set of objects. Amazon S3 lists
--   objects in alphabetical order Note: This element is returned only if
--   you have delimiter request parameter specified. If response does not
--   include the NextMarker and it is truncated, you can use the value of
--   the last Key in the response as the marker in the subsequent request
--   to get the next set of object keys.
[$sel:nextMarker:ListObjectsResponse'] :: ListObjectsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of keys returned in the response body.
[$sel:maxKeys:ListObjectsResponse'] :: ListObjectsResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | A flag that indicates whether Amazon S3 returned all of the results
--   that satisfied the search criteria.
[$sel:isTruncated:ListObjectsResponse'] :: ListObjectsResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Causes keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the
--   first occurrence of the delimiter to be rolled up into a single result
--   element in the <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> collection. These rolled-up
--   keys are not returned elsewhere in the response. Each rolled-up result
--   counts as only one return against the <tt>MaxKeys</tt> value.
[$sel:delimiter:ListObjectsResponse'] :: ListObjectsResponse -> Maybe Delimiter

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListObjectsResponse'] :: ListObjectsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListObjectsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contents:ListObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_contents</a> - Metadata about each object
--   returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ListObjects'</a>, <a>listObjectsResponse_prefix</a> -
--   Keys that begin with the indicated prefix.
--   
--   <a>$sel:commonPrefixes:ListObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_commonPrefixes</a> - All of the keys (up to
--   1,000) rolled up in a common prefix count as a single return when
--   calculating the number of returns.
--   
--   A response can contain CommonPrefixes only if you specify a delimiter.
--   
--   CommonPrefixes contains all (if there are any) keys between Prefix and
--   the next occurrence of the string specified by the delimiter.
--   
--   CommonPrefixes lists keys that act like subdirectories in the
--   directory specified by Prefix.
--   
--   For example, if the prefix is notes/ and the delimiter is a slash (/)
--   as in notes/summer/july, the common prefix is notes/summer/. All of
--   the keys that roll up into a common prefix count as a single return
--   when calculating the number of returns.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encodingType:ListObjects'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_encodingType</a> - Encoding type used by Amazon
--   S3 to encode object keys in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ListObjectsResponse'</a>, <a>listObjectsResponse_name</a>
--   - The bucket name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:ListObjects'</a>, <a>listObjectsResponse_marker</a> -
--   Indicates where in the bucket listing begins. Marker is included in
--   the response if it was sent with the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextMarker:ListObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_nextMarker</a> - When response is truncated
--   (the IsTruncated element value in the response is true), you can use
--   the key name in this field as marker in the subsequent request to get
--   next set of objects. Amazon S3 lists objects in alphabetical order
--   Note: This element is returned only if you have delimiter request
--   parameter specified. If response does not include the NextMarker and
--   it is truncated, you can use the value of the last Key in the response
--   as the marker in the subsequent request to get the next set of object
--   keys.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxKeys:ListObjects'</a>, <a>listObjectsResponse_maxKeys</a> -
--   The maximum number of keys returned in the response body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isTruncated:ListObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_isTruncated</a> - A flag that indicates whether
--   Amazon S3 returned all of the results that satisfied the search
--   criteria.
--   
--   <a>$sel:delimiter:ListObjects'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_delimiter</a> - Causes keys that contain the
--   same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the
--   delimiter to be rolled up into a single result element in the
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> collection. These rolled-up keys are not
--   returned elsewhere in the response. Each rolled-up result counts as
--   only one return against the <tt>MaxKeys</tt> value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListObjectsResponse :: Int -> ListObjectsResponse

-- | Metadata about each object returned.
listObjectsResponse_contents :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe [Object])

-- | Keys that begin with the indicated prefix.
listObjectsResponse_prefix :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | All of the keys (up to 1,000) rolled up in a common prefix count as a
--   single return when calculating the number of returns.
--   
--   A response can contain CommonPrefixes only if you specify a delimiter.
--   
--   CommonPrefixes contains all (if there are any) keys between Prefix and
--   the next occurrence of the string specified by the delimiter.
--   
--   CommonPrefixes lists keys that act like subdirectories in the
--   directory specified by Prefix.
--   
--   For example, if the prefix is notes/ and the delimiter is a slash (/)
--   as in notes/summer/july, the common prefix is notes/summer/. All of
--   the keys that roll up into a common prefix count as a single return
--   when calculating the number of returns.
listObjectsResponse_commonPrefixes :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe [CommonPrefix])

-- | Encoding type used by Amazon S3 to encode object keys in the response.
listObjectsResponse_encodingType :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe EncodingType)

-- | The bucket name.
listObjectsResponse_name :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe BucketName)

-- | Indicates where in the bucket listing begins. Marker is included in
--   the response if it was sent with the request.
listObjectsResponse_marker :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | When response is truncated (the IsTruncated element value in the
--   response is true), you can use the key name in this field as marker in
--   the subsequent request to get next set of objects. Amazon S3 lists
--   objects in alphabetical order Note: This element is returned only if
--   you have delimiter request parameter specified. If response does not
--   include the NextMarker and it is truncated, you can use the value of
--   the last Key in the response as the marker in the subsequent request
--   to get the next set of object keys.
listObjectsResponse_nextMarker :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of keys returned in the response body.
listObjectsResponse_maxKeys :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | A flag that indicates whether Amazon S3 returned all of the results
--   that satisfied the search criteria.
listObjectsResponse_isTruncated :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Causes keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the
--   first occurrence of the delimiter to be rolled up into a single result
--   element in the <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> collection. These rolled-up
--   keys are not returned elsewhere in the response. Each rolled-up result
--   counts as only one return against the <tt>MaxKeys</tt> value.
listObjectsResponse_delimiter :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe Delimiter)

-- | The response's http status code.
listObjectsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse Int

-- | Returns metadata about all versions of the objects in a bucket. You
--   can also use request parameters as selection criteria to return
--   metadata about a subset of all the object versions.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permissions to perform the
--   <tt>s3:ListBucketVersions</tt> action. Be aware of the name
--   difference.
--   
--   A 200 OK response can contain valid or invalid XML. Make sure to
--   design your application to parse the contents of the response and
--   handle it appropriately.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have READ access to the bucket.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>ListObjectVersions</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ListObjectsV2</a></li>
--   <li><a>GetObject</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutObject</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteObject</a></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.S3.ListObjectVersions

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListObjectVersions</a> smart constructor.
data ListObjectVersions
ListObjectVersions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EncodingType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Delimiter -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ListObjectVersions

-- | Specifies the key to start with when listing objects in a bucket.
[$sel:keyMarker:ListObjectVersions'] :: ListObjectVersions -> Maybe Text

-- | Use this parameter to select only those keys that begin with the
--   specified prefix. You can use prefixes to separate a bucket into
--   different groupings of keys. (You can think of using prefix to make
--   groups in the same way you'd use a folder in a file system.) You can
--   use prefix with delimiter to roll up numerous objects into a single
--   result under CommonPrefixes.

[$sel:encodingType:ListObjectVersions'] :: ListObjectVersions -> Maybe EncodingType

--   the action returns up to 1,000 key names. The response might contain
--   fewer keys but will never contain more. If additional keys satisfy the
--   search criteria, but were not returned because max-keys was exceeded,
--   the response contains &lt;isTruncated&gt;true&lt;/isTruncated&gt;. To
--   return the additional keys, see key-marker and version-id-marker.

-- | A delimiter is a character that you specify to group keys. All keys
--   that contain the same string between the <tt>prefix</tt> and the first
--   occurrence of the delimiter are grouped under a single result element
--   in CommonPrefixes. These groups are counted as one result against the
--   max-keys limitation. These keys are not returned elsewhere in the
--   response.

--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.

-- | This action lists in-progress multipart uploads. An in-progress
--   multipart upload is a multipart upload that has been initiated using
--   the Initiate Multipart Upload request, but has not yet been completed
--   or aborted.
--   
--   This action returns at most 1,000 multipart uploads in the response.
--   1,000 multipart uploads is the maximum number of uploads a response
--   can include, which is also the default value. You can further limit
--   the number of uploads in a response by specifying the
--   <tt>max-uploads</tt> parameter in the response. If additional
--   multipart uploads satisfy the list criteria, the response will contain
--   an <tt>IsTruncated</tt> element with the value true. To list the
--   additional multipart uploads, use the <tt>key-marker</tt> and
--   <tt>upload-id-marker</tt> request parameters.
--   
--   In the response, the uploads are sorted by key. If your application
--   has initiated more than one multipart upload using the same object
--   key, then uploads in the response are first sorted by key.
--   Additionally, uploads are sorted in ascending order within each key by
--   the upload initiation time.
--   
--   For more information on multipart uploads, see <a>Uploading Objects
--   Using Multipart Upload</a>.
--   
--   For information on permissions required to use the multipart upload
--   API, see <a>Multipart Upload and Permissions</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>ListMultipartUploads</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>CreateMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>UploadPart</a></li>
--   <li><a>CompleteMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListParts</a></li>
--   <li><a>AbortMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.S3.ListMultipartUploads

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListMultipartUploads</a> smart constructor.
data ListMultipartUploads
ListMultipartUploads' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EncodingType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Delimiter -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ListMultipartUploads

-- | Together with upload-id-marker, this parameter specifies the multipart
--   upload after which listing should begin.
--   
--   If <tt>upload-id-marker</tt> is not specified, only the keys
--   lexicographically greater than the specified <tt>key-marker</tt> will
--   be included in the list.
--   
--   If <tt>upload-id-marker</tt> is specified, any multipart uploads for a
--   key equal to the <tt>key-marker</tt> might also be included, provided
--   those multipart uploads have upload IDs lexicographically greater than
--   the specified <tt>upload-id-marker</tt>.
[$sel:keyMarker:ListMultipartUploads'] :: ListMultipartUploads -> Maybe Text

-- | Lists in-progress uploads only for those keys that begin with the
--   specified prefix. You can use prefixes to separate a bucket into
--   different grouping of keys. (You can think of using prefix to make
--   groups in the same way you'd use a folder in a file system.)
[$sel:prefix:ListMultipartUploads'] :: ListMultipartUploads -> Maybe Text
[$sel:encodingType:ListMultipartUploads'] :: ListMultipartUploads -> Maybe EncodingType

-- | Together with key-marker, specifies the multipart upload after which
--   listing should begin. If key-marker is not specified, the
--   upload-id-marker parameter is ignored. Otherwise, any multipart
--   uploads for a key equal to the key-marker might be included in the
--   list only if they have an upload ID lexicographically greater than the
--   specified <tt>upload-id-marker</tt>.
[$sel:uploadIdMarker:ListMultipartUploads'] :: ListMultipartUploads -> Maybe Text

-- | Sets the maximum number of multipart uploads, from 1 to 1,000, to
--   return in the response body. 1,000 is the maximum number of uploads
--   that can be returned in a response.
[$sel:maxUploads:ListMultipartUploads'] :: ListMultipartUploads -> Maybe Int

-- | Character you use to group keys.
--   
--   All keys that contain the same string between the prefix, if
--   specified, and the first occurrence of the delimiter after the prefix
--   are grouped under a single result element, <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt>. If
--   you don't specify the prefix parameter, then the substring starts at
--   the beginning of the key. The keys that are grouped under
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> result element are not returned elsewhere in
--   the response.
[$sel:delimiter:ListMultipartUploads'] :: ListMultipartUploads -> Maybe Delimiter

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:ListMultipartUploads'] :: ListMultipartUploads -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bucket to which the multipart upload was initiated.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:ListMultipartUploads'] :: ListMultipartUploads -> BucketName

[$sel:keyMarker:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'] :: ListMultipartUploadsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | When a prefix is provided in the request, this field contains the
--   specified prefix. The result contains only keys starting with the
--   specified prefix.
[$sel:prefix:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'] :: ListMultipartUploadsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | If you specify a delimiter in the request, then the result returns
--   each distinct key prefix containing the delimiter in a
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> element. The distinct key prefixes are
--   returned in the <tt>Prefix</tt> child element.
[$sel:commonPrefixes:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'] :: ListMultipartUploadsResponse -> Maybe [CommonPrefix]

-- | Encoding type used by Amazon S3 to encode object keys in the response.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>encoding-type</tt> request parameter, Amazon S3
--   includes this element in the response, and returns encoded key name
--   values in the following response elements:
--   
--   <tt>Delimiter</tt>, <tt>KeyMarker</tt>, <tt>Prefix</tt>,
--   <tt>NextKeyMarker</tt>, <tt>Key</tt>.
[$sel:encodingType:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'] :: ListMultipartUploadsResponse -> Maybe EncodingType

--   Does not return the access point ARN or access point alias if used.

-- | Upload ID after which listing began.

-- | Maximum number of multipart uploads that could have been included in
--   the response.
[$sel:maxUploads:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'] :: ListMultipartUploadsResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | When a list is truncated, this element specifies the value that should
--   be used for the key-marker request parameter in a subsequent request.
[$sel:nextKeyMarker:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'] :: ListMultipartUploadsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Container for elements related to a particular multipart upload. A
--   response can contain zero or more <tt>Upload</tt> elements.
[$sel:uploads:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'] :: ListMultipartUploadsResponse -> Maybe [MultipartUpload]

-- | Indicates whether the returned list of multipart uploads is truncated.
--   A value of true indicates that the list was truncated. The list can be
--   truncated if the number of multipart uploads exceeds the limit allowed
--   or specified by max uploads.
[$sel:isTruncated:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'] :: ListMultipartUploadsResponse -> Maybe Bool

--   be used for the <tt>upload-id-marker</tt> request parameter in a

-- | Returns a list of all buckets owned by the authenticated sender of the
--   request.
module Network.AWS.S3.ListBuckets

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListBuckets</a> smart constructor.
data ListBuckets
ListBuckets' :: ListBuckets

-- | Create a value of <a>ListBuckets</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newListBuckets :: ListBuckets

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListBucketsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListBucketsResponse
ListBucketsResponse' :: Maybe [Bucket] -> Maybe Owner -> Int -> ListBucketsResponse

-- | The list of buckets owned by the requestor.
[$sel:buckets:ListBucketsResponse'] :: ListBucketsResponse -> Maybe [Bucket]

-- | The owner of the buckets listed.
[$sel:owner:ListBucketsResponse'] :: ListBucketsResponse -> Maybe Owner

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListBucketsResponse'] :: ListBucketsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListBucketsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:buckets:ListBucketsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listBucketsResponse_buckets</a> - The list of buckets owned by the
--   requestor.
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:ListBucketsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listBucketsResponse_owner</a> - The owner of the buckets listed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListBucketsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listBucketsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status

-- | Lists the metrics configurations for the bucket. The metrics
--   configurations are only for the request metrics of the bucket and do
--   not provide information on daily storage metrics. You can have up to
--   1,000 configurations per bucket.
--   
--   This action supports list pagination and does not return more than 100
--   configurations at a time. Always check the <tt>IsTruncated</tt>
--   element in the response. If there are no more configurations to list,
--   <tt>IsTruncated</tt> is set to false. If there are more configurations
--   to list, <tt>IsTruncated</tt> is set to true, and there is a value in
--   <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt>. You use the
--   <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt> value to continue the pagination of the
--   list by passing the value in <tt>continuation-token</tt> in the
--   request to <tt>GET</tt> the next page.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permissions to perform the
--   <tt>s3:GetMetricsConfiguration</tt> action. The bucket owner has this
--   permission by default. The bucket owner can grant this permission to
--   others. For more information about permissions, see <a>Permissions
--   Related to Bucket Subresource Operations</a> and <a>Managing Access
--   Permissions to Your Amazon S3 Resources</a>.
--   
--   For more information about metrics configurations and CloudWatch
--   request metrics, see <a>Monitoring Metrics with Amazon CloudWatch</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to
--   <tt>ListBucketMetricsConfigurations</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>PutBucketMetricsConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>GetBucketMetricsConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketMetricsConfiguration</a></li>
--   </ul>

--   element in the response. If there are no more configurations to list,

-- | Lists the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration from the specified
--   bucket.
--   
--   The S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class is designed to optimize
--   storage costs by automatically moving data to the most cost-effective
--   storage access tier, without performance impact or operational
--   overhead. S3 Intelligent-Tiering delivers automatic cost savings in
--   two low latency and high throughput access tiers. For data that can be
--   accessed asynchronously, you can choose to activate automatic
--   archiving capabilities within the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage
--   class.
--   
--   The S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class is the ideal storage class
--   for data with unknown, changing, or unpredictable access patterns,
--   independent of object size or retention period. If the size of an
--   object is less than 128 KB, it is not eligible for auto-tiering.
--   Smaller objects can be stored, but they are always charged at the
--   Frequent Access tier rates in the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage
--   class.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Storage class for automatically
--   optimizing frequently and infrequently accessed objects</a>.
--   
--   Operations related to
--   <tt>ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations</tt> include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>GetBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations
ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations' :: Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations

-- | The ContinuationToken that represents a placeholder from where this
--   request should begin.
[$sel:continuationToken:ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations'] :: ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket whose configuration you want to
--   modify or retrieve.
[$sel:bucket:ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations'] :: ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations -> BucketName

-- | Create a value of <a>ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:continuationToken:ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations'</a>,
--   <a>listBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations_continuationToken</a> -
--   The ContinuationToken that represents a placeholder from where this
--   request should begin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations'</a>,
--   <a>listBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations_bucket</a> - The name of
--   the Amazon S3 bucket whose configuration you want to modify or
--   retrieve.
newListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations :: BucketName -> ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations

-- | The ContinuationToken that represents a placeholder from where this
--   request should begin.
listBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations_continuationToken :: Lens' ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket whose configuration you want to
--   modify or retrieve.
listBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations_bucket :: Lens' ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations BucketName

-- | <i>See:</i>
--   <a>newListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse
ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse' :: Maybe [IntelligentTieringConfiguration] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Int -> ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse

-- | The list of S3 Intelligent-Tiering configurations for a bucket.

-- | The ContinuationToken that represents a placeholder from where this
--   request should begin.
[$sel:continuationToken:ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse'] :: ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse -> Maybe Text

--   listing in a subsequent request. The continuation token is an opaque

--   the NextContinuationToken will be provided for a subsequent request.

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:intelligentTieringConfigurationList:ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse_intelligentTieringConfigurationList</a>
--   - The list of S3 Intelligent-Tiering configurations for a bucket.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:continuationToken:ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations'</a>,
--   <a>listBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse_continuationToken</a>
--   - The ContinuationToken that represents a placeholder from where this
--   request should begin.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextContinuationToken:ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse_nextContinuationToken</a>
--   - The marker used to continue this inventory configuration listing.
--   Use the <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt> from this response to continue
--   the listing in a subsequent request. The continuation token is an
--   opaque value that Amazon S3 understands.

--   <a>listBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurationsResponse_isTruncated</a>

--   the NextContinuationToken will be provided for a subsequent request.
--

--   The response's http status code.

-- | Lists the analytics configurations for the bucket. You can have up to
--   1,000 analytics configurations per bucket.
--   
--   This action supports list pagination and does not return more than 100
--   configurations at a time. You should always check the
--   <tt>IsTruncated</tt> element in the response. If there are no more
--   configurations to list, <tt>IsTruncated</tt> is set to false. If there
--   are more configurations to list, <tt>IsTruncated</tt> is set to true,
--   and there will be a value in <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt>. You use
--   the <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt> value to continue the pagination of
--   the list by passing the value in continuation-token in the request to
--   <tt>GET</tt> the next page.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permissions to perform the
--   <tt>s3:GetAnalyticsConfiguration</tt> action. The bucket owner has
--   this permission by default. The bucket owner can grant this permission
--   to others. For more information about permissions, see <a>Permissions
--   Related to Bucket Subresource Operations</a> and <a>Managing Access
--   Permissions to Your Amazon S3 Resources</a>.
--   
--   For information about Amazon S3 analytics feature, see <a>Amazon S3
--   Analytics – Storage Class Analysis</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to
--   <tt>ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketAnalyticsConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutBucketAnalyticsConfiguration</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations
ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations

-- | The ContinuationToken that represents a placeholder from where this
--   request should begin.
[$sel:continuationToken:ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations'] :: ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations'] :: ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bucket from which analytics configurations are
--   retrieved.
[$sel:bucket:ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations'] :: ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations -> BucketName

-- | Create a value of <a>ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations</a> with all

--   Denied)</tt> error.

--   <a>listBucketAnalyticsConfigurations_bucket</a> - The name of the
--   bucket from which analytics configurations are retrieved.
