-- | The HEAD action retrieves metadata from an object without returning
--   the object itself. This action is useful if you're only interested in
--   an object's metadata. To use HEAD, you must have READ access to the
--   object.
--   
--   A <tt>HEAD</tt> request has the same options as a <tt>GET</tt> action
--   on an object. The response is identical to the <tt>GET</tt> response
--   except that there is no response body. Because of this, if the
--   <tt>HEAD</tt> request generates an error, it returns a generic <tt>404
--   Not Found</tt> or <tt>403 Forbidden</tt> code. It is not possible to
--   retrieve the exact exception beyond these error codes.
--   
--   If you encrypt an object by using server-side encryption with
--   customer-provided encryption keys (SSE-C) when you store the object in
--   Amazon S3, then when you retrieve the metadata from the object, you
--   must use the following headers:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</li>
--   <li>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key</li>
--   <li>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key-MD5</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about SSE-C, see <a>Server-Side Encryption (Using
--   Customer-Provided Encryption Keys)</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Encryption request headers, like
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption</tt>, should not be sent for GET
--   requests if your object uses server-side encryption with KMS keys
--   (SSE-KMS) or server-side encryption with Amazon S3–managed encryption
--   keys (SSE-S3). If your object does use these types of keys, you’ll get
--   an HTTP 400 BadRequest error.</li>
--   <li>The last modified property in this case is the creation date of
--   the object.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Request headers are limited to 8 KB in size. For more information, see
--   <a>Common Request Headers</a>.
--   
--   Consider the following when using request headers:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Consideration 1 – If both of the <tt>If-Match</tt> and
--   <tt>If-Unmodified-Since</tt> headers are present in the request as
--   follows:<ul><li><tt>If-Match</tt> condition evaluates to
--   <tt>true</tt>, and;</li><li><tt>If-Unmodified-Since</tt> condition
--   evaluates to <tt>false</tt>;</li></ul>Then Amazon S3 returns <tt>200
--   OK</tt> and the data requested.</li>
--   <li>Consideration 2 – If both of the <tt>If-None-Match</tt> and
--   <tt>If-Modified-Since</tt> headers are present in the request as
--   follows:<ul><li><tt>If-None-Match</tt> condition evaluates to
--   <tt>false</tt>, and;</li><li><tt>If-Modified-Since</tt> condition
--   evaluates to <tt>true</tt>;</li></ul>Then Amazon S3 returns the
--   <tt>304 Not Modified</tt> response code.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about conditional requests, see <a>RFC 7232</a>.
--   
--   <b>Permissions</b>
--   
--   You need the relevant read object (or version) permission for this
--   operation. For more information, see <a>Specifying Permissions in a
--   Policy</a>. If the object you request does not exist, the error Amazon
--   S3 returns depends on whether you also have the s3:ListBucket
--   permission.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you have the <tt>s3:ListBucket</tt> permission on the bucket,
--   Amazon S3 returns an HTTP status code 404 ("no such key") error.</li>
--   <li>If you don’t have the <tt>s3:ListBucket</tt> permission, Amazon S3
--   returns an HTTP status code 403 ("access denied") error.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The following action is related to <tt>HeadObject</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetObject</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newHeadObject</a> smart constructor.
data HeadObject
HeadObject' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ObjectKey -> HeadObject

-- | Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one
--   specified, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
[$sel:ifMatch:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> Maybe Text

-- | VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
[$sel:versionId:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> Maybe ObjectVersionId

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (for
--   example, AES256).
[$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in
--   encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is
--   discarded; Amazon S3 does not store the encryption key. The key must
--   be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header.
[$sel:sSECustomerKey:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)
[$sel:requestPayer:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> Maybe RequestPayer

-- | Return the object only if it has been modified since the specified
--   time, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
[$sel:ifModifiedSince:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Part number of the object being read. This is a positive integer
--   between 1 and 10,000. Effectively performs a 'ranged' HEAD request for
--   the part specified. Useful querying about the size of the part and the
--   number of parts in this object.
[$sel:partNumber:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> Maybe Int

-- | Downloads the specified range bytes of an object. For more information
--   about the HTTP Range header, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35</a>.
--   
--   Amazon S3 doesn't support retrieving multiple ranges of data per
--   <tt>GET</tt> request.
[$sel:range:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> Maybe Text

-- | Return the object only if it has not been modified since the specified
--   time, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
[$sel:ifUnmodifiedSince:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
[$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> Maybe Text

-- | Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is different from the
--   one specified, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
[$sel:ifNoneMatch:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bucket containing the object.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> BucketName

-- | The object key.
[$sel:key:HeadObject'] :: HeadObject -> ObjectKey

-- | Create a value of <a>HeadObject</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifMatch:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_ifMatch</a> - Return
--   the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one
--   specified, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_versionId</a> -
--   VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObject_sSECustomerAlgorithm</a> - Specifies the algorithm to
--   use to when encrypting the object (for example, AES256).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKey:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObject_sSECustomerKey</a> - Specifies the customer-provided
--   encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is
--   used to store the object and then it is discarded; Amazon S3 does not
--   store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the
--   algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestPayer:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_requestPayer</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifModifiedSince:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObject_ifModifiedSince</a> - Return the object only if it has
--   been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 304 (not
--   modified).
--   
--   <a>$sel:partNumber:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_partNumber</a> -
--   Part number of the object being read. This is a positive integer
--   between 1 and 10,000. Effectively performs a 'ranged' HEAD request for
--   the part specified. Useful querying about the size of the part and the
--   number of parts in this object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:range:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_range</a> - Downloads the
--   specified range bytes of an object. For more information about the
--   HTTP Range header, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35</a>.
--   
--   Amazon S3 doesn't support retrieving multiple ranges of data per
--   <tt>GET</tt> request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifUnmodifiedSince:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObject_ifUnmodifiedSince</a> - Return the object only if it has
--   not been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 412
--   (precondition failed).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObject_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest
--   of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this
--   header for a message integrity check to ensure that the encryption key
--   was transmitted without error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifNoneMatch:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_ifNoneMatch</a> -
--   Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is different from the
--   one specified, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObject_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the expected
--   bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account, the
--   request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_bucket</a> - The name of
--   the bucket containing the object.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_key</a> - The object key.
newHeadObject :: BucketName -> ObjectKey -> HeadObject

-- | Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one
--   specified, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
headObject_ifMatch :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe Text)

-- | VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
headObject_versionId :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (for
--   example, AES256).
headObject_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in
--   encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is
--   discarded; Amazon S3 does not store the encryption key. The key must
--   be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header.
headObject_sSECustomerKey :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
headObject_requestPayer :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe RequestPayer)

-- | Return the object only if it has been modified since the specified
--   time, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
headObject_ifModifiedSince :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Part number of the object being read. This is a positive integer
--   between 1 and 10,000. Effectively performs a 'ranged' HEAD request for
--   the part specified. Useful querying about the size of the part and the
--   number of parts in this object.
headObject_partNumber :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe Int)

-- | Downloads the specified range bytes of an object. For more information
--   about the HTTP Range header, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35</a>.
--   
--   Amazon S3 doesn't support retrieving multiple ranges of data per
--   <tt>GET</tt> request.
headObject_range :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Return the object only if it has not been modified since the specified
--   time, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
headObject_ifUnmodifiedSince :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
headObject_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is different from the
--   one specified, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
headObject_ifNoneMatch :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
headObject_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the bucket containing the object.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
headObject_bucket :: Lens' HeadObject BucketName

-- | The object key.
headObject_key :: Lens' HeadObject ObjectKey

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newHeadObjectResponse</a> smart constructor.
data HeadObjectResponse
HeadObjectResponse' :: Maybe RequestCharged -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ETag -> Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe ObjectLockMode -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ArchiveStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> HashMap Text Text -> Maybe ReplicationStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption -> Maybe Text -> Int -> HeadObjectResponse
[$sel:requestCharged:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe RequestCharged

-- | The count of parts this object has.
[$sel:partsCount:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | An ETag is an opaque identifier assigned by a web server to a specific
--   version of a resource found at a URL.
[$sel:eTag:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe ETag

-- | Version of the object.
[$sel:versionId:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe ObjectVersionId

-- | Size of the body in bytes.
[$sel:contentLength:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | The Object Lock mode, if any, that's in effect for this object. This
--   header is only returned if the requester has the
--   <tt>s3:GetObjectRetention</tt> permission. For more information about
--   S3 Object Lock, see <a>Object Lock</a>.
[$sel:objectLockMode:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe ObjectLockMode

-- | The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable.
[$sel:expires:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | If the object is an archived object (an object whose storage class is
--   GLACIER), the response includes this header if either the archive
--   restoration is in progress (see <a>RestoreObject</a> or an archive
--   copy is already restored.
--   
--   If an archive copy is already restored, the header value indicates
--   when Amazon S3 is scheduled to delete the object copy. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   x-amz-restore: ongoing-request="false", expiry-date="Fri, 21 Dec 2012 00:00:00 GMT"
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the object restoration is in progress, the header returns the value
--   <tt>ongoing-request="true"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about archiving objects, see <a>Transitioning
--   Objects: General Considerations</a>.
[$sel:restore:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | If the object expiration is configured (see PUT Bucket lifecycle), the
--   response includes this header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id
--   key-value pairs providing object expiration information. The value of
--   the rule-id is URL encoded.
[$sel:expiration:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the object retrieved was (true) or was not (false) a
--   Delete Marker. If false, this response header does not appear in the
--   response.
[$sel:deleteMarker:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The archive state of the head object.
[$sel:archiveStatus:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe ArchiveStatus

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header confirming the
--   encryption algorithm used.
[$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | This is set to the number of metadata entries not returned in
--   <tt>x-amz-meta</tt> headers. This can happen if you create metadata
--   using an API like SOAP that supports more flexible metadata than the
--   REST API. For example, using SOAP, you can create metadata whose
--   values are not legal HTTP headers.
[$sel:missingMeta:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | Indicates whether the object uses an S3 Bucket Key for server-side
--   encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
[$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this
--   object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL.
--   Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.
[$sel:websiteRedirectLocation:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates that a range of bytes was specified.
[$sel:acceptRanges:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides storage class information of the object. Amazon S3 returns
--   this header for all objects except for S3 Standard storage class
--   objects.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Storage Classes</a>.
[$sel:storageClass:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe StorageClass

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header to provide round-trip
--   message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption
--   key.
[$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | If present, specifies the ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key that
--   was used for the object.
[$sel:sSEKMSKeyId:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and
--   thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type
--   referenced by the Content-Type header field.
[$sel:contentEncoding:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when the Object Lock retention period expires. This
--   header is only returned if the requester has the
--   <tt>s3:GetObjectRetention</tt> permission.
[$sel:objectLockRetainUntilDate:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | A map of metadata to store with the object in S3.
[$sel:metadata:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Amazon S3 can return this header if your request involves a bucket
--   that is either a source or a destination in a replication rule.
--   
--   In replication, you have a source bucket on which you configure
--   replication and destination bucket or buckets where Amazon S3 stores
--   object replicas. When you request an object (<tt>GetObject</tt>) or
--   object metadata (<tt>HeadObject</tt>) from these buckets, Amazon S3
--   will return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header in the
--   response as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If requesting an object from the source bucket — Amazon S3 will
--   return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header if the object in
--   your request is eligible for replication.For example, suppose that in
--   your replication configuration, you specify object prefix
--   <tt>TaxDocs</tt> requesting Amazon S3 to replicate objects with key
--   prefix <tt>TaxDocs</tt>. Any objects you upload with this key name
--   prefix, for example <tt>TaxDocs/document1.pdf</tt>, are eligible for
--   replication. For any object request with this key name prefix, Amazon
--   S3 will return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header with value
--   PENDING, COMPLETED or FAILED indicating object replication
--   status.</li>
--   <li>If requesting an object from a destination bucket — Amazon S3 will
--   return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header with value REPLICA
--   if the object in your request is a replica that Amazon S3 created and
--   there is no replica modification replication in progress.</li>
--   <li>When replicating objects to multiple destination buckets the
--   <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header acts differently. The header
--   of the source object will only return a value of COMPLETED when
--   replication is successful to all destinations. The header will remain
--   at value PENDING until replication has completed for all destinations.
--   If one or more destinations fails replication the header will return
--   FAILED.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Replication</a>.
[$sel:replicationStatus:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe ReplicationStatus

-- | Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
[$sel:cacheControl:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The language the content is in.
[$sel:contentLanguage:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Creation date of the object.
[$sel:lastModified:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Specifies whether a legal hold is in effect for this object. This
--   header is only returned if the requester has the
--   <tt>s3:GetObjectLegalHold</tt> permission. This header is not returned
--   if the specified version of this object has never had a legal hold
--   applied. For more information about S3 Object Lock, see <a>Object
--   Lock</a>.
[$sel:objectLockLegalHoldStatus:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus

-- | Specifies presentational information for the object.
[$sel:contentDisposition:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | If the object is stored using server-side encryption either with an
--   Amazon Web Services KMS key or an Amazon S3-managed encryption key,
--   the response includes this header with the value of the server-side
--   encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3 (for
--   example, AES256, aws:kms).
[$sel:serverSideEncryption:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption

-- | A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
[$sel:contentType:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:HeadObjectResponse'] :: HeadObjectResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>HeadObjectResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestCharged:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_requestCharged</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partsCount:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_partsCount</a> - The count of parts this object
--   has.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eTag:HeadObjectResponse'</a>, <a>headObjectResponse_eTag</a> -
--   An ETag is an opaque identifier assigned by a web server to a specific
--   version of a resource found at a URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObjectResponse_versionId</a>
--   - Version of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentLength:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_contentLength</a> - Size of the body in bytes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectLockMode:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_objectLockMode</a> - The Object Lock mode, if
--   any, that's in effect for this object. This header is only returned if
--   the requester has the <tt>s3:GetObjectRetention</tt> permission. For
--   more information about S3 Object Lock, see <a>Object Lock</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expires:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_expires</a> - The date and time at which the
--   object is no longer cacheable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restore:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_restore</a> - If the object is an archived
--   object (an object whose storage class is GLACIER), the response
--   includes this header if either the archive restoration is in progress
--   (see <a>RestoreObject</a> or an archive copy is already restored.
--   
--   If an archive copy is already restored, the header value indicates
--   when Amazon S3 is scheduled to delete the object copy. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   x-amz-restore: ongoing-request="false", expiry-date="Fri, 21 Dec 2012 00:00:00 GMT"
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the object restoration is in progress, the header returns the value
--   <tt>ongoing-request="true"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about archiving objects, see <a>Transitioning
--   Objects: General Considerations</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiration:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_expiration</a> - If the object expiration is
--   configured (see PUT Bucket lifecycle), the response includes this
--   header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id key-value pairs
--   providing object expiration information. The value of the rule-id is
--   URL encoded.

--   retrieved was (true) or was not (false) a Delete Marker. If false,

--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveStatus:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_archiveStatus</a> - The archive state of the

--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:HeadObject'</a>,

--   response will include this header confirming the encryption algorithm
--   used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingMeta:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,

--   metadata entries not returned in <tt>x-amz-meta</tt> headers. This can
--   happen if you create metadata using an API like SOAP that supports
--   more flexible metadata than the REST API. For example, using SOAP, you

--   <a>$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,

--   object uses an S3 Bucket Key for server-side encryption with Amazon
--   Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
--   
--   <a>$sel:websiteRedirectLocation:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,

--   configured as a website, redirects requests for this object to another
--   object in the same bucket or to an external URL. Amazon S3 stores the
--   value of this header in the object metadata.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptRanges:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_acceptRanges</a> - Indicates that a range of
--   bytes was specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_storageClass</a> - Provides storage class
--   information of the object. Amazon S3 returns this header for all
--   objects except for S3 Standard storage class objects.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Storage Classes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - If server-side
--   encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was requested, the

--   integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSEKMSKeyId:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_sSEKMSKeyId</a> - If present, specifies the ID
--   of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services
--   KMS) symmetric customer managed key that was used for the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentEncoding:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_contentEncoding</a> - Specifies what content
--   encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding
--   mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the
--   Content-Type header field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectLockRetainUntilDate:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_objectLockRetainUntilDate</a> - The date and
--   time when the Object Lock retention period expires. This header is
--   only returned if the requester has the <tt>s3:GetObjectRetention</tt>
--   permission.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadata:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_metadata</a> - A map of metadata to store with
--   the object in S3.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationStatus:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_replicationStatus</a> - Amazon S3 can return
--   this header if your request involves a bucket that is either a source
--   or a destination in a replication rule.
--   
--   In replication, you have a source bucket on which you configure
--   replication and destination bucket or buckets where Amazon S3 stores
--   object replicas. When you request an object (<tt>GetObject</tt>) or

--   response as follows:

--   status.</li>

--   return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header with value REPLICA
--   if the object in your request is a replica that Amazon S3 created and
--   there is no replica modification replication in progress.</li>

--   <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header acts differently. The header
--   of the source object will only return a value of COMPLETED when
--   replication is successful to all destinations. The header will remain
--   at value PENDING until replication has completed for all destinations.
--   If one or more destinations fails replication the header will return
--   FAILED.</li>
--   </ul>

--   For more information, see <a>Replication</a>.

--   <a>headObjectResponse_contentLanguage</a> - The language the content
--   is in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModified:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_lastModified</a> - Creation date of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectLockLegalHoldStatus:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_objectLockLegalHoldStatus</a> - Specifies
--   whether a legal hold is in effect for this object. This header is only
--   returned if the requester has the <tt>s3:GetObjectLegalHold</tt>
--   permission. This header is not returned if the specified version of
--   this object has never had a legal hold applied. For more information
--   about S3 Object Lock, see <a>Object Lock</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentDisposition:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_contentDisposition</a> - Specifies
--   presentational information for the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryption:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_serverSideEncryption</a> - If the object is
--   stored using server-side encryption either with an Amazon Web Services
--   KMS key or an Amazon S3-managed encryption key, the response includes

--   used when storing this object in Amazon S3 (for example, AES256,
--   aws:kms).
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentType:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_contentType</a> - A standard MIME type
--   describing the format of the object data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newHeadObjectResponse :: Int -> HeadObjectResponse

-- | Undocumented member.
headObjectResponse_requestCharged :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe RequestCharged)

-- | The count of parts this object has.
headObjectResponse_partsCount :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | An ETag is an opaque identifier assigned by a web server to a specific
--   version of a resource found at a URL.
headObjectResponse_eTag :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ETag)

-- | Version of the object.
headObjectResponse_versionId :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | Size of the body in bytes.
headObjectResponse_contentLength :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Object Lock mode, if any, that's in effect for this object. This
--   header is only returned if the requester has the
--   <tt>s3:GetObjectRetention</tt> permission. For more information about
--   S3 Object Lock, see <a>Object Lock</a>.
headObjectResponse_objectLockMode :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ObjectLockMode)

-- | The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable.
headObjectResponse_expires :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If the object is an archived object (an object whose storage class is
--   GLACIER), the response includes this header if either the archive
--   restoration is in progress (see <a>RestoreObject</a> or an archive
--   copy is already restored.
--   
--   If an archive copy is already restored, the header value indicates
--   when Amazon S3 is scheduled to delete the object copy. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   x-amz-restore: ongoing-request="false", expiry-date="Fri, 21 Dec 2012 00:00:00 GMT"
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the object restoration is in progress, the header returns the value
--   <tt>ongoing-request="true"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about archiving objects, see <a>Transitioning
--   Objects: General Considerations</a>.
headObjectResponse_restore :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If the object expiration is configured (see PUT Bucket lifecycle), the
--   response includes this header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id
--   key-value pairs providing object expiration information. The value of
--   the rule-id is URL encoded.
headObjectResponse_expiration :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the object retrieved was (true) or was not (false) a
--   Delete Marker. If false, this response header does not appear in the
--   response.
headObjectResponse_deleteMarker :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The archive state of the head object.
headObjectResponse_archiveStatus :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ArchiveStatus)

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header confirming the
--   encryption algorithm used.
headObjectResponse_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | This is set to the number of metadata entries not returned in
--   <tt>x-amz-meta</tt> headers. This can happen if you create metadata
--   using an API like SOAP that supports more flexible metadata than the
--   REST API. For example, using SOAP, you can create metadata whose
--   values are not legal HTTP headers.
headObjectResponse_missingMeta :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates whether the object uses an S3 Bucket Key for server-side
--   encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
headObjectResponse_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this
--   object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL.
--   Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.
headObjectResponse_websiteRedirectLocation :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates that a range of bytes was specified.
headObjectResponse_acceptRanges :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides storage class information of the object. Amazon S3 returns
--   this header for all objects except for S3 Standard storage class
--   objects.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Storage Classes</a>.
headObjectResponse_storageClass :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header to provide round-trip
--   message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption
--   key.
headObjectResponse_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If present, specifies the ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key that
--   was used for the object.
headObjectResponse_sSEKMSKeyId :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and
--   thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type
--   referenced by the Content-Type header field.
headObjectResponse_contentEncoding :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the Object Lock retention period expires. This
--   header is only returned if the requester has the
--   <tt>s3:GetObjectRetention</tt> permission.
headObjectResponse_objectLockRetainUntilDate :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of metadata to store with the object in S3.
headObjectResponse_metadata :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Amazon S3 can return this header if your request involves a bucket
--   that is either a source or a destination in a replication rule.
--   
--   In replication, you have a source bucket on which you configure
--   replication and destination bucket or buckets where Amazon S3 stores
--   object replicas. When you request an object (<tt>GetObject</tt>) or
--   object metadata (<tt>HeadObject</tt>) from these buckets, Amazon S3
--   will return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header in the
--   response as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If requesting an object from the source bucket — Amazon S3 will
--   return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header if the object in
--   your request is eligible for replication.For example, suppose that in
--   your replication configuration, you specify object prefix
--   <tt>TaxDocs</tt> requesting Amazon S3 to replicate objects with key
--   prefix <tt>TaxDocs</tt>. Any objects you upload with this key name
--   prefix, for example <tt>TaxDocs/document1.pdf</tt>, are eligible for
--   replication. For any object request with this key name prefix, Amazon
--   S3 will return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header with value
--   PENDING, COMPLETED or FAILED indicating object replication
--   status.</li>
--   <li>If requesting an object from a destination bucket — Amazon S3 will
--   return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header with value REPLICA
--   if the object in your request is a replica that Amazon S3 created and
--   there is no replica modification replication in progress.</li>
--   <li>When replicating objects to multiple destination buckets the
--   <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header acts differently. The header
--   of the source object will only return a value of COMPLETED when
--   replication is successful to all destinations. The header will remain
--   at value PENDING until replication has completed for all destinations.
--   If one or more destinations fails replication the header will return
--   FAILED.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Replication</a>.
headObjectResponse_replicationStatus :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ReplicationStatus)

-- | Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
headObjectResponse_cacheControl :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The language the content is in.
headObjectResponse_contentLanguage :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Creation date of the object.
headObjectResponse_lastModified :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether a legal hold is in effect for this object. This
--   header is only returned if the requester has the
--   <tt>s3:GetObjectLegalHold</tt> permission. This header is not returned
--   if the specified version of this object has never had a legal hold
--   applied. For more information about S3 Object Lock, see <a>Object
--   Lock</a>.
headObjectResponse_objectLockLegalHoldStatus :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus)

-- | Specifies presentational information for the object.
headObjectResponse_contentDisposition :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If the object is stored using server-side encryption either with an
--   Amazon Web Services KMS key or an Amazon S3-managed encryption key,
--   the response includes this header with the value of the server-side
--   encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3 (for
--   example, AES256, aws:kms).
headObjectResponse_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
headObjectResponse_contentType :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
headObjectResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObject
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObject
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObject
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObjectResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObjectResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObjectResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObject
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObjectResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObject
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObject
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObject
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObject
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.S3.HeadObject.HeadObject


-- | This action is useful to determine if a bucket exists and you have
--   permission to access it. The action returns a <tt>200 OK</tt> if the
--   bucket exists and you have permission to access it.
--   
--   If the bucket does not exist or you do not have permission to access
--   it, the <tt>HEAD</tt> request returns a generic <tt>404 Not Found</tt>
--   or <tt>403 Forbidden</tt> code. A message body is not included, so you
--   cannot determine the exception beyond these error codes.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permissions to perform the
--   <tt>s3:ListBucket</tt> action. The bucket owner has this permission by
--   default and can grant this permission to others. For more information
--   about permissions, see <a>Permissions Related to Bucket Subresource
--   Operations</a> and <a>Managing Access Permissions to Your Amazon S3
--   Resources</a>.
--   
--   To use this API against an access point, you must provide the alias of
--   the access point in place of the bucket name or specify the access
--   point ARN. When using the access point ARN, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   AccessPointName-AccountId.s3-accesspoint.Region.amazonaws.com. When
--   using the Amazon Web Services SDKs, you provide the ARN in place of
--   the bucket name. For more information see, <a>Using access points</a>.
module Network.AWS.S3.HeadBucket

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newHeadBucket</a> smart constructor.
data HeadBucket
HeadBucket' :: Maybe Text -> BucketName -> HeadBucket

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:HeadBucket'] :: HeadBucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The bucket name.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:HeadBucket'] :: HeadBucket -> BucketName

-- | Create a value of <a>HeadBucket</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:HeadBucket'</a>,
--   <a>headBucket_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the expected
--   bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account, the
--   request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:HeadBucket'</a>, <a>headBucket_bucket</a> - The bucket
--   name.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
newHeadBucket :: BucketName -> HeadBucket

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
headBucket_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' HeadBucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The bucket name.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.

-- | Retrieves the <tt>PublicAccessBlock</tt> configuration for an Amazon
--   S3 bucket. To use this operation, you must have the
--   <tt>s3:GetBucketPublicAccessBlock</tt> permission. For more
--   information about Amazon S3 permissions, see <a>Specifying Permissions
--   in a Policy</a>.
--   
--   When Amazon S3 evaluates the <tt>PublicAccessBlock</tt> configuration
--   for a bucket or an object, it checks the <tt>PublicAccessBlock</tt>
--   configuration for both the bucket (or the bucket that contains the
--   object) and the bucket owner's account. If the
--   <tt>PublicAccessBlock</tt> settings are different between the bucket
--   and the account, Amazon S3 uses the most restrictive combination of
--   the bucket-level and account-level settings.
--   
--   For more information about when Amazon S3 considers a bucket or an
--   object public, see <a>The Meaning of "Public"</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>GetPublicAccessBlock</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>Using Amazon S3 Block Public Access</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutPublicAccessBlock</a></li>
--   <li><a>GetPublicAccessBlock</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeletePublicAccessBlock</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetPublicAccessBlock

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetPublicAccessBlock</a> smart constructor.
data GetPublicAccessBlock
GetPublicAccessBlock' :: Maybe Text -> BucketName -> GetPublicAccessBlock

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:GetPublicAccessBlock'] :: GetPublicAccessBlock -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket whose <tt>PublicAccessBlock</tt>
--   configuration you want to retrieve.
[$sel:bucket:GetPublicAccessBlock'] :: GetPublicAccessBlock -> BucketName

-- | Create a value of <a>GetPublicAccessBlock</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:GetPublicAccessBlock'</a>,
--   <a>getPublicAccessBlock_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of
--   the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different
--   account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access
--   Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:GetPublicAccessBlock'</a>,
--   <a>getPublicAccessBlock_bucket</a> - The name of the Amazon S3 bucket
--   whose <tt>PublicAccessBlock</tt> configuration you want to retrieve.
newGetPublicAccessBlock :: BucketName -> GetPublicAccessBlock

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
getPublicAccessBlock_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' GetPublicAccessBlock (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket whose <tt>PublicAccessBlock</tt>
--   configuration you want to retrieve.
getPublicAccessBlock_bucket :: Lens' GetPublicAccessBlock BucketName

--   this Amazon S3 bucket.

-- | Returns torrent files from a bucket. BitTorrent can save you bandwidth
--   when you're distributing large files. For more information about
--   BitTorrent, see <a>Using BitTorrent with Amazon S3</a>.
--   
--   You can get torrent only for objects that are less than 5 GB in size,
--   and that are not encrypted using server-side encryption with a
--   customer-provided encryption key.
--   
--   To use GET, you must have READ access to the object.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
--   
--   The following action is related to <tt>GetObjectTorrent</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetObject</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetObjectTorrent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetObjectTorrent</a> smart constructor.
data GetObjectTorrent
GetObjectTorrent' :: Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ObjectKey -> GetObjectTorrent

--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.

--   torrent files.

-- | Create a value of <a>GetObjectTorrent</a> with all optional fields

--   expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account,
--   the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.

--   torrent files.

-- | Returns the tag-set of an object. You send the GET request against the
--   tagging subresource associated with the object.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permission to perform the
--   <tt>s3:GetObjectTagging</tt> action. By default, the GET action
--   returns information about current version of an object. For a
--   versioned bucket, you can have multiple versions of an object in your
--   bucket. To retrieve tags of any other version, use the versionId query
--   parameter. You also need permission for the
--   <tt>s3:GetObjectVersionTagging</tt> action.
--   
--   By default, the bucket owner has this permission and can grant this
--   permission to others.
--   
--   For information about the Amazon S3 object tagging feature, see
--   <a>Object Tagging</a>.
--   
--   The following action is related to <tt>GetObjectTagging</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>PutObjectTagging</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteObjectTagging</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetObjectTagging

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetObjectTagging</a> smart constructor.
data GetObjectTagging
GetObjectTagging' :: Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ObjectKey -> GetObjectTagging

-- | The versionId of the object for which to get the tagging information.
[$sel:versionId:GetObjectTagging'] :: GetObjectTagging -> Maybe ObjectVersionId
[$sel:requestPayer:GetObjectTagging'] :: GetObjectTagging -> Maybe RequestPayer

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:GetObjectTagging'] :: GetObjectTagging -> Maybe Text

-- | The bucket name containing the object for which to get the tagging
--   information.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:GetObjectTagging'] :: GetObjectTagging -> BucketName

-- | Gets the Object Lock configuration for a bucket. The rule specified in
--   the Object Lock configuration will be applied by default to every new
--   object placed in the specified bucket. For more information, see
--   <a>Locking Objects</a>.
module Network.AWS.S3.GetObjectLockConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetObjectLockConfiguration</a> smart constructor.

--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:GetObjectLegalHold'] :: GetObjectLegalHold -> BucketName

--   retrieve.

-- | Returns the access control list (ACL) of an object. To use this
--   operation, you must have <tt>READ_ACP</tt> access to the object.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
--   
--   <b>Versioning</b>
--   
--   By default, GET returns ACL information about the current version of
--   an object. To return ACL information about a different version, use
--   the versionId subresource.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>GetObjectAcl</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetObject</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteObject</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutObject</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetObjectAcl

-- | Retrieves objects from Amazon S3. To use <tt>GET</tt>, you must have
--   <tt>READ</tt> access to the object. If you grant <tt>READ</tt> access
--   to the anonymous user, you can return the object without using an
--   authorization header.
--   
--   An Amazon S3 bucket has no directory hierarchy such as you would find
--   in a typical computer file system. You can, however, create a logical
--   hierarchy by using object key names that imply a folder structure. For
--   example, instead of naming an object <tt>sample.jpg</tt>, you can name
--   it <tt>photos/2006/February/sample.jpg</tt>.
--   
--   To get an object from such a logical hierarchy, specify the full key
--   name for the object in the <tt>GET</tt> operation. For a virtual
--   hosted-style request example, if you have the object
--   <tt>photos/2006/February/sample.jpg</tt>, specify the resource as
--   <tt>/photos/2006/February/sample.jpg</tt>. For a path-style request
--   example, if you have the object
--   <tt>photos/2006/February/sample.jpg</tt> in the bucket named
--   <tt>examplebucket</tt>, specify the resource as
--   <tt>/examplebucket/photos/2006/February/sample.jpg</tt>. For more
--   information about request types, see <a>HTTP Host Header Bucket
--   Specification</a>.
--   
--   To distribute large files to many people, you can save bandwidth costs
--   by using BitTorrent. For more information, see <a>Amazon S3
--   Torrent</a>. For more information about returning the ACL of an
--   object, see <a>GetObjectAcl</a>.
--   
--   If the object you are retrieving is stored in the S3 Glacier or S3
--   Glacier Deep Archive storage class, or S3 Intelligent-Tiering Archive
--   or S3 Intelligent-Tiering Deep Archive tiers, before you can retrieve
--   the object you must first restore a copy using <a>RestoreObject</a>.
--   Otherwise, this action returns an <tt>InvalidObjectStateError</tt>
--   error. For information about restoring archived objects, see
--   <a>Restoring Archived Objects</a>.
--   
--   Encryption request headers, like
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption</tt>, should not be sent for GET
--   requests if your object uses server-side encryption with KMS keys
--   (SSE-KMS) or server-side encryption with Amazon S3–managed encryption
--   keys (SSE-S3). If your object does use these types of keys, you’ll get
--   an HTTP 400 BadRequest error.
--   
--   If you encrypt an object by using server-side encryption with
--   customer-provided encryption keys (SSE-C) when you store the object in
--   Amazon S3, then when you GET the object, you must use the following
--   headers:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</li>
--   <li>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key</li>
--   <li>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key-MD5</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about SSE-C, see <a>Server-Side Encryption (Using
--   Customer-Provided Encryption Keys)</a>.
--   
--   Assuming you have the relevant permission to read object tags, the
--   response also returns the <tt>x-amz-tagging-count</tt> header that
--   provides the count of number of tags associated with the object. You
--   can use <a>GetObjectTagging</a> to retrieve the tag set associated
--   with an object.
--   
--   <b>Permissions</b>
--   
--   You need the relevant read object (or version) permission for this
--   operation. For more information, see <a>Specifying Permissions in a
--   Policy</a>. If the object you request does not exist, the error Amazon
--   S3 returns depends on whether you also have the <tt>s3:ListBucket</tt>
--   permission.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you have the <tt>s3:ListBucket</tt> permission on the bucket,
--   Amazon S3 will return an HTTP status code 404 ("no such key")
--   error.</li>
--   <li>If you don’t have the <tt>s3:ListBucket</tt> permission, Amazon S3
--   will return an HTTP status code 403 ("access denied") error.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>Versioning</b>
--   
--   By default, the GET action returns the current version of an object.
--   To return a different version, use the <tt>versionId</tt> subresource.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You need the <tt>s3:GetObjectVersion</tt> permission to access a
--   specific version of an object.</li>
--   <li>If the current version of the object is a delete marker, Amazon S3
--   behaves as if the object was deleted and includes
--   <tt>x-amz-delete-marker: true</tt> in the response.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about versioning, see <a>PutBucketVersioning</a>.
--   
--   <b>Overriding Response Header Values</b>
--   
--   There are times when you want to override certain response header
--   values in a GET response. For example, you might override the
--   Content-Disposition response header value in your GET request.
--   
--   You can override values for a set of response headers using the
--   following query parameters. These response header values are sent only
--   on a successful request, that is, when status code 200 OK is returned.
--   The set of headers you can override using these parameters is a subset
--   of the headers that Amazon S3 accepts when you create an object. The
--   response headers that you can override for the GET response are
--   <tt>Content-Type</tt>, <tt>Content-Language</tt>, <tt>Expires</tt>,
--   <tt>Cache-Control</tt>, <tt>Content-Disposition</tt>, and
--   <tt>Content-Encoding</tt>. To override these header values in the GET
--   response, you use the following request parameters.
--   
--   You must sign the request, either using an Authorization header or a
--   presigned URL, when using these parameters. They cannot be used with
--   an unsigned (anonymous) request.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>response-content-type</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>response-content-language</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>response-expires</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>response-cache-control</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>response-content-disposition</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>response-content-encoding</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>Additional Considerations about Request Headers</b>
--   
--   If both of the <tt>If-Match</tt> and <tt>If-Unmodified-Since</tt>
--   headers are present in the request as follows: <tt>If-Match</tt>
--   condition evaluates to <tt>true</tt>, and;
--   <tt>If-Unmodified-Since</tt> condition evaluates to <tt>false</tt>;
--   then, S3 returns 200 OK and the data requested.
--   
--   If both of the <tt>If-None-Match</tt> and <tt>If-Modified-Since</tt>
--   headers are present in the request as follows:<tt> If-None-Match</tt>
--   condition evaluates to <tt>false</tt>, and; <tt>If-Modified-Since</tt>
--   condition evaluates to <tt>true</tt>; then, S3 returns 304 Not
--   Modified response code.
--   
--   For more information about conditional requests, see <a>RFC 7232</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>GetObject</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ListBuckets</a></li>
--   <li><a>GetObjectAcl</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetObject

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetObject</a> smart constructor.
data GetObject
GetObject' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ObjectKey -> GetObject

-- | Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one
--   specified, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
[$sel:ifMatch:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe Text

-- | VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
[$sel:versionId:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe ObjectVersionId

-- | Sets the <tt>Content-Type</tt> header of the response.
[$sel:responseContentType:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe Text

-- | Sets the <tt>Content-Disposition</tt> header of the response
[$sel:responseContentDisposition:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe Text

-- | Sets the <tt>Content-Language</tt> header of the response.
[$sel:responseContentLanguage:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use to when decrypting the object (for
--   example, AES256).
[$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 used to
--   encrypt the data. This value is used to decrypt the object when
--   recovering it and must match the one used when storing the data. The
--   key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header.
[$sel:sSECustomerKey:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)
[$sel:requestPayer:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe RequestPayer

-- | Sets the <tt>Content-Encoding</tt> header of the response.
[$sel:responseContentEncoding:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe Text

-- | Return the object only if it has been modified since the specified
--   time, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
[$sel:ifModifiedSince:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Part number of the object being read. This is a positive integer
--   between 1 and 10,000. Effectively performs a 'ranged' GET request for
--   the part specified. Useful for downloading just a part of an object.
[$sel:partNumber:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe Int

-- | Downloads the specified range bytes of an object. For more information
--   about the HTTP Range header, see
--   <a>https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35</a>.
--   
--   Amazon S3 doesn't support retrieving multiple ranges of data per
--   <tt>GET</tt> request.
[$sel:range:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe Text

-- | Return the object only if it has not been modified since the specified
--   time, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
[$sel:ifUnmodifiedSince:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
[$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe Text

-- | Sets the <tt>Cache-Control</tt> header of the response.
[$sel:responseCacheControl:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe Text

-- | Sets the <tt>Expires</tt> header of the response.
[$sel:responseExpires:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is different from the
--   one specified, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
[$sel:ifNoneMatch:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> Maybe Text

-- | The bucket name containing the object.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using an Object Lambda access point the hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-object-lambda.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> BucketName

-- | Key of the object to get.
[$sel:key:GetObject'] :: GetObject -> ObjectKey

-- | Create a value of <a>GetObject</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifMatch:GetObject'</a>, <a>getObject_ifMatch</a> - Return the
--   object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one specified,
--   otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:GetObject'</a>, <a>getObject_versionId</a> -
--   VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:responseContentType:GetObject'</a>,
--   <a>getObject_responseContentType</a> - Sets the <tt>Content-Type</tt>
--   header of the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:responseContentDisposition:GetObject'</a>,
--   <a>getObject_responseContentDisposition</a> - Sets the
--   <tt>Content-Disposition</tt> header of the response
--   
--   <a>$sel:responseContentLanguage:GetObject'</a>,
--   <a>getObject_responseContentLanguage</a> - Sets the
--   <tt>Content-Language</tt> header of the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:GetObject'</a>,
--   <a>getObject_sSECustomerAlgorithm</a> - Specifies the algorithm to use
--   to when decrypting the object (for example, AES256).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKey:GetObject'</a>, <a>getObject_sSECustomerKey</a>
--   - Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 used to
--   encrypt the data. This value is used to decrypt the object when
--   recovering it and must match the one used when storing the data. The
--   key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestPayer:GetObject'</a>, <a>getObject_requestPayer</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:responseContentEncoding:GetObject'</a>,
--   <a>getObject_responseContentEncoding</a> - Sets the
--   <tt>Content-Encoding</tt> header of the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifModifiedSince:GetObject'</a>,
--   <a>getObject_ifModifiedSince</a> - Return the object only if it has
--   been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 304 (not
--   modified).
--   
--   <a>$sel:partNumber:GetObject'</a>, <a>getObject_partNumber</a> - Part
--   number of the object being read. This is a positive integer between 1
--   and 10,000. Effectively performs a 'ranged' GET request for the part
--   specified. Useful for downloading just a part of an object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:range:GetObject'</a>, <a>getObject_range</a> - Downloads the
--   specified range bytes of an object. For more information about the
--   HTTP Range header, see
--   <a>https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35</a>.
--   
--   Amazon S3 doesn't support retrieving multiple ranges of data per
--   <tt>GET</tt> request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifUnmodifiedSince:GetObject'</a>,
--   <a>getObject_ifUnmodifiedSince</a> - Return the object only if it has
--   not been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 412
--   (precondition failed).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:GetObject'</a>,
--   <a>getObject_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest
--   of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this
--   header for a message integrity check to ensure that the encryption key
--   was transmitted without error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:responseCacheControl:GetObject'</a>,
--   <a>getObject_responseCacheControl</a> - Sets the
--   <tt>Cache-Control</tt> header of the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:responseExpires:GetObject'</a>,
--   <a>getObject_responseExpires</a> - Sets the <tt>Expires</tt> header of
--   the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifNoneMatch:GetObject'</a>, <a>getObject_ifNoneMatch</a> -
--   Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is different from the
--   one specified, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:GetObject'</a>,
--   <a>getObject_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the expected
--   bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account, the
--   request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:GetObject'</a>, <a>getObject_bucket</a> - The bucket
--   name containing the object.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using an Object Lambda access point the hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-object-lambda.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:GetObject'</a>, <a>getObject_key</a> - Key of the object
--   to get.
newGetObject :: BucketName -> ObjectKey -> GetObject

-- | Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one
--   specified, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
getObject_ifMatch :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
getObject_versionId :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | Sets the <tt>Content-Type</tt> header of the response.
getObject_responseContentType :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the <tt>Content-Disposition</tt> header of the response
getObject_responseContentDisposition :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the <tt>Content-Language</tt> header of the response.
getObject_responseContentLanguage :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use to when decrypting the object (for
--   example, AES256).
getObject_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 used to
--   encrypt the data. This value is used to decrypt the object when
--   recovering it and must match the one used when storing the data. The
--   key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the

--   time, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
getObject_ifModifiedSince :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Part number of the object being read. This is a positive integer
--   between 1 and 10,000. Effectively performs a 'ranged' GET request for
--   the part specified. Useful for downloading just a part of an object.
getObject_partNumber :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Int)

-- | Downloads the specified range bytes of an object. For more information
--   about the HTTP Range header, see
--   <a>https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35</a>.
--   
--   Amazon S3 doesn't support retrieving multiple ranges of data per
--   <tt>GET</tt> request.
getObject_range :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)
