--   time, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
getObject_ifUnmodifiedSince :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe UTCTime)

--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
getObject_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the <tt>Cache-Control</tt> header of the response.
getObject_responseCacheControl :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the <tt>Expires</tt> header of the response.
getObject_responseExpires :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is different from the
--   one specified, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
getObject_ifNoneMatch :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
getObject_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The bucket name containing the object.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using an Object Lambda access point the hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-object-lambda.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
getObject_bucket :: Lens' GetObject BucketName

-- | Key of the object to get.
getObject_key :: Lens' GetObject ObjectKey

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetObjectResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetObjectResponse
GetObjectResponse' :: Maybe RequestCharged -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ETag -> Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe ObjectLockMode -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> HashMap Text Text -> Maybe ReplicationStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ResponseBody -> GetObjectResponse
[$sel:requestCharged:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe RequestCharged

-- | The count of parts this object has.
[$sel:partsCount:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | An ETag is an opaque identifier assigned by a web server to a specific
--   version of a resource found at a URL.
[$sel:eTag:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe ETag

-- | Version of the object.
[$sel:versionId:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe ObjectVersionId

-- | Size of the body in bytes.
[$sel:contentLength:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Integer

-- | The Object Lock mode currently in place for this object.
[$sel:objectLockMode:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe ObjectLockMode

-- | The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable.
[$sel:expires:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Provides information about object restoration action and expiration
--   time of the restored object copy.
[$sel:restore:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | If the object expiration is configured (see PUT Bucket lifecycle), the
--   response includes this header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id
--   key-value pairs providing object expiration information. The value of
--   the rule-id is URL encoded.
[$sel:expiration:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether the object retrieved was (true) or was not (false) a
--   Delete Marker. If false, this response header does not appear in the
--   response.
[$sel:deleteMarker:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header confirming the
--   encryption algorithm used.
[$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of tags, if any, on the object.
[$sel:tagCount:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | This is set to the number of metadata entries not returned in
--   <tt>x-amz-meta</tt> headers. This can happen if you create metadata
--   using an API like SOAP that supports more flexible metadata than the
--   REST API. For example, using SOAP, you can create metadata whose
--   values are not legal HTTP headers.
[$sel:missingMeta:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Int

-- | Indicates whether the object uses an S3 Bucket Key for server-side
--   encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
[$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this
--   object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL.
--   Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.
[$sel:websiteRedirectLocation:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates that a range of bytes was specified.
[$sel:acceptRanges:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Provides storage class information of the object. Amazon S3 returns
--   this header for all objects except for S3 Standard storage class
--   objects.
[$sel:storageClass:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe StorageClass

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header to provide round-trip
--   message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption
--   key.
[$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | If present, specifies the ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key that
--   was used for the object.
[$sel:sSEKMSKeyId:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and
--   thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type
--   referenced by the Content-Type header field.
[$sel:contentEncoding:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time when this object's Object Lock will expire.
[$sel:objectLockRetainUntilDate:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | A map of metadata to store with the object in S3.
[$sel:metadata:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Amazon S3 can return this if your request involves a bucket that is
--   either a source or destination in a replication rule.
[$sel:replicationStatus:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe ReplicationStatus

-- | Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
[$sel:cacheControl:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The language the content is in.
[$sel:contentLanguage:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Creation date of the object.
[$sel:lastModified:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Indicates whether this object has an active legal hold. This field is
--   only returned if you have permission to view an object's legal hold
--   status.
[$sel:objectLockLegalHoldStatus:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus

-- | Specifies presentational information for the object.
[$sel:contentDisposition:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The portion of the object returned in the response.
[$sel:contentRange:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in
--   Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
[$sel:serverSideEncryption:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption

-- | A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
[$sel:contentType:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> Int

-- | Object data.
[$sel:body:GetObjectResponse'] :: GetObjectResponse -> ResponseBody

--   omitted.

getObjectResponse_objectLockMode :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe ObjectLockMode)

-- | The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable.
getObjectResponse_expires :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Provides information about object restoration action and expiration
--   time of the restored object copy.
getObjectResponse_restore :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If the object expiration is configured (see PUT Bucket lifecycle), the
--   response includes this header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id
--   key-value pairs providing object expiration information. The value of
--   the rule-id is URL encoded.
getObjectResponse_expiration :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the object retrieved was (true) or was not (false) a
--   Delete Marker. If false, this response header does not appear in the
--   response.
getObjectResponse_deleteMarker :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header confirming the
--   encryption algorithm used.
getObjectResponse_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of tags, if any, on the object.
getObjectResponse_tagCount :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | This is set to the number of metadata entries not returned in
--   <tt>x-amz-meta</tt> headers. This can happen if you create metadata
--   using an API like SOAP that supports more flexible metadata than the
--   REST API. For example, using SOAP, you can create metadata whose
--   values are not legal HTTP headers.
getObjectResponse_missingMeta :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates whether the object uses an S3 Bucket Key for server-side
--   encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
getObjectResponse_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this
--   object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL.
--   Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.
getObjectResponse_websiteRedirectLocation :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates that a range of bytes was specified.
getObjectResponse_acceptRanges :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Provides storage class information of the object. Amazon S3 returns
--   this header for all objects except for S3 Standard storage class
--   objects.
getObjectResponse_storageClass :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header to provide round-trip
--   message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption
--   key.
getObjectResponse_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If present, specifies the ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key that
--   was used for the object.
getObjectResponse_sSEKMSKeyId :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and
--   thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type
--   referenced by the Content-Type header field.
getObjectResponse_contentEncoding :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when this object's Object Lock will expire.
getObjectResponse_objectLockRetainUntilDate :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of metadata to store with the object in S3.
getObjectResponse_metadata :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Amazon S3 can return this if your request involves a bucket that is
--   either a source or destination in a replication rule.
getObjectResponse_replicationStatus :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe ReplicationStatus)

-- | Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
getObjectResponse_cacheControl :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The language the content is in.
getObjectResponse_contentLanguage :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Creation date of the object.
getObjectResponse_lastModified :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Indicates whether this object has an active legal hold. This field is
--   only returned if you have permission to view an object's legal hold
--   status.
getObjectResponse_objectLockLegalHoldStatus :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus)

-- | Specifies presentational information for the object.
getObjectResponse_contentDisposition :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The portion of the object returned in the response.
getObjectResponse_contentRange :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in
--   Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
getObjectResponse_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
getObjectResponse_contentType :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getObjectResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetObjectResponse Int

-- | Object data.
getObjectResponse_body :: Lens' GetObjectResponse ResponseBody
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.GetObject.GetObject
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.GetObject.GetObject
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.GetObject.GetObject
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.GetObject.GetObjectResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.GetObject.GetObjectResponse

-- | Returns the website configuration for a bucket. To host website on
--   Amazon S3, you can configure a bucket as website by adding a website
--   configuration. For more information about hosting websites, see
--   <a>Hosting Websites on Amazon S3</a>.
--   
--   This GET action requires the <tt>S3:GetBucketWebsite</tt> permission.
--   By default, only the bucket owner can read the bucket website
--   configuration. However, bucket owners can allow other users to read
--   the website configuration by writing a bucket policy granting them the
--   <tt>S3:GetBucketWebsite</tt> permission.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>DeleteBucketWebsite</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketWebsite</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutBucketWebsite</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetBucketWebsite

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBucketWebsite</a> smart constructor.
data GetBucketWebsite
GetBucketWebsite' :: Maybe Text -> BucketName -> GetBucketWebsite

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:GetBucketWebsite'] :: GetBucketWebsite -> Maybe Text

-- | The bucket name for which to get the website configuration.
[$sel:bucket:GetBucketWebsite'] :: GetBucketWebsite -> BucketName

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBucketWebsite</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:GetBucketWebsite'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketWebsite_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the
--   expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account,
--   the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:GetBucketWebsite'</a>, <a>getBucketWebsite_bucket</a> -
--   The bucket name for which to get the website configuration.
newGetBucketWebsite :: BucketName -> GetBucketWebsite

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
getBucketWebsite_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' GetBucketWebsite (Maybe Text)

-- | The bucket name for which to get the website configuration.
getBucketWebsite_bucket :: Lens' GetBucketWebsite BucketName

--   of an Amazon S3 bucket.

--   errors.

--   behavior.

-- | Returns the versioning state of a bucket.
--   
--   To retrieve the versioning state of a bucket, you must be the bucket
--   owner.
--   
--   This implementation also returns the MFA Delete status of the
--   versioning state. If the MFA Delete status is <tt>enabled</tt>, the
--   bucket owner must use an authentication device to change the
--   versioning state of the bucket.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>GetBucketVersioning</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetObject</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutObject</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteObject</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetBucketVersioning

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBucketVersioning</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account,
--   the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:GetBucketVersioning'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketVersioning_bucket</a> - The name of the bucket for which
--   to get the versioning information.

[$sel:mfaDelete:GetBucketVersioningResponse'] :: GetBucketVersioningResponse -> Maybe MFADeleteStatus

-- | Returns the tag set associated with the bucket.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permission to perform the
--   <tt>s3:GetBucketTagging</tt> action. By default, the bucket owner has
--   this permission and can grant this permission to others.
--   
--   <tt>GetBucketTagging</tt> has the following special error:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Error code: <tt>NoSuchTagSetError</tt><ul><li>Description: There
--   is no tag set associated with the bucket.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>GetBucketTagging</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>PutBucketTagging</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketTagging</a></li>
--   </ul>

-- | Returns the request payment configuration of a bucket. To use this
--   version of the operation, you must be the bucket owner. For more
--   information, see <a>Requester Pays Buckets</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to
--   <tt>GetBucketRequestPayment</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ListObjects</a></li>
--   </ul>

-- | Returns the replication configuration of a bucket.
--   
--   It can take a while to propagate the put or delete a replication
--   configuration to all Amazon S3 systems. Therefore, a get request soon
--   after put or delete can return a wrong result.
--   
--   For information about replication configuration, see
--   <a>Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   This action requires permissions for the
--   <tt>s3:GetReplicationConfiguration</tt> action. For more information
--   about permissions, see <a>Using Bucket Policies and User Policies</a>.
--   
--   If you include the <tt>Filter</tt> element in a replication
--   configuration, you must also include the
--   <tt>DeleteMarkerReplication</tt> and <tt>Priority</tt> elements. The
--   response also returns those elements.
--   
--   For information about <tt>GetBucketReplication</tt> errors, see
--   <a>List of replication-related error codes</a>
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>GetBucketReplication</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>PutBucketReplication</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketReplication</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetBucketReplication

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBucketReplication</a> smart constructor.
data GetBucketReplication
GetBucketReplication' :: Maybe Text -> BucketName -> GetBucketReplication

--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.

-- | The bucket name for which to get the replication information.
[$sel:bucket:GetBucketReplication'] :: GetBucketReplication -> BucketName

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBucketReplication</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>getBucketReplication_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of
--   the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different
--   account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access
--   Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:GetBucketReplication'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketReplication_bucket</a> - The bucket name for which to get
--   the replication information.

-- | Returns the policy of a specified bucket. If you are using an identity
--   other than the root user of the Amazon Web Services account that owns
--   the bucket, the calling identity must have the
--   <tt>GetBucketPolicy</tt> permissions on the specified bucket and
--   belong to the bucket owner's account in order to use this operation.
--   
--   If you don't have <tt>GetBucketPolicy</tt> permissions, Amazon S3
--   returns a <tt>403 Access Denied</tt> error. If you have the correct
--   permissions, but you're not using an identity that belongs to the
--   bucket owner's account, Amazon S3 returns a <tt>405 Method Not
--   Allowed</tt> error.
--   
--   As a security precaution, the root user of the Amazon Web Services
--   account that owns a bucket can always use this operation, even if the
--   policy explicitly denies the root user the ability to perform this
--   action.
--   
--   For more information about bucket policies, see <a>Using Bucket
--   Policies and User Policies</a>.
--   
--   The following action is related to <tt>GetBucketPolicy</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetObject</a></li>
--   </ul>

-- | Returns the notification configuration of a bucket.
--   
--   If notifications are not enabled on the bucket, the action returns an
--   empty <tt>NotificationConfiguration</tt> element.
--   
--   By default, you must be the bucket owner to read the notification
--   configuration of a bucket. However, the bucket owner can use a bucket
--   policy to grant permission to other users to read this configuration
--   with the <tt>s3:GetBucketNotification</tt> permission.
--   
--   For more information about setting and reading the notification
--   configuration on a bucket, see <a>Setting Up Notification of Bucket
--   Events</a>. For more information about bucket policies, see <a>Using
--   Bucket Policies</a>.
--   
--   The following action is related to <tt>GetBucketNotification</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>PutBucketNotification</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetBucketNotificationConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBucketNotificationConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetBucketNotificationConfiguration
GetBucketNotificationConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> BucketName -> GetBucketNotificationConfiguration

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:GetBucketNotificationConfiguration'] :: GetBucketNotificationConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bucket for which to get the notification
--   configuration.
[$sel:bucket:GetBucketNotificationConfiguration'] :: GetBucketNotificationConfiguration -> BucketName

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBucketNotificationConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:GetBucketNotificationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketNotificationConfiguration_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The
--   account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a
--   different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access
--   Denied)</tt> error.
--

--   <a>getBucketNotificationConfiguration_bucket</a> - The name of the
--   bucket for which to get the notification configuration.

--   configuration.
getBucketNotificationConfiguration_bucket :: Lens' GetBucketNotificationConfiguration BucketName

-- | A container for specifying the notification configuration of the
--   bucket. If this element is empty, notifications are turned off for the
--   bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotificationConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data NotificationConfiguration
NotificationConfiguration' :: Maybe [QueueConfiguration] -> Maybe [TopicConfiguration] -> Maybe [LambdaFunctionConfiguration] -> NotificationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Simple Queue Service queues to publish messages to and the
--   events for which to publish messages.
[$sel:queueConfigurations:NotificationConfiguration'] :: NotificationConfiguration -> Maybe [QueueConfiguration]

-- | The topic to which notifications are sent and the events for which
--   notifications are generated.
[$sel:topicConfigurations:NotificationConfiguration'] :: NotificationConfiguration -> Maybe [TopicConfiguration]

-- | Describes the Lambda functions to invoke and the events for which to
--   invoke them.
[$sel:lambdaFunctionConfigurations:NotificationConfiguration'] :: NotificationConfiguration -> Maybe [LambdaFunctionConfiguration]

-- | Create a value of <a>NotificationConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueConfigurations:NotificationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>notificationConfiguration_queueConfigurations</a> - The Amazon
--   Simple Queue Service queues to publish messages to and the events for
--   which to publish messages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicConfigurations:NotificationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>notificationConfiguration_topicConfigurations</a> - The topic to
--   which notifications are sent and the events for which notifications
--   are generated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambdaFunctionConfigurations:NotificationConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>notificationConfiguration_lambdaFunctionConfigurations</a> -
--   Describes the Lambda functions to invoke and the events for which to
--   invoke them.
newNotificationConfiguration :: NotificationConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Simple Queue Service queues to publish messages to and the
--   events for which to publish messages.
notificationConfiguration_queueConfigurations :: Lens' NotificationConfiguration (Maybe [QueueConfiguration])

--   notifications are generated.
notificationConfiguration_topicConfigurations :: Lens' NotificationConfiguration (Maybe [TopicConfiguration])

--   invoke them.

-- | Gets a metrics configuration (specified by the metrics configuration
--   ID) from the bucket. Note that this doesn't include the daily storage
--   metrics.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permissions to perform the
--   <tt>s3:GetMetricsConfiguration</tt> action. The bucket owner has this
--   permission by default. The bucket owner can grant this permission to
--   others. For more information about permissions, see <a>Permissions
--   Related to Bucket Subresource Operations</a> and <a>Managing Access
--   Permissions to Your Amazon S3 Resources</a>.
--   
--   For information about CloudWatch request metrics for Amazon S3, see
--   <a>Monitoring Metrics with Amazon CloudWatch</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to
--   <tt>GetBucketMetricsConfiguration</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>PutBucketMetricsConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketMetricsConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListBucketMetricsConfigurations</a></li>
--   <li><a>Monitoring Metrics with Amazon CloudWatch</a></li>
--   </ul>

-- | Bucket lifecycle configuration now supports specifying a lifecycle
--   rule using an object key name prefix, one or more object tags, or a
--   combination of both. Accordingly, this section describes the latest
--   API. The response describes the new filter element that you can use to
--   specify a filter to select a subset of objects to which the rule
--   applies. If you are using a previous version of the lifecycle
--   configuration, it still works. For the earlier action, see
--   <a>GetBucketLifecycle</a>.
--   
--   Returns the lifecycle configuration information set on the bucket. For
--   information about lifecycle configuration, see <a>Object Lifecycle
--   Management</a>.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permission to perform the
--   <tt>s3:GetLifecycleConfiguration</tt> action. The bucket owner has
--   this permission, by default. The bucket owner can grant this
--   permission to others. For more information about permissions, see
--   <a>Permissions Related to Bucket Subresource Operations</a> and
--   <a>Managing Access Permissions to Your Amazon S3 Resources</a>.
--   
--   <tt>GetBucketLifecycleConfiguration</tt> has the following special
--   error:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Error code:
--   <tt>NoSuchLifecycleConfiguration</tt><ul><li>Description: The
--   lifecycle configuration does not exist.</li><li>HTTP Status Code: 404
--   Not Found</li><li>SOAP Fault Code Prefix: Client</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The following operations are related to
--   <tt>GetBucketLifecycleConfiguration</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetBucketLifecycle</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutBucketLifecycle</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketLifecycle</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetBucketLifecycleConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBucketLifecycleConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetBucketLifecycleConfiguration
GetBucketLifecycleConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> BucketName -> GetBucketLifecycleConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBucketLifecycleConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--

--   account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a
--   different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access
--   Denied)</tt> error.

--   <a>$sel:bucket:GetBucketLifecycleConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketLifecycleConfiguration_bucket</a> - The name of the bucket

--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
getBucketLifecycleConfiguration_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' GetBucketLifecycleConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Returns an inventory configuration (identified by the inventory
--   configuration ID) from the bucket.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permissions to perform the
--   <tt>s3:GetInventoryConfiguration</tt> action. The bucket owner has
--   this permission by default and can grant this permission to others.
--   For more information about permissions, see <a>Permissions Related to
--   Bucket Subresource Operations</a> and <a>Managing Access Permissions
--   to Your Amazon S3 Resources</a>.
--   
--   For information about the Amazon S3 inventory feature, see <a>Amazon
--   S3 Inventory</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to
--   <tt>GetBucketInventoryConfiguration</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>

-- | Gets the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration from the specified
--   bucket.
--   
--   The S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class is designed to optimize
--   storage costs by automatically moving data to the most cost-effective
--   storage access tier, without performance impact or operational
--   overhead. S3 Intelligent-Tiering delivers automatic cost savings in
--   two low latency and high throughput access tiers. For data that can be
--   accessed asynchronously, you can choose to activate automatic
--   archiving capabilities within the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage
--   class.
--   
--   The S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class is the ideal storage class
--   for data with unknown, changing, or unpredictable access patterns,
--   independent of object size or retention period. If the size of an
--   object is less than 128 KB, it is not eligible for auto-tiering.
--   Smaller objects can be stored, but they are always charged at the
--   Frequent Access tier rates in the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage
--   class.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Storage class for automatically
--   optimizing frequently and infrequently accessed objects</a>.
--   
--   Operations related to
--   <tt>GetBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration</tt> include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration
GetBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration' :: BucketName -> Text -> GetBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket whose configuration you want to
--   modify or retrieve.
[$sel:bucket:GetBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration'] :: GetBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration -> BucketName

--   all optional fields omitted.

--

--   the Amazon S3 bucket whose configuration you want to modify or
--   retrieve.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:GetBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration_id</a> - The ID used to
--   identify the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration.

--   modify or retrieve.

--   smart constructor.

-- | Returns the default encryption configuration for an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   If the bucket does not have a default encryption configuration,
--   GetBucketEncryption returns
--   <tt>ServerSideEncryptionConfigurationNotFoundError</tt>.
--   
--   For information about the Amazon S3 default encryption feature, see
--   <a>Amazon S3 Default Bucket Encryption</a>.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permission to perform the
--   <tt>s3:GetEncryptionConfiguration</tt> action. The bucket owner has
--   this permission by default. The bucket owner can grant this permission
--   to others. For more information about permissions, see <a>Permissions
--   Related to Bucket Subresource Operations</a> and <a>Managing Access
--   Permissions to Your Amazon S3 Resources</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>GetBucketEncryption</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>PutBucketEncryption</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketEncryption</a></li>
--   </ul>

-- | Returns the cors configuration information set for the bucket.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permission to perform the
--   s3:GetBucketCORS action. By default, the bucket owner has this
--   permission and can grant it to others.
--   
--   For more information about cors, see <a>Enabling Cross-Origin Resource
--   Sharing</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>GetBucketCors</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>PutBucketCors</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketCors</a></li>
--   </ul>

-- | This implementation of the GET action returns an analytics
--   configuration (identified by the analytics configuration ID) from the
--   bucket.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permissions to perform the
--   <tt>s3:GetAnalyticsConfiguration</tt> action. The bucket owner has
--   this permission by default. The bucket owner can grant this permission
--   to others. For more information about permissions, see <a>Permissions
--   Related to Bucket Subresource Operations</a> and <a>Managing Access
--   Permissions to Your Amazon S3 Resources</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   For information about Amazon S3 analytics feature, see <a>Amazon S3
--   Analytics – Storage Class Analysis</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <b>Related Resources</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>DeleteBucketAnalyticsConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutBucketAnalyticsConfiguration</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration
GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> BucketName -> Text -> GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration'] :: GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bucket from which an analytics configuration is
--   retrieved.
[$sel:bucket:GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration'] :: GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration -> BucketName

--   optional fields omitted.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketAnalyticsConfiguration_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The
--   account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a
--   different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access
--   Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketAnalyticsConfiguration_bucket</a> - The name of the bucket
--   from which an analytics configuration is retrieved.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketAnalyticsConfiguration_id</a> - The ID that identifies the
--   analytics configuration.
newGetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration :: BucketName -> Text -> GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
getBucketAnalyticsConfiguration_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration (Maybe Text)

--   retrieved.
getBucketAnalyticsConfiguration_bucket :: Lens' GetBucketAnalyticsConfiguration BucketName

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBucketAnalyticsConfigurationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetBucketAnalyticsConfigurationResponse
GetBucketAnalyticsConfigurationResponse' :: Maybe AnalyticsConfiguration -> Int -> GetBucketAnalyticsConfigurationResponse

[$sel:analyticsConfiguration:GetBucketAnalyticsConfigurationResponse'] :: GetBucketAnalyticsConfigurationResponse -> Maybe AnalyticsConfiguration

-- | The response's http status code.

-- | This implementation of the <tt>GET</tt> action uses the <tt>acl</tt>
--   subresource to return the access control list (ACL) of a bucket. To
--   use <tt>GET</tt> to return the ACL of the bucket, you must have
--   <tt>READ_ACP</tt> access to the bucket. If <tt>READ_ACP</tt>
--   permission is granted to the anonymous user, you can return the ACL of
--   the bucket without using an authorization header.
--   
--   <b>Related Resources</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>ListObjects</a></li>
--   </ul>

-- | This implementation of the GET action uses the <tt>accelerate</tt>
--   subresource to return the Transfer Acceleration state of a bucket,
--   which is either <tt>Enabled</tt> or <tt>Suspended</tt>. Amazon S3
--   Transfer Acceleration is a bucket-level feature that enables you to
--   perform faster data transfers to and from Amazon S3.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permission to perform the
--   <tt>s3:GetAccelerateConfiguration</tt> action. The bucket owner has
--   this permission by default. The bucket owner can grant this permission
--   to others. For more information about permissions, see <a>Permissions
--   Related to Bucket Subresource Operations</a> and <a>Managing Access
--   Permissions to your Amazon S3 Resources</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   You set the Transfer Acceleration state of an existing bucket to
--   <tt>Enabled</tt> or <tt>Suspended</tt> by using the
--   <a>PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration</a> operation.
--   
--   A GET <tt>accelerate</tt> request does not return a state value for a
--   bucket that has no transfer acceleration state. A bucket has no
--   Transfer Acceleration state if a state has never been set on the
--   bucket.
--   
--   For more information about transfer acceleration, see <a>Transfer
--   Acceleration</a> in the Amazon S3 User Guide.
--   
--   <b>Related Resources</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>PutBucketAccelerateConfiguration</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.GetBucketAccelerateConfiguration

-- | This action enables you to delete multiple objects from a bucket using
--   a single HTTP request. If you know the object keys that you want to
--   delete, then this action provides a suitable alternative to sending
--   individual delete requests, reducing per-request overhead.
--   
--   The request contains a list of up to 1000 keys that you want to
--   delete. In the XML, you provide the object key names, and optionally,
--   version IDs if you want to delete a specific version of the object
--   from a versioning-enabled bucket. For each key, Amazon S3 performs a
--   delete action and returns the result of that delete, success, or
--   failure, in the response. Note that if the object specified in the
--   request is not found, Amazon S3 returns the result as deleted.
--   
--   The action supports two modes for the response: verbose and quiet. By
--   default, the action uses verbose mode in which the response includes
--   the result of deletion of each key in your request. In quiet mode the
--   response includes only keys where the delete action encountered an
--   error. For a successful deletion, the action does not return any
--   information about the delete in the response body.
--   
--   When performing this action on an MFA Delete enabled bucket, that
--   attempts to delete any versioned objects, you must include an MFA
--   token. If you do not provide one, the entire request will fail, even
--   if there are non-versioned objects you are trying to delete. If you
--   provide an invalid token, whether there are versioned keys in the
--   request or not, the entire Multi-Object Delete request will fail. For
--   information about MFA Delete, see <a>MFA Delete</a>.
--   
--   Finally, the Content-MD5 header is required for all Multi-Object
--   Delete requests. Amazon S3 uses the header value to ensure that your
--   request body has not been altered in transit.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>DeleteObjects</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>CreateMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>UploadPart</a></li>
--   <li><a>CompleteMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListParts</a></li>
--   <li><a>AbortMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.DeleteObjects

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteObjects</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteObjects
DeleteObjects' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> Delete -> DeleteObjects

-- | The concatenation of the authentication device's serial number, a
--   space, and the value that is displayed on your authentication device.
--   Required to permanently delete a versioned object if versioning is
--   configured with MFA delete enabled.
[$sel:mfa:DeleteObjects'] :: DeleteObjects -> Maybe Text
[$sel:requestPayer:DeleteObjects'] :: DeleteObjects -> Maybe RequestPayer

-- | Specifies whether you want to delete this object even if it has a
--   Governance-type Object Lock in place. To use this header, you must
--   have the <tt>s3:PutBucketPublicAccessBlock</tt> permission.
[$sel:bypassGovernanceRetention:DeleteObjects'] :: DeleteObjects -> Maybe Bool

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:DeleteObjects'] :: DeleteObjects -> Maybe Text

-- | The bucket name containing the objects to delete.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:DeleteObjects'] :: DeleteObjects -> BucketName

-- | Container for the request.
[$sel:delete':DeleteObjects'] :: DeleteObjects -> Delete

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteObjects</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mfa:DeleteObjects'</a>, <a>deleteObjects_mfa</a> - The
--   concatenation of the authentication device's serial number, a space,
--   and the value that is displayed on your authentication device.
--   Required to permanently delete a versioned object if versioning is
--   configured with MFA delete enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestPayer:DeleteObjects'</a>,
--   <a>deleteObjects_requestPayer</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bypassGovernanceRetention:DeleteObjects'</a>,
--   <a>deleteObjects_bypassGovernanceRetention</a> - Specifies whether you
--   want to delete this object even if it has a Governance-type Object
--   Lock in place. To use this header, you must have the
--   <tt>s3:PutBucketPublicAccessBlock</tt> permission.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:DeleteObjects'</a>,

--   the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.

--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--

--   Container for the request.
newDeleteObjects :: BucketName -> Delete -> DeleteObjects

-- | Specifies whether you want to delete this object even if it has a
--   Governance-type Object Lock in place. To use this header, you must
--   have the <tt>s3:PutBucketPublicAccessBlock</tt> permission.
deleteObjects_bypassGovernanceRetention :: Lens' DeleteObjects (Maybe Bool)

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
deleteObjects_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' DeleteObjects (Maybe Text)

-- | The bucket name containing the objects to delete.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
deleteObjects_bucket :: Lens' DeleteObjects BucketName

-- | Container for the request.
deleteObjects_delete :: Lens' DeleteObjects Delete

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteObjectsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteObjectsResponse
DeleteObjectsResponse' :: Maybe RequestCharged -> Maybe [DeletedObject] -> Maybe [S3ServiceError] -> Int -> DeleteObjectsResponse
[$sel:requestCharged:DeleteObjectsResponse'] :: DeleteObjectsResponse -> Maybe RequestCharged

-- | Container element for a successful delete. It identifies the object
--   that was successfully deleted.
[$sel:deleted:DeleteObjectsResponse'] :: DeleteObjectsResponse -> Maybe [DeletedObject]

-- | Container for a failed delete action that describes the object that
--   Amazon S3 attempted to delete and the error it encountered.
[$sel:errors:DeleteObjectsResponse'] :: DeleteObjectsResponse -> Maybe [S3ServiceError]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteObjectsResponse'] :: DeleteObjectsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteObjectsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>$sel:deleted:DeleteObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteObjectsResponse_deleted</a> - Container element for a
--   successful delete. It identifies the object that was successfully
--   deleted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errors:DeleteObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteObjectsResponse_errors</a> - Container for a failed delete
--   action that describes the object that Amazon S3 attempted to delete
--   and the error it encountered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteObjectsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.

deleteObjectsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteObjectsResponse Int

-- | Removes the entire tag set from the specified object. For more
--   information about managing object tags, see <a>Object Tagging</a>.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permission to perform the
--   <tt>s3:DeleteObjectTagging</tt> action.
--   
--   To delete tags of a specific object version, add the
--   <tt>versionId</tt> query parameter in the request. You will need
--   permission for the <tt>s3:DeleteObjectVersionTagging</tt> action.
--   
--   The following operations are related to
--   <tt>DeleteBucketMetricsConfiguration</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>PutObjectTagging</a></li>
--   <li><a>GetObjectTagging</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.DeleteObjectTagging

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteObjectTagging</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteObjectTagging
DeleteObjectTagging' :: Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ObjectKey -> DeleteObjectTagging

-- | The versionId of the object that the tag-set will be removed from.
[$sel:versionId:DeleteObjectTagging'] :: DeleteObjectTagging -> Maybe ObjectVersionId

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:DeleteObjectTagging'] :: DeleteObjectTagging -> Maybe Text

-- | The bucket name containing the objects from which to remove the tags.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:DeleteObjectTagging'] :: DeleteObjectTagging -> BucketName

-- | The key that identifies the object in the bucket from which to remove
--   all tags.
[$sel:key:DeleteObjectTagging'] :: DeleteObjectTagging -> ObjectKey

--   omitted.

-- | Removes the null version (if there is one) of an object and inserts a
--   delete marker, which becomes the latest version of the object. If
--   there isn't a null version, Amazon S3 does not remove any objects but
--   will still respond that the command was successful.
--   
--   To remove a specific version, you must be the bucket owner and you
--   must use the version Id subresource. Using this subresource
--   permanently deletes the version. If the object deleted is a delete
--   marker, Amazon S3 sets the response header,
--   <tt>x-amz-delete-marker</tt>, to true.
--   
--   If the object you want to delete is in a bucket where the bucket
--   versioning configuration is MFA Delete enabled, you must include the
--   <tt>x-amz-mfa</tt> request header in the DELETE <tt>versionId</tt>
--   request. Requests that include <tt>x-amz-mfa</tt> must use HTTPS.
--   
--   For more information about MFA Delete, see <a>Using MFA Delete</a>. To
--   see sample requests that use versioning, see <a>Sample Request</a>.
--   
--   You can delete objects by explicitly calling DELETE Object or
--   configure its lifecycle (<a>PutBucketLifecycle</a>) to enable Amazon
--   S3 to remove them for you. If you want to block users or accounts from
--   removing or deleting objects from your bucket, you must deny them the
--   <tt>s3:DeleteObject</tt>, <tt>s3:DeleteObjectVersion</tt>, and
--   <tt>s3:PutLifeCycleConfiguration</tt> actions.
--   
--   The following action is related to <tt>DeleteObject</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>PutObject</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.DeleteObject

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteObject</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteObject
DeleteObject' :: Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ObjectKey -> DeleteObject

-- | VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
[$sel:versionId:DeleteObject'] :: DeleteObject -> Maybe ObjectVersionId

-- | The concatenation of the authentication device's serial number, a
--   space, and the value that is displayed on your authentication device.
--   Required to permanently delete a versioned object if versioning is
--   configured with MFA delete enabled.
[$sel:mfa:DeleteObject'] :: DeleteObject -> Maybe Text
[$sel:requestPayer:DeleteObject'] :: DeleteObject -> Maybe RequestPayer

-- | Indicates whether S3 Object Lock should bypass Governance-mode
--   restrictions to process this operation. To use this header, you must
--   have the <tt>s3:PutBucketPublicAccessBlock</tt> permission.
[$sel:bypassGovernanceRetention:DeleteObject'] :: DeleteObject -> Maybe Bool

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:DeleteObject'] :: DeleteObject -> Maybe Text

-- | The bucket name of the bucket containing the object.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:DeleteObject'] :: DeleteObject -> BucketName

-- | Key name of the object to delete.
[$sel:key:DeleteObject'] :: DeleteObject -> ObjectKey

--   omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mfa:DeleteObject'</a>, <a>deleteObject_mfa</a> - The
--   concatenation of the authentication device's serial number, a space,
--   and the value that is displayed on your authentication device.
--   Required to permanently delete a versioned object if versioning is
--   configured with MFA delete enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestPayer:DeleteObject'</a>,
--   <a>deleteObject_requestPayer</a> - Undocumented member.
--

--   <a>deleteObject_bypassGovernanceRetention</a> - Indicates whether S3
--   Object Lock should bypass Governance-mode restrictions to process this
--   operation. To use this header, you must have the
--   <tt>s3:PutBucketPublicAccessBlock</tt> permission.

--   was (true) or was not (false) a delete marker.
[$sel:deleteMarker:DeleteObjectResponse'] :: DeleteObjectResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteObjectResponse'] :: DeleteObjectResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteObjectResponse</a> with all optional fields

--   delete marker created as a result of the DELETE operation.

--   <a>$sel:deleteMarker:DeleteObjectResponse'</a>,

--   versioned object that was permanently deleted was (true) or was not
--   (false) a delete marker.

--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteObjectResponse'</a>,

-- | This action removes the website configuration for a bucket. Amazon S3
--   returns a <tt>200 OK</tt> response upon successfully deleting a
--   website configuration on the specified bucket. You will get a <tt>200
--   OK</tt> response if the website configuration you are trying to delete
--   does not exist on the bucket. Amazon S3 returns a <tt>404</tt>
--   response if the bucket specified in the request does not exist.
--   
--   This DELETE action requires the <tt>S3:DeleteBucketWebsite</tt>
--   permission. By default, only the bucket owner can delete the website
--   configuration attached to a bucket. However, bucket owners can grant
--   other users permission to delete the website configuration by writing
--   a bucket policy granting them the <tt>S3:DeleteBucketWebsite</tt>
--   permission.
--   
--   For more information about hosting websites, see <a>Hosting Websites
--   on Amazon S3</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>DeleteBucketWebsite</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetBucketWebsite</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutBucketWebsite</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.DeleteBucketWebsite

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteBucketWebsite</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteBucketWebsite
DeleteBucketWebsite' :: Maybe Text -> BucketName -> DeleteBucketWebsite

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:DeleteBucketWebsite'] :: DeleteBucketWebsite -> Maybe Text

-- | The bucket name for which you want to remove the website
--   configuration.
[$sel:bucket:DeleteBucketWebsite'] :: DeleteBucketWebsite -> BucketName

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteBucketWebsite</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:DeleteBucketWebsite'</a>,
--   <a>deleteBucketWebsite_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the
--   expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account,
--   the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:DeleteBucketWebsite'</a>,
--   <a>deleteBucketWebsite_bucket</a> - The bucket name for which you want
--   to remove the website configuration.
newDeleteBucketWebsite :: BucketName -> DeleteBucketWebsite

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.

-- | Deletes the replication configuration from the bucket.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permissions to perform the
--   <tt>s3:PutReplicationConfiguration</tt> action. The bucket owner has
--   these permissions by default and can grant it to others. For more
--   information about permissions, see <a>Permissions Related to Bucket
--   Subresource Operations</a> and <a>Managing Access Permissions to Your
--   Amazon S3 Resources</a>.
--   
--   It can take a while for the deletion of a replication configuration to
--   fully propagate.

--   For information about replication configuration, see
--   <a>Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.

-- | This implementation of the DELETE action uses the policy subresource
--   to delete the policy of a specified bucket. If you are using an
--   identity other than the root user of the Amazon Web Services account
--   that owns the bucket, the calling identity must have the
--   <tt>DeleteBucketPolicy</tt> permissions on the specified bucket and
--   belong to the bucket owner's account to use this operation.
--   
--   If you don't have <tt>DeleteBucketPolicy</tt> permissions, Amazon S3
--   returns a <tt>403 Access Denied</tt> error. If you have the correct
--   permissions, but you're not using an identity that belongs to the
--   bucket owner's account, Amazon S3 returns a <tt>405 Method Not
--   Allowed</tt> error.
--   
--   As a security precaution, the root user of the Amazon Web Services
--   account that owns a bucket can always use this operation, even if the
--   policy explicitly denies the root user the ability to perform this
--   action.
--   
--   For more information about bucket policies, see <a>Using Bucket
--   Policies and UserPolicies</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>DeleteBucketPolicy</tt>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>CreateBucket</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteObject</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.DeleteBucketPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteBucketPolicy</a> smart constructor.

DeleteBucketPolicy' :: Maybe Text -> BucketName -> DeleteBucketPolicy

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:DeleteBucketPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>deleteBucketPolicy_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the
--   expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account,
--   the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:DeleteBucketPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>deleteBucketPolicy_bucket</a> - The bucket name.

-- | Deletes a metrics configuration for the Amazon CloudWatch request
--   metrics (specified by the metrics configuration ID) from the bucket.
--   Note that this doesn't include the daily storage metrics.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permissions to perform the
--   <tt>s3:PutMetricsConfiguration</tt> action. The bucket owner has this
--   permission by default. The bucket owner can grant this permission to
--   others. For more information about permissions, see <a>Permissions
--   Related to Bucket Subresource Operations</a> and <a>Managing Access
--   Permissions to Your Amazon S3 Resources</a>.
--   
--   For information about CloudWatch request metrics for Amazon S3, see
--   <a>Monitoring Metrics with Amazon CloudWatch</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to
--   <tt>DeleteBucketMetricsConfiguration</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetBucketMetricsConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutBucketMetricsConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListBucketMetricsConfigurations</a></li>
--   <li><a>Monitoring Metrics with Amazon CloudWatch</a></li>
--   </ul>

--   constructor.

-- | Deletes the lifecycle configuration from the specified bucket. Amazon
--   S3 removes all the lifecycle configuration rules in the lifecycle
--   subresource associated with the bucket. Your objects never expire, and
--   Amazon S3 no longer automatically deletes any objects on the basis of
--   rules contained in the deleted lifecycle configuration.
--   
--   To use this operation, you must have permission to perform the
--   <tt>s3:PutLifecycleConfiguration</tt> action. By default, the bucket
--   owner has this permission and the bucket owner can grant this
--   permission to others.
--   
--   There is usually some time lag before lifecycle configuration deletion
--   is fully propagated to all the Amazon S3 systems.
--   
--   For more information about the object expiration, see <a>Elements to
--   Describe Lifecycle Actions</a>.
--   
--   Related actions include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>PutBucketLifecycleConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>GetBucketLifecycleConfiguration</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.DeleteBucketLifecycle

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteBucketLifecycle</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteBucketLifecycle
DeleteBucketLifecycle' :: Maybe Text -> BucketName -> DeleteBucketLifecycle

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:DeleteBucketLifecycle'] :: DeleteBucketLifecycle -> Maybe Text

-- | The bucket name of the lifecycle to delete.
[$sel:bucket:DeleteBucketLifecycle'] :: DeleteBucketLifecycle -> BucketName

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteBucketLifecycle</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:DeleteBucketLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>deleteBucketLifecycle_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of
--   the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different
--   account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access
--   Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:DeleteBucketLifecycle'</a>,
--   <a>deleteBucketLifecycle_bucket</a> - The bucket name of the lifecycle
--   to delete.
newDeleteBucketLifecycle :: BucketName -> DeleteBucketLifecycle

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
deleteBucketLifecycle_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' DeleteBucketLifecycle (Maybe Text)

-- | The bucket name of the lifecycle to delete.
deleteBucketLifecycle_bucket :: Lens' DeleteBucketLifecycle BucketName

-- | Deletes the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration from the specified
--   bucket.
--   
--   The S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class is designed to optimize
--   storage costs by automatically moving data to the most cost-effective
--   storage access tier, without performance impact or operational
--   overhead. S3 Intelligent-Tiering delivers automatic cost savings in
--   two low latency and high throughput access tiers. For data that can be
--   accessed asynchronously, you can choose to activate automatic
--   archiving capabilities within the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage
--   class.
--   
--   The S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage class is the ideal storage class
--   for data with unknown, changing, or unpredictable access patterns,
--   independent of object size or retention period. If the size of an
--   object is less than 128 KB, it is not eligible for auto-tiering.
--   Smaller objects can be stored, but they are always charged at the
--   Frequent Access tier rates in the S3 Intelligent-Tiering storage
--   class.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Storage class for automatically
--   optimizing frequently and infrequently accessed objects</a>.
--   
--   Operations related to
--   <tt>DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration</tt> include:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>GetBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>PutBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListBucketIntelligentTieringConfigurations</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration</a>
--   smart constructor.
data DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration
DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration' :: BucketName -> Text -> DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket whose configuration you want to
--   modify or retrieve.
[$sel:bucket:DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration'] :: DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration -> BucketName

-- | The ID used to identify the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration.
[$sel:id:DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration'] :: DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>deleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration_bucket</a> - The name
--   of the Amazon S3 bucket whose configuration you want to modify or
--   retrieve.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>deleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration_id</a> - The ID used to
--   identify the S3 Intelligent-Tiering configuration.
newDeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration :: BucketName -> Text -> DeleteBucketIntelligentTieringConfiguration

--   modify or retrieve.

--   <tt>DeleteBucketAnalyticsConfiguration</tt>:

--   <ul>

--   constructor.

-- | Deletes the S3 bucket. All objects (including all object versions and
--   delete markers) in the bucket must be deleted before the bucket itself
--   can be deleted.
--   
--   <b>Related Resources</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>CreateBucket</a></li>
--   <li><a>DeleteObject</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.DeleteBucket
