-- | This action aborts a multipart upload. After a multipart upload is
--   aborted, no additional parts can be uploaded using that upload ID. The
--   storage consumed by any previously uploaded parts will be freed.
--   However, if any part uploads are currently in progress, those part
--   uploads might or might not succeed. As a result, it might be necessary
--   to abort a given multipart upload multiple times in order to
--   completely free all storage consumed by all parts.
--   
--   To verify that all parts have been removed, so you don't get charged
--   for the part storage, you should call the <a>ListParts</a> action and
--   ensure that the parts list is empty.
--   
--   For information about permissions required to use the multipart
--   upload, see <a>Multipart Upload and Permissions</a>.
--   
--   The following operations are related to <tt>AbortMultipartUpload</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>CreateMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>UploadPart</a></li>
--   <li><a>CompleteMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListParts</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListMultipartUploads</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.AbortMultipartUpload

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAbortMultipartUpload</a> smart constructor.
data AbortMultipartUpload
AbortMultipartUpload' :: Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ObjectKey -> Text -> AbortMultipartUpload
[$sel:requestPayer:AbortMultipartUpload'] :: AbortMultipartUpload -> Maybe RequestPayer

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:AbortMultipartUpload'] :: AbortMultipartUpload -> Maybe Text

-- | The bucket name to which the upload was taking place.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:AbortMultipartUpload'] :: AbortMultipartUpload -> BucketName

[$sel:key:AbortMultipartUpload'] :: AbortMultipartUpload -> ObjectKey

-- | Uploads a part in a multipart upload.
--   
--   In this operation, you provide part data in your request. However, you
--   have an option to specify your existing Amazon S3 object as a data
--   source for the part you are uploading. To upload a part from an
--   existing object, you use the <a>UploadPartCopy</a> operation.
--   
--   You must initiate a multipart upload (see
--   <a>CreateMultipartUpload</a>) before you can upload any part. In
--   response to your initiate request, Amazon S3 returns an upload ID, a
--   unique identifier, that you must include in your upload part request.
--   
--   Part numbers can be any number from 1 to 10,000, inclusive. A part
--   number uniquely identifies a part and also defines its position within
--   the object being created. If you upload a new part using the same part
--   number that was used with a previous part, the previously uploaded
--   part is overwritten. Each part must be at least 5 MB in size, except
--   the last part. There is no size limit on the last part of your
--   multipart upload.
--   
--   To ensure that data is not corrupted when traversing the network,
--   specify the <tt>Content-MD5</tt> header in the upload part request.
--   Amazon S3 checks the part data against the provided MD5 value. If they
--   do not match, Amazon S3 returns an error.
--   
--   If the upload request is signed with Signature Version 4, then Amazon
--   Web Services S3 uses the <tt>x-amz-content-sha256</tt> header as a
--   checksum instead of <tt>Content-MD5</tt>. For more information see
--   <a>Authenticating Requests: Using the Authorization Header (Amazon Web
--   Services Signature Version 4)</a>.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> After you initiate multipart upload and upload one or
--   more parts, you must either complete or abort multipart upload in
--   order to stop getting charged for storage of the uploaded parts. Only
--   after you either complete or abort multipart upload, Amazon S3 frees
--   up the parts storage and stops charging you for the parts storage.
--   
--   For more information on multipart uploads, go to <a>Multipart Upload
--   Overview</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i> .
--   
--   For information on the permissions required to use the multipart
--   upload API, go to <a>Multipart Upload and Permissions</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can optionally request server-side encryption where Amazon S3
--   encrypts your data as it writes it to disks in its data centers and
--   decrypts it for you when you access it. You have the option of
--   providing your own encryption key, or you can use the Amazon Web
--   Services managed encryption keys. If you choose to provide your own
--   encryption key, the request headers you provide in the request must
--   match the headers you used in the request to initiate the upload by
--   using <a>CreateMultipartUpload</a>. For more information, go to
--   <a>Using Server-Side Encryption</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   Server-side encryption is supported by the S3 Multipart Upload
--   actions. Unless you are using a customer-provided encryption key, you
--   don't need to specify the encryption parameters in each UploadPart
--   request. Instead, you only need to specify the server-side encryption
--   parameters in the initial Initiate Multipart request. For more
--   information, see <a>CreateMultipartUpload</a>.
--   
--   If you requested server-side encryption using a customer-provided
--   encryption key in your initiate multipart upload request, you must
--   provide identical encryption information in each part upload using the
--   following headers.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</li>
--   <li>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key</li>
--   <li>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key-MD5</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>Special Errors</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>- <i>Code: NoSuchUpload</i><ul><li>/Cause: The specified multipart
--   upload does not exist. The upload ID might be invalid, or the
--   multipart upload might have been aborted or
--   completed./</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code: 404 Not
--   Found</i></li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix: Client</i></li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>Related Resources</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>CreateMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>CompleteMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>AbortMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListParts</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListMultipartUploads</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.UploadPart

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUploadPart</a> smart constructor.
data UploadPart
UploadPart' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ObjectKey -> Int -> Text -> RequestBody -> UploadPart

-- | Size of the body in bytes. This parameter is useful when the size of
--   the body cannot be determined automatically.
[$sel:contentLength:UploadPart'] :: UploadPart -> Maybe Integer

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (for
--   example, AES256).
[$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:UploadPart'] :: UploadPart -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in
--   encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is
--   discarded; Amazon S3 does not store the encryption key. The key must
--   be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm header</tt>. This
--   must be the same encryption key specified in the initiate multipart
--   upload request.
[$sel:sSECustomerKey:UploadPart'] :: UploadPart -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)
[$sel:requestPayer:UploadPart'] :: UploadPart -> Maybe RequestPayer

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
[$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:UploadPart'] :: UploadPart -> Maybe Text

-- | The base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the part data. This parameter
--   is auto-populated when using the command from the CLI. This parameter
--   is required if object lock parameters are specified.
[$sel:contentMD5:UploadPart'] :: UploadPart -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:UploadPart'] :: UploadPart -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bucket to which the multipart upload was initiated.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:UploadPart'] :: UploadPart -> BucketName

-- | Object key for which the multipart upload was initiated.
[$sel:key:UploadPart'] :: UploadPart -> ObjectKey

-- | Part number of part being uploaded. This is a positive integer between
--   1 and 10,000.
[$sel:partNumber:UploadPart'] :: UploadPart -> Int

-- | Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose part is being
--   uploaded.
[$sel:uploadId:UploadPart'] :: UploadPart -> Text

-- | Object data.
[$sel:body:UploadPart'] :: UploadPart -> RequestBody

-- | Create a value of <a>UploadPart</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentLength:UploadPart'</a>, <a>uploadPart_contentLength</a>
--   - Size of the body in bytes. This parameter is useful when the size of
--   the body cannot be determined automatically.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:UploadPart'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPart_sSECustomerAlgorithm</a> - Specifies the algorithm to
--   use to when encrypting the object (for example, AES256).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKey:UploadPart'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPart_sSECustomerKey</a> - Specifies the customer-provided
--   encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is
--   used to store the object and then it is discarded; Amazon S3 does not
--   store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the
--   algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm header</tt>. This
--   must be the same encryption key specified in the initiate multipart
--   upload request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestPayer:UploadPart'</a>, <a>uploadPart_requestPayer</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:UploadPart'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPart_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest
--   of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this
--   header for a message integrity check to ensure that the encryption key
--   was transmitted without error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentMD5:UploadPart'</a>, <a>uploadPart_contentMD5</a> - The
--   base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the part data. This parameter is
--   auto-populated when using the command from the CLI. This parameter is
--   required if object lock parameters are specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:UploadPart'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPart_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the expected
--   bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account, the
--   request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:UploadPart'</a>, <a>uploadPart_bucket</a> - The name of
--   the bucket to which the multipart upload was initiated.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:UploadPart'</a>, <a>uploadPart_key</a> - Object key for
--   which the multipart upload was initiated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partNumber:UploadPart'</a>, <a>uploadPart_partNumber</a> -
--   Part number of part being uploaded. This is a positive integer between
--   1 and 10,000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadId:UploadPart'</a>, <a>uploadPart_uploadId</a> - Upload
--   ID identifying the multipart upload whose part is being uploaded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:UploadPart'</a>, <a>uploadPart_body</a> - Object data.
newUploadPart :: BucketName -> ObjectKey -> Int -> Text -> RequestBody -> UploadPart

-- | Size of the body in bytes. This parameter is useful when the size of
--   the body cannot be determined automatically.
uploadPart_contentLength :: Lens' UploadPart (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (for
--   example, AES256).
uploadPart_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' UploadPart (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in
--   encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is
--   discarded; Amazon S3 does not store the encryption key. The key must
--   be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm header</tt>. This
--   must be the same encryption key specified in the initiate multipart
--   upload request.
uploadPart_sSECustomerKey :: Lens' UploadPart (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
uploadPart_requestPayer :: Lens' UploadPart (Maybe RequestPayer)

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
uploadPart_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' UploadPart (Maybe Text)

-- | The base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the part data. This parameter
--   is auto-populated when using the command from the CLI. This parameter
--   is required if object lock parameters are specified.
uploadPart_contentMD5 :: Lens' UploadPart (Maybe Text)

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
uploadPart_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' UploadPart (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the bucket to which the multipart upload was initiated.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
uploadPart_bucket :: Lens' UploadPart BucketName

-- | Object key for which the multipart upload was initiated.
uploadPart_key :: Lens' UploadPart ObjectKey

-- | Part number of part being uploaded. This is a positive integer between
--   1 and 10,000.
uploadPart_partNumber :: Lens' UploadPart Int

-- | Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose part is being
--   uploaded.
uploadPart_uploadId :: Lens' UploadPart Text

-- | Object data.
uploadPart_body :: Lens' UploadPart RequestBody

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUploadPartResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UploadPartResponse
UploadPartResponse' :: Maybe RequestCharged -> Maybe ETag -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption -> Int -> UploadPartResponse
[$sel:requestCharged:UploadPartResponse'] :: UploadPartResponse -> Maybe RequestCharged

-- | Entity tag for the uploaded object.
[$sel:eTag:UploadPartResponse'] :: UploadPartResponse -> Maybe ETag

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header confirming the
--   encryption algorithm used.
[$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:UploadPartResponse'] :: UploadPartResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether the multipart upload uses an S3 Bucket Key for
--   server-side encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
[$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:UploadPartResponse'] :: UploadPartResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header to provide round-trip
--   message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption
--   key.
[$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:UploadPartResponse'] :: UploadPartResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | If present, specifies the ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key was
--   used for the object.
[$sel:sSEKMSKeyId:UploadPartResponse'] :: UploadPartResponse -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in
--   Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
[$sel:serverSideEncryption:UploadPartResponse'] :: UploadPartResponse -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UploadPartResponse'] :: UploadPartResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UploadPartResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestCharged:UploadPartResponse'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartResponse_requestCharged</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eTag:UploadPartResponse'</a>, <a>uploadPartResponse_eTag</a> -
--   Entity tag for the uploaded object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:UploadPart'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartResponse_sSECustomerAlgorithm</a> - If server-side
--   encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was requested, the
--   response will include this header confirming the encryption algorithm
--   used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:UploadPartResponse'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartResponse_bucketKeyEnabled</a> - Indicates whether the
--   multipart upload uses an S3 Bucket Key for server-side encryption with
--   Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:UploadPart'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartResponse_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - If server-side
--   encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was requested, the
--   response will include this header to provide round-trip message
--   integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSEKMSKeyId:UploadPartResponse'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartResponse_sSEKMSKeyId</a> - If present, specifies the ID
--   of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services
--   KMS) symmetric customer managed key was used for the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryption:UploadPartResponse'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartResponse_serverSideEncryption</a> - The server-side
--   encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3 (for
--   example, AES256, aws:kms).
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UploadPartResponse'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUploadPartResponse :: Int -> UploadPartResponse

-- | Undocumented member.
uploadPartResponse_requestCharged :: Lens' UploadPartResponse (Maybe RequestCharged)

-- | Entity tag for the uploaded object.
uploadPartResponse_eTag :: Lens' UploadPartResponse (Maybe ETag)

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header confirming the
--   encryption algorithm used.
uploadPartResponse_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' UploadPartResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the multipart upload uses an S3 Bucket Key for
--   server-side encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
uploadPartResponse_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' UploadPartResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header to provide round-trip
--   message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption
--   key.
uploadPartResponse_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' UploadPartResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If present, specifies the ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key was
--   used for the object.
uploadPartResponse_sSEKMSKeyId :: Lens' UploadPartResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in
--   Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
uploadPartResponse_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' UploadPartResponse (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | The response's http status code.
uploadPartResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UploadPartResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.UploadPart.UploadPart
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.UploadPart.UploadPart
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.UploadPart.UploadPartResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.UploadPart.UploadPartResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.UploadPart.UploadPartResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.S3.UploadPart.UploadPart
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.UploadPart.UploadPartResponse
instance Network.AWS.Data.Body.ToBody Network.AWS.S3.UploadPart.UploadPart
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.S3.UploadPart.UploadPart
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.S3.UploadPart.UploadPart
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.S3.UploadPart.UploadPart


-- | Uploads a part by copying data from an existing object as data source.
--   You specify the data source by adding the request header
--   <tt>x-amz-copy-source</tt> in your request and a byte range by adding
--   the request header <tt>x-amz-copy-source-range</tt> in your request.
--   
--   The minimum allowable part size for a multipart upload is 5 MB. For
--   more information about multipart upload limits, go to <a>Quick
--   Facts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   Instead of using an existing object as part data, you might use the
--   <a>UploadPart</a> action and provide data in your request.
--   
--   You must initiate a multipart upload before you can upload any part.
--   In response to your initiate request. Amazon S3 returns a unique
--   identifier, the upload ID, that you must include in your upload part
--   request.
--   
--   For more information about using the <tt>UploadPartCopy</tt>
--   operation, see the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For conceptual information about multipart uploads, see
--   <a>Uploading Objects Using Multipart Upload</a> in the <i>Amazon S3
--   User Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li>For information about permissions required to use the multipart
--   upload API, see <a>Multipart Upload and Permissions</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li>For information about copying objects using a single atomic action
--   vs. the multipart upload, see <a>Operations on Objects</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li>For information about using server-side encryption with
--   customer-provided encryption keys with the UploadPartCopy operation,
--   see <a>CopyObject</a> and <a>UploadPart</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Note the following additional considerations about the request headers
--   <tt>x-amz-copy-source-if-match</tt>,
--   <tt>x-amz-copy-source-if-none-match</tt>,
--   <tt>x-amz-copy-source-if-unmodified-since</tt>, and
--   <tt>x-amz-copy-source-if-modified-since</tt>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Consideration 1</b> - If both of the
--   <tt>x-amz-copy-source-if-match</tt> and
--   <tt>x-amz-copy-source-if-unmodified-since</tt> headers are present in
--   the request as follows:<tt>x-amz-copy-source-if-match</tt> condition
--   evaluates to <tt>true</tt>,
--   and;<tt>x-amz-copy-source-if-unmodified-since</tt> condition evaluates
--   to <tt>false</tt>;Amazon S3 returns <tt>200 OK</tt> and copies the
--   data.</li>
--   <li><b>Consideration 2</b> - If both of the
--   <tt>x-amz-copy-source-if-none-match</tt> and
--   <tt>x-amz-copy-source-if-modified-since</tt> headers are present in
--   the request as follows:<tt>x-amz-copy-source-if-none-match</tt>
--   condition evaluates to <tt>false</tt>,
--   and;<tt>x-amz-copy-source-if-modified-since</tt> condition evaluates
--   to <tt>true</tt>;Amazon S3 returns <tt>412 Precondition Failed</tt>
--   response code.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>Versioning</b>
--   
--   If your bucket has versioning enabled, you could have multiple
--   versions of the same object. By default, <tt>x-amz-copy-source</tt>
--   identifies the current version of the object to copy. If the current
--   version is a delete marker and you don't specify a versionId in the
--   <tt>x-amz-copy-source</tt>, Amazon S3 returns a 404 error, because the
--   object does not exist. If you specify versionId in the
--   <tt>x-amz-copy-source</tt> and the versionId is a delete marker,
--   Amazon S3 returns an HTTP 400 error, because you are not allowed to
--   specify a delete marker as a version for the
--   <tt>x-amz-copy-source</tt>.
--   
--   You can optionally specify a specific version of the source object to
--   copy by adding the <tt>versionId</tt> subresource as shown in the
--   following example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   x-amz-copy-source: /bucket/object?versionId=version id
--   </pre>
--   
--   <b>Special Errors</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>- <i>Code: NoSuchUpload</i><ul><li>/Cause: The specified multipart
--   upload does not exist. The upload ID might be invalid, or the
--   multipart upload might have been aborted or
--   completed./</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code: 404 Not
--   Found</i></li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code: InvalidRequest</i><ul><li>/Cause: The specified copy
--   source is not supported as a byte-range copy source./</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code: 400 Bad Request</i></li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>Related Resources</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>CreateMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>UploadPart</a></li>
--   <li><a>CompleteMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>AbortMultipartUpload</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListParts</a></li>
--   <li><a>ListMultipartUploads</a></li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.S3.UploadPartCopy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUploadPartCopy</a> smart constructor.
data UploadPartCopy
UploadPartCopy' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> Text -> ObjectKey -> Int -> Text -> UploadPartCopy

-- | Copies the object if it has been modified since the specified time.
[$sel:copySourceIfModifiedSince:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | Copies the object if it hasn't been modified since the specified time.
[$sel:copySourceIfUnmodifiedSince:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The range of bytes to copy from the source object. The range value
--   must use the form bytes=first-last, where the first and last are the
--   zero-based byte offsets to copy. For example, bytes=0-9 indicates that
--   you want to copy the first 10 bytes of the source. You can copy a
--   range only if the source object is greater than 5 MB.
[$sel:copySourceRange:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
[$sel:copySourceSSECustomerKeyMD5:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe Text

-- | Copies the object if its entity tag (ETag) is different than the
--   specified ETag.
[$sel:copySourceIfNoneMatch:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (for
--   example, AES256).
[$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in
--   encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is
--   discarded; Amazon S3 does not store the encryption key. The key must
--   be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header. This
--   must be the same encryption key specified in the initiate multipart
--   upload request.
[$sel:sSECustomerKey:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)
[$sel:requestPayer:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe RequestPayer

-- | Copies the object if its entity tag (ETag) matches the specified tag.
[$sel:copySourceIfMatch:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID of the expected source bucket owner. If the source
--   bucket is owned by a different account, the request will fail with an
--   HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedSourceBucketOwner:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
[$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use to
--   decrypt the source object. The encryption key provided in this header
--   must be one that was used when the source object was created.
[$sel:copySourceSSECustomerKey:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use when decrypting the source object (for
--   example, AES256).
[$sel:copySourceSSECustomerAlgorithm:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe Text

-- | The account ID of the expected destination bucket owner. If the
--   destination bucket is owned by a different account, the request will
--   fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
[$sel:expectedBucketOwner:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Maybe Text

-- | The bucket name.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
[$sel:bucket:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> BucketName

-- | Specifies the source object for the copy operation. You specify the
--   value in one of two formats, depending on whether you want to access
--   the source object through an <a>access point</a>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For objects not accessed through an access point, specify the name
--   of the source bucket and key of the source object, separated by a
--   slash (/). For example, to copy the object
--   <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> from the bucket
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket</tt>, use
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf</tt>. The value must be URL
--   encoded.</li>
--   <li>For objects accessed through access points, specify the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the object as accessed through the access
--   point, in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:accesspoint/&lt;access-point-name&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   access point <tt>my-access-point</tt> owned by account
--   <tt>123456789012</tt> in Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL
--   encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:us-west-2:123456789012:accesspoint/my-access-point/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.Amazon S3 supports copy operations using
--   access points only when the source and destination buckets are in the
--   same Amazon Web Services Region.Alternatively, for objects accessed
--   through Amazon S3 on Outposts, specify the ARN of the object as
--   accessed in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:outpost/&lt;outpost-id&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   outpost <tt>my-outpost</tt> owned by account <tt>123456789012</tt> in
--   Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:us-west-2:123456789012:outpost/my-outpost/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To copy a specific version of an object, append
--   <tt>?versionId=&lt;version-id&gt;</tt> to the value (for example,
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf?versionId=QUpfdndhfd8438MNFDN93jdnJFkdmqnh893</tt>).
--   If you don't specify a version ID, Amazon S3 copies the latest version
--   of the source object.
[$sel:copySource:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Text

-- | Object key for which the multipart upload was initiated.
[$sel:key:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> ObjectKey

-- | Part number of part being copied. This is a positive integer between 1
--   and 10,000.
[$sel:partNumber:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Int

-- | Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose part is being copied.
[$sel:uploadId:UploadPartCopy'] :: UploadPartCopy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UploadPartCopy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:copySourceIfModifiedSince:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_copySourceIfModifiedSince</a> - Copies the object if
--   it has been modified since the specified time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copySourceIfUnmodifiedSince:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_copySourceIfUnmodifiedSince</a> - Copies the object
--   if it hasn't been modified since the specified time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copySourceRange:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_copySourceRange</a> - The range of bytes to copy
--   from the source object. The range value must use the form
--   bytes=first-last, where the first and last are the zero-based byte
--   offsets to copy. For example, bytes=0-9 indicates that you want to
--   copy the first 10 bytes of the source. You can copy a range only if
--   the source object is greater than 5 MB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copySourceSSECustomerKeyMD5:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_copySourceSSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - Specifies the
--   128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon
--   S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to ensure that the
--   encryption key was transmitted without error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copySourceIfNoneMatch:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_copySourceIfNoneMatch</a> - Copies the object if its
--   entity tag (ETag) is different than the specified ETag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_sSECustomerAlgorithm</a> - Specifies the algorithm
--   to use to when encrypting the object (for example, AES256).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKey:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_sSECustomerKey</a> - Specifies the customer-provided
--   encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is
--   used to store the object and then it is discarded; Amazon S3 does not
--   store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the
--   algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header. This
--   must be the same encryption key specified in the initiate multipart
--   upload request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestPayer:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_requestPayer</a> - Undocumented member.

--   <a>$sel:expectedSourceBucketOwner:UploadPartCopy'</a>,

--   Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - Specifies the 128-bit MD5
--   digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses
--   this header for a message integrity check to ensure that the
--   encryption key was transmitted without error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copySourceSSECustomerKey:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_copySourceSSECustomerKey</a> - Specifies the
--   customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use to decrypt the
--   source object. The encryption key provided in this header must be one
--   that was used when the source object was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copySourceSSECustomerAlgorithm:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_copySourceSSECustomerAlgorithm</a> - Specifies the
--   algorithm to use when decrypting the source object (for example,
--   AES256).
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the
--   expected destination bucket owner. If the destination bucket is owned
--   by a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:UploadPartCopy'</a>, <a>uploadPartCopy_bucket</a> - The
--   bucket name.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copySource:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_copySource</a> - Specifies the source object for the
--   copy operation. You specify the value in one of two formats, depending
--   on whether you want to access the source object through an <a>access

--   <ul>
--   <li>For objects not accessed through an access point, specify the name
--   of the source bucket and key of the source object, separated by a
--   slash (/). For example, to copy the object
--   <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> from the bucket
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket</tt>, use
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf</tt>. The value must be URL
--   encoded.</li>
--   <li>For objects accessed through access points, specify the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the object as accessed through the access
--   point, in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:accesspoint/&lt;access-point-name&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   access point <tt>my-access-point</tt> owned by account
--   <tt>123456789012</tt> in Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL
--   encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:us-west-2:123456789012:accesspoint/my-access-point/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.Amazon S3 supports copy operations using
--   access points only when the source and destination buckets are in the
--   same Amazon Web Services Region.Alternatively, for objects accessed
--   through Amazon S3 on Outposts, specify the ARN of the object as
--   accessed in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:outpost/&lt;outpost-id&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   outpost <tt>my-outpost</tt> owned by account <tt>123456789012</tt> in
--   Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:us-west-2:123456789012:outpost/my-outpost/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To copy a specific version of an object, append
--   <tt>?versionId=&lt;version-id&gt;</tt> to the value (for example,
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf?versionId=QUpfdndhfd8438MNFDN93jdnJFkdmqnh893</tt>).
--   If you don't specify a version ID, Amazon S3 copies the latest version
--   of the source object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:UploadPartCopy'</a>, <a>uploadPartCopy_key</a> - Object
--   key for which the multipart upload was initiated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partNumber:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_partNumber</a> - Part number of part being copied.
--   This is a positive integer between 1 and 10,000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadId:UploadPartCopy'</a>, <a>uploadPartCopy_uploadId</a> -
--   Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose part is being copied.
newUploadPartCopy :: BucketName -> Text -> ObjectKey -> Int -> Text -> UploadPartCopy

uploadPartCopy_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe Text)

--   be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the

-- | The bucket name.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.

--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.

--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
uploadPartCopy_bucket :: Lens' UploadPartCopy BucketName

-- | Specifies the source object for the copy operation. You specify the
--   value in one of two formats, depending on whether you want to access
--   the source object through an <a>access point</a>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For objects not accessed through an access point, specify the name
--   of the source bucket and key of the source object, separated by a
--   slash (/). For example, to copy the object
--   <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> from the bucket
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket</tt>, use
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf</tt>. The value must be URL
--   encoded.</li>
--   <li>For objects accessed through access points, specify the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the object as accessed through the access
--   point, in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:accesspoint/&lt;access-point-name&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   access point <tt>my-access-point</tt> owned by account
--   <tt>123456789012</tt> in Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL
--   encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:us-west-2:123456789012:accesspoint/my-access-point/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.Amazon S3 supports copy operations using
--   access points only when the source and destination buckets are in the
--   same Amazon Web Services Region.Alternatively, for objects accessed
--   through Amazon S3 on Outposts, specify the ARN of the object as
--   accessed in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:outpost/&lt;outpost-id&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   outpost <tt>my-outpost</tt> owned by account <tt>123456789012</tt> in
--   Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:us-west-2:123456789012:outpost/my-outpost/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To copy a specific version of an object, append
--   <tt>?versionId=&lt;version-id&gt;</tt> to the value (for example,

--   If you don't specify a version ID, Amazon S3 copies the latest version
--   of the source object.
uploadPartCopy_copySource :: Lens' UploadPartCopy Text

--   and 10,000.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUploadPartCopyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UploadPartCopyResponse
UploadPartCopyResponse' :: Maybe RequestCharged -> Maybe CopyPartResult -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption -> Int -> UploadPartCopyResponse
[$sel:requestCharged:UploadPartCopyResponse'] :: UploadPartCopyResponse -> Maybe RequestCharged

-- | Container for all response elements.
[$sel:copyPartResult:UploadPartCopyResponse'] :: UploadPartCopyResponse -> Maybe CopyPartResult

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header confirming the
--   encryption algorithm used.
[$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:UploadPartCopyResponse'] :: UploadPartCopyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether the multipart upload uses an S3 Bucket Key for
--   server-side encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
[$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:UploadPartCopyResponse'] :: UploadPartCopyResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The version of the source object that was copied, if you have enabled
--   versioning on the source bucket.
[$sel:copySourceVersionId:UploadPartCopyResponse'] :: UploadPartCopyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header to provide round-trip
--   message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption
--   key.
[$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:UploadPartCopyResponse'] :: UploadPartCopyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | If present, specifies the ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key that
--   was used for the object.
[$sel:sSEKMSKeyId:UploadPartCopyResponse'] :: UploadPartCopyResponse -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in
--   Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
[$sel:serverSideEncryption:UploadPartCopyResponse'] :: UploadPartCopyResponse -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UploadPartCopyResponse'] :: UploadPartCopyResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UploadPartCopyResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was requested, the
--   response will include this header confirming the encryption algorithm

--   multipart upload uses an S3 Bucket Key for server-side encryption with

--

--   <a>uploadPartCopyResponse_copySourceVersionId</a> - The version of the

--

--   encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was requested, the
--   response will include this header to provide round-trip message
--   integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSEKMSKeyId:UploadPartCopyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopyResponse_sSEKMSKeyId</a> - If present, specifies the
--   ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web
--   Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key that was used for the
--   object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryption:UploadPartCopyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopyResponse_serverSideEncryption</a> - The server-side
--   encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3 (for

newUploadPartCopyResponse :: Int -> UploadPartCopyResponse

--   requested, the response will include this header confirming the
--   encryption algorithm used.
uploadPartCopyResponse_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe Text)

--   server-side encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
uploadPartCopyResponse_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The version of the source object that was copied, if you have enabled
--   versioning on the source bucket.
uploadPartCopyResponse_copySourceVersionId :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header to provide round-trip
--   message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption
--   key.
uploadPartCopyResponse_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If present, specifies the ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key that
--   was used for the object.
uploadPartCopyResponse_sSEKMSKeyId :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in
--   Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
uploadPartCopyResponse_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | The response's http status code.
uploadPartCopyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse Int

-- | Passes transformed objects to a <tt>GetObject</tt> operation when
--   using Object Lambda access points. For information about Object Lambda
--   access points, see <a>Transforming objects with Object Lambda access
--   points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   This operation supports metadata that can be returned by
--   <a>GetObject</a>, in addition to <tt>RequestRoute</tt>,
--   <tt>RequestToken</tt>, <tt>StatusCode</tt>, <tt>ErrorCode</tt>, and
--   <tt>ErrorMessage</tt>. The <tt>GetObject</tt> response metadata is
--   supported so that the <tt>WriteGetObjectResponse</tt> caller,
--   typically an Lambda function, can provide the same metadata when it
--   internally invokes <tt>GetObject</tt>. When
--   <tt>WriteGetObjectResponse</tt> is called by a customer-owned Lambda
--   function, the metadata returned to the end user <tt>GetObject</tt>
--   call might differ from what Amazon S3 would normally return.
--   
--   You can include any number of metadata headers. When including a
--   metadata header, it should be prefaced with <tt>x-amz-meta</tt>. For
--   example, <tt>x-amz-meta-my-custom-header: MyCustomValue</tt>. The
--   primary use case for this is to forward <tt>GetObject</tt> metadata.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services provides some prebuilt Lambda functions that you
--   can use with S3 Object Lambda to detect and redact personally
--   identifiable information (PII) and decompress S3 objects. These Lambda
--   functions are available in the Amazon Web Services Serverless
--   Application Repository, and can be selected through the Amazon Web
--   Services Management Console when you create your Object Lambda access
--   point.
--   
--   Example 1: PII Access Control - This Lambda function uses Amazon
--   Comprehend, a natural language processing (NLP) service using machine
--   learning to find insights and relationships in text. It automatically
--   detects personally identifiable information (PII) such as names,
--   addresses, dates, credit card numbers, and social security numbers
--   from documents in your Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   Example 2: PII Redaction - This Lambda function uses Amazon
--   Comprehend, a natural language processing (NLP) service using machine
--   learning to find insights and relationships in text. It automatically
--   redacts personally identifiable information (PII) such as names,
--   addresses, dates, credit card numbers, and social security numbers
--   from documents in your Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   Example 3: Decompression - The Lambda function
--   S3ObjectLambdaDecompression, is equipped to decompress objects stored
--   in S3 in one of six compressed file formats including bzip2, gzip,
--   snappy, zlib, zstandard and ZIP.
--   
--   For information on how to view and use these functions, see <a>Using
--   Amazon Web Services built Lambda functions</a> in the <i>Amazon S3
--   User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.S3.WriteGetObjectResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteGetObjectResponse</a> smart constructor.
data WriteGetObjectResponse

--   Lock</a>.

--   time of the restored object copy.

--   lifecycle) it includes expiry-date and rule-id key-value pairs
--   providing object expiration information. The value of the rule-id is
--   URL encoded.
[$sel:expiration:WriteGetObjectResponse'] :: WriteGetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

--   is not (<tt>false</tt>) a delete marker.
[$sel:deleteMarker:WriteGetObjectResponse'] :: WriteGetObjectResponse -> Maybe Bool

--   customer-provided encryption key was specified for object stored in
--   Amazon S3.
[$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:WriteGetObjectResponse'] :: WriteGetObjectResponse -> Maybe Text

[$sel:tagCount:WriteGetObjectResponse'] :: WriteGetObjectResponse -> Maybe Int

writeGetObjectResponse_objectLockRetainUntilDate :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of metadata to store with the object in S3.
writeGetObjectResponse_metadata :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Indicates if request involves bucket that is either a source or
--   destination in a Replication rule. For more information about S3
--   Replication, see <a>Replication</a>.
writeGetObjectResponse_replicationStatus :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe ReplicationStatus)

-- | Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
writeGetObjectResponse_cacheControl :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The language the content is in.
writeGetObjectResponse_contentLanguage :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains a generic description of the error condition. Returned in the
--   &lt;Message&gt; tag of the error XML response for a corresponding
--   <tt>GetObject</tt> call. Cannot be used with a successful
--   <tt>StatusCode</tt> header or when the transformed object is provided
--   in body.
writeGetObjectResponse_errorMessage :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the object was last modified.
writeGetObjectResponse_lastModified :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Indicates whether an object stored in Amazon S3 has an active legal
--   hold.
writeGetObjectResponse_objectLockLegalHoldStatus :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus)

-- | Specifies presentational information for the object.
writeGetObjectResponse_contentDisposition :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The portion of the object returned in the response.
writeGetObjectResponse_contentRange :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing requested
--   object in Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
writeGetObjectResponse_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
writeGetObjectResponse_contentType :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The integer status code for an HTTP response of a corresponding
--   <tt>GetObject</tt> request.
--   
--   <b>Status Codes</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>200 - OK</i></li>
--   <li><i>206 - Partial Content</i></li>
--   <li><i>304 - Not Modified</i></li>
--   <li><i>400 - Bad Request</i></li>
--   <li><i>401 - Unauthorized</i></li>
--   <li><i>403 - Forbidden</i></li>
--   <li><i>404 - Not Found</i></li>
--   <li><i>405 - Method Not Allowed</i></li>
--   <li><i>409 - Conflict</i></li>
--   <li><i>411 - Length Required</i></li>
--   <li><i>412 - Precondition Failed</i></li>
--   <li><i>416 - Range Not Satisfiable</i></li>
--   <li><i>500 - Internal Server Error</i></li>
--   <li><i>503 - Service Unavailable</i></li>
--   </ul>
writeGetObjectResponse_statusCode :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | Route prefix to the HTTP URL generated.
writeGetObjectResponse_requestRoute :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse Text

-- | A single use encrypted token that maps <tt>WriteGetObjectResponse</tt>
--   to the end user <tt>GetObject</tt> request.
writeGetObjectResponse_requestToken :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse Text

-- | The object data.
writeGetObjectResponse_body :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse RequestBody

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newWriteGetObjectResponseResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WriteGetObjectResponseResponse
WriteGetObjectResponseResponse' :: WriteGetObjectResponseResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>WriteGetObjectResponseResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newWriteGetObjectResponseResponse :: WriteGetObjectResponseResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.WriteGetObjectResponse.WriteGetObjectResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.WriteGetObjectResponse.WriteGetObjectResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.S3.WriteGetObjectResponse.WriteGetObjectResponseResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.S3.WriteGetObjectResponse.WriteGetObjectResponseResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.S3.WriteGetObjectResponse.WriteGetObjectResponseResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.S3.WriteGetObjectResponse.WriteGetObjectResponseResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.S3.WriteGetObjectResponse.WriteGetObjectResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.S3.WriteGetObjectResponse.WriteGetObjectResponseResponse
instance Network.AWS.Data.Body.ToBody Network.AWS.S3.WriteGetObjectResponse.WriteGetObjectResponse
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.S3.WriteGetObjectResponse.WriteGetObjectResponse
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.S3.WriteGetObjectResponse.WriteGetObjectResponse

module Network.AWS.S3.Lens

-- | The base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the data. You must use this
--   header as a message integrity check to verify that the request body
--   was not corrupted in transit. For more information, see <a>RFC
--   1864</a>.
--   
--   For requests made using the Amazon Web Services Command Line Interface
--   (CLI) or Amazon Web Services SDKs, this field is calculated
--   automatically.
putBucketRequestPayment_contentMD5 :: Lens' PutBucketRequestPayment (Maybe Text)

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
putBucketRequestPayment_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' PutBucketRequestPayment (Maybe Text)

-- | The bucket name.
putBucketRequestPayment_bucket :: Lens' PutBucketRequestPayment BucketName

-- | Container for Payer.
putBucketRequestPayment_requestPaymentConfiguration :: Lens' PutBucketRequestPayment RequestPaymentConfiguration

-- | Size of the body in bytes. This parameter is useful when the size of
--   the body cannot be determined automatically. For more information, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.13</a>.
putObject_contentLength :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Object Lock mode that you want to apply to this object.
putObject_objectLockMode :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe ObjectLockMode)

-- | The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable. For more
--   information, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.21</a>.
putObject_expires :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Allows grantee to read the object ACL.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
putObject_grantReadACP :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (for
--   example, AES256).
putObject_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in
--   encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is
--   discarded; Amazon S3 does not store the encryption key. The key must
--   be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header.
putObject_sSECustomerKey :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
putObject_requestPayer :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe RequestPayer)

-- | Allows grantee to write the ACL for the applicable object.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
putObject_grantWriteACP :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should use an S3 Bucket Key for object
--   encryption with server-side encryption using AWS KMS (SSE-KMS).
--   Setting this header to <tt>true</tt> causes Amazon S3 to use an S3
--   Bucket Key for object encryption with SSE-KMS.
--   
--   Specifying this header with a PUT action doesn’t affect bucket-level
--   settings for S3 Bucket Key.
putObject_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Bool)

-- | If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this
--   object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL.
--   Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata. For
--   information about object metadata, see <a>Object Key and Metadata</a>.
--   
--   In the following example, the request header sets the redirect to an
--   object (anotherPage.html) in the same bucket:
--   
--   <pre>
--   x-amz-website-redirect-location: /anotherPage.html
--   </pre>
--   
--   In the following example, the request header sets the object redirect
--   to another website:
--   
--   <pre>
--   x-amz-website-redirect-location: http://www.example.com/
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information about website hosting in Amazon S3, see
--   <a>Hosting Websites on Amazon S3</a> and <a>How to Configure Website
--   Page Redirects</a>.
putObject_websiteRedirectLocation :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Allows grantee to read the object data and its metadata.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
putObject_grantRead :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | By default, Amazon S3 uses the STANDARD Storage Class to store newly
--   created objects. The STANDARD storage class provides high durability
--   and high availability. Depending on performance needs, you can specify
--   a different Storage Class. Amazon S3 on Outposts only uses the
--   OUTPOSTS Storage Class. For more information, see <a>Storage
--   Classes</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
putObject_storageClass :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
putObject_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | If <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption</tt> is present and has the value
--   of <tt>aws:kms</tt>, this header specifies the ID of the Amazon Web
--   Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetrical
--   customer managed key that was used for the object. If you specify
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption:aws:kms</tt>, but do not provide<tt>
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption-aws-kms-key-id</tt>, Amazon S3 uses the
--   Amazon Web Services managed key to protect the data. If the KMS key
--   does not exist in the same account issuing the command, you must use
--   the full ARN and not just the ID.
putObject_sSEKMSKeyId :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Gives the grantee READ, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP permissions on the
--   object.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
putObject_grantFullControl :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and
--   thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type
--   referenced by the Content-Type header field. For more information, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.11</a>.
putObject_contentEncoding :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag-set for the object. The tag-set must be encoded as URL Query
--   parameters. (For example, "Key1=Value1")
putObject_tagging :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the message (without the
--   headers) according to RFC 1864. This header can be used as a message
--   integrity check to verify that the data is the same data that was
--   originally sent. Although it is optional, we recommend using the
--   Content-MD5 mechanism as an end-to-end integrity check. For more
--   information about REST request authentication, see <a>REST
--   Authentication</a>.
putObject_contentMD5 :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when you want this object's Object Lock to expire.
--   Must be formatted as a timestamp parameter.
putObject_objectLockRetainUntilDate :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of metadata to store with the object in S3.
putObject_metadata :: Lens' PutObject (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS Encryption Context to use for
--   object encryption. The value of this header is a base64-encoded UTF-8
--   string holding JSON with the encryption context key-value pairs.
putObject_sSEKMSEncryptionContext :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Can be used to specify caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
--   For more information, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.9</a>.
putObject_cacheControl :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The language the content is in.
putObject_contentLanguage :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether a legal hold will be applied to this object. For
--   more information about S3 Object Lock, see <a>Object Lock</a>.
putObject_objectLockLegalHoldStatus :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus)

-- | The canned ACL to apply to the object. For more information, see
--   <a>Canned ACL</a>.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
putObject_acl :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe ObjectCannedACL)

-- | Specifies presentational information for the object. For more
--   information, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec19.html#sec19.5.1</a>.
putObject_contentDisposition :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
putObject_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in
--   Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
putObject_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | A standard MIME type describing the format of the contents. For more
--   information, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.17</a>.
putObject_contentType :: Lens' PutObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The bucket name to which the PUT action was initiated.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
putObject_bucket :: Lens' PutObject BucketName

-- | Object key for which the PUT action was initiated.
putObject_key :: Lens' PutObject ObjectKey

-- | Object data.
putObject_body :: Lens' PutObject RequestBody

-- | Undocumented member.
putObjectResponse_requestCharged :: Lens' PutObjectResponse (Maybe RequestCharged)

-- | Entity tag for the uploaded object.
putObjectResponse_eTag :: Lens' PutObjectResponse (Maybe ETag)

-- | Version of the object.
putObjectResponse_versionId :: Lens' PutObjectResponse (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | If the expiration is configured for the object (see
--   <a>PutBucketLifecycleConfiguration</a>), the response includes this
--   header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id key-value pairs that
--   provide information about object expiration. The value of the rule-id
--   is URL encoded.
putObjectResponse_expiration :: Lens' PutObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header confirming the
--   encryption algorithm used.
putObjectResponse_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' PutObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the uploaded object uses an S3 Bucket Key for
--   server-side encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
putObjectResponse_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' PutObjectResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header to provide round-trip
--   message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption
--   key.
putObjectResponse_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' PutObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption</tt> is present and has the value
--   of <tt>aws:kms</tt>, this header specifies the ID of the Amazon Web
--   Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric
--   customer managed key that was used for the object.
putObjectResponse_sSEKMSKeyId :: Lens' PutObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If present, specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS Encryption Context
--   to use for object encryption. The value of this header is a
--   base64-encoded UTF-8 string holding JSON with the encryption context
--   key-value pairs.
putObjectResponse_sSEKMSEncryptionContext :: Lens' PutObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If you specified server-side encryption either with an Amazon Web
--   Services KMS key or Amazon S3-managed encryption key in your PUT
--   request, the response includes this header. It confirms the encryption
--   algorithm that Amazon S3 used to encrypt the object.
putObjectResponse_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' PutObjectResponse (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | The response's http status code.
putObjectResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutObjectResponse Int

-- | VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
deleteObject_versionId :: Lens' DeleteObject (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | The concatenation of the authentication device's serial number, a
--   space, and the value that is displayed on your authentication device.
--   Required to permanently delete a versioned object if versioning is
--   configured with MFA delete enabled.
deleteObject_mfa :: Lens' DeleteObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
deleteObject_requestPayer :: Lens' DeleteObject (Maybe RequestPayer)

-- | Indicates whether S3 Object Lock should bypass Governance-mode
--   restrictions to process this operation. To use this header, you must
--   have the <tt>s3:PutBucketPublicAccessBlock</tt> permission.
deleteObject_bypassGovernanceRetention :: Lens' DeleteObject (Maybe Bool)

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
deleteObject_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' DeleteObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The bucket name of the bucket containing the object.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
deleteObject_bucket :: Lens' DeleteObject BucketName

-- | Key name of the object to delete.
deleteObject_key :: Lens' DeleteObject ObjectKey

-- | Undocumented member.

--   DELETE operation.

--   was (true) or was not (false) a delete marker.
deleteObjectResponse_deleteMarker :: Lens' DeleteObjectResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteObjectResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteObjectResponse Int

--   the bucket.

-- | Allows grantee to create new objects in the bucket.
--   
--   For the bucket and object owners of existing objects, also allows
--   deletions and overwrites of those objects.
createBucket_grantWrite :: Lens' CreateBucket (Maybe Text)

--   do not need to specify the location.
createBucketResponse_location :: Lens' CreateBucketResponse (Maybe Text)

--   
--   For requests made using the Amazon Web Services Command Line Interface

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by

--   not a real key.
listObjectsV2_continuationToken :: Lens' ListObjectsV2 (Maybe Text)

--   return owner field with each key in the result then set the fetch
--   owner field to true.
listObjectsV2_fetchOwner :: Lens' ListObjectsV2 (Maybe Bool)

--   the list objects request in V2 style. Bucket owners need not specify
--   this parameter in their requests.
listObjectsV2_requestPayer :: Lens' ListObjectsV2 (Maybe RequestPayer)

-- | Sets the maximum number of keys returned in the response. By default
--   the action returns up to 1,000 key names. The response might contain
--   fewer keys but will never contain more.
listObjectsV2_maxKeys :: Lens' ListObjectsV2 (Maybe Int)

-- | A delimiter is a character you use to group keys.
listObjectsV2_delimiter :: Lens' ListObjectsV2 (Maybe Delimiter)
