--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
listObjectsV2_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' ListObjectsV2 (Maybe Text)

--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form

--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.

--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
listObjectsV2_bucket :: Lens' ListObjectsV2 BucketName

-- | If StartAfter was sent with the request, it is included in the
--   response.
listObjectsV2Response_startAfter :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response (Maybe Text)

-- | KeyCount is the number of keys returned with this request. KeyCount
--   will always be less than or equals to MaxKeys field. Say you ask for
--   50 keys, your result will include less than equals 50 keys
listObjectsV2Response_keyCount :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response (Maybe Int)

-- | Metadata about each object returned.
listObjectsV2Response_contents :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response (Maybe [Object])

-- | If ContinuationToken was sent with the request, it is included in the
--   response.
listObjectsV2Response_continuationToken :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response (Maybe Text)

-- | Keys that begin with the indicated prefix.
listObjectsV2Response_prefix :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response (Maybe Text)

-- | All of the keys (up to 1,000) rolled up into a common prefix count as
--   a single return when calculating the number of returns.
--   
--   A response can contain <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> only if you specify a
--   delimiter.
--   
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> contains all (if there are any) keys between
--   <tt>Prefix</tt> and the next occurrence of the string specified by a
--   delimiter.
--   
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> lists keys that act like subdirectories in the
--   directory specified by <tt>Prefix</tt>.
--   
--   For example, if the prefix is <tt>notes/</tt> and the delimiter is a
--   slash (<tt>/</tt>) as in <tt>notes/summer/july</tt>, the common prefix
--   is <tt>notes/summer/</tt>. All of the keys that roll up into a common
--   prefix count as a single return when calculating the number of
--   returns.
listObjectsV2Response_commonPrefixes :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response (Maybe [CommonPrefix])

-- | Encoding type used by Amazon S3 to encode object key names in the XML
--   response.
--   
--   If you specify the encoding-type request parameter, Amazon S3 includes
--   this element in the response, and returns encoded key name values in
--   the following response elements:
--   
--   <tt>Delimiter, Prefix, Key,</tt> and <tt>StartAfter</tt>.
listObjectsV2Response_encodingType :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response (Maybe EncodingType)

-- | The bucket name.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
listObjectsV2Response_name :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response (Maybe BucketName)

-- | <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt> is sent when <tt>isTruncated</tt> is
--   true, which means there are more keys in the bucket that can be
--   listed. The next list requests to Amazon S3 can be continued with this
--   <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt>. <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt> is
--   obfuscated and is not a real key
listObjectsV2Response_nextContinuationToken :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the maximum number of keys returned in the response. By default
--   the action returns up to 1,000 key names. The response might contain
--   fewer keys but will never contain more.
listObjectsV2Response_maxKeys :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response (Maybe Int)

-- | Set to false if all of the results were returned. Set to true if more
--   keys are available to return. If the number of results exceeds that
--   specified by MaxKeys, all of the results might not be returned.
listObjectsV2Response_isTruncated :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response (Maybe Bool)

-- | Causes keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the
--   first occurrence of the delimiter to be rolled up into a single result
--   element in the CommonPrefixes collection. These rolled-up keys are not
--   returned elsewhere in the response. Each rolled-up result counts as
--   only one return against the <tt>MaxKeys</tt> value.
listObjectsV2Response_delimiter :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response (Maybe Delimiter)

-- | The response's http status code.
listObjectsV2Response_httpStatus :: Lens' ListObjectsV2Response Int

-- | Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one
--   specified, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
getObject_ifMatch :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
getObject_versionId :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | Sets the <tt>Content-Type</tt> header of the response.
getObject_responseContentType :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the <tt>Content-Disposition</tt> header of the response
getObject_responseContentDisposition :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the <tt>Content-Language</tt> header of the response.
getObject_responseContentLanguage :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use to when decrypting the object (for
--   example, AES256).
getObject_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 used to
--   encrypt the data. This value is used to decrypt the object when
--   recovering it and must match the one used when storing the data. The
--   key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header.
getObject_sSECustomerKey :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
getObject_requestPayer :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe RequestPayer)

-- | Sets the <tt>Content-Encoding</tt> header of the response.
getObject_responseContentEncoding :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Return the object only if it has been modified since the specified
--   time, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
getObject_ifModifiedSince :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Part number of the object being read. This is a positive integer
--   between 1 and 10,000. Effectively performs a 'ranged' GET request for
--   the part specified. Useful for downloading just a part of an object.
getObject_partNumber :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Int)

-- | Downloads the specified range bytes of an object. For more information
--   about the HTTP Range header, see
--   <a>https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35</a>.
--   
--   Amazon S3 doesn't support retrieving multiple ranges of data per
--   <tt>GET</tt> request.
getObject_range :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Return the object only if it has not been modified since the specified
--   time, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
getObject_ifUnmodifiedSince :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
getObject_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the <tt>Cache-Control</tt> header of the response.
getObject_responseCacheControl :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the <tt>Expires</tt> header of the response.
getObject_responseExpires :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is different from the
--   one specified, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
getObject_ifNoneMatch :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
getObject_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' GetObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The bucket name containing the object.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using an Object Lambda access point the hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-object-lambda.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
getObject_bucket :: Lens' GetObject BucketName

getObject_key :: Lens' GetObject ObjectKey

--   version of a resource found at a URL.
getObjectResponse_eTag :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe ETag)

--   time of the restored object copy.

-- | If the object expiration is configured (see PUT Bucket lifecycle), the
--   response includes this header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id
--   key-value pairs providing object expiration information. The value of
--   the rule-id is URL encoded.
getObjectResponse_expiration :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the object retrieved was (true) or was not (false) a
--   Delete Marker. If false, this response header does not appear in the
--   response.
getObjectResponse_deleteMarker :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Bool)

--   requested, the response will include this header confirming the
--   encryption algorithm used.
getObjectResponse_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

getObjectResponse_tagCount :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | This is set to the number of metadata entries not returned in
--   <tt>x-amz-meta</tt> headers. This can happen if you create metadata
--   using an API like SOAP that supports more flexible metadata than the
--   REST API. For example, using SOAP, you can create metadata whose
--   values are not legal HTTP headers.
getObjectResponse_missingMeta :: Lens' GetObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

--   Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.

-- | Specifies the key to start with when listing objects in a bucket.
listObjectVersions_keyMarker :: Lens' ListObjectVersions (Maybe Text)

-- | Use this parameter to select only those keys that begin with the
--   specified prefix. You can use prefixes to separate a bucket into
--   different groupings of keys. (You can think of using prefix to make
--   groups in the same way you'd use a folder in a file system.) You can
--   use prefix with delimiter to roll up numerous objects into a single
--   result under CommonPrefixes.
listObjectVersions_prefix :: Lens' ListObjectVersions (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
listObjectVersions_encodingType :: Lens' ListObjectVersions (Maybe EncodingType)

-- | Specifies the object version you want to start listing from.
listObjectVersions_versionIdMarker :: Lens' ListObjectVersions (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the maximum number of keys returned in the response. By default
--   the action returns up to 1,000 key names. The response might contain
--   fewer keys but will never contain more. If additional keys satisfy the
--   search criteria, but were not returned because max-keys was exceeded,
--   the response contains &lt;isTruncated&gt;true&lt;/isTruncated&gt;. To
--   return the additional keys, see key-marker and version-id-marker.
listObjectVersions_maxKeys :: Lens' ListObjectVersions (Maybe Int)

-- | A delimiter is a character that you specify to group keys. All keys
--   that contain the same string between the <tt>prefix</tt> and the first
--   occurrence of the delimiter are grouped under a single result element
--   in CommonPrefixes. These groups are counted as one result against the
--   max-keys limitation. These keys are not returned elsewhere in the
--   response.
listObjectVersions_delimiter :: Lens' ListObjectVersions (Maybe Delimiter)

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
listObjectVersions_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' ListObjectVersions (Maybe Text)

-- | The bucket name that contains the objects.
listObjectVersions_bucket :: Lens' ListObjectVersions BucketName

-- | When the number of responses exceeds the value of <tt>MaxKeys</tt>,
--   <tt>NextVersionIdMarker</tt> specifies the first object version not
--   returned that satisfies the search criteria. Use this value for the
--   version-id-marker request parameter in a subsequent request.
listObjectVersionsResponse_nextVersionIdMarker :: Lens' ListObjectVersionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Marks the last key returned in a truncated response.
listObjectVersionsResponse_keyMarker :: Lens' ListObjectVersionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Container for an object that is a delete marker.
listObjectVersionsResponse_deleteMarkers :: Lens' ListObjectVersionsResponse (Maybe [DeleteMarkerEntry])

-- | Selects objects that start with the value supplied by this parameter.
listObjectVersionsResponse_prefix :: Lens' ListObjectVersionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | All of the keys rolled up into a common prefix count as a single
--   return when calculating the number of returns.
listObjectVersionsResponse_commonPrefixes :: Lens' ListObjectVersionsResponse (Maybe [CommonPrefix])

-- | Encoding type used by Amazon S3 to encode object key names in the XML
--   response.
--   
--   If you specify encoding-type request parameter, Amazon S3 includes
--   this element in the response, and returns encoded key name values in
--   the following response elements:
--   
--   <tt>KeyMarker, NextKeyMarker, Prefix, Key</tt>, and
--   <tt>Delimiter</tt>.

listObjectVersionsResponse_versions :: Lens' ListObjectVersionsResponse (Maybe [ObjectVersion])

listObjectVersionsResponse_name :: Lens' ListObjectVersionsResponse (Maybe BucketName)

-- | When the number of responses exceeds the value of <tt>MaxKeys</tt>,
--   <tt>NextKeyMarker</tt> specifies the first key not returned that
--   satisfies the search criteria. Use this value for the key-marker
--   request parameter in a subsequent request.
listObjectVersionsResponse_nextKeyMarker :: Lens' ListObjectVersionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Marks the last version of the key returned in a truncated response.
listObjectVersionsResponse_versionIdMarker :: Lens' ListObjectVersionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the maximum number of objects to return.
listObjectVersionsResponse_maxKeys :: Lens' ListObjectVersionsResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | A flag that indicates whether Amazon S3 returned all of the results
--   that satisfied the search criteria. If your results were truncated,
--   you can make a follow-up paginated request using the NextKeyMarker and
--   NextVersionIdMarker response parameters as a starting place in another
--   request to return the rest of the results.
listObjectVersionsResponse_isTruncated :: Lens' ListObjectVersionsResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The delimiter grouping the included keys. A delimiter is a character
--   that you specify to group keys. All keys that contain the same string
--   between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter are
--   grouped under a single result element in <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt>.
--   These groups are counted as one result against the max-keys

--   example, AES256).

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in
--   encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is
--   discarded; Amazon S3 does not store the encryption key. The key must
--   be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header.

--   encryption with server-side encryption using AWS KMS (SSE-KMS).
--   Setting this header to <tt>true</tt> causes Amazon S3 to use an S3
--   Bucket Key for object encryption with SSE-KMS.
--   
--   Specifying this header with an object action doesn’t affect
--   bucket-level settings for S3 Bucket Key.
createMultipartUpload_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' CreateMultipartUpload (Maybe Bool)

--   object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL.
--   Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.

-- | Allows grantee to read the object data and its metadata.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
createMultipartUpload_grantRead :: Lens' CreateMultipartUpload (Maybe Text)

-- | By default, Amazon S3 uses the STANDARD Storage Class to store newly
--   created objects. The STANDARD storage class provides high durability
--   and high availability. Depending on performance needs, you can specify
--   a different Storage Class. Amazon S3 on Outposts only uses the
--   OUTPOSTS Storage Class. For more information, see <a>Storage
--   Classes</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
createMultipartUpload_storageClass :: Lens' CreateMultipartUpload (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
createMultipartUpload_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' CreateMultipartUpload (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the ID of the symmetric customer managed key to use for
--   object encryption. All GET and PUT requests for an object protected by
--   Amazon Web Services KMS will fail if not made via SSL or using SigV4.
--   For information about configuring using any of the officially
--   supported Amazon Web Services SDKs and Amazon Web Services CLI, see
--   <a>Specifying the Signature Version in Request Authentication</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
createMultipartUpload_sSEKMSKeyId :: Lens' CreateMultipartUpload (Maybe Text)

-- | Gives the grantee READ, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP permissions on the
--   object.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
createMultipartUpload_grantFullControl :: Lens' CreateMultipartUpload (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and
--   thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type
--   referenced by the Content-Type header field.
createMultipartUpload_contentEncoding :: Lens' CreateMultipartUpload (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag-set for the object. The tag-set must be encoded as URL Query
--   parameters.

-- | Specifies the date and time when you want the Object Lock to expire.
createMultipartUpload_objectLockRetainUntilDate :: Lens' CreateMultipartUpload (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of metadata to store with the object in S3.

--   must be the same encryption key specified in the initiate multipart

-- | Specifies the byte range of the object to get the records from. A
--   record is processed when its first byte is contained by the range.
--   This parameter is optional, but when specified, it must not be empty.
--   See RFC 2616, Section 14.35.1 about how to specify the start and end
--   of the range.
--   
--   <tt>ScanRange</tt>may be used in the following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   
--   <li><tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;start&gt;50&lt;/start&gt;&lt;end&gt;100&lt;/end&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   - process only the records starting between the bytes 50 and 100
--   (inclusive, counting from zero)</li>
--   
--   <li><tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;start&gt;50&lt;/start&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   - process only the records starting after the byte 50</li>
--   
--   <li><tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;end&gt;50&lt;/end&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   - process only the records within the last 50 bytes of the file.</li>
--   </ul>
selectObjectContent_scanRange :: Lens' SelectObjectContent (Maybe ScanRange)

-- | Entity tag that identifies the newly created object's data. Objects
--   with different object data will have different entity tags. The entity
--   tag is an opaque string. The entity tag may or may not be an MD5
--   digest of the object data. If the entity tag is not an MD5 digest of
--   the object data, it will contain one or more nonhexadecimal characters
--   and/or will consist of less than 32 or more than 32 hexadecimal
--   digits.

-- | Together with upload-id-marker, this parameter specifies the multipart
--   upload after which listing should begin.
--   
--   If <tt>upload-id-marker</tt> is not specified, only the keys
--   lexicographically greater than the specified <tt>key-marker</tt> will
--   be included in the list.
--   
--   If <tt>upload-id-marker</tt> is specified, any multipart uploads for a
--   key equal to the <tt>key-marker</tt> might also be included, provided
--   those multipart uploads have upload IDs lexicographically greater than
--   the specified <tt>upload-id-marker</tt>.
listMultipartUploads_keyMarker :: Lens' ListMultipartUploads (Maybe Text)

-- | Lists in-progress uploads only for those keys that begin with the
--   specified prefix. You can use prefixes to separate a bucket into
--   different grouping of keys. (You can think of using prefix to make
--   groups in the same way you'd use a folder in a file system.)
listMultipartUploads_prefix :: Lens' ListMultipartUploads (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
listMultipartUploads_encodingType :: Lens' ListMultipartUploads (Maybe EncodingType)

-- | Together with key-marker, specifies the multipart upload after which
--   listing should begin. If key-marker is not specified, the
--   upload-id-marker parameter is ignored. Otherwise, any multipart
--   uploads for a key equal to the key-marker might be included in the
--   list only if they have an upload ID lexicographically greater than the
--   specified <tt>upload-id-marker</tt>.
listMultipartUploads_uploadIdMarker :: Lens' ListMultipartUploads (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the maximum number of multipart uploads, from 1 to 1,000, to
--   return in the response body. 1,000 is the maximum number of uploads
--   that can be returned in a response.
listMultipartUploads_maxUploads :: Lens' ListMultipartUploads (Maybe Int)

-- | Character you use to group keys.
--   
--   All keys that contain the same string between the prefix, if
--   specified, and the first occurrence of the delimiter after the prefix
--   are grouped under a single result element, <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt>. If
--   you don't specify the prefix parameter, then the substring starts at
--   the beginning of the key. The keys that are grouped under
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> result element are not returned elsewhere in
--   the response.
listMultipartUploads_delimiter :: Lens' ListMultipartUploads (Maybe Delimiter)

-- | The key at or after which the listing began.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_keyMarker :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | When a prefix is provided in the request, this field contains the
--   specified prefix. The result contains only keys starting with the
--   specified prefix.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_prefix :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If you specify a delimiter in the request, then the result returns
--   each distinct key prefix containing the delimiter in a
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> element. The distinct key prefixes are
--   returned in the <tt>Prefix</tt> child element.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_commonPrefixes :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse (Maybe [CommonPrefix])

-- | Encoding type used by Amazon S3 to encode object keys in the response.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>encoding-type</tt> request parameter, Amazon S3
--   includes this element in the response, and returns encoded key name
--   values in the following response elements:
--   
--   <tt>Delimiter</tt>, <tt>KeyMarker</tt>, <tt>Prefix</tt>,
--   <tt>NextKeyMarker</tt>, <tt>Key</tt>.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_encodingType :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse (Maybe EncodingType)

-- | The name of the bucket to which the multipart upload was initiated.
--   Does not return the access point ARN or access point alias if used.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_bucket :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse (Maybe BucketName)

-- | Upload ID after which listing began.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_uploadIdMarker :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Maximum number of multipart uploads that could have been included in
--   the response.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_maxUploads :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | When a list is truncated, this element specifies the value that should
--   be used for the key-marker request parameter in a subsequent request.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_nextKeyMarker :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Container for elements related to a particular multipart upload. A
--   response can contain zero or more <tt>Upload</tt> elements.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_uploads :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse (Maybe [MultipartUpload])

-- | Indicates whether the returned list of multipart uploads is truncated.
--   A value of true indicates that the list was truncated. The list can be
--   truncated if the number of multipart uploads exceeds the limit allowed
--   or specified by max uploads.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_isTruncated :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | When a list is truncated, this element specifies the value that should
--   be used for the <tt>upload-id-marker</tt> request parameter in a
--   subsequent request.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_nextUploadIdMarker :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the delimiter you specified in the request. If you don't
--   specify a delimiter in your request, this element is absent from the
--   response.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_delimiter :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse (Maybe Delimiter)

-- | The response's http status code.
listMultipartUploadsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListMultipartUploadsResponse Int

-- | Limits the response to keys that begin with the specified prefix.
listObjects_prefix :: Lens' ListObjects (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
listObjects_encodingType :: Lens' ListObjects (Maybe EncodingType)

-- | Confirms that the requester knows that she or he will be charged for
--   the list objects request. Bucket owners need not specify this
--   parameter in their requests.
listObjects_requestPayer :: Lens' ListObjects (Maybe RequestPayer)

-- | Marker is where you want Amazon S3 to start listing from. Amazon S3
--   starts listing after this specified key. Marker can be any key in the
--   bucket.
listObjects_marker :: Lens' ListObjects (Maybe Text)

-- | Sets the maximum number of keys returned in the response. By default
--   the action returns up to 1,000 key names. The response might contain
--   fewer keys but will never contain more.
listObjects_maxKeys :: Lens' ListObjects (Maybe Int)

-- | A delimiter is a character you use to group keys.
listObjects_delimiter :: Lens' ListObjects (Maybe Delimiter)

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
listObjects_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' ListObjects (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the bucket containing the objects.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
listObjects_bucket :: Lens' ListObjects BucketName

-- | Metadata about each object returned.
listObjectsResponse_contents :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe [Object])

-- | Keys that begin with the indicated prefix.
listObjectsResponse_prefix :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | All of the keys (up to 1,000) rolled up in a common prefix count as a
--   single return when calculating the number of returns.
--   
--   A response can contain CommonPrefixes only if you specify a delimiter.
--   
--   CommonPrefixes contains all (if there are any) keys between Prefix and
--   the next occurrence of the string specified by the delimiter.
--   
--   CommonPrefixes lists keys that act like subdirectories in the
--   directory specified by Prefix.
--   
--   For example, if the prefix is notes/ and the delimiter is a slash (/)
--   as in notes/summer/july, the common prefix is notes/summer/. All of
--   the keys that roll up into a common prefix count as a single return
--   when calculating the number of returns.
listObjectsResponse_commonPrefixes :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe [CommonPrefix])

-- | Encoding type used by Amazon S3 to encode object keys in the response.
listObjectsResponse_encodingType :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe EncodingType)

-- | The bucket name.
listObjectsResponse_name :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe BucketName)

-- | Indicates where in the bucket listing begins. Marker is included in
--   the response if it was sent with the request.
listObjectsResponse_marker :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | When response is truncated (the IsTruncated element value in the
--   response is true), you can use the key name in this field as marker in
--   the subsequent request to get next set of objects. Amazon S3 lists
--   objects in alphabetical order Note: This element is returned only if
--   you have delimiter request parameter specified. If response does not
--   include the NextMarker and it is truncated, you can use the value of
--   the last Key in the response as the marker in the subsequent request
--   to get the next set of object keys.
listObjectsResponse_nextMarker :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of keys returned in the response body.
listObjectsResponse_maxKeys :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | A flag that indicates whether Amazon S3 returned all of the results
--   that satisfied the search criteria.
listObjectsResponse_isTruncated :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Causes keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the
--   first occurrence of the delimiter to be rolled up into a single result
--   element in the <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> collection. These rolled-up
--   keys are not returned elsewhere in the response. Each rolled-up result
--   counts as only one return against the <tt>MaxKeys</tt> value.
listObjectsResponse_delimiter :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse (Maybe Delimiter)

-- | The response's http status code.
listObjectsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListObjectsResponse Int

-- | A set of origins and methods (cross-origin access that you want to
--   allow). You can add up to 100 rules to the configuration.
getBucketCorsResponse_cORSRules :: Lens' GetBucketCorsResponse (Maybe [CORSRule])

-- | The response's http status code.
getBucketCorsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetBucketCorsResponse Int

-- | Undocumented member.
writeGetObjectResponse_requestCharged :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe RequestCharged)

-- | The count of parts this object has.
writeGetObjectResponse_partsCount :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | An opaque identifier assigned by a web server to a specific version of
--   a resource found at a URL.
writeGetObjectResponse_eTag :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe ETag)

writeGetObjectResponse_versionId :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | The size of the content body in bytes.
writeGetObjectResponse_contentLength :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | Indicates whether an object stored in Amazon S3 has Object Lock
--   enabled. For more information about S3 Object Lock, see <a>Object
--   Lock</a>.
writeGetObjectResponse_objectLockMode :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe ObjectLockMode)

-- | The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable.
writeGetObjectResponse_expires :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Provides information about object restoration operation and expiration
--   time of the restored object copy.
writeGetObjectResponse_restore :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If object stored in Amazon S3 expiration is configured (see PUT Bucket
--   lifecycle) it includes expiry-date and rule-id key-value pairs
--   providing object expiration information. The value of the rule-id is
--   URL encoded.
writeGetObjectResponse_expiration :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether an object stored in Amazon S3 is (<tt>true</tt>) or
--   is not (<tt>false</tt>) a delete marker.
writeGetObjectResponse_deleteMarker :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Bool)

--   customer-provided encryption key was specified for object stored in
--   Amazon S3.
writeGetObjectResponse_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of tags, if any, on the object.
writeGetObjectResponse_tagCount :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | Set to the number of metadata entries not returned in
--   <tt>x-amz-meta</tt> headers. This can happen if you create metadata
--   using an API like SOAP that supports more flexible metadata than the
--   REST API. For example, using SOAP, you can create metadata whose
--   values are not legal HTTP headers.
writeGetObjectResponse_missingMeta :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

--   for server-side encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
writeGetObjectResponse_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Bool)

writeGetObjectResponse_acceptRanges :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The class of storage used to store object in Amazon S3.
writeGetObjectResponse_storageClass :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | 128-bit MD5 digest of customer-provided encryption key used in Amazon
--   S3 to encrypt data stored in S3. For more information, see
--   <a>Protecting data using server-side encryption with customer-provided
--   encryption keys (SSE-C)</a>.
writeGetObjectResponse_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

--   Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key that
--   was used for stored in Amazon S3 object.
writeGetObjectResponse_sSEKMSKeyId :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and
--   thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type
--   referenced by the Content-Type header field.
writeGetObjectResponse_contentEncoding :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A string that uniquely identifies an error condition. Returned in the
--   &lt;Code&gt; tag of the error XML response for a corresponding
--   <tt>GetObject</tt> call. Cannot be used with a successful
--   <tt>StatusCode</tt> header or when the transformed object is provided
--   in the body. All error codes from S3 are sentence-cased. Regex value
--   is "^[A-Z][a-zA-Z]+$".
writeGetObjectResponse_errorCode :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when Object Lock is configured to expire.
writeGetObjectResponse_objectLockRetainUntilDate :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of metadata to store with the object in S3.
writeGetObjectResponse_metadata :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (HashMap Text Text)

--   destination in a Replication rule. For more information about S3
--   Replication, see <a>Replication</a>.

-- | Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
writeGetObjectResponse_cacheControl :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The language the content is in.
writeGetObjectResponse_contentLanguage :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains a generic description of the error condition. Returned in the
--   &lt;Message&gt; tag of the error XML response for a corresponding
--   <tt>GetObject</tt> call. Cannot be used with a successful
--   <tt>StatusCode</tt> header or when the transformed object is provided
--   in body.
writeGetObjectResponse_errorMessage :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

writeGetObjectResponse_contentDisposition :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The portion of the object returned in the response.
writeGetObjectResponse_contentRange :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing requested
--   object in Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
writeGetObjectResponse_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
writeGetObjectResponse_contentType :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The integer status code for an HTTP response of a corresponding
--   <tt>GetObject</tt> request.
--   
--   <b>Status Codes</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>200 - OK</i></li>
--   <li><i>206 - Partial Content</i></li>
--   <li><i>304 - Not Modified</i></li>
--   <li><i>400 - Bad Request</i></li>
--   <li><i>401 - Unauthorized</i></li>
--   <li><i>403 - Forbidden</i></li>
--   <li><i>404 - Not Found</i></li>
--   <li><i>405 - Method Not Allowed</i></li>
--   <li><i>409 - Conflict</i></li>
--   <li><i>411 - Length Required</i></li>
--   <li><i>412 - Precondition Failed</i></li>
--   <li><i>416 - Range Not Satisfiable</i></li>
--   <li><i>500 - Internal Server Error</i></li>
--   <li><i>503 - Service Unavailable</i></li>
--   </ul>
writeGetObjectResponse_statusCode :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

writeGetObjectResponse_requestRoute :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse Text

-- | A single use encrypted token that maps <tt>WriteGetObjectResponse</tt>
--   to the end user <tt>GetObject</tt> request.
writeGetObjectResponse_requestToken :: Lens' WriteGetObjectResponse Text

--   be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header.

-- | Part number of the object being read. This is a positive integer
--   between 1 and 10,000. Effectively performs a 'ranged' HEAD request for
--   the part specified. Useful querying about the size of the part and the
--   number of parts in this object.
headObject_partNumber :: Lens' HeadObject (Maybe Int)

-- | Downloads the specified range bytes of an object. For more information
--   about the HTTP Range header, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35</a>.
--   
--   Amazon S3 doesn't support retrieving multiple ranges of data per

--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.

headObjectResponse_partsCount :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | An ETag is an opaque identifier assigned by a web server to a specific
--   version of a resource found at a URL.
headObjectResponse_eTag :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ETag)

-- | Version of the object.
headObjectResponse_versionId :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | Size of the body in bytes.
headObjectResponse_contentLength :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Object Lock mode, if any, that's in effect for this object. This
--   header is only returned if the requester has the
--   <tt>s3:GetObjectRetention</tt> permission. For more information about
--   S3 Object Lock, see <a>Object Lock</a>.
headObjectResponse_objectLockMode :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ObjectLockMode)

-- | The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable.
headObjectResponse_expires :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If the object is an archived object (an object whose storage class is
--   GLACIER), the response includes this header if either the archive
--   restoration is in progress (see <a>RestoreObject</a> or an archive
--   copy is already restored.
--   
--   If an archive copy is already restored, the header value indicates
--   when Amazon S3 is scheduled to delete the object copy. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   x-amz-restore: ongoing-request="false", expiry-date="Fri, 21 Dec 2012 00:00:00 GMT"
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the object restoration is in progress, the header returns the value
--   <tt>ongoing-request="true"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about archiving objects, see <a>Transitioning
--   Objects: General Considerations</a>.
headObjectResponse_restore :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If the object expiration is configured (see PUT Bucket lifecycle), the
--   response includes this header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id
--   key-value pairs providing object expiration information. The value of
--   the rule-id is URL encoded.
headObjectResponse_expiration :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether the object retrieved was (true) or was not (false) a
--   Delete Marker. If false, this response header does not appear in the
--   response.
headObjectResponse_deleteMarker :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The archive state of the head object.

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header confirming the
--   encryption algorithm used.
headObjectResponse_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | This is set to the number of metadata entries not returned in

--   using an API like SOAP that supports more flexible metadata than the
--   REST API. For example, using SOAP, you can create metadata whose
--   values are not legal HTTP headers.
headObjectResponse_missingMeta :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Int)

--   encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
headObjectResponse_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Bool)

--   Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.
headObjectResponse_websiteRedirectLocation :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

headObjectResponse_storageClass :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe StorageClass)

--   message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption
--   key.

headObjectResponse_sSEKMSKeyId :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and
--   thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type
--   referenced by the Content-Type header field.
headObjectResponse_contentEncoding :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when the Object Lock retention period expires. This
--   header is only returned if the requester has the
--   <tt>s3:GetObjectRetention</tt> permission.
headObjectResponse_objectLockRetainUntilDate :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of metadata to store with the object in S3.
headObjectResponse_metadata :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Amazon S3 can return this header if your request involves a bucket
--   that is either a source or a destination in a replication rule.
--   
--   In replication, you have a source bucket on which you configure
--   replication and destination bucket or buckets where Amazon S3 stores
--   object replicas. When you request an object (<tt>GetObject</tt>) or
--   object metadata (<tt>HeadObject</tt>) from these buckets, Amazon S3
--   will return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header in the
--   response as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If requesting an object from the source bucket — Amazon S3 will
--   return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header if the object in
--   your request is eligible for replication.For example, suppose that in
--   your replication configuration, you specify object prefix
--   <tt>TaxDocs</tt> requesting Amazon S3 to replicate objects with key
--   prefix <tt>TaxDocs</tt>. Any objects you upload with this key name
--   prefix, for example <tt>TaxDocs/document1.pdf</tt>, are eligible for
--   replication. For any object request with this key name prefix, Amazon
--   S3 will return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header with value
--   PENDING, COMPLETED or FAILED indicating object replication
--   status.</li>
--   <li>If requesting an object from a destination bucket — Amazon S3 will
--   return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header with value REPLICA
--   if the object in your request is a replica that Amazon S3 created and
--   there is no replica modification replication in progress.</li>
--   <li>When replicating objects to multiple destination buckets the
--   <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header acts differently. The header
--   of the source object will only return a value of COMPLETED when
--   replication is successful to all destinations. The header will remain
--   at value PENDING until replication has completed for all destinations.
--   If one or more destinations fails replication the header will return
--   FAILED.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Replication</a>.
headObjectResponse_replicationStatus :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ReplicationStatus)

-- | Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
headObjectResponse_cacheControl :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The language the content is in.
headObjectResponse_contentLanguage :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Creation date of the object.
headObjectResponse_lastModified :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies whether a legal hold is in effect for this object. This
--   header is only returned if the requester has the
--   <tt>s3:GetObjectLegalHold</tt> permission. This header is not returned
--   if the specified version of this object has never had a legal hold
--   applied. For more information about S3 Object Lock, see <a>Object
--   Lock</a>.
headObjectResponse_objectLockLegalHoldStatus :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus)

-- | Specifies presentational information for the object.
headObjectResponse_contentDisposition :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If the object is stored using server-side encryption either with an
--   Amazon Web Services KMS key or an Amazon S3-managed encryption key,
--   the response includes this header with the value of the server-side
--   encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3 (for
--   example, AES256, aws:kms).
headObjectResponse_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
headObjectResponse_contentType :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
headObjectResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' HeadObjectResponse Int

-- | The concatenation of the authentication device's serial number, a
--   space, and the value that is displayed on your authentication device.
putBucketVersioning_mfa :: Lens' PutBucketVersioning (Maybe Text)

-- | <pre>
--   The base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the data. You must use this
--   </pre>
--   
--   header as a message integrity check to verify that the request body
--   was not corrupted in transit. For more information, see <a>RFC
--   1864</a>.
--   
--   For requests made using the Amazon Web Services Command Line Interface
--   (CLI) or Amazon Web Services SDKs, this field is calculated
--   automatically.

--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
copyObject_grantReadACP :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Copies the object if its entity tag (ETag) is different than the
--   specified ETag.
copyObject_copySourceIfNoneMatch :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (for
--   example, AES256).
copyObject_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in
--   encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is
--   discarded; Amazon S3 does not store the encryption key. The key must
--   be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header.
copyObject_sSECustomerKey :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
copyObject_requestPayer :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe RequestPayer)

-- | Allows grantee to write the ACL for the applicable object.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
copyObject_grantWriteACP :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Copies the object if its entity tag (ETag) matches the specified tag.
copyObject_copySourceIfMatch :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should use an S3 Bucket Key for object
--   encryption with server-side encryption using AWS KMS (SSE-KMS).
--   Setting this header to <tt>true</tt> causes Amazon S3 to use an S3
--   Bucket Key for object encryption with SSE-KMS.
--   
--   Specifying this header with a COPY action doesn’t affect bucket-level
--   settings for S3 Bucket Key.
copyObject_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Bool)

-- | If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this
--   object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL.
--   Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.
copyObject_websiteRedirectLocation :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Allows grantee to read the object data and its metadata.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
copyObject_grantRead :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The account ID of the expected source bucket owner. If the source
--   bucket is owned by a different account, the request will fail with an
--   HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
copyObject_expectedSourceBucketOwner :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | By default, Amazon S3 uses the STANDARD Storage Class to store newly
--   created objects. The STANDARD storage class provides high durability
--   and high availability. Depending on performance needs, you can specify
--   a different Storage Class. Amazon S3 on Outposts only uses the
--   OUTPOSTS Storage Class. For more information, see <a>Storage
--   Classes</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
copyObject_storageClass :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
copyObject_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS key ID to use for object
--   encryption. All GET and PUT requests for an object protected by Amazon
--   Web Services KMS will fail if not made via SSL or using SigV4. For
--   information about configuring using any of the officially supported
--   Amazon Web Services SDKs and Amazon Web Services CLI, see
--   <a>Specifying the Signature Version in Request Authentication</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
copyObject_sSEKMSKeyId :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Gives the grantee READ, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP permissions on the
--   object.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
copyObject_grantFullControl :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and
--   thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type
--   referenced by the Content-Type header field.
copyObject_contentEncoding :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag-set for the object destination object this value must be used
--   in conjunction with the <tt>TaggingDirective</tt>. The tag-set must be
--   encoded as URL Query parameters.
copyObject_tagging :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time when you want the copied object's Object Lock to
--   expire.
copyObject_objectLockRetainUntilDate :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A map of metadata to store with the object in S3.
copyObject_metadata :: Lens' CopyObject (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS Encryption Context to use for
--   object encryption. The value of this header is a base64-encoded UTF-8
--   string holding JSON with the encryption context key-value pairs.
copyObject_sSEKMSEncryptionContext :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
copyObject_cacheControl :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The language the content is in.
copyObject_contentLanguage :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use to
--   decrypt the source object. The encryption key provided in this header
--   must be one that was used when the source object was created.
copyObject_copySourceSSECustomerKey :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether you want to apply a Legal Hold to the copied object.
copyObject_objectLockLegalHoldStatus :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus)

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use when decrypting the source object (for
--   example, AES256).
copyObject_copySourceSSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The canned ACL to apply to the object.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
copyObject_acl :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe ObjectCannedACL)

-- | Specifies presentational information for the object.
copyObject_contentDisposition :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The account ID of the expected destination bucket owner. If the
--   destination bucket is owned by a different account, the request will
--   fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
copyObject_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in
--   Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
copyObject_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
copyObject_contentType :: Lens' CopyObject (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the destination bucket.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
copyObject_bucket :: Lens' CopyObject BucketName

-- | Specifies the source object for the copy operation. You specify the
--   value in one of two formats, depending on whether you want to access
--   the source object through an <a>access point</a>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For objects not accessed through an access point, specify the name
--   of the source bucket and the key of the source object, separated by a
--   slash (/). For example, to copy the object
--   <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> from the bucket
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket</tt>, use
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf</tt>. The value must be URL
--   encoded.</li>
--   <li>For objects accessed through access points, specify the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the object as accessed through the access
--   point, in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:accesspoint/&lt;access-point-name&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   access point <tt>my-access-point</tt> owned by account
--   <tt>123456789012</tt> in Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL
--   encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:us-west-2:123456789012:accesspoint/my-access-point/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.Amazon S3 supports copy operations using
--   access points only when the source and destination buckets are in the
--   same Amazon Web Services Region.Alternatively, for objects accessed
--   through Amazon S3 on Outposts, specify the ARN of the object as
--   accessed in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:outpost/&lt;outpost-id&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   outpost <tt>my-outpost</tt> owned by account <tt>123456789012</tt> in
--   Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:us-west-2:123456789012:outpost/my-outpost/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To copy a specific version of an object, append
--   <tt>?versionId=&lt;version-id&gt;</tt> to the value (for example,
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf?versionId=QUpfdndhfd8438MNFDN93jdnJFkdmqnh893</tt>).
--   If you don't specify a version ID, Amazon S3 copies the latest version
--   of the source object.
copyObject_copySource :: Lens' CopyObject Text

-- | The key of the destination object.
copyObject_key :: Lens' CopyObject ObjectKey

copyObjectResponse_requestCharged :: Lens' CopyObjectResponse (Maybe RequestCharged)

--   header.

--   message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption
--   key.

--   Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key that
--   was used for the object.
copyObjectResponse_sSEKMSKeyId :: Lens' CopyObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If present, specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS Encryption Context
--   to use for object encryption. The value of this header is a
--   base64-encoded UTF-8 string holding JSON with the encryption context
--   key-value pairs.
copyObjectResponse_sSEKMSEncryptionContext :: Lens' CopyObjectResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in
--   Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
copyObjectResponse_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' CopyObjectResponse (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | Container for all response elements.
copyObjectResponse_copyObjectResult :: Lens' CopyObjectResponse (Maybe CopyObjectResult)

-- | The response's http status code.
copyObjectResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CopyObjectResponse Int

-- | The marker that is used to continue a metrics configuration listing
--   that has been truncated. Use the NextContinuationToken from a
--   previously truncated list response to continue the listing. The
--   continuation token is an opaque value that Amazon S3 understands.
listBucketMetricsConfigurations_continuationToken :: Lens' ListBucketMetricsConfigurations (Maybe Text)

--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.

--   retrieve.

--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form

--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the

listParts_key :: Lens' ListParts ObjectKey

--   listed.

listPartsResponse_parts :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe [Part])

listPartsResponse_requestCharged :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe RequestCharged)

-- | Maximum number of parts that were allowed in the response.
listPartsResponse_maxParts :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | Container element that identifies who initiated the multipart upload.
--   If the initiator is an Amazon Web Services account, this element
--   provides the same information as the <tt>Owner</tt> element. If the
--   initiator is an IAM User, this element provides the user ARN and
--   display name.
listPartsResponse_initiator :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe Initiator)

-- | The name of the bucket to which the multipart upload was initiated.
--   Does not return the access point ARN or access point alias if used.
listPartsResponse_bucket :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe BucketName)

-- | If the bucket has a lifecycle rule configured with an action to abort
--   incomplete multipart uploads and the prefix in the lifecycle rule
--   matches the object name in the request, then the response includes
--   this header indicating when the initiated multipart upload will become
--   eligible for abort operation. For more information, see <a>Aborting
--   Incomplete Multipart Uploads Using a Bucket Lifecycle Policy</a>.
--   
--   The response will also include the <tt>x-amz-abort-rule-id</tt> header
--   that will provide the ID of the lifecycle configuration rule that
--   defines this action.
listPartsResponse_abortDate :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | When a list is truncated, this element specifies the last part in the
--   list, as well as the value to use for the part-number-marker request
--   parameter in a subsequent request.
listPartsResponse_nextPartNumberMarker :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe Int)

--   header. It identifies applicable lifecycle configuration rule that
--   defines the action to abort incomplete multipart uploads.
listPartsResponse_abortRuleId :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Container element that identifies the object owner, after the object
--   is created. If multipart upload is initiated by an IAM user, this
--   element provides the parent account ID and display name.
listPartsResponse_owner :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe Owner)

-- | Object key for which the multipart upload was initiated.
listPartsResponse_key :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe ObjectKey)

-- | Class of storage (STANDARD or REDUCED_REDUNDANCY) used to store the
--   uploaded object.

-- | Indicates whether the returned list of parts is truncated. A true
--   value indicates that the list was truncated. A list can be truncated
--   if the number of parts exceeds the limit returned in the MaxParts
--   element.
listPartsResponse_isTruncated :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe Bool)

--   list, as well as the value to use for the part-number-marker request
--   parameter in a subsequent request.
listPartsResponse_partNumberMarker :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe Int)

-- | Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose parts are being
--   listed.
listPartsResponse_uploadId :: Lens' ListPartsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listPartsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListPartsResponse Int

-- | The versionId of the object that the tag-set will be removed from.
deleteObjectTagging_versionId :: Lens' DeleteObjectTagging (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | The account ID of the expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by
--   a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
deleteObjectTagging_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' DeleteObjectTagging (Maybe Text)

-- | The bucket name containing the objects from which to remove the tags.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
deleteObjectTagging_bucket :: Lens' DeleteObjectTagging BucketName

-- | The key that identifies the object in the bucket from which to remove
--   all tags.
deleteObjectTagging_key :: Lens' DeleteObjectTagging ObjectKey

-- | The versionId of the object the tag-set was removed from.
deleteObjectTaggingResponse_versionId :: Lens' DeleteObjectTaggingResponse (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteObjectTaggingResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteObjectTaggingResponse Int

-- | Copies the object if it has been modified since the specified time.
uploadPartCopy_copySourceIfModifiedSince :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Copies the object if it hasn't been modified since the specified time.
uploadPartCopy_copySourceIfUnmodifiedSince :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The range of bytes to copy from the source object. The range value
--   must use the form bytes=first-last, where the first and last are the
--   zero-based byte offsets to copy. For example, bytes=0-9 indicates that
--   you want to copy the first 10 bytes of the source. You can copy a
--   range only if the source object is greater than 5 MB.
uploadPartCopy_copySourceRange :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
uploadPartCopy_copySourceSSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe Text)

-- | Copies the object if its entity tag (ETag) is different than the
--   specified ETag.
uploadPartCopy_copySourceIfNoneMatch :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (for
--   example, AES256).
uploadPartCopy_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in
--   encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is
--   discarded; Amazon S3 does not store the encryption key. The key must
--   be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header. This
--   must be the same encryption key specified in the initiate multipart
--   upload request.
uploadPartCopy_sSECustomerKey :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
uploadPartCopy_requestPayer :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe RequestPayer)

-- | Copies the object if its entity tag (ETag) matches the specified tag.
uploadPartCopy_copySourceIfMatch :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe Text)

-- | The account ID of the expected source bucket owner. If the source
--   bucket is owned by a different account, the request will fail with an
--   HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
uploadPartCopy_expectedSourceBucketOwner :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to
--   RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to
--   ensure that the encryption key was transmitted without error.
uploadPartCopy_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use to
--   decrypt the source object. The encryption key provided in this header
--   must be one that was used when the source object was created.
uploadPartCopy_copySourceSSECustomerKey :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the algorithm to use when decrypting the source object (for
--   example, AES256).
uploadPartCopy_copySourceSSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe Text)

-- | The account ID of the expected destination bucket owner. If the
--   destination bucket is owned by a different account, the request will
--   fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
uploadPartCopy_expectedBucketOwner :: Lens' UploadPartCopy (Maybe Text)

-- | The bucket name.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
uploadPartCopy_bucket :: Lens' UploadPartCopy BucketName

-- | Specifies the source object for the copy operation. You specify the
--   value in one of two formats, depending on whether you want to access
--   the source object through an <a>access point</a>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For objects not accessed through an access point, specify the name
--   of the source bucket and key of the source object, separated by a
--   slash (/). For example, to copy the object
--   <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> from the bucket
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket</tt>, use
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf</tt>. The value must be URL
--   encoded.</li>
--   <li>For objects accessed through access points, specify the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the object as accessed through the access
--   point, in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:accesspoint/&lt;access-point-name&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   access point <tt>my-access-point</tt> owned by account
--   <tt>123456789012</tt> in Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL
--   encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:us-west-2:123456789012:accesspoint/my-access-point/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.Amazon S3 supports copy operations using
--   access points only when the source and destination buckets are in the
--   same Amazon Web Services Region.Alternatively, for objects accessed
--   through Amazon S3 on Outposts, specify the ARN of the object as
--   accessed in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:outpost/&lt;outpost-id&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   outpost <tt>my-outpost</tt> owned by account <tt>123456789012</tt> in
--   Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:us-west-2:123456789012:outpost/my-outpost/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To copy a specific version of an object, append
--   <tt>?versionId=&lt;version-id&gt;</tt> to the value (for example,
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf?versionId=QUpfdndhfd8438MNFDN93jdnJFkdmqnh893</tt>).
--   If you don't specify a version ID, Amazon S3 copies the latest version
--   of the source object.
uploadPartCopy_copySource :: Lens' UploadPartCopy Text

-- | Object key for which the multipart upload was initiated.
uploadPartCopy_key :: Lens' UploadPartCopy ObjectKey

-- | Part number of part being copied. This is a positive integer between 1
--   and 10,000.
uploadPartCopy_partNumber :: Lens' UploadPartCopy Int

-- | Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose part is being copied.
uploadPartCopy_uploadId :: Lens' UploadPartCopy Text

uploadPartCopyResponse_requestCharged :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe RequestCharged)

-- | Container for all response elements.
uploadPartCopyResponse_copyPartResult :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe CopyPartResult)

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header confirming the
--   encryption algorithm used.
uploadPartCopyResponse_sSECustomerAlgorithm :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the multipart upload uses an S3 Bucket Key for
--   server-side encryption with Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
uploadPartCopyResponse_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The version of the source object that was copied, if you have enabled
--   versioning on the source bucket.
uploadPartCopyResponse_copySourceVersionId :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If server-side encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was
--   requested, the response will include this header to provide round-trip
--   message integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption
--   key.
uploadPartCopyResponse_sSECustomerKeyMD5 :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If present, specifies the ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management
--   Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key that
--   was used for the object.
uploadPartCopyResponse_sSEKMSKeyId :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in
--   Amazon S3 (for example, AES256, aws:kms).
uploadPartCopyResponse_serverSideEncryption :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse (Maybe ServerSideEncryption)

-- | The response's http status code.
uploadPartCopyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UploadPartCopyResponse Int

-- | A single character used for escaping when the field delimiter is part
--   of the value. For example, if the value is <tt>a, b</tt>, Amazon S3
--   wraps this field value in quotation marks, as follows: <tt>" a , b
--   "</tt>.
--   
--   Type: String
--   
--   Default: <tt>"</tt>
--   
--   Ancestors: <tt>CSV</tt>
cSVInput_quoteCharacter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A single character used to separate individual records in the input.
--   Instead of the default value, you can specify an arbitrary delimiter.
cSVInput_recordDelimiter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies that CSV field values may contain quoted record delimiters
--   and such records should be allowed. Default value is FALSE. Setting
--   this value to TRUE may lower performance.
cSVInput_allowQuotedRecordDelimiter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Bool)

-- | Describes the first line of input. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>NONE</tt>: First line is not a header.</li>
--   <li><tt>IGNORE</tt>: First line is a header, but you can't use the
--   header values to indicate the column in an expression. You can use
--   column position (such as _1, _2, …) to indicate the column (<tt>SELECT
--   s._1 FROM OBJECT s</tt>).</li>
--   <li><tt>Use</tt>: First line is a header, and you can use the header
--   value to identify a column in an expression (<tt>SELECT "name" FROM
--   OBJECT</tt>).</li>
--   </ul>
cSVInput_fileHeaderInfo :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe FileHeaderInfo)

-- | A single character used for escaping the quotation mark character
--   inside an already escaped value. For example, the value """ a , b """
--   is parsed as " a , b ".
cSVInput_quoteEscapeCharacter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A single character used to indicate that a row should be ignored when
--   the character is present at the start of that row. You can specify any
--   character to indicate a comment line.
cSVInput_comments :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A single character used to separate individual fields in a record. You
--   can specify an arbitrary delimiter.

-- | A single character used for escaping when the field delimiter is part
--   of the value. For example, if the value is <tt>a, b</tt>, Amazon S3
--   wraps this field value in quotation marks, as follows: <tt>" a , b
--   "</tt>.

--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALWAYS</tt>: Always use quotation marks for output

--   specify an arbitrary delimiter.
