objectVersion_storageClass :: Lens' ObjectVersion (Maybe ObjectVersionStorageClass)

-- | Date and time the object was last modified.
objectVersion_lastModified :: Lens' ObjectVersion (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Describes an S3 location that will receive the results of the restore
--   request.
outputLocation_s3 :: Lens' OutputLocation (Maybe S3Location)

-- | Specifies JSON as request's output serialization format.
outputSerialization_json :: Lens' OutputSerialization (Maybe JSONOutput)

-- | Describes the serialization of CSV-encoded Select results.
outputSerialization_csv :: Lens' OutputSerialization (Maybe CSVOutput)

-- | Container for the display name of the owner.
owner_displayName :: Lens' Owner (Maybe Text)

-- | Container for the ID of the owner.
owner_id :: Lens' Owner (Maybe Text)

-- | The container element for an ownership control rule.
ownershipControls_rules :: Lens' OwnershipControls [OwnershipControlsRule]

-- | Undocumented member.
ownershipControlsRule_objectOwnership :: Lens' OwnershipControlsRule ObjectOwnership

-- | Entity tag returned when the part was uploaded.
part_eTag :: Lens' Part (Maybe ETag)

-- | Size in bytes of the uploaded part data.
part_size :: Lens' Part (Maybe Integer)

-- | Part number identifying the part. This is a positive integer between 1
--   and 10,000.
part_partNumber :: Lens' Part (Maybe Int)

-- | Date and time at which the part was uploaded.
part_lastModified :: Lens' Part (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The policy status for this bucket. <tt>TRUE</tt> indicates that this
--   bucket is public. <tt>FALSE</tt> indicates that the bucket is not
--   public.
policyStatus_isPublic :: Lens' PolicyStatus (Maybe Bool)

-- | The current number of bytes of records payload data returned.
progress_bytesReturned :: Lens' Progress (Maybe Integer)

-- | The current number of object bytes scanned.
progress_bytesScanned :: Lens' Progress (Maybe Integer)

-- | The current number of uncompressed object bytes processed.
progress_bytesProcessed :: Lens' Progress (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Progress event details.
progressEvent_details :: Lens' ProgressEvent (Maybe Progress)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should ignore public ACLs for this bucket
--   and objects in this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt>
--   causes Amazon S3 to ignore all public ACLs on this bucket and objects
--   in this bucket.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect the persistence of any existing
--   ACLs and doesn't prevent new public ACLs from being set.
publicAccessBlockConfiguration_ignorePublicAcls :: Lens' PublicAccessBlockConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should block public access control lists
--   (ACLs) for this bucket and objects in this bucket. Setting this
--   element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes the following behavior:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>PUT Bucket acl and PUT Object acl calls fail if the specified ACL
--   is public.</li>
--   <li>PUT Object calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   <li>PUT Bucket calls fail if the request includes a public ACL.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing policies or ACLs.
publicAccessBlockConfiguration_blockPublicAcls :: Lens' PublicAccessBlockConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should restrict public bucket policies for
--   this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> restricts access to
--   this bucket to only Amazon Web Service principals and authorized users
--   within this account if the bucket has a public policy.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect previously stored bucket
--   policies, except that public and cross-account access within any
--   public bucket policy, including non-public delegation to specific
--   accounts, is blocked.
publicAccessBlockConfiguration_restrictPublicBuckets :: Lens' PublicAccessBlockConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should block public bucket policies for
--   this bucket. Setting this element to <tt>TRUE</tt> causes Amazon S3 to
--   reject calls to PUT Bucket policy if the specified bucket policy
--   allows public access.
--   
--   Enabling this setting doesn't affect existing bucket policies.
publicAccessBlockConfiguration_blockPublicPolicy :: Lens' PublicAccessBlockConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Undocumented member.
queueConfiguration_id :: Lens' QueueConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
queueConfiguration_filter :: Lens' QueueConfiguration (Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SQS queue to which Amazon
--   S3 publishes a message when it detects events of the specified type.
queueConfiguration_queueArn :: Lens' QueueConfiguration Text

-- | A collection of bucket events for which to send notifications
queueConfiguration_events :: Lens' QueueConfiguration [Event]

-- | The byte array of partial, one or more result records.-- --
--   <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes
--   Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64
--   representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
recordsEvent_payload :: Lens' RecordsEvent (Maybe ByteString)

-- | The host name to use in the redirect request.
redirect_hostName :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Text)

-- | Protocol to use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol
--   that is used in the original request.
redirect_protocol :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Protocol)

-- | The HTTP redirect code to use on the response. Not required if one of
--   the siblings is present.
redirect_httpRedirectCode :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Text)

-- | The specific object key to use in the redirect request. For example,
--   redirect request to <tt>error.html</tt>. Not required if one of the
--   siblings is present. Can be present only if
--   <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
redirect_replaceKeyWith :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Text)

-- | The object key prefix to use in the redirect request. For example, to
--   redirect requests for all pages with prefix <tt>docs/</tt> (objects in
--   the <tt>docs/</tt> folder) to <tt>documents/</tt>, you can set a
--   condition block with <tt>KeyPrefixEquals</tt> set to <tt>docs/</tt>
--   and in the Redirect set <tt>ReplaceKeyPrefixWith</tt> to
--   <tt>/documents</tt>. Not required if one of the siblings is present.
--   Can be present only if <tt>ReplaceKeyWith</tt> is not provided.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
redirect_replaceKeyPrefixWith :: Lens' Redirect (Maybe Text)

-- | Protocol to use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol
--   that is used in the original request.
redirectAllRequestsTo_protocol :: Lens' RedirectAllRequestsTo (Maybe Protocol)

-- | Name of the host where requests are redirected.
redirectAllRequestsTo_hostName :: Lens' RedirectAllRequestsTo Text

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 replicates modifications on replicas.
replicaModifications_status :: Lens' ReplicaModifications ReplicaModificationsStatus

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role that Amazon S3 assumes when replicating objects. For more
--   information, see <a>How to Set Up Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3
--   User Guide</i>.
replicationConfiguration_role :: Lens' ReplicationConfiguration Text

-- | A container for one or more replication rules. A replication
--   configuration must have at least one rule and can contain a maximum of
--   1,000 rules.
replicationConfiguration_rules :: Lens' ReplicationConfiguration [ReplicationRule]

-- | Undocumented member.
replicationRule_deleteMarkerReplication :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe DeleteMarkerReplication)

-- | The priority indicates which rule has precedence whenever two or more
--   replication rules conflict. Amazon S3 will attempt to replicate
--   objects according to all replication rules. However, if there are two
--   or more rules with the same destination bucket, then objects will be
--   replicated according to the rule with the highest priority. The higher
--   the number, the higher the priority.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Replication</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
replicationRule_priority :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe Int)

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the object or objects to
--   which the rule applies. The maximum prefix length is 1,024 characters.
--   To include all objects in a bucket, specify an empty string.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
replicationRule_prefix :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe Text)

replicationRule_existingObjectReplication :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe ExistingObjectReplication)

-- | A unique identifier for the rule. The maximum value is 255 characters.
replicationRule_id :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
replicationRule_filter :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe ReplicationRuleFilter)

-- | A container that describes additional filters for identifying the
--   source objects that you want to replicate. You can choose to enable or
--   disable the replication of these objects. Currently, Amazon S3
--   supports only the filter that you can specify for objects created with
--   server-side encryption using a customer managed key stored in Amazon
--   Web Services Key Management Service (SSE-KMS).
replicationRule_sourceSelectionCriteria :: Lens' ReplicationRule (Maybe SourceSelectionCriteria)

-- | Specifies whether the rule is enabled.
replicationRule_status :: Lens' ReplicationRule ReplicationRuleStatus

-- | A container for information about the replication destination and its
--   configurations including enabling the S3 Replication Time Control (S3
--   RTC).
replicationRule_destination :: Lens' ReplicationRule Destination

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
replicationRuleAndOperator_prefix :: Lens' ReplicationRuleAndOperator (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of tags containing key and value pairs.
replicationRuleAndOperator_tags :: Lens' ReplicationRuleAndOperator (Maybe [Tag])

-- | A container for specifying a tag key and value.
--   
--   The rule applies only to objects that have the tag in their tag set.
replicationRuleFilter_tag :: Lens' ReplicationRuleFilter (Maybe Tag)

-- | An object key name prefix that identifies the subset of objects to
--   which the rule applies.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
replicationRuleFilter_prefix :: Lens' ReplicationRuleFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | A container for specifying rule filters. The filters determine the
--   subset of objects to which the rule applies. This element is required
--   only if you specify more than one filter. For example:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If you specify both a <tt>Prefix</tt> and a <tt>Tag</tt> filter,
--   wrap these filters in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   <li>If you specify a filter based on multiple tags, wrap the
--   <tt>Tag</tt> elements in an <tt>And</tt> tag.</li>
--   </ul>
replicationRuleFilter_and :: Lens' ReplicationRuleFilter (Maybe ReplicationRuleAndOperator)

-- | Specifies whether the replication time is enabled.
replicationTime_status :: Lens' ReplicationTime ReplicationTimeStatus

-- | A container specifying the time by which replication should be
--   complete for all objects and operations on objects.
replicationTime_time :: Lens' ReplicationTime ReplicationTimeValue

-- | Contains an integer specifying time in minutes.
--   
--   Valid value: 15
replicationTimeValue_minutes :: Lens' ReplicationTimeValue (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies who pays for the download and request fees.
requestPaymentConfiguration_payer :: Lens' RequestPaymentConfiguration Payer

-- | Specifies whether periodic QueryProgress frames should be sent. Valid
--   values: TRUE, FALSE. Default value: FALSE.
requestProgress_enabled :: Lens' RequestProgress (Maybe Bool)

-- | Lifetime of the active copy in days. Do not use with restores that
--   specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
--   
--   The Days element is required for regular restores, and must not be
--   provided for select requests.
restoreRequest_days :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe Int)

-- | Describes the parameters for Select job types.
restoreRequest_selectParameters :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe SelectParameters)

-- | Describes the location where the restore job's output is stored.
restoreRequest_outputLocation :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe OutputLocation)

-- | Retrieval tier at which the restore will be processed.
restoreRequest_tier :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe Tier)

-- | S3 Glacier related parameters pertaining to this job. Do not use with
--   restores that specify <tt>OutputLocation</tt>.
restoreRequest_glacierJobParameters :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe GlacierJobParameters)

-- | Type of restore request.
restoreRequest_type :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe RestoreRequestType)

-- | The optional description for the job.
restoreRequest_description :: Lens' RestoreRequest (Maybe Text)

-- | A container for describing a condition that must be met for the
--   specified redirect to apply. For example, 1. If request is for pages
--   in the <tt>/docs</tt> folder, redirect to the <tt>/documents</tt>
--   folder. 2. If request results in HTTP error 4xx, redirect request to
--   another host where you might process the error.
routingRule_condition :: Lens' RoutingRule (Maybe Condition)

-- | Container for redirect information. You can redirect requests to
--   another host, to another page, or with another protocol. In the event
--   of an error, you can specify a different error code to return.
routingRule_redirect :: Lens' RoutingRule Redirect

-- | Undocumented member.
s3KeyFilter_filterRules :: Lens' S3KeyFilter (Maybe [FilterRule])

-- | The canned ACL to apply to the restore results.
s3Location_cannedACL :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe ObjectCannedACL)

-- | A list of grants that control access to the staged results.
s3Location_accessControlList :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe [Grant])

-- | A list of metadata to store with the restore results in S3.
s3Location_userMetadata :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe [MetadataEntry])

-- | Undocumented member.
s3Location_encryption :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe Encryption)

-- | The class of storage used to store the restore results.
s3Location_storageClass :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | The tag-set that is applied to the restore results.
s3Location_tagging :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe Tagging)

-- | The name of the bucket where the restore results will be placed.
s3Location_bucketName :: Lens' S3Location BucketName

-- | The prefix that is prepended to the restore results for this request.
s3Location_prefix :: Lens' S3Location Text

-- | The version ID of the error.
s3ServiceError_versionId :: Lens' S3ServiceError (Maybe ObjectVersionId)

-- | The error key.
s3ServiceError_key :: Lens' S3ServiceError (Maybe ObjectKey)

-- | The error code is a string that uniquely identifies an error
--   condition. It is meant to be read and understood by programs that
--   detect and handle errors by type.
--   
--   <b>Amazon S3 error codes</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> AccessDenied<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Access
--   Denied</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> AccountProblem<ul><li><i>Description:</i> There is
--   a problem with your Amazon Web Services account that prevents the
--   action from completing successfully. Contact Amazon Web Services
--   Support for further assistance.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403
--   Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> AllAccessDisabled<ul><li><i>Description:</i> All
--   access to this Amazon S3 resource has been disabled. Contact Amazon
--   Web Services Support for further assistance.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   AmbiguousGrantByEmailAddress<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The email
--   address you provided is associated with more than one
--   account.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   AuthorizationHeaderMalformed<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   authorization header you provided is invalid.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i>
--   N/A</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BadDigest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   Content-MD5 you specified did not match what we
--   received.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BucketAlreadyExists<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   requested bucket name is not available. The bucket namespace is shared
--   by all users of the system. Please select a different name and try
--   again.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 409 Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BucketAlreadyOwnedByYou<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   The bucket you tried to create already exists, and you own it. Amazon
--   S3 returns this error in all Amazon Web Services Regions except in the
--   North Virginia Region. For legacy compatibility, if you re-create an
--   existing bucket that you already own in the North Virginia Region,
--   Amazon S3 returns 200 OK and resets the bucket access control lists
--   (ACLs).</li><li><i>Code:</i> 409 Conflict (in all Regions except the
--   North Virginia Region)</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> BucketNotEmpty<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   bucket you tried to delete is not empty.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 409 Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> CredentialsNotSupported<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   This request does not support credentials.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   CrossLocationLoggingProhibited<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Cross-location logging not allowed. Buckets in one geographic location
--   cannot log information to a bucket in another
--   location.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403
--   Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> EntityTooSmall<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your
--   proposed upload is smaller than the minimum allowed object
--   size.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> EntityTooLarge<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your
--   proposed upload exceeds the maximum allowed object
--   size.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> ExpiredToken<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   provided token has expired.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   IllegalVersioningConfigurationException<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Indicates that the versioning configuration specified in the request
--   is invalid.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> IncompleteBody<ul><li><i>Description:</i> You did
--   not provide the number of bytes specified by the Content-Length HTTP
--   header</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   IncorrectNumberOfFilesInPostRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> POST
--   requires exactly one file upload per request.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InlineDataTooLarge<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Inline data exceeds the maximum allowed size.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InternalError<ul><li><i>Description:</i> We
--   encountered an internal error. Please try again.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 500 Internal Server Error</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Server</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidAccessKeyId<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   Amazon Web Services access key ID you provided does not exist in our
--   records.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403
--   Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidAddressingHeader<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   You must specify the Anonymous role.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i>
--   N/A</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidArgument<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Invalid
--   Argument</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidBucketName<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   specified bucket is not valid.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400
--   Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidBucketState<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   request is not valid with the current state of the
--   bucket.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 409 Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidDigest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   Content-MD5 you specified is not valid.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   InvalidEncryptionAlgorithmError<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   encryption request you specified is not valid. The valid value is
--   AES256.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   InvalidLocationConstraint<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The specified
--   location constraint is not valid. For more information about Regions,
--   see <a>How to Select a Region for Your Buckets</a>.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidObjectState<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   action is not valid for the current state of the
--   object.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidPart<ul><li><i>Description:</i> One or more
--   of the specified parts could not be found. The part might not have
--   been uploaded, or the specified entity tag might not have matched the
--   part's entity tag.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidPartOrder<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   list of parts was not in ascending order. Parts list must be specified
--   in order by part number.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidPayer<ul><li><i>Description:</i> All access
--   to this object has been disabled. Please contact Amazon Web Services
--   Support for further assistance.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403
--   Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidPolicyDocument<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   The content of the form does not meet the conditions specified in the
--   policy document.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidRange<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   requested range cannot be satisfied.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i>
--   416 Requested Range Not Satisfiable</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Please
--   use <tt>AWS4-HMAC-SHA256</tt>.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400
--   Bad Request</li><li><i>Code:</i> N/A</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> SOAP
--   requests must be made over an HTTPS connection.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Amazon S3
--   Transfer Acceleration is not supported for buckets with non-DNS
--   compliant names.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>Code:</i> N/A</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Amazon S3
--   Transfer Acceleration is not supported for buckets with periods (.) in
--   their names.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>Code:</i> N/A</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Amazon S3
--   Transfer Accelerate endpoint only supports virtual style
--   requests.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>Code:</i> N/A</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Amazon S3
--   Transfer Accelerate is not configured on this bucket.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>Code:</i>
--   N/A</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Amazon S3
--   Transfer Accelerate is disabled on this bucket.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>Code:</i> N/A</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Amazon S3
--   Transfer Acceleration is not supported on this bucket. Contact Amazon
--   Web Services Support for more information.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>Code:</i> N/A</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Amazon S3
--   Transfer Acceleration cannot be enabled on this bucket. Contact Amazon
--   Web Services Support for more information.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>Code:</i> N/A</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidSecurity<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   provided security credentials are not valid.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidSOAPRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   SOAP request body is invalid.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidStorageClass<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   storage class you specified is not valid.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   InvalidTargetBucketForLogging<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The target
--   bucket for logging does not exist, is not owned by you, or does not
--   have the appropriate grants for the log-delivery
--   group.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidToken<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   provided token is malformed or otherwise invalid.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> InvalidURI<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Couldn't
--   parse the specified URI.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> KeyTooLongError<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your key
--   is too long.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> MalformedACLError<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   XML you provided was not well-formed or did not validate against our
--   published schema.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> MalformedPOSTRequest<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   body of your POST request is not well-formed
--   multipart/form-data.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> MalformedXML<ul><li><i>Description:</i> This
--   happens when the user sends malformed XML (XML that doesn't conform to
--   the published XSD) for the configuration. The error message is, "The
--   XML you provided was not well-formed or did not validate against our
--   published schema."</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> MaxMessageLengthExceeded<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Your request was too big.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   MaxPostPreDataLengthExceededError<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your POST
--   request fields preceding the upload file were too
--   large.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> MetadataTooLarge<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your
--   metadata headers exceed the maximum allowed metadata
--   size.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> MethodNotAllowed<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   specified method is not allowed against this resource.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 405 Method Not Allowed</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> MissingAttachment<ul><li><i>Description:</i> A SOAP
--   attachment was expected, but none were found.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> N/A</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> MissingContentLength<ul><li><i>Description:</i> You
--   must provide the Content-Length HTTP header.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 411 Length Required</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> MissingRequestBodyError<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   This happens when the user sends an empty XML document as a request.
--   The error message is, "Request body is empty."</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> MissingSecurityElement<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   The SOAP 1.1 request is missing a security element.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> MissingSecurityHeader<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Your request is missing a required header.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NoLoggingStatusForKey<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   There is no such thing as a logging status subresource for a
--   key.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NoSuchBucket<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   specified bucket does not exist.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 404
--   Not Found</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NoSuchBucketPolicy<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   specified bucket does not have a bucket policy.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 404 Not Found</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NoSuchKey<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The specified
--   key does not exist.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 404 Not
--   Found</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   NoSuchLifecycleConfiguration<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The lifecycle
--   configuration does not exist.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 404 Not
--   Found</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NoSuchUpload<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   specified multipart upload does not exist. The upload ID might be
--   invalid, or the multipart upload might have been aborted or
--   completed.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 404 Not
--   Found</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NoSuchVersion<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Indicates
--   that the version ID specified in the request does not match an
--   existing version.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 404 Not
--   Found</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NotImplemented<ul><li><i>Description:</i> A header
--   you provided implies functionality that is not
--   implemented.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 501 Not
--   Implemented</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Server</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> NotSignedUp<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your account
--   is not signed up for the Amazon S3 service. You must sign up before
--   you can use Amazon S3. You can sign up at the following URL: <a>Amazon
--   S3</a></li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> OperationAborted<ul><li><i>Description:</i> A
--   conflicting conditional action is currently in progress against this
--   resource. Try again.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 409
--   Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> PermanentRedirect<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   bucket you are attempting to access must be addressed using the
--   specified endpoint. Send all future requests to this
--   endpoint.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 301 Moved
--   Permanently</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> PreconditionFailed<ul><li><i>Description:</i> At
--   least one of the preconditions you specified did not
--   hold.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 412 Precondition
--   Failed</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> Redirect<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Temporary
--   redirect.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 307 Moved
--   Temporarily</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> RestoreAlreadyInProgress<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Object restore is already in progress.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 409 Conflict</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   RequestIsNotMultiPartContent<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Bucket POST
--   must be of the enclosure-type multipart/form-data.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> RequestTimeout<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Your
--   socket connection to the server was not read from or written to within
--   the timeout period.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> RequestTimeTooSkewed<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   difference between the request time and the server's time is too
--   large.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP
--   Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   RequestTorrentOfBucketError<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Requesting the
--   torrent file of a bucket is not permitted.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> SignatureDoesNotMatch<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   The request signature we calculated does not match the signature you
--   provided. Check your Amazon Web Services secret access key and signing
--   method. For more information, see <a>REST Authentication</a> and
--   <a>SOAP Authentication</a> for details.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 403 Forbidden</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> ServiceUnavailable<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   Reduce your request rate.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 503 Service
--   Unavailable</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Server</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> SlowDown<ul><li><i>Description:</i> Reduce your
--   request rate.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 503 Slow
--   Down</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Server</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> TemporaryRedirect<ul><li><i>Description:</i> You
--   are being redirected to the bucket while DNS updates.</li><li><i>HTTP
--   Status Code:</i> 307 Moved Temporarily</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code
--   Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> TokenRefreshRequired<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The
--   provided token must be refreshed.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400
--   Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> TooManyBuckets<ul><li><i>Description:</i> You have
--   attempted to create more buckets than allowed.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> UnexpectedContent<ul><li><i>Description:</i> This
--   request does not support content.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400
--   Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i>
--   UnresolvableGrantByEmailAddress<ul><li><i>Description:</i> The email
--   address you provided does not match any account on
--   record.</li><li><i>HTTP Status Code:</i> 400 Bad
--   Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i> Client</li></ul></li>
--   <li>- <i>Code:</i> UserKeyMustBeSpecified<ul><li><i>Description:</i>
--   The bucket POST must contain the specified field name. If it is
--   specified, check the order of the fields.</li><li><i>HTTP Status
--   Code:</i> 400 Bad Request</li><li><i>SOAP Fault Code Prefix:</i>
--   Client</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
s3ServiceError_code :: Lens' S3ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | The error message contains a generic description of the error
--   condition in English. It is intended for a human audience. Simple
--   programs display the message directly to the end user if they
--   encounter an error condition they don't know how or don't care to
--   handle. Sophisticated programs with more exhaustive error handling and
--   proper internationalization are more likely to ignore the error
--   message.
s3ServiceError_message :: Lens' S3ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service
--   (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetric customer managed key to use for
--   encrypting inventory reports.
ssekms_keyId :: Lens' SSEKMS Text

-- | Specifies the start of the byte range. This parameter is optional.
--   Valid values: non-negative integers. The default value is 0. If only
--   start is supplied, it means scan from that point to the end of the
--   file.For example;
--   <tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;start&gt;50&lt;/start&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   means scan from byte 50 until the end of the file.
scanRange_start :: Lens' ScanRange (Maybe Integer)

-- | Specifies the end of the byte range. This parameter is optional. Valid
--   values: non-negative integers. The default value is one less than the
--   size of the object being queried. If only the End parameter is
--   supplied, it is interpreted to mean scan the last N bytes of the file.
--   For example,
--   <tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;end&gt;50&lt;/end&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   means scan the last 50 bytes.
scanRange_end :: Lens' ScanRange (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Progress Event.
selectObjectContentEventStream_progress :: Lens' SelectObjectContentEventStream (Maybe ProgressEvent)

-- | The Records Event.
selectObjectContentEventStream_records :: Lens' SelectObjectContentEventStream (Maybe RecordsEvent)

-- | The Continuation Event.
selectObjectContentEventStream_cont :: Lens' SelectObjectContentEventStream (Maybe ContinuationEvent)

-- | The Stats Event.
selectObjectContentEventStream_stats :: Lens' SelectObjectContentEventStream (Maybe StatsEvent)

-- | The End Event.
selectObjectContentEventStream_end :: Lens' SelectObjectContentEventStream (Maybe EndEvent)

-- | Describes the serialization format of the object.
selectParameters_inputSerialization :: Lens' SelectParameters InputSerialization

-- | The type of the provided expression (for example, SQL).
selectParameters_expressionType :: Lens' SelectParameters ExpressionType

-- | The expression that is used to query the object.
selectParameters_expression :: Lens' SelectParameters Text

-- | Describes how the results of the Select job are serialized.
selectParameters_outputSerialization :: Lens' SelectParameters OutputSerialization

-- | Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) customer Amazon Web
--   Services KMS key ID to use for the default encryption. This parameter
--   is allowed if and only if <tt>SSEAlgorithm</tt> is set to
--   <tt>aws:kms</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify the key ID or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the
--   KMS key. However, if you are using encryption with cross-account
--   operations, you must use a fully qualified KMS key ARN. For more
--   information, see <a>Using encryption for cross-account operations</a>.
--   
--   <b>For example:</b>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Key ID: <tt>1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   <li>Key ARN:
--   <tt>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Amazon S3 only supports symmetric KMS keys and not asymmetric KMS
--   keys. For more information, see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric
--   keys</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services Key Management Service
--   Developer Guide</i>.
serverSideEncryptionByDefault_kmsMasterKeyID :: Lens' ServerSideEncryptionByDefault (Maybe Text)

-- | Server-side encryption algorithm to use for the default encryption.
serverSideEncryptionByDefault_sSEAlgorithm :: Lens' ServerSideEncryptionByDefault ServerSideEncryption

-- | Container for information about a particular server-side encryption
--   configuration rule.
serverSideEncryptionConfiguration_rules :: Lens' ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration [ServerSideEncryptionRule]

-- | Specifies the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects
--   in the bucket. If a PUT Object request doesn't specify any server-side
--   encryption, this default encryption will be applied.
serverSideEncryptionRule_applyServerSideEncryptionByDefault :: Lens' ServerSideEncryptionRule (Maybe ServerSideEncryptionByDefault)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 should use an S3 Bucket Key with
--   server-side encryption using KMS (SSE-KMS) for new objects in the
--   bucket. Existing objects are not affected. Setting the
--   <tt>BucketKeyEnabled</tt> element to <tt>true</tt> causes Amazon S3 to
--   use an S3 Bucket Key. By default, S3 Bucket Key is not enabled.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Amazon S3 Bucket Keys</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
serverSideEncryptionRule_bucketKeyEnabled :: Lens' ServerSideEncryptionRule (Maybe Bool)

-- | A filter that you can specify for selections for modifications on
--   replicas. Amazon S3 doesn't replicate replica modifications by
--   default. In the latest version of replication configuration (when
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is specified), you can specify this element and set
--   the status to <tt>Enabled</tt> to replicate modifications on replicas.
--   
--   If you don't specify the <tt>Filter</tt> element, Amazon S3 assumes
--   that the replication configuration is the earlier version, V1. In the
--   earlier version, this element is not allowed
sourceSelectionCriteria_replicaModifications :: Lens' SourceSelectionCriteria (Maybe ReplicaModifications)

-- | A container for filter information for the selection of Amazon S3
--   objects encrypted with Amazon Web Services KMS. If you include
--   <tt>SourceSelectionCriteria</tt> in the replication configuration,
--   this element is required.
sourceSelectionCriteria_sseKmsEncryptedObjects :: Lens' SourceSelectionCriteria (Maybe SseKmsEncryptedObjects)

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 replicates objects created with
--   server-side encryption using an Amazon Web Services KMS key stored in
--   Amazon Web Services Key Management Service.
sseKmsEncryptedObjects_status :: Lens' SseKmsEncryptedObjects SseKmsEncryptedObjectsStatus

-- | The total number of bytes of records payload data returned.
stats_bytesReturned :: Lens' Stats (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of object bytes scanned.
stats_bytesScanned :: Lens' Stats (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of uncompressed object bytes processed.
stats_bytesProcessed :: Lens' Stats (Maybe Integer)

-- | The Stats event details.
statsEvent_details :: Lens' StatsEvent (Maybe Stats)

-- | Specifies how data related to the storage class analysis for an Amazon
--   S3 bucket should be exported.
storageClassAnalysis_dataExport :: Lens' StorageClassAnalysis (Maybe StorageClassAnalysisDataExport)

-- | The version of the output schema to use when exporting data. Must be
--   <tt>V_1</tt>.
storageClassAnalysisDataExport_outputSchemaVersion :: Lens' StorageClassAnalysisDataExport StorageClassAnalysisSchemaVersion

-- | The place to store the data for an analysis.
storageClassAnalysisDataExport_destination :: Lens' StorageClassAnalysisDataExport AnalyticsExportDestination

-- | Name of the object key.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag ObjectKey

-- | Value of the tag.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | A collection for a set of tags
tagging_tagSet :: Lens' Tagging [Tag]

-- | Logging permissions assigned to the grantee for the bucket.
targetGrant_permission :: Lens' TargetGrant (Maybe BucketLogsPermission)

-- | Container for the person being granted permissions.
targetGrant_grantee :: Lens' TargetGrant (Maybe Grantee)

-- | The number of consecutive days of no access after which an object will
--   be eligible to be transitioned to the corresponding tier. The minimum
--   number of days specified for Archive Access tier must be at least 90
--   days and Deep Archive Access tier must be at least 180 days. The
--   maximum can be up to 2 years (730 days).
tiering_days :: Lens' Tiering Int

-- | S3 Intelligent-Tiering access tier. See <a>Storage class for
--   automatically optimizing frequently and infrequently accessed
--   objects</a> for a list of access tiers in the S3 Intelligent-Tiering
--   storage class.
tiering_accessTier :: Lens' Tiering IntelligentTieringAccessTier

-- | Undocumented member.
topicConfiguration_id :: Lens' TopicConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
topicConfiguration_filter :: Lens' TopicConfiguration (Maybe NotificationConfigurationFilter)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic to which Amazon
--   S3 publishes a message when it detects events of the specified type.
topicConfiguration_topicArn :: Lens' TopicConfiguration Text

-- | The Amazon S3 bucket event about which to send notifications. For more
--   information, see <a>Supported Event Types</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User
--   Guide</i>.
topicConfiguration_events :: Lens' TopicConfiguration [Event]

-- | Indicates the number of days after creation when objects are
--   transitioned to the specified storage class. The value must be a
--   positive integer.
transition_days :: Lens' Transition (Maybe Int)

-- | Indicates when objects are transitioned to the specified storage
--   class. The date value must be in ISO 8601 format. The time is always
--   midnight UTC.
transition_date :: Lens' Transition (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The storage class to which you want the object to transition.
transition_storageClass :: Lens' Transition (Maybe TransitionStorageClass)

-- | The versioning state of the bucket.
versioningConfiguration_status :: Lens' VersioningConfiguration (Maybe BucketVersioningStatus)

-- | Specifies whether MFA delete is enabled in the bucket versioning
--   configuration. This element is only returned if the bucket has been
--   configured with MFA delete. If the bucket has never been so
--   configured, this element is not returned.
versioningConfiguration_mfaDelete :: Lens' VersioningConfiguration (Maybe MFADelete)

-- | The redirect behavior for every request to this bucket's website
--   endpoint.
--   
--   If you specify this property, you can't specify any other property.
websiteConfiguration_redirectAllRequestsTo :: Lens' WebsiteConfiguration (Maybe RedirectAllRequestsTo)

-- | The name of the error document for the website.
websiteConfiguration_errorDocument :: Lens' WebsiteConfiguration (Maybe ErrorDocument)

-- | The name of the index document for the website.
websiteConfiguration_indexDocument :: Lens' WebsiteConfiguration (Maybe IndexDocument)

-- | Rules that define when a redirect is applied and the redirect
--   behavior.
websiteConfiguration_routingRules :: Lens' WebsiteConfiguration (Maybe [RoutingRule])


module Network.AWS.S3.Waiters

-- | Polls <a>HeadObject</a> every 5 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newObjectNotExists :: Wait HeadObject

-- | Polls <a>HeadBucket</a> every 5 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newBucketExists :: Wait HeadBucket

-- | Polls <a>HeadObject</a> every 5 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newObjectExists :: Wait HeadObject

-- | Polls <a>HeadBucket</a> every 5 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newBucketNotExists :: Wait HeadBucket


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2006-03-01</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Amazon Simple Storage Service is storage for the Internet. Amazon S3
--   has a simple web services interface that you can use to store and
--   retrieve any amount of data, at any time, from anywhere on the web. It
--   gives any developer access to the same highly scalable, reliable,
--   fast, inexpensive data storage infrastructure that Amazon uses to run
--   its own global network of web sites. The service aims to maximize
--   benefits of scale and to pass those benefits on to developers.
module Network.AWS.S3

-- | API version <tt>2006-03-01</tt> of the Amazon Simple Storage Service
--   SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The bucket you tried to create already exists, and you own it. Amazon
--   S3 returns this error in all Amazon Web Services Regions except in the
--   North Virginia Region. For legacy compatibility, if you re-create an
--   existing bucket that you already own in the North Virginia Region,
--   Amazon S3 returns 200 OK and resets the bucket access control lists
--   (ACLs).
_BucketAlreadyOwnedByYou :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | This action is not allowed against this storage tier.
_ObjectAlreadyInActiveTierError :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested bucket name is not available. The bucket namespace is
--   shared by all users of the system. Select a different name and try
--   again.
_BucketAlreadyExists :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The source object of the COPY action is not in the active tier and is
--   only stored in Amazon S3 Glacier.
_ObjectNotInActiveTierError :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified multipart upload does not exist.
_NoSuchUpload :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified bucket does not exist.
_NoSuchBucket :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified key does not exist.
_NoSuchKey :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Object is archived and inaccessible until restored.
_InvalidObjectState :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Polls <a>HeadObject</a> every 5 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newObjectNotExists :: Wait HeadObject

-- | Polls <a>HeadBucket</a> every 5 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newBucketExists :: Wait HeadBucket

-- | Polls <a>HeadObject</a> every 5 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newObjectExists :: Wait HeadObject

-- | Polls <a>HeadBucket</a> every 5 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 20 failed checks.
newBucketNotExists :: Wait HeadBucket

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutBucketRequestPayment</a> smart constructor.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutObject</a> smart constructor.
data PutObject
PutObject' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe ObjectLockMode -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> HashMap Text Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus -> Maybe ObjectCannedACL -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ObjectKey -> RequestBody -> PutObject

-- | Create a value of <a>PutObject</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentLength:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_contentLength</a> -
--   Size of the body in bytes. This parameter is useful when the size of
--   the body cannot be determined automatically. For more information, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.13</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectLockMode:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_objectLockMode</a>
--   - The Object Lock mode that you want to apply to this object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expires:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_expires</a> - The date
--   and time at which the object is no longer cacheable. For more
--   information, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.21</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantReadACP:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_grantReadACP</a> -
--   Allows grantee to read the object ACL.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObject_sSECustomerAlgorithm</a> - Specifies the algorithm to use
--   to when encrypting the object (for example, AES256).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKey:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_sSECustomerKey</a>
--   - Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use
--   in encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it
--   is discarded; Amazon S3 does not store the encryption key. The key
--   must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestPayer:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_requestPayer</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantWriteACP:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_grantWriteACP</a> -
--   Allows grantee to write the ACL for the applicable object.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObject_bucketKeyEnabled</a> - Specifies whether Amazon S3 should
--   use an S3 Bucket Key for object encryption with server-side encryption
--   using AWS KMS (SSE-KMS). Setting this header to <tt>true</tt> causes
--   Amazon S3 to use an S3 Bucket Key for object encryption with SSE-KMS.
--   
--   Specifying this header with a PUT action doesn’t affect bucket-level
--   settings for S3 Bucket Key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:websiteRedirectLocation:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObject_websiteRedirectLocation</a> - If the bucket is configured
--   as a website, redirects requests for this object to another object in
--   the same bucket or to an external URL. Amazon S3 stores the value of
--   this header in the object metadata. For information about object
--   metadata, see <a>Object Key and Metadata</a>.
--   
--   In the following example, the request header sets the redirect to an
--   object (anotherPage.html) in the same bucket:
--   
--   <pre>
--   x-amz-website-redirect-location: /anotherPage.html
--   </pre>
--   
--   In the following example, the request header sets the object redirect
--   to another website:
--   
--   <pre>
--   x-amz-website-redirect-location: http://www.example.com/
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information about website hosting in Amazon S3, see
--   <a>Hosting Websites on Amazon S3</a> and <a>How to Configure Website
--   Page Redirects</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantRead:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_grantRead</a> - Allows
--   grantee to read the object data and its metadata.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_storageClass</a> -
--   By default, Amazon S3 uses the STANDARD Storage Class to store newly
--   created objects. The STANDARD storage class provides high durability
--   and high availability. Depending on performance needs, you can specify
--   a different Storage Class. Amazon S3 on Outposts only uses the
--   OUTPOSTS Storage Class. For more information, see <a>Storage
--   Classes</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObject_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest
--   of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this
--   header for a message integrity check to ensure that the encryption key
--   was transmitted without error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSEKMSKeyId:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_sSEKMSKeyId</a> - If
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption</tt> is present and has the value of
--   <tt>aws:kms</tt>, this header specifies the ID of the Amazon Web
--   Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) symmetrical
--   customer managed key that was used for the object. If you specify
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption:aws:kms</tt>, but do not provide<tt>
--   x-amz-server-side-encryption-aws-kms-key-id</tt>, Amazon S3 uses the
--   Amazon Web Services managed key to protect the data. If the KMS key
--   does not exist in the same account issuing the command, you must use
--   the full ARN and not just the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantFullControl:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObject_grantFullControl</a> - Gives the grantee READ, READ_ACP,
--   and WRITE_ACP permissions on the object.
--   
--   This action is not supported by Amazon S3 on Outposts.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentEncoding:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObject_contentEncoding</a> - Specifies what content encodings
--   have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must
--   be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type
--   header field. For more information, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.11</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagging:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_tagging</a> - The tag-set
--   for the object. The tag-set must be encoded as URL Query parameters.
--   (For example, "Key1=Value1")
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentMD5:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_contentMD5</a> - The
--   base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the message (without the headers)
--   according to RFC 1864. This header can be used as a message integrity
--   check to verify that the data is the same data that was originally
--   sent. Although it is optional, we recommend using the Content-MD5
--   mechanism as an end-to-end integrity check. For more information about
--   REST request authentication, see <a>REST Authentication</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectLockRetainUntilDate:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObject_objectLockRetainUntilDate</a> - The date and time when
--   you want this object's Object Lock to expire. Must be formatted as a
--   timestamp parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadata:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_metadata</a> - A map of
--   metadata to store with the object in S3.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSEKMSEncryptionContext:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObject_sSEKMSEncryptionContext</a> - Specifies the Amazon Web
--   Services KMS Encryption Context to use for object encryption. The
--   value of this header is a base64-encoded UTF-8 string holding JSON

--   For more information, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.9</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentLanguage:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObject_contentLanguage</a> - The language the content is in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectLockLegalHoldStatus:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObject_objectLockLegalHoldStatus</a> - Specifies whether a legal

--   <a>putObject_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the expected
--   bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account, the
--   request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.

--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryption:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObject_serverSideEncryption</a> - The server-side encryption
--   algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3 (for example,

--

--   standard MIME type describing the format of the contents. For more
--   information, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.17</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_bucket</a> - The bucket
--   name to which the PUT action was initiated.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket

--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_key</a> - Object key for
--   which the PUT action was initiated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:PutObject'</a>, <a>putObject_body</a> - Object data.
newPutObject :: BucketName -> ObjectKey -> RequestBody -> PutObject

--   uploaded object uses an S3 Bucket Key for server-side encryption with
--   Amazon Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).

--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObjectResponse_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - If server-side encryption
--   with a customer-provided encryption key was requested, the response
--   will include this header to provide round-trip message integrity
--   verification of the customer-provided encryption key.

--   customer managed key that was used for the object.
--

--   <a>putObjectResponse_sSEKMSEncryptionContext</a> - If present,
--   specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS Encryption Context to use for
--   object encryption. The value of this header is a base64-encoded UTF-8
--   string holding JSON with the encryption context key-value pairs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryption:PutObject'</a>,
--   <a>putObjectResponse_serverSideEncryption</a> - If you specified
--   server-side encryption either with an Amazon Web Services KMS key or
--   Amazon S3-managed encryption key in your PUT request, the response
--   includes this header. It confirms the encryption algorithm that Amazon
--   S3 used to encrypt the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:PutObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putObjectResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
newPutObjectResponse :: Int -> PutObjectResponse

--   opaque value that Amazon S3 understands.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isTruncated:ListBucketInventoryConfigurationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listBucketInventoryConfigurationsResponse_isTruncated</a> - Tells
--   whether the returned list of inventory configurations is complete. A
--   value of true indicates that the list is not complete and the
--   NextContinuationToken is provided for a subsequent request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListBucketInventoryConfigurationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listBucketInventoryConfigurationsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.

--   the action returns up to 1,000 key names. The response might contain
--   fewer keys but will never contain more.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListObjectsV2Response</a> smart constructor.
data ListObjectsV2Response
ListObjectsV2Response' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Object] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [CommonPrefix] -> Maybe EncodingType -> Maybe BucketName -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Delimiter -> Int -> ListObjectsV2Response

-- | Create a value of <a>ListObjectsV2Response</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startAfter:ListObjectsV2'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_startAfter</a> - If StartAfter was sent with
--   the request, it is included in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyCount:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_keyCount</a> - KeyCount is the number of keys
--   returned with this request. KeyCount will always be less than or
--   equals to MaxKeys field. Say you ask for 50 keys, your result will
--   include less than equals 50 keys
--   
--   <a>$sel:contents:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_contents</a> - Metadata about each object
--   returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:continuationToken:ListObjectsV2'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_continuationToken</a> - If ContinuationToken
--   was sent with the request, it is included in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ListObjectsV2'</a>, <a>listObjectsV2Response_prefix</a>
--   - Keys that begin with the indicated prefix.
--   
--   <a>$sel:commonPrefixes:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_commonPrefixes</a> - All of the keys (up to
--   1,000) rolled up into a common prefix count as a single return when
--   calculating the number of returns.
--   
--   A response can contain <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> only if you specify a
--   delimiter.
--   
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> contains all (if there are any) keys between
--   <tt>Prefix</tt> and the next occurrence of the string specified by a
--   delimiter.
--   
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> lists keys that act like subdirectories in the
--   directory specified by <tt>Prefix</tt>.
--   
--   For example, if the prefix is <tt>notes/</tt> and the delimiter is a
--   slash (<tt>/</tt>) as in <tt>notes/summer/july</tt>, the common prefix
--   is <tt>notes/summer/</tt>. All of the keys that roll up into a common
--   prefix count as a single return when calculating the number of
--   returns.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encodingType:ListObjectsV2'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_encodingType</a> - Encoding type used by
--   Amazon S3 to encode object key names in the XML response.
--   
--   If you specify the encoding-type request parameter, Amazon S3 includes
--   this element in the response, and returns encoded key name values in
--   the following response elements:
--   
--   <tt>Delimiter, Prefix, Key,</tt> and <tt>StartAfter</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_name</a> - The bucket name.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextContinuationToken:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_nextContinuationToken</a> -
--   <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt> is sent when <tt>isTruncated</tt> is
--   true, which means there are more keys in the bucket that can be
--   listed. The next list requests to Amazon S3 can be continued with this
--   <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt>. <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt> is
--   obfuscated and is not a real key
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxKeys:ListObjectsV2'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_maxKeys</a> - Sets the maximum number of keys
--   returned in the response. By default the action returns up to 1,000
--   key names. The response might contain fewer keys but will never
--   contain more.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isTruncated:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_isTruncated</a> - Set to false if all of the
--   results were returned. Set to true if more keys are available to
--   return. If the number of results exceeds that specified by MaxKeys,
--   all of the results might not be returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:delimiter:ListObjectsV2'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_delimiter</a> - Causes keys that contain the
--   same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the
--   delimiter to be rolled up into a single result element in the
--   CommonPrefixes collection. These rolled-up keys are not returned
--   elsewhere in the response. Each rolled-up result counts as only one
--   return against the <tt>MaxKeys</tt> value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListObjectsV2Response'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsV2Response_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListObjectsV2Response :: Int -> ListObjectsV2Response

--   recovering it and must match the one used when storing the data. The
--   key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the

--   and 10,000. Effectively performs a 'ranged' GET request for the part
--   specified. Useful for downloading just a part of an object.

--   specified range bytes of an object. For more information about the
--   HTTP Range header, see
--   <a>https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35</a>.
--   
--   Amazon S3 doesn't support retrieving multiple ranges of data per
--   <tt>GET</tt> request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifUnmodifiedSince:GetObject'</a>,
--   <a>getObject_ifUnmodifiedSince</a> - Return the object only if it has

--   (precondition failed).

--   <a>getObject_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest
--   of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this
--   header for a message integrity check to ensure that the encryption key
--   was transmitted without error.

--

--   request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.

--   name containing the object.

--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket

--   When using an Object Lambda access point the hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-object-lambda.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.

--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.

--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:GetObject'</a>, <a>getObject_key</a> - Key of the object
--   to get.
newGetObject :: BucketName -> ObjectKey -> GetObject

--   mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the
--   Content-Type header field.
--

--   encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3 (for

-- | Create a value of <a>ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurationsResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--

--

--   <a>listBucketAnalyticsConfigurationsResponse_analyticsConfigurationList</a>

--   
--   <a>$sel:continuationToken:ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurations'</a>,
--   <a>listBucketAnalyticsConfigurationsResponse_continuationToken</a> -
--   The marker that is used as a starting point for this analytics
--   configuration list response. This value is present if it was sent in
--   the request.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextContinuationToken:ListBucketAnalyticsConfigurationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listBucketAnalyticsConfigurationsResponse_nextContinuationToken</a>
--   - <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt> is sent when <tt>isTruncated</tt> is
--   true, which indicates that there are more analytics configurations to
--   list. The next request must include this
--   <tt>NextContinuationToken</tt>. The token is obfuscated and is not a
--   usable value.

--   encryption algorithm used when storing this object in Amazon S3 (for
--   example, AES256, aws:kms).
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UploadPartResponse'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUploadPartResponse :: Int -> UploadPartResponse

-- | Request to filter the contents of an Amazon S3 object based on a
--   simple Structured Query Language (SQL) statement. In the request,
--   along with the SQL expression, you must specify a data serialization
--   format (JSON or CSV) of the object. Amazon S3 uses this to parse
--   object data into records. It returns only records that match the
--   specified SQL expression. You must also specify the data serialization
--   format for the response. For more information, see <a>S3Select API
--   Documentation</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSelectObjectContent</a> smart constructor.
data SelectObjectContent
SelectObjectContent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe RequestProgress -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ScanRange -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ObjectKey -> Text -> ExpressionType -> InputSerialization -> OutputSerialization -> SelectObjectContent

-- | Create a value of <a>SelectObjectContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   Encryption (Using Customer-Provided Encryption Keys</a>.

--   <a>selectObjectContent_scanRange</a> - Specifies the byte range of the
--   object to get the records from. A record is processed when its first
--   byte is contained by the range. This parameter is optional, but when
--   specified, it must not be empty. See RFC 2616, Section 14.35.1 about
--   how to specify the start and end of the range.
--   
--   <tt>ScanRange</tt>may be used in the following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   
--   <li><tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;start&gt;50&lt;/start&gt;&lt;end&gt;100&lt;/end&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   - process only the records starting between the bytes 50 and 100
--   (inclusive, counting from zero)</li>
--   
--   <li><tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;start&gt;50&lt;/start&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   - process only the records starting after the byte 50</li>
--   
--   <li><tt>&lt;scanrange&gt;&lt;end&gt;50&lt;/end&gt;&lt;/scanrange&gt;</tt>
--   - process only the records within the last 50 bytes of the file.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:SelectObjectContent'</a>,
--   <a>selectObjectContent_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the
--   expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account,
--   the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:SelectObjectContent'</a>,
--   <a>selectObjectContent_bucket</a> - The S3 bucket.

--   The object key.

--   query the object.
--

--   expression (for example, SQL).
--

-- | Create a value of <a>ListMultipartUploads</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--

--   <a>listMultipartUploads_keyMarker</a> - Together with
--   upload-id-marker, this parameter specifies the multipart upload after
--   which listing should begin.
--   
--   If <tt>upload-id-marker</tt> is not specified, only the keys
--   lexicographically greater than the specified <tt>key-marker</tt> will
--   be included in the list.
--   
--   If <tt>upload-id-marker</tt> is specified, any multipart uploads for a
--   key equal to the <tt>key-marker</tt> might also be included, provided
--   those multipart uploads have upload IDs lexicographically greater than
--   the specified <tt>upload-id-marker</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ListMultipartUploads'</a>,
--   <a>listMultipartUploads_prefix</a> - Lists in-progress uploads only
--   for those keys that begin with the specified prefix. You can use
--   prefixes to separate a bucket into different grouping of keys. (You
--   can think of using prefix to make groups in the same way you'd use a
--   folder in a file system.)
--   
--   <a>$sel:encodingType:ListMultipartUploads'</a>,
--   <a>listMultipartUploads_encodingType</a> - Undocumented member.
--
