--   <a>listMultipartUploads_uploadIdMarker</a> - Together with key-marker,
--   specifies the multipart upload after which listing should begin. If
--   key-marker is not specified, the upload-id-marker parameter is
--   ignored. Otherwise, any multipart uploads for a key equal to the
--   key-marker might be included in the list only if they have an upload
--   ID lexicographically greater than the specified
--   <tt>upload-id-marker</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxUploads:ListMultipartUploads'</a>,
--   <a>listMultipartUploads_maxUploads</a> - Sets the maximum number of
--   multipart uploads, from 1 to 1,000, to return in the response body.

--   response.

--   <a>$sel:delimiter:ListMultipartUploads'</a>,
--   <a>listMultipartUploads_delimiter</a> - Character you use to group
--   keys.
--   
--   All keys that contain the same string between the prefix, if
--   specified, and the first occurrence of the delimiter after the prefix
--   are grouped under a single result element, <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt>. If
--   you don't specify the prefix parameter, then the substring starts at
--   the beginning of the key. The keys that are grouped under
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> result element are not returned elsewhere in
--   the response.

--   multipart uploads that could have been included in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextKeyMarker:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listMultipartUploadsResponse_nextKeyMarker</a> - When a list is
--   truncated, this element specifies the value that should be used for
--   the key-marker request parameter in a subsequent request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploads:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listMultipartUploadsResponse_uploads</a> - Container for elements
--   related to a particular multipart upload. A response can contain zero
--   or more <tt>Upload</tt> elements.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isTruncated:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listMultipartUploadsResponse_isTruncated</a> - Indicates whether
--   the returned list of multipart uploads is truncated. A value of true
--   indicates that the list was truncated. The list can be truncated if
--   the number of multipart uploads exceeds the limit allowed or specified
--   by max uploads.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextUploadIdMarker:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listMultipartUploadsResponse_nextUploadIdMarker</a> - When a list
--   is truncated, this element specifies the value that should be used for
--   the <tt>upload-id-marker</tt> request parameter in a subsequent
--   request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:delimiter:ListMultipartUploads'</a>,
--   <a>listMultipartUploadsResponse_delimiter</a> - Contains the delimiter
--   you specified in the request. If you don't specify a delimiter in your
--   request, this element is absent from the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListMultipartUploadsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listMultipartUploadsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newListMultipartUploadsResponse :: Int -> ListMultipartUploadsResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListObjectsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListObjectsResponse
ListObjectsResponse' :: Maybe [Object] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [CommonPrefix] -> Maybe EncodingType -> Maybe BucketName -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Delimiter -> Int -> ListObjectsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ListObjectsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contents:ListObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_contents</a> - Metadata about each object
--   returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:ListObjects'</a>, <a>listObjectsResponse_prefix</a> -
--   Keys that begin with the indicated prefix.
--   
--   <a>$sel:commonPrefixes:ListObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_commonPrefixes</a> - All of the keys (up to
--   1,000) rolled up in a common prefix count as a single return when
--   calculating the number of returns.
--   
--   A response can contain CommonPrefixes only if you specify a delimiter.
--   
--   CommonPrefixes contains all (if there are any) keys between Prefix and
--   the next occurrence of the string specified by the delimiter.
--   
--   CommonPrefixes lists keys that act like subdirectories in the
--   directory specified by Prefix.
--   
--   For example, if the prefix is notes/ and the delimiter is a slash (/)
--   as in notes/summer/july, the common prefix is notes/summer/. All of
--   the keys that roll up into a common prefix count as a single return
--   when calculating the number of returns.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encodingType:ListObjects'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_encodingType</a> - Encoding type used by Amazon
--   S3 to encode object keys in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ListObjectsResponse'</a>, <a>listObjectsResponse_name</a>
--   - The bucket name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:ListObjects'</a>, <a>listObjectsResponse_marker</a> -
--   Indicates where in the bucket listing begins. Marker is included in
--   the response if it was sent with the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextMarker:ListObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_nextMarker</a> - When response is truncated
--   (the IsTruncated element value in the response is true), you can use
--   the key name in this field as marker in the subsequent request to get
--   next set of objects. Amazon S3 lists objects in alphabetical order
--   Note: This element is returned only if you have delimiter request
--   parameter specified. If response does not include the NextMarker and
--   it is truncated, you can use the value of the last Key in the response
--   as the marker in the subsequent request to get the next set of object
--   keys.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxKeys:ListObjects'</a>, <a>listObjectsResponse_maxKeys</a> -
--   The maximum number of keys returned in the response body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isTruncated:ListObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_isTruncated</a> - A flag that indicates whether
--   Amazon S3 returned all of the results that satisfied the search
--   criteria.
--   
--   <a>$sel:delimiter:ListObjects'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_delimiter</a> - Causes keys that contain the
--   same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the
--   delimiter to be rolled up into a single result element in the
--   <tt>CommonPrefixes</tt> collection. These rolled-up keys are not
--   returned elsewhere in the response. Each rolled-up result counts as
--   only one return against the <tt>MaxKeys</tt> value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListObjectsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listObjectsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.

data HeadObject
HeadObject' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe RequestPayer -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> ObjectKey -> HeadObject

-- | Create a value of <a>HeadObject</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifMatch:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_ifMatch</a> - Return
--   the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one
--   specified, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_versionId</a> -
--   VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObject_sSECustomerAlgorithm</a> - Specifies the algorithm to
--   use to when encrypting the object (for example, AES256).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKey:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObject_sSECustomerKey</a> - Specifies the customer-provided
--   encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is
--   used to store the object and then it is discarded; Amazon S3 does not
--   store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the
--   algorithm specified in the
--   <tt>x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm</tt> header.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestPayer:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_requestPayer</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifModifiedSince:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObject_ifModifiedSince</a> - Return the object only if it has
--   been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 304 (not
--   modified).
--   
--   <a>$sel:partNumber:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_partNumber</a> -
--   Part number of the object being read. This is a positive integer
--   between 1 and 10,000. Effectively performs a 'ranged' HEAD request for
--   the part specified. Useful querying about the size of the part and the
--   number of parts in this object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:range:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_range</a> - Downloads the
--   specified range bytes of an object. For more information about the
--   HTTP Range header, see
--   <a>http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35</a>.
--   
--   Amazon S3 doesn't support retrieving multiple ranges of data per
--   <tt>GET</tt> request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifUnmodifiedSince:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObject_ifUnmodifiedSince</a> - Return the object only if it has
--   not been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 412
--   (precondition failed).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObject_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest
--   of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this
--   header for a message integrity check to ensure that the encryption key
--   was transmitted without error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ifNoneMatch:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_ifNoneMatch</a> -
--   Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is different from the
--   one specified, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObject_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the expected
--   bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account, the
--   request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_bucket</a> - The name of
--   the bucket containing the object.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObject_key</a> - The object key.
newHeadObject :: BucketName -> ObjectKey -> HeadObject

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newHeadObjectResponse</a> smart constructor.
data HeadObjectResponse
HeadObjectResponse' :: Maybe RequestCharged -> Maybe Int -> Maybe ETag -> Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe ObjectLockMode -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ArchiveStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> HashMap Text Text -> Maybe ReplicationStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe ObjectLockLegalHoldStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryption -> Maybe Text -> Int -> HeadObjectResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>HeadObjectResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestCharged:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_requestCharged</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partsCount:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_partsCount</a> - The count of parts this object
--   has.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eTag:HeadObjectResponse'</a>, <a>headObjectResponse_eTag</a> -
--   An ETag is an opaque identifier assigned by a web server to a specific
--   version of a resource found at a URL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:HeadObject'</a>, <a>headObjectResponse_versionId</a>
--   - Version of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentLength:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_contentLength</a> - Size of the body in bytes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectLockMode:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_objectLockMode</a> - The Object Lock mode, if
--   any, that's in effect for this object. This header is only returned if
--   the requester has the <tt>s3:GetObjectRetention</tt> permission. For
--   more information about S3 Object Lock, see <a>Object Lock</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expires:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_expires</a> - The date and time at which the
--   object is no longer cacheable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:restore:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_restore</a> - If the object is an archived
--   object (an object whose storage class is GLACIER), the response
--   includes this header if either the archive restoration is in progress
--   (see <a>RestoreObject</a> or an archive copy is already restored.
--   
--   If an archive copy is already restored, the header value indicates
--   when Amazon S3 is scheduled to delete the object copy. For example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   x-amz-restore: ongoing-request="false", expiry-date="Fri, 21 Dec 2012 00:00:00 GMT"
--   </pre>
--   
--   If the object restoration is in progress, the header returns the value
--   <tt>ongoing-request="true"</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about archiving objects, see <a>Transitioning
--   Objects: General Considerations</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiration:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_expiration</a> - If the object expiration is
--   configured (see PUT Bucket lifecycle), the response includes this
--   header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id key-value pairs
--   providing object expiration information. The value of the rule-id is
--   URL encoded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteMarker:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_deleteMarker</a> - Specifies whether the object
--   retrieved was (true) or was not (false) a Delete Marker. If false,
--   this response header does not appear in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveStatus:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_archiveStatus</a> - The archive state of the
--   head object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerAlgorithm:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_sSECustomerAlgorithm</a> - If server-side
--   encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was requested, the
--   response will include this header confirming the encryption algorithm
--   used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingMeta:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_missingMeta</a> - This is set to the number of
--   metadata entries not returned in <tt>x-amz-meta</tt> headers. This can
--   happen if you create metadata using an API like SOAP that supports
--   more flexible metadata than the REST API. For example, using SOAP, you
--   can create metadata whose values are not legal HTTP headers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_bucketKeyEnabled</a> - Indicates whether the
--   object uses an S3 Bucket Key for server-side encryption with Amazon
--   Web Services KMS (SSE-KMS).
--   
--   <a>$sel:websiteRedirectLocation:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_websiteRedirectLocation</a> - If the bucket is
--   configured as a website, redirects requests for this object to another
--   object in the same bucket or to an external URL. Amazon S3 stores the
--   value of this header in the object metadata.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptRanges:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_acceptRanges</a> - Indicates that a range of
--   bytes was specified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_storageClass</a> - Provides storage class
--   information of the object. Amazon S3 returns this header for all
--   objects except for S3 Standard storage class objects.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Storage Classes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:HeadObject'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - If server-side
--   encryption with a customer-provided encryption key was requested, the
--   response will include this header to provide round-trip message
--   integrity verification of the customer-provided encryption key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSEKMSKeyId:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_sSEKMSKeyId</a> - If present, specifies the ID
--   of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services
--   KMS) symmetric customer managed key that was used for the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentEncoding:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_contentEncoding</a> - Specifies what content
--   encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding
--   mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the
--   Content-Type header field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectLockRetainUntilDate:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_objectLockRetainUntilDate</a> - The date and
--   time when the Object Lock retention period expires. This header is
--   only returned if the requester has the <tt>s3:GetObjectRetention</tt>
--   permission.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadata:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_metadata</a> - A map of metadata to store with
--   the object in S3.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationStatus:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_replicationStatus</a> - Amazon S3 can return
--   this header if your request involves a bucket that is either a source
--   or a destination in a replication rule.
--   
--   In replication, you have a source bucket on which you configure
--   replication and destination bucket or buckets where Amazon S3 stores
--   object replicas. When you request an object (<tt>GetObject</tt>) or
--   object metadata (<tt>HeadObject</tt>) from these buckets, Amazon S3
--   will return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header in the
--   response as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If requesting an object from the source bucket — Amazon S3 will
--   return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header if the object in
--   your request is eligible for replication.For example, suppose that in
--   your replication configuration, you specify object prefix
--   <tt>TaxDocs</tt> requesting Amazon S3 to replicate objects with key
--   prefix <tt>TaxDocs</tt>. Any objects you upload with this key name
--   prefix, for example <tt>TaxDocs/document1.pdf</tt>, are eligible for
--   replication. For any object request with this key name prefix, Amazon
--   S3 will return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header with value
--   PENDING, COMPLETED or FAILED indicating object replication
--   status.</li>
--   <li>If requesting an object from a destination bucket — Amazon S3 will
--   return the <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header with value REPLICA
--   if the object in your request is a replica that Amazon S3 created and
--   there is no replica modification replication in progress.</li>
--   <li>When replicating objects to multiple destination buckets the
--   <tt>x-amz-replication-status</tt> header acts differently. The header
--   of the source object will only return a value of COMPLETED when
--   replication is successful to all destinations. The header will remain
--   at value PENDING until replication has completed for all destinations.
--   If one or more destinations fails replication the header will return
--   FAILED.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Replication</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cacheControl:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_cacheControl</a> - Specifies caching behavior
--   along the request/reply chain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentLanguage:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_contentLanguage</a> - The language the content
--   is in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModified:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_lastModified</a> - Creation date of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectLockLegalHoldStatus:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_objectLockLegalHoldStatus</a> - Specifies
--   whether a legal hold is in effect for this object. This header is only
--   returned if the requester has the <tt>s3:GetObjectLegalHold</tt>
--   permission. This header is not returned if the specified version of
--   this object has never had a legal hold applied. For more information
--   about S3 Object Lock, see <a>Object Lock</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentDisposition:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_contentDisposition</a> - Specifies
--   presentational information for the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryption:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_serverSideEncryption</a> - If the object is
--   stored using server-side encryption either with an Amazon Web Services
--   KMS key or an Amazon S3-managed encryption key, the response includes
--   this header with the value of the server-side encryption algorithm
--   used when storing this object in Amazon S3 (for example, AES256,
--   aws:kms).
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentType:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_contentType</a> - A standard MIME type
--   describing the format of the object data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:HeadObjectResponse'</a>,
--   <a>headObjectResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newHeadObjectResponse :: Int -> HeadObjectResponse

--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketKeyEnabled:CopyObject'</a>,
--   <a>copyObject_bucketKeyEnabled</a> - Specifies whether Amazon S3
--   should use an S3 Bucket Key for object encryption with server-side
--   encryption using AWS KMS (SSE-KMS). Setting this header to
--   <tt>true</tt> causes Amazon S3 to use an S3 Bucket Key for object
--   encryption with SSE-KMS.
--   
--   Specifying this header with a COPY action doesn’t affect bucket-level
--   settings for S3 Bucket Key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:websiteRedirectLocation:CopyObject'</a>,

--   expected source bucket owner. If the source bucket is owned by a
--   different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access
--   Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:CopyObject'</a>, <a>copyObject_storageClass</a> -
--   By default, Amazon S3 uses the STANDARD Storage Class to store newly
--   created objects. The STANDARD storage class provides high durability
--   and high availability. Depending on performance needs, you can specify
--   a different Storage Class. Amazon S3 on Outposts only uses the
--   OUTPOSTS Storage Class. For more information, see <a>Storage
--   Classes</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSECustomerKeyMD5:CopyObject'</a>,
--   <a>copyObject_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest
--   of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this
--   header for a message integrity check to ensure that the encryption key
--   was transmitted without error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSEKMSKeyId:CopyObject'</a>, <a>copyObject_sSEKMSKeyId</a> -
--   Specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS key ID to use for object
--   encryption. All GET and PUT requests for an object protected by Amazon
--   Web Services KMS will fail if not made via SSL or using SigV4. For
--   information about configuring using any of the officially supported
--   Amazon Web Services SDKs and Amazon Web Services CLI, see
--   <a>Specifying the Signature Version in Request Authentication</a> in

--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:CopyObject'</a>,

--   different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access

--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryption:CopyObject'</a>,

--   AES256, aws:kms).
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentType:CopyObject'</a>, <a>copyObject_contentType</a> - A
--   standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:CopyObject'</a>, <a>copyObject_bucket</a> - The name of
--   the destination bucket.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copySource:CopyObject'</a>, <a>copyObject_copySource</a> -
--   Specifies the source object for the copy operation. You specify the
--   value in one of two formats, depending on whether you want to access
--   the source object through an <a>access point</a>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For objects not accessed through an access point, specify the name
--   of the source bucket and the key of the source object, separated by a
--   slash (/). For example, to copy the object
--   <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> from the bucket
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket</tt>, use
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf</tt>. The value must be URL
--   encoded.</li>
--   <li>For objects accessed through access points, specify the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the object as accessed through the access
--   point, in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:accesspoint/&lt;access-point-name&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   access point <tt>my-access-point</tt> owned by account
--   <tt>123456789012</tt> in Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL
--   encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:us-west-2:123456789012:accesspoint/my-access-point/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.Amazon S3 supports copy operations using
--   access points only when the source and destination buckets are in the
--   same Amazon Web Services Region.Alternatively, for objects accessed
--   through Amazon S3 on Outposts, specify the ARN of the object as
--   accessed in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:outpost/&lt;outpost-id&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   outpost <tt>my-outpost</tt> owned by account <tt>123456789012</tt> in
--   Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:us-west-2:123456789012:outpost/my-outpost/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To copy a specific version of an object, append
--   <tt>?versionId=&lt;version-id&gt;</tt> to the value (for example,
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf?versionId=QUpfdndhfd8438MNFDN93jdnJFkdmqnh893</tt>).
--   If you don't specify a version ID, Amazon S3 copies the latest version
--   of the source object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:CopyObject'</a>, <a>copyObject_key</a> - The key of the
--   destination object.
newCopyObject :: BucketName -> Text -> ObjectKey -> CopyObject

--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:GetObjectTagging'</a>, <a>getObjectTagging_key</a> -
--   Object key for which to get the tagging information.
newGetObjectTagging :: BucketName -> ObjectKey -> GetObjectTagging

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   it has been modified since the specified time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copySourceIfUnmodifiedSince:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_copySourceIfUnmodifiedSince</a> - Copies the object
--   if it hasn't been modified since the specified time.
--

--   <a>uploadPartCopy_copySourceRange</a> - The range of bytes to copy
--   from the source object. The range value must use the form
--   bytes=first-last, where the first and last are the zero-based byte
--   offsets to copy. For example, bytes=0-9 indicates that you want to
--   copy the first 10 bytes of the source. You can copy a range only if
--   the source object is greater than 5 MB.

--   used to store the object and then it is discarded; Amazon S3 does not
--   store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the
--   algorithm specified in the

--   must be the same encryption key specified in the initiate multipart

--   different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access
--   Denied)</tt> error.
--

--   <a>uploadPartCopy_sSECustomerKeyMD5</a> - Specifies the 128-bit MD5

--   source object. The encryption key provided in this header must be one
--   that was used when the source object was created.

--   <a>uploadPartCopy_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the
--   expected destination bucket owner. If the destination bucket is owned
--   by a different account, the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403
--   (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:UploadPartCopy'</a>, <a>uploadPartCopy_bucket</a> - The
--   bucket name.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:copySource:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_copySource</a> - Specifies the source object for the
--   copy operation. You specify the value in one of two formats, depending
--   on whether you want to access the source object through an <a>access
--   point</a>:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For objects not accessed through an access point, specify the name
--   of the source bucket and key of the source object, separated by a
--   slash (/). For example, to copy the object
--   <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> from the bucket
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket</tt>, use
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf</tt>. The value must be URL
--   encoded.</li>
--   <li>For objects accessed through access points, specify the Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the object as accessed through the access
--   point, in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:accesspoint/&lt;access-point-name&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   access point <tt>my-access-point</tt> owned by account
--   <tt>123456789012</tt> in Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL
--   encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:us-west-2:123456789012:accesspoint/my-access-point/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.Amazon S3 supports copy operations using
--   access points only when the source and destination buckets are in the
--   same Amazon Web Services Region.Alternatively, for objects accessed
--   through Amazon S3 on Outposts, specify the ARN of the object as
--   accessed in the format
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:&lt;Region&gt;:&lt;account-id&gt;:outpost/&lt;outpost-id&gt;/object/&lt;key&gt;</tt>.
--   For example, to copy the object <tt>reports/january.pdf</tt> through
--   outpost <tt>my-outpost</tt> owned by account <tt>123456789012</tt> in
--   Region <tt>us-west-2</tt>, use the URL encoding of
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3-outposts:us-west-2:123456789012:outpost/my-outpost/object/reports/january.pdf</tt>.
--   The value must be URL encoded.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To copy a specific version of an object, append
--   <tt>?versionId=&lt;version-id&gt;</tt> to the value (for example,
--   <tt>awsexamplebucket/reports/january.pdf?versionId=QUpfdndhfd8438MNFDN93jdnJFkdmqnh893</tt>).
--   If you don't specify a version ID, Amazon S3 copies the latest version
--   of the source object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:UploadPartCopy'</a>, <a>uploadPartCopy_key</a> - Object
--   key for which the multipart upload was initiated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partNumber:UploadPartCopy'</a>,
--   <a>uploadPartCopy_partNumber</a> - Part number of part being copied.
--   This is a positive integer between 1 and 10,000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadId:UploadPartCopy'</a>, <a>uploadPartCopy_uploadId</a> -
--   Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose part is being copied.
newUploadPartCopy :: BucketName -> Text -> ObjectKey -> Int -> Text -> UploadPartCopy

-- | Create a value of <a>PutObjectTagging</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:PutObjectTagging'</a>,

--   the tag-set will be added to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestPayer:PutObjectTagging'</a>,
--   <a>putObjectTagging_requestPayer</a> - Undocumented member.

--   body.
--   
--   For requests made using the Amazon Web Services Command Line Interface
--   (CLI) or Amazon Web Services SDKs, this field is calculated
--   automatically.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:PutObjectTagging'</a>,
--   <a>putObjectTagging_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the
--   expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account,
--   the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:PutObjectTagging'</a>, <a>putObjectTagging_bucket</a> -
--   The bucket name containing the object.
--   
--   When using this action with an access point, you must direct requests
--   to the access point hostname. The access point hostname takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.s3-accesspoint.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action with an access point through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the access point ARN in place of the bucket
--   name. For more information about access point ARNs, see <a>Using
--   access points</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   When using this action with Amazon S3 on Outposts, you must direct
--   requests to the S3 on Outposts hostname. The S3 on Outposts hostname
--   takes the form
--   <i>AccessPointName</i>-<i>AccountId</i>.<i>outpostID</i>.s3-outposts.<i>Region</i>.amazonaws.com.
--   When using this action using S3 on Outposts through the Amazon Web
--   Services SDKs, you provide the Outposts bucket ARN in place of the
--   bucket name. For more information about S3 on Outposts ARNs, see
--   <a>Using S3 on Outposts</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:PutObjectTagging'</a>, <a>putObjectTagging_key</a> - Name
--   of the object key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagging:PutObjectTagging'</a>, <a>putObjectTagging_tagging</a>
--   - Container for the <tt>TagSet</tt> and <tt>Tag</tt> elements
newPutObjectTagging :: BucketName -> ObjectKey -> Tagging -> PutObjectTagging

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutObjectTaggingResponse</a> smart constructor.
data PutObjectTaggingResponse
PutObjectTaggingResponse' :: Maybe ObjectVersionId -> Int -> PutObjectTaggingResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>PutObjectTaggingResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:PutObjectTagging'</a>,
--   <a>putObjectTaggingResponse_versionId</a> - The versionId of the
--   object the tag-set was added to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:PutObjectTaggingResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putObjectTaggingResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newPutObjectTaggingResponse :: Int -> PutObjectTaggingResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutBucketAcl</a> smart constructor.
data PutBucketAcl
PutBucketAcl' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AccessControlPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BucketCannedACL -> Maybe Text -> BucketName -> PutBucketAcl

-- | Create a value of <a>PutBucketAcl</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantReadACP:PutBucketAcl'</a>,
--   <a>putBucketAcl_grantReadACP</a> - Allows grantee to read the bucket
--   ACL.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantWriteACP:PutBucketAcl'</a>,
--   <a>putBucketAcl_grantWriteACP</a> - Allows grantee to write the ACL
--   for the applicable bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantRead:PutBucketAcl'</a>, <a>putBucketAcl_grantRead</a> -
--   Allows grantee to list the objects in the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantFullControl:PutBucketAcl'</a>,
--   <a>putBucketAcl_grantFullControl</a> - Allows grantee the read, write,
--   read ACP, and write ACP permissions on the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentMD5:PutBucketAcl'</a>, <a>putBucketAcl_contentMD5</a> -
--   The base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the data. This header must be
--   used as a message integrity check to verify that the request body was
--   not corrupted in transit. For more information, go to <a>RFC 1864.</a>
--   
--   For requests made using the Amazon Web Services Command Line Interface
--   (CLI) or Amazon Web Services SDKs, this field is calculated
--   automatically.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessControlPolicy:PutBucketAcl'</a>,
--   <a>putBucketAcl_accessControlPolicy</a> - Contains the elements that
--   set the ACL permissions for an object per grantee.
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantWrite:PutBucketAcl'</a>, <a>putBucketAcl_grantWrite</a> -
--   Allows grantee to create new objects in the bucket.
--   
--   For the bucket and object owners of existing objects, also allows
--   deletions and overwrites of those objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acl:PutBucketAcl'</a>, <a>putBucketAcl_acl</a> - The canned
--   ACL to apply to the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expectedBucketOwner:PutBucketAcl'</a>,
--   <a>putBucketAcl_expectedBucketOwner</a> - The account ID of the
--   expected bucket owner. If the bucket is owned by a different account,
--   the request will fail with an HTTP <tt>403 (Access Denied)</tt> error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:PutBucketAcl'</a>, <a>putBucketAcl_bucket</a> - The
--   bucket to which to apply the ACL.
newPutBucketAcl :: BucketName -> PutBucketAcl

--   parameter to request that Amazon S3 encode the keys in the response.

-- | The container element for object ownership for a bucket's ownership

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates in
--   any combination, and an object must match all of the predicates for
--   the filter to apply.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnalyticsAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data AnalyticsAndOperator
AnalyticsAndOperator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> AnalyticsAndOperator

-- | Create a value of <a>AnalyticsAndOperator</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:AnalyticsAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsAndOperator_prefix</a> - The prefix to use when evaluating
--   an AND predicate: The prefix that an object must have to be included
--   in the metrics results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:AnalyticsAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsAndOperator_tags</a> - The list of tags to use when
--   evaluating an AND predicate.
newAnalyticsAndOperator :: AnalyticsAndOperator

-- | Specifies the configuration and any analyses for the analytics filter
--   of an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnalyticsConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data AnalyticsConfiguration
AnalyticsConfiguration' :: Maybe AnalyticsFilter -> Text -> StorageClassAnalysis -> AnalyticsConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>AnalyticsConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':AnalyticsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsConfiguration_filter</a> - The filter used to describe a
--   set of objects for analyses. A filter must have exactly one prefix,
--   one tag, or one conjunction (AnalyticsAndOperator). If no filter is
--   provided, all objects will be considered in any analysis.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:AnalyticsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsConfiguration_id</a> - The ID that identifies the
--   analytics configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClassAnalysis:AnalyticsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>analyticsConfiguration_storageClassAnalysis</a> - Contains data
--   related to access patterns to be collected and made available to
--   analyze the tradeoffs between different storage classes.
newAnalyticsConfiguration :: Text -> StorageClassAnalysis -> AnalyticsConfiguration

--   signifying output to an S3 bucket.
newAnalyticsExportDestination :: AnalyticsS3BucketDestination -> AnalyticsExportDestination

-- | The filter used to describe a set of objects for analyses. A filter
--   must have exactly one prefix, one tag, or one conjunction
--   (AnalyticsAndOperator). If no filter is provided, all objects will be
--   considered in any analysis.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnalyticsFilter</a> smart constructor.

--   The prefix to use when evaluating an analytics filter.

--   conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   an analytics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates.
newAnalyticsFilter :: AnalyticsFilter

--   owner is not validated before exporting data.

-- | In terms of implementation, a Bucket is a resource. An Amazon S3

newBucket :: UTCTime -> BucketName -> Bucket

data CORSRule

-- | Create a value of <a>CORSRule</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:maxAgeSeconds:CORSRule'</a>, <a>cORSRule_maxAgeSeconds</a> -
--   The time in seconds that your browser is to cache the preflight
--   response for the specified resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedHeaders:CORSRule'</a>, <a>cORSRule_allowedHeaders</a> -
--   Headers that are specified in the
--   <tt>Access-Control-Request-Headers</tt> header. These headers are
--   allowed in a preflight OPTIONS request. In response to any preflight
--   OPTIONS request, Amazon S3 returns any requested headers that are
--   allowed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exposeHeaders:CORSRule'</a>, <a>cORSRule_exposeHeaders</a> -
--   One or more headers in the response that you want customers to be able
--   to access from their applications (for example, from a JavaScript
--   <tt>XMLHttpRequest</tt> object).
--

--   the rule. The value cannot be longer than 255 characters.

--   <tt>GET</tt>, <tt>PUT</tt>, <tt>HEAD</tt>, <tt>POST</tt>, and
--   <tt>DELETE</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedOrigins:CORSRule'</a>, <a>cORSRule_allowedOrigins</a> -
--   One or more origins you want customers to be able to access the bucket
--   from.
newCORSRule :: CORSRule

-- | Describes how an uncompressed comma-separated values (CSV)-formatted
--   input object is formatted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCSVInput</a> smart constructor.
data CSVInput
CSVInput' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe FileHeaderInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CSVInput

-- | Create a value of <a>CSVInput</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteCharacter:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_quoteCharacter</a> -
--   A single character used for escaping when the field delimiter is part
--   of the value. For example, if the value is <tt>a, b</tt>, Amazon S3
--   wraps this field value in quotation marks, as follows: <tt>" a , b
--   "</tt>.
--   
--   Type: String
--   
--   Default: <tt>"</tt>
--   
--   Ancestors: <tt>CSV</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordDelimiter:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_recordDelimiter</a>
--   - A single character used to separate individual records in the input.
--   Instead of the default value, you can specify an arbitrary delimiter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowQuotedRecordDelimiter:CSVInput'</a>,
--   <a>cSVInput_allowQuotedRecordDelimiter</a> - Specifies that CSV field
--   values may contain quoted record delimiters and such records should be
--   allowed. Default value is FALSE. Setting this value to TRUE may lower
--   performance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileHeaderInfo:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_fileHeaderInfo</a> -
--   Describes the first line of input. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>NONE</tt>: First line is not a header.</li>
--   <li><tt>IGNORE</tt>: First line is a header, but you can't use the
--   header values to indicate the column in an expression. You can use
--   column position (such as _1, _2, …) to indicate the column (<tt>SELECT
--   s._1 FROM OBJECT s</tt>).</li>
--   <li><tt>Use</tt>: First line is a header, and you can use the header
--   value to identify a column in an expression (<tt>SELECT "name" FROM
--   OBJECT</tt>).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteEscapeCharacter:CSVInput'</a>,
--   <a>cSVInput_quoteEscapeCharacter</a> - A single character used for
--   escaping the quotation mark character inside an already escaped value.
--   For example, the value """ a , b """ is parsed as " a , b ".
--   
--   <a>$sel:comments:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_comments</a> - A single
--   character used to indicate that a row should be ignored when the
--   character is present at the start of that row. You can specify any
--   character to indicate a comment line.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fieldDelimiter:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_fieldDelimiter</a> -
--   A single character used to separate individual fields in a record. You
--   can specify an arbitrary delimiter.
newCSVInput :: CSVInput

-- | Describes how uncompressed comma-separated values (CSV)-formatted
--   results are formatted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCSVOutput</a> smart constructor.
data CSVOutput
CSVOutput' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe QuoteFields -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CSVOutput

-- | Create a value of <a>CSVOutput</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteCharacter:CSVOutput'</a>, <a>cSVOutput_quoteCharacter</a>
--   - A single character used for escaping when the field delimiter is
--   part of the value. For example, if the value is <tt>a, b</tt>, Amazon
--   S3 wraps this field value in quotation marks, as follows: <tt>" a , b
--   "</tt>.

--   Indicates whether to use quotation marks around output fields.
--

--   fields.</li>

--   - The value used to separate individual fields in a record. You can
--   specify an arbitrary delimiter.
newCSVOutput :: CSVOutput

-- | Container for all (if there are any) keys between Prefix and the next

--   lists keys that act like subdirectories in the directory specified by

-- | A container for describing a condition that must be met for the
--   specified redirect to apply. For example, 1. If request is for pages
--   in the <tt>/docs</tt> folder, redirect to the <tt>/documents</tt>
--   folder. 2. If request results in HTTP error 4xx, redirect request to
--   another host where you might process the error.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCondition</a> smart constructor.
data Condition
Condition' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Condition

-- | Create a value of <a>Condition</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyPrefixEquals:Condition'</a>,
--   <a>condition_keyPrefixEquals</a> - The object key name prefix when the
--   redirect is applied. For example, to redirect requests for
--   <tt>ExamplePage.html</tt>, the key prefix will be
--   <tt>ExamplePage.html</tt>. To redirect request for all pages with the
--   prefix <tt>docs/</tt>, the key prefix will be <tt>/docs</tt>, which
--   identifies all objects in the <tt>docs/</tt> folder. Required when the
--   parent element <tt>Condition</tt> is specified and sibling
--   <tt>HttpErrorCodeReturnedEquals</tt> is not specified. If both
--   conditions are specified, both must be true for the redirect to be
--   applied.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpErrorCodeReturnedEquals:Condition'</a>,
--   <a>condition_httpErrorCodeReturnedEquals</a> - The HTTP error code
--   when the redirect is applied. In the event of an error, if the error
--   code equals this value, then the specified redirect is applied.
--   Required when parent element <tt>Condition</tt> is specified and
--   sibling <tt>KeyPrefixEquals</tt> is not specified. If both are
--   specified, then both must be true for the redirect to be applied.
newCondition :: Condition

-- | The container element for specifying the default Object Lock retention
--   settings for new objects placed in the specified bucket.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The <tt>DefaultRetention</tt> settings require both a mode and a
--   period.</li>
--   <li>The <tt>DefaultRetention</tt> period can be either <tt>Days</tt>
--   or <tt>Years</tt> but you must select one. You cannot specify
--   <tt>Days</tt> and <tt>Years</tt> at the same time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDefaultRetention</a> smart constructor.
data DefaultRetention
DefaultRetention' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe ObjectLockRetentionMode -> Maybe Int -> DefaultRetention

-- | Create a value of <a>DefaultRetention</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:days:DefaultRetention'</a>, <a>defaultRetention_days</a> - The
--   number of days that you want to specify for the default retention
--   period. Must be used with <tt>Mode</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mode:DefaultRetention'</a>, <a>defaultRetention_mode</a> - The
--   default Object Lock retention mode you want to apply to new objects
--   placed in the specified bucket. Must be used with either <tt>Days</tt>
--   or <tt>Years</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:years:DefaultRetention'</a>, <a>defaultRetention_years</a> -
--   The number of years that you want to specify for the default retention
--   period. Must be used with <tt>Mode</tt>.
newDefaultRetention :: DefaultRetention

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionId:DeleteMarkerEntry'</a>,
--   <a>deleteMarkerEntry_versionId</a> - Version ID of an object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isLatest:DeleteMarkerEntry'</a>,
--   <a>deleteMarkerEntry_isLatest</a> - Specifies whether the object is
--   (true) or is not (false) the latest version of an object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:DeleteMarkerEntry'</a>, <a>deleteMarkerEntry_owner</a> -
--   The account that created the delete marker.&gt;
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:DeleteMarkerEntry'</a>, <a>deleteMarkerEntry_key</a> - The
--   object key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModified:DeleteMarkerEntry'</a>,
--   <a>deleteMarkerEntry_lastModified</a> - Date and time the object was
--   last modified.
newDeleteMarkerEntry :: DeleteMarkerEntry

-- | Specifies whether Amazon S3 replicates delete markers. If you specify
--   a <tt>Filter</tt> in your replication configuration, you must also
--   include a <tt>DeleteMarkerReplication</tt> element. If your
--   <tt>Filter</tt> includes a <tt>Tag</tt> element, the
--   <tt>DeleteMarkerReplication</tt> <tt>Status</tt> must be set to
--   Disabled, because Amazon S3 does not support replicating delete
--   markers for tag-based rules. For an example configuration, see
--   <a>Basic Rule Configuration</a>.
--   
--   For more information about delete marker replication, see <a>Basic
--   Rule Configuration</a>.
--   
--   If you are using an earlier version of the replication configuration,
--   Amazon S3 handles replication of delete markers differently. For more
--   information, see <a>Backward Compatibility</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteMarkerReplication</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteMarkerReplication
DeleteMarkerReplication' :: Maybe DeleteMarkerReplicationStatus -> DeleteMarkerReplication

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteMarkerReplication</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DeleteMarkerReplication'</a>,
--   <a>deleteMarkerReplication_status</a> - Indicates whether to replicate
--   delete markers.
--   
--   Indicates whether to replicate delete markers.
newDeleteMarkerReplication :: DeleteMarkerReplication

--   <a>deletedObject_deleteMarker</a> - Specifies whether the versioned
--   object that was permanently deleted was (true) or was not (false) a
--   delete marker. In a simple DELETE, this header indicates whether
--   (true) or not (false) a delete marker was created.

--   the version ID of the object version deleted.

newDeletedObject :: DeletedObject

-- | Specifies information about where to publish analysis or configuration
--   results for an Amazon S3 bucket and S3 Replication Time Control (S3
--   RTC).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDestination</a> smart constructor.
data Destination
Destination' :: Maybe Metrics -> Maybe AccessControlTranslation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StorageClass -> Maybe EncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe ReplicationTime -> BucketName -> Destination

-- | Create a value of <a>Destination</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metrics:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_metrics</a> - A
--   container specifying replication metrics-related settings enabling
--   replication metrics and events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessControlTranslation:Destination'</a>,
--   <a>destination_accessControlTranslation</a> - Specify this only in a
--   cross-account scenario (where source and destination bucket owners are
--   not the same), and you want to change replica ownership to the Amazon
--   Web Services account that owns the destination bucket. If this is not
--   specified in the replication configuration, the replicas are owned by
--   same Amazon Web Services account that owns the source object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:account:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_account</a> -
--   Destination bucket owner account ID. In a cross-account scenario, if
--   you direct Amazon S3 to change replica ownership to the Amazon Web
--   Services account that owns the destination bucket by specifying the
--   <tt>AccessControlTranslation</tt> property, this is the account ID of
--   the destination bucket owner. For more information, see <a>Replication
--   Additional Configuration: Changing the Replica Owner</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_storageClass</a>
--   - The storage class to use when replicating objects, such as S3
--   Standard or reduced redundancy. By default, Amazon S3 uses the storage
--   class of the source object to create the object replica.
--   
--   For valid values, see the <tt>StorageClass</tt> element of the <a>PUT
--   Bucket replication</a> action in the <i>Amazon S3 API Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionConfiguration:Destination'</a>,
--   <a>destination_encryptionConfiguration</a> - A container that provides
--   information about encryption. If <tt>SourceSelectionCriteria</tt> is
--   specified, you must specify this element.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replicationTime:Destination'</a>,
--   <a>destination_replicationTime</a> - A container specifying S3
--   Replication Time Control (S3 RTC), including whether S3 RTC is enabled
--   and the time when all objects and operations on objects must be
--   replicated. Must be specified together with a <tt>Metrics</tt> block.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucket:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_bucket</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket where you want Amazon S3 to
--   store the results.
newDestination :: BucketName -> Destination

--   ID of the symmetric customer managed key to use for encryption of job
--   results. Amazon S3 only supports symmetric keys. For more information,
--   see <a>Using symmetric and asymmetric keys</a> in the <i>Amazon Web
--   Services Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.

--   the encryption type is <tt>aws:kms</tt>, this optional value can be

-- | Specifies the inventory configuration for an Amazon S3 bucket. For
--   more information, see <a>GET Bucket inventory</a> in the <i>Amazon S3
--   API Reference</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInventoryConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data InventoryConfiguration
InventoryConfiguration' :: Maybe [InventoryOptionalField] -> Maybe InventoryFilter -> InventoryDestination -> Bool -> Text -> InventoryIncludedObjectVersions -> InventorySchedule -> InventoryConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>InventoryConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:optionalFields:InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_optionalFields</a> - Contains the optional
--   fields that are included in the inventory results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_filter</a> - Specifies an inventory filter.
--   The inventory only includes objects that meet the filter's criteria.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_destination</a> - Contains information about
--   where to publish the inventory results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isEnabled:InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_isEnabled</a> - Specifies whether the
--   inventory is enabled or disabled. If set to <tt>True</tt>, an
--   inventory list is generated. If set to <tt>False</tt>, no inventory
--   list is generated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_id</a> - The ID used to identify the
--   inventory configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includedObjectVersions:InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_includedObjectVersions</a> - Object versions
--   to include in the inventory list. If set to <tt>All</tt>, the list
--   includes all the object versions, which adds the version-related
--   fields <tt>VersionId</tt>, <tt>IsLatest</tt>, and
--   <tt>DeleteMarker</tt> to the list. If set to <tt>Current</tt>, the
--   list does not contain these version-related fields.
--   
--   <a>$sel:schedule:InventoryConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryConfiguration_schedule</a> - Specifies the schedule for
--   generating inventory results.
newInventoryConfiguration :: InventoryDestination -> Bool -> Text -> InventoryIncludedObjectVersions -> InventorySchedule -> InventoryConfiguration

-- | Specifies the inventory configuration for an Amazon S3 bucket.

data InventoryDestination

newInventoryDestination :: InventoryS3BucketDestination -> InventoryDestination

-- | Container for the expiration for the lifecycle of the object.

data LifecycleExpiration

-- | Create a value of <a>LifecycleExpiration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   - Indicates the lifetime, in days, of the objects that are subject to
--   the rule. The value must be a non-zero positive integer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:date:LifecycleExpiration'</a>, <a>lifecycleExpiration_date</a>
--   - Indicates at what date the object is to be moved or deleted. Should
--   be in GMT ISO 8601 Format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiredObjectDeleteMarker:LifecycleExpiration'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleExpiration_expiredObjectDeleteMarker</a> - Indicates
--   whether Amazon S3 will remove a delete marker with no noncurrent
--   versions. If set to true, the delete marker will be expired; if set to
--   false the policy takes no action. This cannot be specified with Days
--   or Date in a Lifecycle Expiration Policy.
newLifecycleExpiration :: LifecycleExpiration

-- | A lifecycle rule for individual objects in an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycleRule</a> smart constructor.
data LifecycleRule
LifecycleRule' :: Maybe [Transition] -> Maybe NoncurrentVersionExpiration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [NoncurrentVersionTransition] -> Maybe LifecycleExpiration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LifecycleRuleFilter -> Maybe AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload -> ExpirationStatus -> LifecycleRule

-- | Create a value of <a>LifecycleRule</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:transitions:LifecycleRule'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRule_transitions</a> - Specifies when an Amazon S3 object
--   transitions to a specified storage class.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noncurrentVersionExpiration:LifecycleRule'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRule_noncurrentVersionExpiration</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_prefix</a> -
--   Prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies. This
--   is no longer used; use <tt>Filter</tt> instead.
--   
--   Replacement must be made for object keys containing special characters
--   (such as carriage returns) when using XML requests. For more
--   information, see <a>XML related object key constraints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noncurrentVersionTransitions:LifecycleRule'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRule_noncurrentVersionTransitions</a> - Specifies the
--   transition rule for the lifecycle rule that describes when noncurrent
--   objects transition to a specific storage class. If your bucket is
--   versioning-enabled (or versioning is suspended), you can set this
--   action to request that Amazon S3 transition noncurrent object versions
--   to a specific storage class at a set period in the object's lifetime.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiration:LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_expiration</a>
--   - Specifies the expiration for the lifecycle of the object in the form
--   of date, days and, whether the object has a delete marker.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_id</a> - Unique
--   identifier for the rule. The value cannot be longer than 255
--   characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_filter</a> - The
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is used to identify objects that a Lifecycle Rule
--   applies to. A <tt>Filter</tt> must have exactly one of
--   <tt>Prefix</tt>, <tt>Tag</tt>, or <tt>And</tt> specified.
--   <tt>Filter</tt> is required if the <tt>LifecycleRule</tt> does not
--   containt a <tt>Prefix</tt> element.
--   
--   <a>$sel:abortIncompleteMultipartUpload:LifecycleRule'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRule_abortIncompleteMultipartUpload</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:LifecycleRule'</a>, <a>lifecycleRule_status</a> - If
--   'Enabled', the rule is currently being applied. If 'Disabled', the
--   rule is not currently being applied.
newLifecycleRule :: ExpirationStatus -> LifecycleRule

-- | This is used in a Lifecycle Rule Filter to apply a logical AND to two
--   or more predicates. The Lifecycle Rule will apply to any object
--   matching all of the predicates configured inside the And operator.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycleRuleAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data LifecycleRuleAndOperator
LifecycleRuleAndOperator' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> LifecycleRuleAndOperator

-- | Create a value of <a>LifecycleRuleAndOperator</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:LifecycleRuleAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRuleAndOperator_prefix</a> - Prefix identifying one or
--   more objects to which the rule applies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:LifecycleRuleAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleRuleAndOperator_tags</a> - All of these tags must exist in
--   the object's tag set in order for the rule to apply.
newLifecycleRuleAndOperator :: LifecycleRuleAndOperator

-- | The <tt>Filter</tt> is used to identify objects that a Lifecycle Rule
--   applies to. A <tt>Filter</tt> must have exactly one of
--   <tt>Prefix</tt>, <tt>Tag</tt>, or <tt>And</tt> specified.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycleRuleFilter</a> smart constructor.

-- | Describes where logs are stored and the prefix that Amazon S3 assigns

data LoggingEnabled

--   <a>loggingEnabled_targetBucket</a> - Specifies the bucket where you
--   want Amazon S3 to store server access logs. You can have your logs
--   delivered to any bucket that you own, including the same bucket that
--   is being logged. You can also configure multiple buckets to deliver
--   their logs to the same target bucket. In this case, you should choose
--   a different <tt>TargetPrefix</tt> for each source bucket so that the
--   delivered log files can be distinguished by key.

--   bucket, you can use a prefix to distinguish which log files came from
--   which bucket.

-- | A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating
--   a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and
--   an object must match all of the predicates in order for the filter to
--   apply.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricsAndOperator</a> smart constructor.
data MetricsAndOperator

--   AND predicate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessPointArn:MetricsAndOperator'</a>,
--   <a>metricsAndOperator_accessPointArn</a> - The access point ARN used
--   when evaluating an AND predicate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:MetricsAndOperator'</a>, <a>metricsAndOperator_tags</a> -
--   The list of tags used when evaluating an AND predicate.
newMetricsAndOperator :: MetricsAndOperator

-- | Specifies a metrics configuration for the CloudWatch request metrics
--   (specified by the metrics configuration ID) from an Amazon S3 bucket.
--   If you're updating an existing metrics configuration, note that this
--   is a full replacement of the existing metrics configuration. If you

--   filter. The metrics configuration will only include objects that meet
--   the filter's criteria. A filter must be a prefix, an object tag, an
--   access point ARN, or a conjunction (MetricsAndOperator).

--   The ID used to identify the metrics configuration.
newMetricsConfiguration :: Text -> MetricsConfiguration

-- | Specifies a metrics configuration filter. The metrics configuration

--   conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating a
--   metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates, and an

newMetricsFilter :: MetricsFilter

newMultipartUpload :: MultipartUpload

-- | Specifies when noncurrent object versions expire. Upon expiration,
--   Amazon S3 permanently deletes the noncurrent object versions. You set
--   this lifecycle configuration action on a bucket that has versioning
--   enabled (or suspended) to request that Amazon S3 delete noncurrent
--   object versions at a specific period in the object's lifetime.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNoncurrentVersionExpiration</a> smart constructor.
data NoncurrentVersionExpiration
NoncurrentVersionExpiration' :: Int -> NoncurrentVersionExpiration

-- | Create a value of <a>NoncurrentVersionExpiration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:noncurrentDays:NoncurrentVersionExpiration'</a>,
--   <a>noncurrentVersionExpiration_noncurrentDays</a> - Specifies the
--   number of days an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3 can perform
--   the associated action. For information about the noncurrent days
--   calculations, see <a>How Amazon S3 Calculates When an Object Became
--   Noncurrent</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
newNoncurrentVersionExpiration :: Int -> NoncurrentVersionExpiration

-- | Container for the transition rule that describes when noncurrent
--   objects transition to the <tt>STANDARD_IA</tt>, <tt>ONEZONE_IA</tt>,
--   <tt>INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>, <tt>GLACIER</tt>, or
--   <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt> storage class. If your bucket is
--   versioning-enabled (or versioning is suspended), you can set this
--   action to request that Amazon S3 transition noncurrent object versions
--   to the <tt>STANDARD_IA</tt>, <tt>ONEZONE_IA</tt>,
--   <tt>INTELLIGENT_TIERING</tt>, <tt>GLACIER</tt>, or
--   <tt>DEEP_ARCHIVE</tt> storage class at a specific period in the
--   object's lifetime.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNoncurrentVersionTransition</a> smart constructor.
data NoncurrentVersionTransition
NoncurrentVersionTransition' :: Int -> TransitionStorageClass -> NoncurrentVersionTransition

-- | Create a value of <a>NoncurrentVersionTransition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:noncurrentDays:NoncurrentVersionTransition'</a>,
--   <a>noncurrentVersionTransition_noncurrentDays</a> - Specifies the
--   number of days an object is noncurrent before Amazon S3 can perform
--   the associated action. For information about the noncurrent days
--   calculations, see <a>How Amazon S3 Calculates How Long an Object Has
--   Been Noncurrent</a> in the <i>Amazon S3 User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:NoncurrentVersionTransition'</a>,
--   <a>noncurrentVersionTransition_storageClass</a> - The class of storage
--   used to store the object.
newNoncurrentVersionTransition :: Int -> TransitionStorageClass -> NoncurrentVersionTransition

-- | An object consists of data and its descriptive metadata.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newObject</a> smart constructor.
data Object
Object' :: Maybe Owner -> ETag -> Integer -> ObjectKey -> ObjectStorageClass -> ISO8601 -> Object

-- | Create a value of <a>Object</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:owner:Object'</a>, <a>object_owner</a> - The owner of the
--   object
--   
--   <a>$sel:eTag:Object'</a>, <a>object_eTag</a> - The entity tag is a
--   hash of the object. The ETag reflects changes only to the contents of
--   an object, not its metadata. The ETag may or may not be an MD5 digest
--   of the object data. Whether or not it is depends on how the object was
--   created and how it is encrypted as described below:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-S3 or plaintext, have ETags that are an MD5 digest of
--   their object data.</li>
--   <li>Objects created by the PUT Object, POST Object, or Copy operation,
--   or through the Amazon Web Services Management Console, and are
--   encrypted by SSE-C or SSE-KMS, have ETags that are not an MD5 digest
--   of their object data.</li>
--   <li>If an object is created by either the Multipart Upload or Part
--   Copy operation, the ETag is not an MD5 digest, regardless of the
--   method of encryption.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:Object'</a>, <a>object_size</a> - Size in bytes of the
--   object
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Object'</a>, <a>object_key</a> - The name that you assign
--   to an object. You use the object key to retrieve the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageClass:Object'</a>, <a>object_storageClass</a> - The
--   class of storage used to store the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastModified:Object'</a>, <a>object_lastModified</a> -
--   Creation date of the object.
newObject :: ETag -> Integer -> ObjectKey -> ObjectStorageClass -> UTCTime -> Object
